Hebrew: חֲזוֹן֙ יְשַֽׁעְיָ֣הוּ בֶן־אָמ֔וֹץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָזָ֔ה עַל־יְהוּדָ֖ה וִירֽוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם בִּימֵ֨י עֻזִּיָּ֧הוּ יוֹתָ֛ם אָחָ֥ז יְחִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ מַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The prophecies of Isaiah son of Amoz, who prophesied concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
Transliteration: chazvon yeshaeyahu ven-amvots asher chazah al-yehudah viyrushala͏im viymey uziyahu yvotam achaz yechizekiyahu malekhey yehudah

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֤וּ שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ וְהַאֲזִ֣ינִי אֶ֔רֶץ כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבֵּ֑ר בָּנִים֙ גִּדַּ֣לְתִּי וְרוֹמַ֔מְתִּי וְהֵ֖ם פָּ֥שְׁעוּ בִֽי׃
Translated:
Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth,
For GOD has spoken:
“I reared children and brought them up—
And they have rebelled against Me!
Transliteration: shimeu shamayiim vehaaziyniy erets khiy yehovah diver vaniym gidaletiy vervomametiy vehem fasheu viy

Hebrew: יָדַ֥ע שׁוֹר֙ קֹנֵ֔הוּ וַחֲמ֖וֹר אֵב֣וּס בְּעָלָ֑יו יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔ע עַמִּ֖י לֹ֥א הִתְבּוֹנָֽן׃
Translated:
An ox knows its owner,
A donkey its master’s crib:
Israel does not know,
My people takes no thought.”
Transliteration: yada shvor konehu vachamvor evus vealayv yisherael lo yada amiy lo hitevvonan

Hebrew: ה֣וֹי ׀ גּ֣וֹי חֹטֵ֗א עַ֚ם כֶּ֣בֶד עָוֺ֔ן זֶ֣רַע מְרֵעִ֔ים בָּנִ֖ים מַשְׁחִיתִ֑ים עָזְב֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֗ה נִֽאֲצ֛וּ אֶת־קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נָזֹ֥רוּ אָחֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Ah, sinful nation!
People laden with iniquity!
Brood of evildoers!
Depraved children!
They have forsaken GOD,
Spurned the Holy One of Israel,
Turned their backs.
Transliteration: hvoy gvoy chote am kheved avon zera mereiym vaniym mashechiytiym azevu et-yehovah niatsu et-kedvosh yisherael nazoru achvor

Hebrew: עַ֣ל מֶ֥ה תֻכּ֛וּ ע֖וֹד תּוֹסִ֣יפוּ סָרָ֑ה כׇּל־רֹ֣אשׁ לׇֽחֳלִ֔י וְכׇל־לֵבָ֖ב דַּוָּֽי׃
Translated:
Why do you seek further beatings,
That you continue to offend?
Every head is ailing,
And every heart is sick.
Transliteration: al meh tukhu vod tvosiyfu sarah khׇl-rosh lׇcholiy vekhׇl-levav davay

Hebrew: מִכַּף־רֶ֤גֶל וְעַד־רֹאשׁ֙ אֵֽין־בּ֣וֹ מְתֹ֔ם פֶּ֥צַע וְחַבּוּרָ֖ה וּמַכָּ֣ה טְרִיָּ֑ה לֹא־זֹ֙רוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א חֻבָּ֔שׁוּ וְלֹ֥א רֻכְּכָ֖ה בַּשָּֽׁמֶן׃
Translated:
From head to foot
No spot is sound:
All bruises, and welts,
And festering sores—
Not pressed out, not bound up,
Not softened with oil.
Transliteration: mikhaf-regel vead-rosh eyn-vvo metom fetsa vechavurah umakhah teriyah lo-zoru velo chuvashu velo rukhekhah vashamen

Hebrew: אַרְצְכֶ֣ם שְׁמָמָ֔ה עָרֵיכֶ֖ם שְׂרֻפ֣וֹת אֵ֑שׁ אַדְמַתְכֶ֗ם לְנֶגְדְּכֶם֙ זָרִים֙ אֹכְלִ֣ים אֹתָ֔הּ וּשְׁמָמָ֖ה כְּמַהְפֵּכַ֥ת זָרִֽים׃
Translated:
Your land is a waste,
Your cities burnt down;
Before your eyes, the yield of your soil
Is consumed by strangers—
A wasteland as overthrown by strangers!
Transliteration: aretsekhem shemamah areykhem sherufvot esh adematekhem lenegedekhem zariym okheliym otah ushemamah khemahefekhat zariym

Hebrew: וְנוֹתְרָ֥ה בַת־צִיּ֖וֹן כְּסֻכָּ֣ה בְכָ֑רֶם כִּמְלוּנָ֥ה בְמִקְשָׁ֖ה כְּעִ֥יר נְצוּרָֽה׃
Translated:
Fair Zion is left
Like a booth in a vineyard,
Like a hut in a cucumber field,
Like a city beleaguered.
Transliteration: venvoterah vat-tsiyyvon khesukhah vekharem khimelunah vemikeshah kheiyr netsurah

Hebrew: לוּלֵי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת הוֹתִ֥יר לָ֛נוּ שָׂרִ֖יד כִּמְעָ֑ט כִּסְדֹ֣ם הָיִ֔ינוּ לַעֲמֹרָ֖ה דָּמִֽינוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Had not GOD of Hosts
Left us some survivors,
We should be like Sodom,
Another Gomorrah.
Transliteration: luley yehovah tsevavot hvotiyr lanu shariyd khimeat khisedom hayiynu laamorah damiynu {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֥וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה קְצִינֵ֣י סְדֹ֑ם הַאֲזִ֛ינוּ תּוֹרַ֥ת אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ עַ֥ם עֲמֹרָֽה׃
Translated:
Hear the word of GOD,
You chieftains of Sodom;
Give ear to our God’s instruction,
You folk of Gomorrah!
Transliteration: shimeu devar-yehovah ketsiyney sedom haaziynu tvorat eloheynu am amorah

Hebrew: לָמָּה־לִּ֤י רֹב־זִבְחֵיכֶם֙ יֹאמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה שָׂבַ֛עְתִּי עֹל֥וֹת אֵילִ֖ים וְחֵ֣לֶב מְרִיאִ֑ים וְדַ֨ם פָּרִ֧ים וּכְבָשִׂ֛ים וְעַתּוּדִ֖ים לֹ֥א חָפָֽצְתִּי׃
Translated:
“What need have I of all your sacrifices?”
Says GOD.
“I am sated with burnt offerings of rams,
And suet of fatlings,
And blood of bulls;
And I have no delight
In lambs and he-goats.
Transliteration: lamah-liy rov-zivecheykhem yomar yehovah shavaetiy olvot eyliym vechelev meriyiym vedam fariym ukhevashiym veatudiym lo chafatsetiy

Hebrew: כִּ֣י תָבֹ֔אוּ לֵֽרָא֖וֹת פָּנָ֑י מִֽי־בִקֵּ֥שׁ זֹ֛את מִיֶּדְכֶ֖ם רְמֹ֥ס חֲצֵרָֽי׃
Translated:
That you come to appear before Me—
Who asked that of you?
Trample My courts
Transliteration: khiy tavou leravot fanay miy-vikesh zot miyedekhem remos chatseray

Hebrew: לֹ֣א תוֹסִ֗יפוּ הָבִיא֙ מִנְחַת־שָׁ֔וְא קְטֹ֧רֶת תּוֹעֵבָ֛ה הִ֖יא לִ֑י חֹ֤דֶשׁ וְשַׁבָּת֙ קְרֹ֣א מִקְרָ֔א לֹא־אוּכַ֥ל אָ֖וֶן וַעֲצָרָֽה׃
Translated:
no more;
Bringing oblations is futile,
Incense is offensive to Me.
New moon and sabbath,
Proclaiming of solemnities,
Assemblies with iniquity
I cannot abide.
Transliteration: lo tvosiyfu haviy minechat-shave ketoret tvoevah hiy liy chodesh veshavat kero mikera lo-ukhal aven vaatsarah

Hebrew: חׇדְשֵׁיכֶ֤ם וּמֽוֹעֲדֵיכֶם֙ שָֽׂנְאָ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֔י הָי֥וּ עָלַ֖י לָטֹ֑רַח נִלְאֵ֖יתִי נְשֹֽׂא׃
Translated:
Your new moons and fixed seasons
Fill Me with loathing;
They are become a burden to Me,
I cannot endure them.
Transliteration: chׇdesheykhem umvoadeykhem shaneah nafeshiy hayu alay latorach nileeytiy nesho

Hebrew: וּבְפָרִשְׂכֶ֣ם כַּפֵּיכֶ֗ם אַעְלִ֤ים עֵינַי֙ מִכֶּ֔ם גַּ֛ם כִּֽי־תַרְבּ֥וּ תְפִלָּ֖ה אֵינֶ֣נִּי שֹׁמֵ֑עַ יְדֵיכֶ֖ם דָּמִ֥ים מָלֵֽאוּ׃
Translated:
And when you lift up your hands,
I will turn My eyes away from you;
Though you pray at length,
I will not listen.
Your hands are stained with crime—
Transliteration: uvefarishekhem khafeykhem aeliym eynay mikhem gam khiy-tarevu tefilah eyneniy shomea yedeykhem damiym maleu

Hebrew: רַֽחֲצוּ֙ הִזַּכּ֔וּ הָסִ֛ירוּ רֹ֥עַ מַעַלְלֵיכֶ֖ם מִנֶּ֣גֶד עֵינָ֑י חִדְל֖וּ הָרֵֽעַ׃
Translated:
Wash yourselves clean;
Put your evil doings
Away from My sight.
Cease to do evil;
Transliteration: rachatsu hizakhu hasiyru roa maaleleykhem mineged eynay chidelu harea

Hebrew: לִמְד֥וּ הֵיטֵ֛ב דִּרְשׁ֥וּ מִשְׁפָּ֖ט אַשְּׁר֣וּ חָמ֑וֹץ שִׁפְט֣וּ יָת֔וֹם רִ֖יבוּ אַלְמָנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Learn to do good.
Devote yourselves to justice;
Aid the wronged.
Uphold the rights of the orphan;
Defend the cause of the widow.
Transliteration: limedu heytev direshu mishefat asheru chamvots shifetu yatvom riyvu alemanah {s}

Hebrew: לְכוּ־נָ֛א וְנִוָּכְחָ֖ה יֹאמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה אִם־יִהְי֨וּ חֲטָאֵיכֶ֤ם כַּשָּׁנִים֙ כַּשֶּׁ֣לֶג יַלְבִּ֔ינוּ אִם־יַאְדִּ֥ימוּ כַתּוֹלָ֖ע כַּצֶּ֥מֶר יִֽהְיֽוּ׃
Translated:
“Come, let us reach an understanding,
—says GOD.
Be your sins like crimson,
They can turn snow-white;
Be they red as dyed wool,
They can become like fleece.”
Transliteration: lekhu-na venivakhechah yomar yehovah im-yiheyu chataeykhem khashaniym khasheleg yaleviynu im-yaediymu khatvola khatsemer yiheyu

Hebrew: אִם־תֹּאב֖וּ וּשְׁמַעְתֶּ֑ם ט֥וּב הָאָ֖רֶץ תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated:
If, then, you agree and give heed,
You will eat the good things of the earth;
Transliteration: im-tovu ushemaetem tuv haarets tokhelu

Hebrew: וְאִם־תְּמָאֲנ֖וּ וּמְרִיתֶ֑ם חֶ֣רֶב תְּאֻכְּל֔וּ כִּ֛י פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבֵּֽר׃ {פ}
Translated:
But if you refuse and disobey,
You will be devoured [by] the sword.—
For it was GOD who spoke.
Transliteration: veim-temaanu umeriytem cherev teukhelu khiy fiy yehovah diver {f}

Hebrew: אֵיכָה֙ הָיְתָ֣ה לְזוֹנָ֔ה קִרְיָ֖ה נֶאֱמָנָ֑ה מְלֵאֲתִ֣י מִשְׁפָּ֗ט צֶ֛דֶק יָלִ֥ין בָּ֖הּ וְעַתָּ֥ה מְרַצְּחִֽים׃
Translated:
Alas, she has become a whore,
The faithful city
That was filled with justice,
Where righteousness dwelt—
But now murderers.
Transliteration: eykhah hayetah lezvonah kireyah neemanah meleatiy mishefat tsedek yaliyn vah veatah meratsechiym

Hebrew: כַּסְפֵּ֖ךְ הָיָ֣ה לְסִיגִ֑ים סׇבְאֵ֖ךְ מָה֥וּל בַּמָּֽיִם׃
Translated:
Your silver has turned to dross;
Your wine is cut with water.
Transliteration: khasefekhe hayah lesiygiym sׇveekhe mahul vamayiim

Hebrew: שָׂרַ֣יִךְ סוֹרְרִ֗ים וְחַבְרֵי֙ גַּנָּבִ֔ים כֻּלּוֹ֙ אֹהֵ֣ב שֹׁ֔חַד וְרֹדֵ֖ף שַׁלְמֹנִ֑ים יָתוֹם֙ לֹ֣א יִשְׁפֹּ֔טוּ וְרִ֥יב אַלְמָנָ֖ה לֹא־יָב֥וֹא אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Your rulers are rogues
And cronies of thieves,
Every one avid for presents
And greedy for gifts;
They do not judge the case of the orphan,
And the widow’s cause never reaches them.
Transliteration: sharayiikhe svoreriym vechaverey ganaviym khulvo ohev shochad verodef shalemoniym yatvom lo yishefotu veriyv alemanah lo-yavvo aleyhem {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן נְאֻ֤ם הָאָדוֹן֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת אֲבִ֖יר יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל ה֚וֹי אֶנָּחֵ֣ם מִצָּרַ֔י וְאִנָּקְמָ֖ה מֵאוֹיְבָֽי׃
Translated:
Assuredly, this is the declaration
Of the Sovereign, GOD of Hosts,
The Mighty One of Israel:
“Ah, I will get satisfaction from My foes;
I will wreak vengeance on My enemies!
Transliteration: lakhen neum haadvon yehovah tsevavot aviyr yisherael hvoy enachem mitsaray veinakemah mevoyevay

Hebrew: וְאָשִׁ֤יבָה יָדִי֙ עָלַ֔יִךְ וְאֶצְרֹ֥ף כַּבֹּ֖ר סִיגָ֑יִךְ וְאָסִ֖ירָה כׇּל־בְּדִילָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
I will turn My hand against you,
And smelt out your dross as with lye,
And remove all your slag:
Transliteration: veashiyvah yadiy alayiikhe veetserof khavor siygayiikhe veasiyrah khׇl-vediylayiikhe

Hebrew: וְאָשִׁ֤יבָה שֹׁפְטַ֙יִךְ֙ כְּבָרִ֣אשֹׁנָ֔ה וְיֹעֲצַ֖יִךְ כְּבַתְּחִלָּ֑ה אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן יִקָּ֤רֵא לָךְ֙ עִ֣יר הַצֶּ֔דֶק קִרְיָ֖ה נֶאֱמָנָֽה׃
Translated:
I will restore your magistrates as of old,
And your counselors as of yore.
After that you shall be called
City of Righteousness, Faithful City.”
Transliteration: veashiyvah shofetayiikhe khevarishonah veyoatsayiikhe khevatechilah acharey-khen yikare lakhe iyr hatsedek kireyah neemanah

Hebrew: צִיּ֖וֹן בְּמִשְׁפָּ֣ט תִּפָּדֶ֑ה וְשָׁבֶ֖יהָ בִּצְדָקָֽה׃
Translated:
Zion shall be saved in the judgment;
Her repentant ones, in the retribution.
Transliteration: tsiyyvon vemishefat tifadeh veshaveyha vitsedakah

Hebrew: וְשֶׁ֧בֶר פֹּשְׁעִ֛ים וְחַטָּאִ֖ים יַחְדָּ֑ו וְעֹזְבֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה יִכְלֽוּ׃
Translated:
But rebels and sinners shall all be crushed,
And those who forsake GOD shall perish.
Transliteration: veshever fosheiym vechataiym yachedav veozevey yehovah yikhelu

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יֵבֹ֔שׁוּ מֵאֵילִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר חֲמַדְתֶּ֑ם וְתַ֨חְפְּר֔וּ מֵהַגַּנּ֖וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּחַרְתֶּֽם׃
Translated:
Truly, you shall be shamed
Because of the terebinths you desired,
And you shall be confounded
Because of the gardens you coveted.
Transliteration: khiy eivoshu meeyliym asher chamadetem vetacheferu mehaganvot asher vecharetem

Hebrew: כִּ֣י תִֽהְי֔וּ כְּאֵלָ֖ה נֹבֶ֣לֶת עָלֶ֑הָ וּֽכְגַנָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־מַ֖יִם אֵ֥ין לָֽהּ׃
Translated:
For you shall be like a terebinth
Wilted of leaf,
And like a garden
That has no water,
Transliteration: khiy tiheyu kheelah novelet aleha ukheganah asher-mayiim eyn lah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה הֶחָסֹן֙ לִנְעֹ֔רֶת וּפֹעֲל֖וֹ לְנִיצ֑וֹץ וּבָעֲר֧וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֛ם יַחְדָּ֖ו וְאֵ֥ין מְכַבֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Stored wealth shall become as tow,
And he who amassed it a spark;
And the two shall burn together,
With none to quench.
Transliteration: vehayah hechason lineoret ufoalvo leniytsvots uvaaru sheneyhem yachedav veeyn mekhaveh {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָזָ֔ה יְשַֽׁעְיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־אָמ֑וֹץ עַל־יְהוּדָ֖ה וִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: The word that Isaiah son of Amoz prophesied concerning Judah and Jerusalem.
Transliteration: hadavar asher chazah yeshaeyahu ven-amvots al-yehudah viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בְּאַחֲרִ֣ית הַיָּמִ֗ים נָכ֨וֹן יִֽהְיֶ֜ה הַ֤ר בֵּית־יְהֹוָה֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הֶהָרִ֔ים וְנִשָּׂ֖א מִגְּבָע֑וֹת וְנָהֲר֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
In the days to come,
The Mount of GOD’s House
Shall stand firm above the mountains
And tower above the hills;
And all the nations
Shall gaze on it with joy.
Transliteration: vehayah veachariyt hayamiym nakhvon yiheyeh har veyt-yehovah verosh hehariym venisha migevavot venaharu elayv khׇl-hagvoyim

Hebrew: וְֽהָלְכ֞וּ עַמִּ֣ים רַבִּ֗ים וְאָֽמְרוּ֙ לְכ֣וּ ׀ וְנַעֲלֶ֣ה אֶל־הַר־יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶל־בֵּית֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְיֹרֵ֙נוּ֙ מִדְּרָכָ֔יו וְנֵלְכָ֖ה בְּאֹרְחֹתָ֑יו כִּ֤י מִצִּיּוֹן֙ תֵּצֵ֣א תוֹרָ֔ה וּדְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה מִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
And the many peoples shall go and say:
“Come,
Let us go up to the Mount of GOD,
To the House of the God of Jacob;
That we may be instructed in God’s ways,
And that we may walk in God’s paths.”
For instruction shall come forth from Zion,
The word of GOD from Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vehalekhu amiym raviym veameru lekhu venaaleh el-har-yehovah el-veyt elohey yaakov veyorenu miderakhayv venelekhah veorechotayv khiy mitsiyyvon tetse tvorah udevar-yehovah miyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וְשָׁפַט֙ בֵּ֣ין הַגּוֹיִ֔ם וְהוֹכִ֖יחַ לְעַמִּ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וְכִתְּת֨וּ חַרְבוֹתָ֜ם לְאִתִּ֗ים וַחֲנִיתֽוֹתֵיהֶם֙ לְמַזְמֵר֔וֹת לֹא־יִשָּׂ֨א ג֤וֹי אֶל־גּוֹי֙ חֶ֔רֶב וְלֹֽא־יִלְמְד֥וּ ע֖וֹד מִלְחָמָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Thus [God] will judge among the nations
And arbitrate for the many peoples,
And they shall beat their swords into plowshares
And their spears into pruning hooks:
Nation shall not take up
Sword against nation;
They shall never again know war.
Transliteration: veshafat veyn hagvoyim vehvokhiycha leamiym raviym vekhitetu charevvotam leitiym vachaniytvoteyhem lemazemervot lo-yisha gvoy el-gvoy cherev velo-yilemedu vod milechamah {f}

Hebrew: בֵּ֖ית יַעֲקֹ֑ב לְכ֥וּ וְנֵלְכָ֖ה בְּא֥וֹר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
O House of Jacob!
Come, let us walk
By the light of GOD.
Transliteration: veyt yaakov lekhu venelekhah vevor yehovah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י נָטַ֗שְׁתָּה עַמְּךָ֙ בֵּ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֔ב כִּ֤י מָֽלְאוּ֙ מִקֶּ֔דֶם וְעֹנְנִ֖ים כַּפְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וּבְיַלְדֵ֥י נׇכְרִ֖ים יַשְׂפִּֽיקוּ׃
Translated:
For you have forsaken [the ways of] your people,
O House of Jacob!
For they are full [of practices] from the East,
And of soothsaying like the Philistines;
They abound in customs of the aliens.
Transliteration: khiy natashetah amekha veyt yaakov khiy maleu mikedem veoneniym khafelishetiym uveyaledey nׇkheriym yashefiyku

Hebrew: וַתִּמָּלֵ֤א אַרְצוֹ֙ כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֔ב וְאֵ֥ין קֵ֖צֶה לְאֹצְרֹתָ֑יו וַתִּמָּלֵ֤א אַרְצוֹ֙ סוּסִ֔ים וְאֵ֥ין קֵ֖צֶה לְמַרְכְּבֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Their land is full of silver and gold,
There is no limit to their treasures;
Their land is full of horses,
There is no limit to their chariots.
Transliteration: vatimale aretsvo khesef vezahav veeyn ketseh leotserotayv vatimale aretsvo susiym veeyn ketseh lemarekhevotayv

Hebrew: וַתִּמָּלֵ֥א אַרְצ֖וֹ אֱלִילִ֑ים לְמַעֲשֵׂ֤ה יָדָיו֙ יִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֔וּ לַאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשׂ֖וּ אֶצְבְּעֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
And their land is full of idols;
They bow down to the work of their hands,
To what their own fingers have wrought.
Transliteration: vatimale aretsvo eliyliym lemaasheh yadayv yishetachavu laasher ashu etseveotayv

Hebrew: וַיִּשַּׁ֥ח אָדָ֖ם וַיִּשְׁפַּל־אִ֑ישׁ וְאַל־תִּשָּׂ֖א לָהֶֽם׃
Translated:
But human shall be humbled,
And mortal brought low—
Oh, do not forgive them!
Transliteration: vayishach adam vayishefal-iysh veal-tisha lahem

Hebrew: בּ֣וֹא בַצּ֔וּר וְהִטָּמֵ֖ן בֶּעָפָ֑ר מִפְּנֵי֙ פַּ֣חַד יְהֹוָ֔ה וּמֵהֲדַ֖ר גְּאֹנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Go deep into the rock,
Bury yourselves in the ground,
Before the terror of GOD
And God’s dread majesty!
Transliteration: vvo vatsur vehitamen veafar mifeney fachad yehovah umehadar geonvo

Hebrew: עֵינֵ֞י גַּבְה֤וּת אָדָם֙ שָׁפֵ֔ל וְשַׁ֖ח ר֣וּם אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וְנִשְׂגַּ֧ב יְהֹוָ֛ה לְבַדּ֖וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃ {פ}
Translated:
The haughty look of humans shall be brought low,
And the pride of mortals shall be humbled.
None but GOD shall be
Exalted in that day.
Transliteration: eyney gavehut adam shafel veshach rum anashiym venishegav yehovah levadvo vayyvom hahu {f}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י י֞וֹם לַיהֹוָ֧ה צְבָא֛וֹת עַ֥ל כׇּל־גֵּאֶ֖ה וָרָ֑ם וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־נִשָּׂ֥א וְשָׁפֵֽל׃
Translated:
For GOD of Hosts has ready a day
Against all that is proud and arrogant,
Against all that is lofty—so that it is brought low:
Transliteration: khiy yvom layhovah tsevavot al khׇl-geeh varam veal khׇl-nisha veshafel

Hebrew: וְעַל֙ כׇּל־אַרְזֵ֣י הַלְּבָנ֔וֹן הָרָמִ֖ים וְהַנִּשָּׂאִ֑ים וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־אַלּוֹנֵ֥י הַבָּשָֽׁן׃
Translated:
Against all the cedars of Lebanon,
Tall and stately,
And all the oaks of Bashan;
Transliteration: veal khׇl-arezey halevanvon haramiym vehanishaiym veal khׇl-alvoney havashan

Hebrew: וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־הֶהָרִ֣ים הָרָמִ֑ים וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־הַגְּבָע֥וֹת הַנִּשָּׂאֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Against all the high mountains
And all the lofty hills;
Transliteration: veal khׇl-hehariym haramiym veal khׇl-hagevavot hanishavot

Hebrew: וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־מִגְדָּ֣ל גָּבֹ֑הַּ וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־חוֹמָ֥ה בְצוּרָֽה׃
Translated:
Against every soaring tower
And every mighty wall;
Transliteration: veal khׇl-migedal gavoha veal khׇl-chvomah vetsurah

Hebrew: וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־אֳנִיּ֣וֹת תַּרְשִׁ֑ישׁ וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־שְׂכִיּ֥וֹת הַחֶמְדָּֽה׃
Translated:
Against all the ships of Tarshish
And all the gallant barks.
Transliteration: veal khׇl-oniyyvot tareshiysh veal khׇl-shekhiyyvot hachemedah

Hebrew: וְשַׁח֙ גַּבְה֣וּת הָאָדָ֔ם וְשָׁפֵ֖ל ר֣וּם אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וְנִשְׂגַּ֧ב יְהֹוָ֛ה לְבַדּ֖וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
Translated:
Then human haughtiness shall be humbled
And the pride of mortals brought low.
None but GOD shall be
Exalted in that day.
Transliteration: veshach gavehut haadam veshafel rum anashiym venishegav yehovah levadvo vayyvom hahu

Hebrew: וְהָאֱלִילִ֖ים כָּלִ֥יל יַחֲלֹֽף׃
Translated: As for idols, they shall vanish completely.
Transliteration: vehaeliyliym khaliyl yachalof

Hebrew: וּבָ֙אוּ֙ בִּמְעָר֣וֹת צֻרִ֔ים וּבִמְחִלּ֖וֹת עָפָ֑ר מִפְּנֵ֞י פַּ֤חַד יְהֹוָה֙ וּמֵהֲדַ֣ר גְּאוֹנ֔וֹ בְּקוּמ֖וֹ לַעֲרֹ֥ץ הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
And people shall enter caverns in the rock
And hollows in the ground—
Before the terror of GOD
And God’s dread majesty,
When [the Holy One] comes forth to overawe the earth.
Transliteration: uvau vimearvot tsuriym uvimechilvot afar mifeney fachad yehovah umehadar gevonvo vekumvo laarots haarets

Hebrew: בַּיּ֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ יַשְׁלִ֣יךְ הָאָדָ֔ם אֵ֚ת אֱלִילֵ֣י כַסְפּ֔וֹ וְאֵ֖ת אֱלִילֵ֣י זְהָב֑וֹ אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָֽשׂוּ־לוֹ֙ לְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֔ת לַחְפֹּ֥ר פֵּר֖וֹת וְלָעֲטַלֵּפִֽים׃
Translated:
On that day, humans shall fling away,
To the flying foxes and the bats,
The idols of silver
And the idols of gold
Which they made for worshiping.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yasheliykhe haadam et eliyley khasefvo veet eliyley zehavvo asher ashu-lvo lehishetachavot lachefor fervot velaatalefiym

Hebrew: לָבוֹא֙ בְּנִקְר֣וֹת הַצֻּרִ֔ים וּבִסְעִפֵ֖י הַסְּלָעִ֑ים מִפְּנֵ֞י פַּ֤חַד יְהֹוָה֙ וּמֵהֲדַ֣ר גְּאוֹנ֔וֹ בְּקוּמ֖וֹ לַעֲרֹ֥ץ הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
And they shall enter the clefts in the rocks
And the crevices in the cliffs,
Before the terror of GOD
And God’s dread majesty,
When [the Holy One] comes forth to overawe the earth.
Transliteration: lavvo venikervot hatsuriym uviseifey haselaiym mifeney fachad yehovah umehadar gevonvo vekumvo laarots haarets

Hebrew: חִדְל֤וּ לָכֶם֙ מִן־הָ֣אָדָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר נְשָׁמָ֖ה בְּאַפּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־בַמֶּ֥ה נֶחְשָׁ֖ב הֽוּא׃ {פ}
Translated:
Oh, cease to glorify human beings,
Who have only a breath in their nostrils!
For by what do they merit esteem?
Transliteration: chidelu lakhem min-haadam asher neshamah veafvo khiy-vameh necheshav hu {f}

Hebrew: כִּי֩ הִנֵּ֨ה הָאָד֜וֹן יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֗וֹת מֵסִ֤יר מִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ וּמִ֣יהוּדָ֔ה מַשְׁעֵ֖ן וּמַשְׁעֵנָ֑ה כֹּ֚ל מִשְׁעַן־לֶ֔חֶם וְכֹ֖ל מִשְׁעַן־מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
For lo!
The Sovereign GOD of Hosts
Will remove from Jerusalem and from Judah
Prop and stay,
Every prop of food
And every prop of water:
Transliteration: khiy hineh haadvon yehovah tsevavot mesiyr miyrushala͏im umiyhudah masheen umasheenah khol mishean-lechem vekhol mishean-mayiim

Hebrew: גִּבּ֖וֹר וְאִ֣ישׁ מִלְחָמָ֑ה שׁוֹפֵ֥ט וְנָבִ֖יא וְקֹסֵ֥ם וְזָקֵֽן׃
Translated:
Soldier and warrior,
Magistrate and prophet,
Augur and elder;
Transliteration: givvor veiysh milechamah shvofet venaviy vekosem vezaken

Hebrew: שַׂר־חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים וּנְשׂ֣וּא פָנִ֑ים וְיוֹעֵ֛ץ וַחֲכַ֥ם חֲרָשִׁ֖ים וּנְב֥וֹן לָֽחַשׁ׃
Translated:
Captain of fifty,
Magnate and counselor,
Skilled artisan and expert enchanter;
Transliteration: shar-chamishiym uneshu faniym veyvoets vachakham charashiym unevvon lachash

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֥י נְעָרִ֖ים שָׂרֵיהֶ֑ם וְתַעֲלוּלִ֖ים יִמְשְׁלוּ־בָֽם׃
Translated:
And I will make boys their rulers,
And babes shall govern them.
Transliteration: venatatiy neariym shareyhem vetaaluliym yimeshelu-vam

Hebrew: וְנִגַּ֣שׂ הָעָ֔ם אִ֥ישׁ בְּאִ֖ישׁ וְאִ֣ישׁ בְּרֵעֵ֑הוּ יִרְהֲב֗וּ הַנַּ֙עַר֙ בַּזָּקֵ֔ן וְהַנִּקְלֶ֖ה בַּנִּכְבָּֽד׃
Translated:
So the people shall oppress one another—
Each man oppressing his fellow:
The youth shall bully the elder;
And the despised [shall bully] the honored.
Transliteration: venigash haam iysh veiysh veiysh vereehu yirehavu hanaar vazaken vehanikeleh vanikhevad

Hebrew: כִּי־יִתְפֹּ֨שׂ אִ֤ישׁ בְּאָחִיו֙ בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֔יו שִׂמְלָ֣ה לְכָ֔ה קָצִ֖ין תִּֽהְיֶה־לָּ֑נוּ וְהַמַּכְשֵׁלָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את תַּ֥חַת יָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
For should a man seize his brother,
In whose father’s house there is clothing:
“Come, be a chief over us,
And let this ruin be under your care,”
Transliteration: khiy-yitefosh iysh veachiyv veyt aviyv shimelah lekhah katsiyn tiheyeh-lanu vehamakheshelah hazot tachat yadekha

Hebrew: יִשָּׂא֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַה֤וּא <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹר֙ לֹא־אֶהְיֶ֣ה חֹבֵ֔שׁ וּבְבֵיתִ֕י אֵ֥ין לֶ֖חֶם וְאֵ֣ין שִׂמְלָ֑ה לֹ֥א תְשִׂימֻ֖נִי קְצִ֥ין עָֽם׃
Translated:
The other will thereupon protest,
“I will not be a dresser of wounds,
With no food or clothing in my own house.
You shall not make me chief of a people!”
Transliteration: yisha vayyvom hahu <small></small> lemor lo-eheyeh chovesh uveveytiy eyn lechem veeyn shimelah lo teshiymuniy ketsiyn am

Hebrew: כִּ֤י כָֽשְׁלָה֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וִיהוּדָ֖ה נָפָ֑ל כִּֽי־לְשׁוֹנָ֤ם וּמַֽעַלְלֵיהֶם֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה לַמְר֖וֹת עֵנֵ֥י כְבוֹדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Ah, Jerusalem has stumbled,
And Judah has fallen,
Because by word and deed
They insult GOD,
Defying God’s majestic glance.
Transliteration: khiy khashelah yerushala͏im viyhudah nafal khiy-leshvonam umaaleleyhem el-yehovah lamervot eney khevvodvo

Hebrew: הַכָּרַ֤ת פְּנֵיהֶם֙ עָ֣נְתָה בָּ֔ם וְחַטָּאתָ֛ם כִּסְדֹ֥ם הִגִּ֖ידוּ לֹ֣א כִחֵ֑דוּ א֣וֹי לְנַפְשָׁ֔ם כִּי־גָמְל֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם רָעָֽה׃
Translated:
Their partiality in judgment accuses them;
They avow their sins like Sodom,
They do not conceal them.
Woe to them! For ill
Have they served themselves.
Transliteration: hakharat feneyhem anetah vam vechatatam khisedom higiydu lo khichedu voy lenafesham khiy-gamelu lahem raah

Hebrew: אִמְר֥וּ צַדִּ֖יק כִּי־ט֑וֹב כִּֽי־פְרִ֥י מַעַלְלֵיהֶ֖ם יֹאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated:
(Hail the righteous, for they shall fare well;
They shall eat the fruit of their works.
Transliteration: imeru tsadiyk khiy-tvov khiy-feriy maaleleyhem yokhelu

Hebrew: א֖וֹי לְרָשָׁ֣ע רָ֑ע כִּֽי־גְמ֥וּל יָדָ֖יו יֵעָ֥שֶׂה לּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Woe to the wicked, for they shall fare ill;
As their hands have dealt, so shall it be done to them.)
Transliteration: voy lerasha ra khiy-gemul yadayv eiasheh lvo

Hebrew: עַמִּי֙ נֹגְשָׂ֣יו מְעוֹלֵ֔ל וְנָשִׁ֖ים מָ֣שְׁלוּ ב֑וֹ עַמִּי֙ מְאַשְּׁרֶ֣יךָ מַתְעִ֔ים וְדֶ֥רֶךְ אֹרְחֹתֶ֖יךָ בִּלֵּֽעוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
My people’s rulers are babes,
It is governed by women.
O my people!
Your leaders are misleaders;
They have confused the course of your paths.
Transliteration: amiy nogeshayv mevolel venashiym mashelu vvo amiy meashereykha mateiym vederekhe orechoteykha vileu {f}

Hebrew: נִצָּ֥ב לָרִ֖יב יְהֹוָ֑ה וְעֹמֵ֖ד לָדִ֥ין עַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
GOD stands up to plead a cause,
And rises to champion peoples.
Transliteration: nitsav lariyv yehovah veomed ladiyn amiym

Hebrew: יְהֹוָה֙ בְּמִשְׁפָּ֣ט יָב֔וֹא עִם־זִקְנֵ֥י עַמּ֖וֹ וְשָׂרָ֑יו וְאַתֶּם֙ בִּעַרְתֶּ֣ם הַכֶּ֔רֶם גְּזֵלַ֥ת הֶעָנִ֖י בְּבָתֵּיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
GOD will bring this charge
Against the elders and officers of this covenanted people:
“It is you who have ravaged the vineyard;
That which was robbed from the poor is in your houses.
Transliteration: yehovah vemishefat yavvo im-zikeney amvo vesharayv veatem viaretem hakherem gezelat heaniy vevateykhem

Hebrew: (מלכם) [מַה־לָּכֶם֙] תְּדַכְּא֣וּ עַמִּ֔י וּפְנֵ֥י עֲנִיִּ֖ים תִּטְחָ֑נוּ נְאֻם־אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated:
How dare you crush My people
And grind the faces of the poor?”
—says my Sovereign GOD of Hosts.
Transliteration: (mlkhm) [mah-lakhem] tedakheu amiy ufeney aniyiym titechanu neum-adonay yehovih tsevavot {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה יַ֚עַן כִּ֤י גָֽבְהוּ֙ בְּנ֣וֹת צִיּ֔וֹן וַתֵּלַ֙כְנָה֙ (נטוות) [נְטוּי֣וֹת] גָּר֔וֹן וּֽמְשַׂקְּר֖וֹת עֵינָ֑יִם הָל֤וֹךְ וְטָפֹף֙ תֵּלַ֔כְנָה וּבְרַגְלֵיהֶ֖ם תְּעַכַּֽסְנָה׃
Translated:
GOD said:
“Because the daughters of Zion
Are so vain
And walk with heads thrown back,
With roving eyes,
And with mincing gait,
Making a tinkling with their feet”—
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah yaan khiy gavehu venvot tsiyyvon vatelakhenah (ntvvt) [netuyvot] garvon umeshakervot eynayiim halvokhe vetafof telakhenah uverageleyhem teakhasenah

Hebrew: וְשִׂפַּ֣ח אֲדֹנָ֔י קׇדְקֹ֖ד בְּנ֣וֹת צִיּ֑וֹן וַיהֹוָ֖ה פׇּתְהֵ֥ן יְעָרֶֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
My Sovereign will bare the pates
Of the daughters of Zion,
GOD will uncover their heads.
Transliteration: veshifach adonay kׇdekod venvot tsiyyvon vayhovah fׇtehen yeareh {s}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֨וֹם הַה֜וּא יָסִ֣יר אֲדֹנָ֗י אֵ֣ת תִּפְאֶ֧רֶת הָעֲכָסִ֛ים וְהַשְּׁבִיסִ֖ים וְהַשַּׂהֲרֹנִֽים׃
Translated: In that day, my Sovereign will strip off the finery of the anklets, the fillets, and the crescents;
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yasiyr adonay et tifeeret haakhasiym vehasheviysiym vehashaharoniym

Hebrew: הַנְּטִפ֥וֹת וְהַשֵּׁיר֖וֹת וְהָרְעָלֽוֹת׃
Translated: of the eardrops, the bracelets, and the veils;
Transliteration: hanetifvot vehasheyrvot veharealvot

Hebrew: הַפְּאֵרִ֤ים וְהַצְּעָדוֹת֙ וְהַקִּשֻּׁרִ֔ים וּבָתֵּ֥י הַנֶּ֖פֶשׁ וְהַלְּחָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: the turbans, the armlets, and the sashes; of the talismans and the amulets;
Transliteration: hafeeriym vehatseadvot vehakishuriym uvatey hanefesh vehalechashiym

Hebrew: הַטַּבָּע֖וֹת וְנִזְמֵ֥י הָאָֽף׃
Translated: the signet rings and the nose rings;
Transliteration: hatavavot venizemey haaf

Hebrew: הַמַּֽחֲלָצוֹת֙ וְהַמַּ֣עֲטָפ֔וֹת וְהַמִּטְפָּח֖וֹת וְהָחֲרִיטִֽים׃
Translated: of the festive robes, the mantles, and the shawls; the purses,
Transliteration: hamachalatsvot vehamaatafvot vehamitefachvot vehachariytiym

Hebrew: וְהַגִּלְיֹנִים֙ וְהַסְּדִינִ֔ים וְהַצְּנִיפ֖וֹת וְהָרְדִידִֽים׃
Translated: the lace gowns, and the linen vests; and the kerchiefs and the capes.
Transliteration: vehagileyoniym vehasediyniym vehatseniyfvot veharediydiym

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ תַ֨חַת בֹּ֜שֶׂם מַ֣ק יִֽהְיֶ֗ה וְתַ֨חַת חֲגוֹרָ֤ה נִקְפָּה֙ וְתַ֨חַת מַעֲשֶׂ֤ה מִקְשֶׁה֙ קׇרְחָ֔ה וְתַ֥חַת פְּתִיגִ֖יל מַחֲגֹ֣רֶת שָׂ֑ק כִּי־תַ֖חַת יֹֽפִי׃
Translated:
And then—
Instead of perfume, there shall be rot;
And instead of an apron, a rope;
Instead of a diadem of beaten-work,
A shorn head;
Instead of a rich robe,
A girding of sackcloth;
A burn instead of beauty.
Transliteration: vehayah tachat voshem mak yiheyeh vetachat chagvorah nikefah vetachat maasheh mikesheh kׇrechah vetachat fetiygiyl machagoret shak khiy-tachat yofiy

Hebrew: מְתַ֖יִךְ בַּחֶ֣רֶב יִפֹּ֑לוּ וּגְבוּרָתֵ֖ךְ בַּמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Her men shall fall by the sword,
Her force, in battle;
Transliteration: metayiikhe vacherev yifolu ugevuratekhe vamilechamah

Hebrew: וְאָנ֥וּ וְאָבְל֖וּ פְּתָחֶ֑יהָ וְנִקָּ֖תָה לָאָ֥רֶץ תֵּשֵֽׁב׃
Translated:
And her gates shall lament and mourn,
And she shall be emptied,
Shall sit on the ground.
Transliteration: veanu veavelu fetacheyha venikatah laarets teshev

Hebrew: וְהֶחֱזִ֩יקוּ֩ שֶׁ֨בַע נָשִׁ֜ים בְּאִ֣ישׁ אֶחָ֗ד בַּיּ֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לַחְמֵ֣נוּ נֹאכֵ֔ל וְשִׂמְלָתֵ֖נוּ נִלְבָּ֑שׁ רַ֗ק יִקָּרֵ֤א שִׁמְךָ֙ עָלֵ֔ינוּ אֱסֹ֖ף חֶרְפָּתֵֽנוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
In that day, seven women shall take hold of one man, saying,
“We will eat our own food
And wear our own clothes;
Only let us be called by your name—
Take away our disgrace!”
Transliteration: vehecheziyku sheva nashiym veiysh echad vayyvom hahu lemor lachemenu nokhel veshimelatenu nilevash rak yikare shimekha aleynu esof cherefatenu {s}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יִֽהְיֶה֙ צֶ֣מַח יְהֹוָ֔ה לִצְבִ֖י וּלְכָב֑וֹד וּפְרִ֤י הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ לְגָא֣וֹן וּלְתִפְאֶ֔רֶת לִפְלֵיטַ֖ת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
In that day,
GOD’s radiance
Will lend beauty and glory,
And the splendor of the land
[Will give] dignity and majesty,
To the survivors of Israel.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yiheyeh tsemach yehovah litseviy ulekhavvod uferiy haarets legavon uletifeeret lifeleytat yisherael

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ הַנִּשְׁאָ֣ר בְּצִיּ֗וֹן וְהַנּוֹתָר֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם קָד֖וֹשׁ יֵאָ֣מֶר ל֑וֹ כׇּל־הַכָּת֥וּב לַחַיִּ֖ים בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
And those who remain in Zion
And are left in Jerusalem—
All who are inscribed for life in Jerusalem—
Shall be called holy.
Transliteration: vehayah hanishear vetsiyyvon vehanvotar viyrushala͏im kadvosh eiamer lvo khׇl-hakhatuv lachayiym viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: אִ֣ם ׀ רָחַ֣ץ אֲדֹנָ֗י אֵ֚ת צֹאַ֣ת בְּנוֹת־צִיּ֔וֹן וְאֶת־דְּמֵ֥י יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם יָדִ֣יחַ מִקִּרְבָּ֑הּ בְּר֥וּחַ מִשְׁפָּ֖ט וּבְר֥וּחַ בָּעֵֽר׃
Translated:
When the Sovereign has washed away
The filth of the daughters of Zion,
And from Jerusalem’s midst
Has rinsed out her infamy—
In a spirit of judgment
And in a spirit of purging—
Transliteration: im rachats adonay et tsoat venvot-tsiyyvon veet-demey yerushala͏im yadiycha mikirevah verucha mishefat uverucha vaer

Hebrew: וּבָרָ֣א יְהֹוָ֡ה עַל֩ כׇּל־מְכ֨וֹן הַר־צִיּ֜וֹן וְעַל־מִקְרָאֶ֗הָ עָנָ֤ן <small>׀</small> יוֹמָם֙ וְעָשָׁ֔ן וְנֹ֛גַהּ אֵ֥שׁ לֶהָבָ֖ה לָ֑יְלָה כִּ֥י עַל־כׇּל־כָּב֖וֹד חֻפָּֽה׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> will create over the whole shrine and meeting place of Mount Zion cloud by day and smoke with a glow of flaming fire by night. Indeed, over all the glory shall hang a canopy,
Transliteration: uvara yehovah al khׇl-mekhvon har-tsiyyvon veal-mikeraeha anan <small></small> yvomam veashan venogah esh lehavah layelah khiy al-khׇl-khavvod chufah

Hebrew: וְסֻכָּ֛ה תִּהְיֶ֥ה לְצֵל־יוֹמָ֖ם מֵחֹ֑רֶב וּלְמַחְסֶה֙ וּלְמִסְתּ֔וֹר מִזֶּ֖רֶם וּמִמָּטָֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: which shall serve as a pavilion for shade from heat by day and as a shelter for protection against drenching rain.
Transliteration: vesukhah tiheyeh letsel-yvomam mechorev ulemacheseh ulemisetvor mizerem umimatar {f}

Hebrew: אָשִׁ֤ירָה נָּא֙ לִֽידִידִ֔י שִׁירַ֥ת דּוֹדִ֖י לְכַרְמ֑וֹ כֶּ֛רֶם הָיָ֥ה לִידִידִ֖י בְּקֶ֥רֶן בֶּן־שָֽׁמֶן׃
Translated:
Let me sing for my beloved
A song of my lover about his vineyard.
My beloved had a vineyard
On a fruitful hill.
Transliteration: ashiyrah na liydiydiy shiyrat dvodiy lekharemvo kherem hayah liydiydiy vekeren ven-shamen

Hebrew: וַֽיְעַזְּקֵ֣הוּ וַֽיְסַקְּלֵ֗הוּ וַיִּטָּעֵ֙הוּ֙ שֹׂרֵ֔ק וַיִּ֤בֶן מִגְדָּל֙ בְּתוֹכ֔וֹ וְגַם־יֶ֖קֶב חָצֵ֣ב בּ֑וֹ וַיְקַ֛ו לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת עֲנָבִ֖ים וַיַּ֥עַשׂ בְּאֻשִֽׁים׃
Translated:
He broke the ground, cleared it of stones,
And planted it with choice vines.
He built a watchtower inside it,
He even hewed a wine press in it;
For he hoped it would yield grapes.
Instead, it yielded wild grapes.
Transliteration: vayeazekehu vayesakelehu vayitaehu shorek vayiven migedal vetvokhvo vegam-yekev chatsev vvo vayekav laashvot anaviym vayaash veushiym

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֛ה יוֹשֵׁ֥ב יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וְאִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֑ה שִׁפְטוּ־נָ֕א בֵּינִ֖י וּבֵ֥ין כַּרְמִֽי׃
Translated:
“Now, then,
Dwellers of Jerusalem
And citizenry of Judah,
You be the judges
Between Me and My vineyard:
Transliteration: veatah yvoshev yerushala͏im veiysh yehudah shifetu-na veyniy uveyn kharemiy

Hebrew: מַה־לַּעֲשׂ֥וֹת עוֹד֙ לְכַרְמִ֔י וְלֹ֥א עָשִׂ֖יתִי בּ֑וֹ מַדּ֧וּעַ קִוֵּ֛יתִי לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת עֲנָבִ֖ים וַיַּ֥עַשׂ בְּאֻשִֽׁים׃
Translated:
What more could have been done for My vineyard
That I failed to do in it?
Why, when I hoped it would yield grapes,
Did it yield wild grapes?
Transliteration: mah-laashvot vod lekharemiy velo ashiytiy vvo madua kiveytiy laashvot anaviym vayaash veushiym

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ אוֹדִיעָה־נָּ֣א אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֥י עֹשֶׂ֖ה לְכַרְמִ֑י הָסֵ֤ר מְשׂוּכָּתוֹ֙ וְהָיָ֣ה לְבָעֵ֔ר פָּרֹ֥ץ גְּדֵר֖וֹ וְהָיָ֥ה לְמִרְמָֽס׃
Translated:
“Now I am going to tell you
What I will do to My vineyard:
I will remove its hedge,
That it may be ravaged;
I will break down its wall,
That it may be trampled.
Transliteration: veatah vodiyah-na etekhem et asher-aniy osheh lekharemiy haser meshukhatvo vehayah levaer farots gedervo vehayah lemiremas

Hebrew: וַאֲשִׁיתֵ֣הוּ בָתָ֗ה לֹ֤א יִזָּמֵר֙ וְלֹ֣א יֵעָדֵ֔ר וְעָלָ֥ה שָׁמִ֖יר וָשָׁ֑יִת וְעַ֤ל הֶֽעָבִים֙ אֲצַוֶּ֔ה מֵהַמְטִ֥יר עָלָ֖יו מָטָֽר׃
Translated:
And I will make it a desolation;
It shall not be pruned or hoed,
And it shall be overgrown with briers and thistles.
And I will command the clouds
To drop no rain on it.”
Transliteration: vaashiytehu vatah lo yizamer velo eiader vealah shamiyr vashayiit veal heaviym atsaveh mehametiyr alayv matar

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֶ֜רֶם יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֔ה נְטַ֖ע שַׁעֲשׁוּעָ֑יו וַיְקַ֤ו לְמִשְׁפָּט֙ וְהִנֵּ֣ה מִשְׂפָּ֔ח לִצְדָקָ֖ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה צְעָקָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
For the vineyard of GOD of Hosts
Is the House of Israel,
And the seedlings he lovingly tended
Is the citizenry of Judah.
And [God] hoped for justice,
But behold, injustice;
For equity,
But behold, iniquity!
Transliteration: khiy kherem yehovah tsevavot veyt yisherael veiysh yehudah neta shaashuayv vayekav lemishefat vehineh mishefach litsedakah vehineh tseakah {f}

Hebrew: ה֗וֹי מַגִּיעֵ֥י בַ֙יִת֙ בְּבַ֔יִת שָׂדֶ֥ה בְשָׂדֶ֖ה יַקְרִ֑יבוּ עַ֚ד אֶ֣פֶס מָק֔וֹם וְהוּשַׁבְתֶּ֥ם לְבַדְּכֶ֖ם בְּקֶ֥רֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Ah,
Those who add house to house
And join field to field,
Till there is room for none but you
To dwell in the land!
Transliteration: hvoy magiyey vayiit vevayiit shadeh veshadeh yakeriyvu ad efes makvom vehushavetem levadekhem vekerev haarets

Hebrew: בְּאׇזְנָ֖י יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֑וֹת אִם־לֹ֞א בָּתִּ֤ים רַבִּים֙ לְשַׁמָּ֣ה יִֽהְי֔וּ גְּדֹלִ֥ים וְטוֹבִ֖ים מֵאֵ֥ין יוֹשֵֽׁב׃
Translated:
In my hearing [said] GOD of Hosts:
Surely, great houses
Shall lie forlorn,
Spacious and splendid ones
Without occupants.
Transliteration: veׇzenay yehovah tsevavot im-lo vatiym raviym leshamah yiheyu gedoliym vetvoviym meeyn yvoshev

Hebrew: כִּ֗י עֲשֶׂ֙רֶת֙ צִמְדֵּי־כֶ֔רֶם יַעֲשׂ֖וּ בַּ֣ת אֶחָ֑ת וְזֶ֥רַע חֹ֖מֶר יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֵיפָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
For ten acres of vineyard
Shall yield just one bath,
And a field sown with a ḥomer of seed
Shall yield a mere ephah.
Transliteration: khiy asheret tsimedey-kherem yaashu vat echat vezera chomer yaasheh eyfah {s}

Hebrew: ה֛וֹי מַשְׁכִּימֵ֥י בַבֹּ֖קֶר שֵׁכָ֣ר יִרְדֹּ֑פוּ מְאַחֲרֵ֣י בַנֶּ֔שֶׁף יַ֖יִן יַדְלִיקֵֽם׃
Translated:
Ah,
Those who chase liquor
From early in the morning,
And till late in the evening
Are inflamed by wine!
Transliteration: hvoy mashekhiymey vavoker shekhar yiredofu meacharey vaneshef yayiin yadeliykem

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה כִנּ֜וֹר וָנֶ֗בֶל תֹּ֧ף וְחָלִ֛יל וָיַ֖יִן מִשְׁתֵּיהֶ֑ם וְאֵ֨ת פֹּ֤עַל יְהֹוָה֙ לֹ֣א יַבִּ֔יטוּ וּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָדָ֖יו לֹ֥א רָאֽוּ׃
Translated:
Who, at their banquets,
Have lyre and lute,
Timbrel, flute, and wine;
But who never give a thought
To the divine plan,
And take no note
Of GOD’s design.
Transliteration: vehayah khinvor vanevel tof vechaliyl vayayiin misheteyhem veet foal yehovah lo yaviytu umaasheh yadayv lo rau

Hebrew: לָכֵ֛ן גָּלָ֥ה עַמִּ֖י מִבְּלִי־דָ֑עַת וּכְבוֹדוֹ֙ מְתֵ֣י רָעָ֔ב וַהֲמוֹנ֖וֹ צִחֵ֥ה צָמָֽא׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
My people will suffer exile
For not giving heed,
Its multitude victims of hunger
And its masses parched with thirst.
Transliteration: lakhen galah amiy miveliy-daat ukhevvodvo metey raav vahamvonvo tsicheh tsama

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן הִרְחִ֤יבָה שְּׁאוֹל֙ נַפְשָׁ֔הּ וּפָעֲרָ֥ה פִ֖יהָ לִבְלִי־חֹ֑ק וְיָרַ֨ד הֲדָרָ֧הּ וַהֲמוֹנָ֛הּ וּשְׁאוֹנָ֖הּ וְעָלֵ֥ז בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
Sheol has opened wide its gullet
And parted its jaws in a measureless gape;
And down into it shall go,
That splendor and tumult,
That din and revelry.
Transliteration: lakhen hirechiyvah shevol nafeshah ufaarah fiyha liveliy-chok veyarad hadarah vahamvonah ushevonah vealez vah

Hebrew: וַיִּשַּׁ֥ח אָדָ֖ם וַיִּשְׁפַּל־אִ֑ישׁ וְעֵינֵ֥י גְבֹהִ֖ים תִּשְׁפַּֽלְנָה׃
Translated:
Yea, human is bowed,
And mortal brought low;
Brought low is the pride of the haughty.
Transliteration: vayishach adam vayishefal-iysh veeyney gevohiym tishefalenah

Hebrew: וַיִּגְבַּ֛הּ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת בַּמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט וְהָאֵל֙ הַקָּד֔וֹשׁ נִקְדָּ֖שׁ בִּצְדָקָֽה׃
Translated:
And GOD of Hosts is exalted by judgment,
The Holy God proved holy by retribution.
Transliteration: vayigevah yehovah tsevavot vamishefat vehael hakadvosh nikedash vitsedakah

Hebrew: וְרָע֥וּ כְבָשִׂ֖ים כְּדׇבְרָ֑ם וְחׇרְב֥וֹת מֵחִ֖ים גָּרִ֥ים יֹאכֵֽלוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Then lambs shall graze
As in their meadows,
And strangers shall feed
On the ruins of the stout.
Transliteration: verau khevashiym khedׇveram vechׇrevvot mechiym gariym yokhelu {s}

Hebrew: ה֛וֹי מֹשְׁכֵ֥י הֶעָוֺ֖ן בְּחַבְלֵ֣י הַשָּׁ֑וְא וְכַעֲב֥וֹת הָעֲגָלָ֖ה חַטָּאָֽה׃
Translated:
Ah,
Those who haul sin with cords of falsehood
And iniquity as with cart ropes!
Transliteration: hvoy moshekhey heavon vechaveley hashave vekhaavvot haagalah chataah

Hebrew: הָאֹמְרִ֗ים יְמַהֵ֧ר ׀ יָחִ֛ישָׁה מַעֲשֵׂ֖הוּ לְמַ֣עַן נִרְאֶ֑ה וְתִקְרַ֣ב וְתָב֗וֹאָה עֲצַ֛ת קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְנֵדָֽעָה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Who say,
“Let [God] speed, let God’s purpose be hastened,
If we are to give thought;
Let the plans of the Holy One of Israel
Be quickly fulfilled,
If we are to give heed.”
Transliteration: haomeriym yemaher yachiyshah maashehu lemaan nireeh vetikerav vetavvoah atsat kedvosh yisherael venedaah {f}

Hebrew: ה֣וֹי הָאֹמְרִ֥ים לָרַ֛ע ט֖וֹב וְלַטּ֣וֹב רָ֑ע שָׂמִ֨ים חֹ֤שֶׁךְ לְאוֹר֙ וְא֣וֹר לְחֹ֔שֶׁךְ שָׂמִ֥ים מַ֛ר לְמָת֖וֹק וּמָת֥וֹק לְמָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Ah,
Those who call evil good
And good evil;
Who present darkness as light
And light as darkness;
Who present bitter as sweet
And sweet as bitter!
Transliteration: hvoy haomeriym lara tvov velatvov ra shamiym choshekhe levor vevor lechoshekhe shamiym mar lematvok umatvok lemar {s}

Hebrew: ה֖וֹי חֲכָמִ֣ים בְּעֵינֵיהֶ֑ם וְנֶ֥גֶד פְּנֵיהֶ֖ם נְבֹנִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
Ah,
Those who are so wise—
In their own opinion;
So clever—
In their own judgment!
Transliteration: hvoy chakhamiym veeyneyhem veneged feneyhem nevoniym {s}

Hebrew: ה֕וֹי גִּבּוֹרִ֖ים לִשְׁתּ֣וֹת יָ֑יִן וְאַנְשֵׁי־חַ֖יִל לִמְסֹ֥ךְ שֵׁכָֽר׃
Translated:
Ah,
Those who are so doughty—
As drinkers of wine,
And so valiant—
As mixers of drink!
Transliteration: hvoy givvoriym lishetvot yayiin veaneshey-chayiil limesokhe shekhar

Hebrew: מַצְדִּיקֵ֥י רָשָׁ֖ע עֵ֣קֶב שֹׁ֑חַד וְצִדְקַ֥ת צַדִּיקִ֖ים יָסִ֥ירוּ מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Who vindicate the one who is in the wrong
In return for a bribe,
And withhold vindication
From those who are in the right.
Transliteration: matsediykey rasha ekev shochad vetsidekat tsadiykiym yasiyru mimenu {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵן֩ כֶּאֱכֹ֨ל קַ֜שׁ לְשׁ֣וֹן אֵ֗שׁ וַחֲשַׁ֤שׁ לֶהָבָה֙ יִרְפֶּ֔ה שׇׁרְשָׁם֙ כַּמָּ֣ק יִֽהְיֶ֔ה וּפִרְחָ֖ם כָּאָבָ֣ק יַעֲלֶ֑ה כִּ֣י מָאֲס֗וּ אֵ֚ת תּוֹרַת֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת וְאֵ֛ת אִמְרַ֥ת קְדֽוֹשׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נִאֵֽצוּ׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
As straw is consumed by a tongue of fire
And hay shrivels as it burns,
Their stock shall become like rot,
And their buds shall blow away like dust.
For they have rejected the instruction of GOD of Hosts,
Spurned the word of the Holy One of Israel.
Transliteration: lakhen kheekhol kash leshvon esh vachashash lehavah yirefeh shׇresham khamak yiheyeh ufirecham khaavak yaaleh khiy maasu et tvorat yehovah tsevavot veet imerat kedvosh-yisherael nietsu

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֡ן חָרָה֩ אַף־יְהֹוָ֨ה בְּעַמּ֜וֹ וַיֵּ֣ט יָד֧וֹ עָלָ֣יו וַיַּכֵּ֗הוּ וַֽיִּרְגְּזוּ֙ הֶהָרִ֔ים וַתְּהִ֧י נִבְלָתָ֛ם כַּסּוּחָ֖ה בְּקֶ֣רֶב חוּצ֑וֹת בְּכׇל־זֹאת֙ לֹא־שָׁ֣ב אַפּ֔וֹ וְע֖וֹד יָד֥וֹ נְטוּיָֽה׃
Translated:
That is why
GOD ’s anger was roused
Against this covenanted people,
Why God’s arm was stretched out against it
And struck it,
So that the mountains quaked,
And its corpses lay
Like refuse in the streets.
Yet God’s anger has not turned back,
And a divine arm is outstretched still.
Transliteration: al-khen charah af-yehovah veamvo vayet yadvo alayv vayakhehu vayiregezu hehariym vatehiy nivelatam khasuchah vekerev chutsvot vekhׇl-zot lo-shav afvo vevod yadvo netuyah

Hebrew: וְנָֽשָׂא־נֵ֤ס לַגּוֹיִם֙ מֵרָח֔וֹק וְשָׁ֥רַק ל֖וֹ מִקְצֵ֣ה הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהִנֵּ֥ה מְהֵרָ֖ה קַ֥ל יָבֽוֹא׃
Translated:
[God] will raise an ensign to a nation afar,
Whistle to one at the end of the earth.
There it comes with lightning speed!
Transliteration: venasha-nes lagvoyim merachvok vesharak lvo miketseh haarets vehineh meherah kal yavvo

Hebrew: אֵין־עָיֵ֤ף וְאֵין־כּוֹשֵׁל֙ בּ֔וֹ לֹ֥א יָנ֖וּם וְלֹ֣א יִישָׁ֑ן וְלֹ֤א נִפְתַּח֙ אֵז֣וֹר חֲלָצָ֔יו וְלֹ֥א נִתַּ֖ק שְׂר֥וֹךְ נְעָלָֽיו׃
Translated:
In its ranks, none is weary or stumbles,
They never sleep or slumber;
The belts on their waists do not come loose,
Nor do the thongs of their sandals break.
Transliteration: eyn-aeif veeyn-khvoshel vvo lo yanum velo yiyshan velo nifetach ezvor chalatsayv velo nitak shervokhe nealayv

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר חִצָּיו֙ שְׁנוּנִ֔ים וְכׇל־קַשְּׁתֹתָ֖יו דְּרֻכ֑וֹת פַּרְס֤וֹת סוּסָיו֙ כַּצַּ֣ר נֶחְשָׁ֔בוּ וְגַלְגִּלָּ֖יו כַּסּוּפָֽה׃
Translated:
Their arrows are sharpened,
And all their bows are drawn.
Their horses’ hoofs are like flint,
Their chariot wheels like the whirlwind.
Transliteration: asher chitsayv shenuniym vekhׇl-kashetotayv derukhvot faresvot susayv khatsar necheshavu vegalegilayv khasufah

Hebrew: שְׁאָגָ֥ה ל֖וֹ כַּלָּבִ֑יא (ושאג) [יִשְׁאַ֨ג] כַּכְּפִירִ֤ים וְיִנְהֹם֙ וְיֹאחֵ֣ז טֶ֔רֶף וְיַפְלִ֖יט וְאֵ֥ין מַצִּֽיל׃
Translated:
Their roaring is like a lion’s,
They roar like the great beasts;
When they growl and seize a prey,
They carry it off and none can recover it.
Transliteration: sheagah lvo khalaviy (vshg) [yisheag] khakhefiyriym veyinehom veyochez teref veyafeliyt veeyn matsiyl

Hebrew: וְיִנְהֹ֥ם עָלָ֛יו בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא כְּנַהֲמַת־יָ֑ם וְנִבַּ֤ט לָאָ֙רֶץ֙ וְהִנֵּה־חֹ֔שֶׁךְ צַ֣ר וָא֔וֹר חָשַׁ֖ךְ בַּעֲרִיפֶֽיהָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
But in that day, a roaring shall resound over My people like that of the sea; and then they shall look below and, behold,
Distressing darkness, with light;
Darkness, in its lowering clouds.
Transliteration: veyinehom alayv vayyvom hahu khenahamat-yam venivat laarets vehineh-choshekhe tsar vavor chashakhe vaariyfeyha {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַת־מוֹת֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ עֻזִּיָּ֔הוּ וָאֶרְאֶ֧ה אֶת־אֲדֹנָ֛י יֹשֵׁ֥ב עַל־כִּסֵּ֖א רָ֣ם וְנִשָּׂ֑א וְשׁוּלָ֖יו מְלֵאִ֥ים אֶת־הַהֵיכָֽל׃
Translated: In the year that King Uzziah died, I beheld my Sovereign seated on a high and lofty throne; and the skirts of God’s robe filled the temple.
Transliteration: vishenat-mvot hamelekhe uziyahu vaereeh et-adonay yoshev al-khise ram venisha veshulayv meleiym et-haheykhal

Hebrew: שְׂרָפִ֨ים עֹמְדִ֤ים ׀ מִמַּ֙עַל֙ ל֔וֹ שֵׁ֧שׁ כְּנָפַ֛יִם שֵׁ֥שׁ כְּנָפַ֖יִם לְאֶחָ֑ד בִּשְׁתַּ֣יִם ׀ יְכַסֶּ֣ה פָנָ֗יו וּבִשְׁתַּ֛יִם יְכַסֶּ֥ה רַגְלָ֖יו וּבִשְׁתַּ֥יִם יְעוֹפֵֽף׃
Translated: Seraphs stood in attendance, each with six wings—two covering the face, two covering the body, and two to fly with.
Transliteration: sherafiym omediym mimaal lvo shesh khenafayiim shesh khenafayiim leechad vishetayiim yekhaseh fanayv uvishetayiim yekhaseh ragelayv uvishetayiim yevofef

Hebrew: וְקָרָ֨א זֶ֤ה אֶל־זֶה֙ וְאָמַ֔ר קָד֧וֹשׁ <small>׀</small> קָד֛וֹשׁ קָד֖וֹשׁ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֑וֹת מְלֹ֥א כׇל־הָאָ֖רֶץ כְּבוֹדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
And one would call to the other,
“Holy, holy, holy!
GOD of Hosts—
Whose presence fills all the earth!”
Transliteration: vekara zeh el-zeh veamar kadvosh <small></small> kadvosh kadvosh yehovah tsevavot melo khׇl-haarets khevvodvo

Hebrew: וַיָּנֻ֙עוּ֙ אַמּ֣וֹת הַסִּפִּ֔ים מִקּ֖וֹל הַקּוֹרֵ֑א וְהַבַּ֖יִת יִמָּלֵ֥א עָשָֽׁן׃
Translated: The doorposts would shake at the sound of the one who called, and the House kept filling with smoke.
Transliteration: vayanuu amvot hasifiym mikvol hakvore vehavayiit yimale ashan

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֞ר אֽוֹי־לִ֣י כִֽי־נִדְמֵ֗יתִי כִּ֣י אִ֤ישׁ טְמֵֽא־שְׂפָתַ֙יִם֙ אָנֹ֔כִי וּבְתוֹךְ֙ עַם־טְמֵ֣א שְׂפָתַ֔יִם אָנֹכִ֖י יוֹשֵׁ֑ב כִּ֗י אֶת־הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת רָא֥וּ עֵינָֽי׃
Translated:
I cried,
“Woe is me; I am lost!
For I am a man of impure lips
And I live among a people
Of impure lips;
Yet my own eyes have beheld
The Sovereign GOD of Hosts.”
Transliteration: vaomar voy-liy khiy-nidemeytiy khiy iysh teme-shefatayiim anokhiy uvetvokhe am-teme shefatayiim anokhiy yvoshev khiy et-hamelekhe yehovah tsevavot rau eynay

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣עׇף אֵלַ֗י אֶחָד֙ מִן־הַשְּׂרָפִ֔ים וּבְיָד֖וֹ רִצְפָּ֑ה בְּמֶ֨לְקַחַ֔יִם לָקַ֖ח מֵעַ֥ל הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: Then one of the seraphs—who had taken a live coal from the altar with a pair of tongs—flew over to me,
Transliteration: vayaׇf elay echad min-hasherafiym uveyadvo ritsefah vemelekachayiim lakach meal hamizevecha

Hebrew: וַיַּגַּ֣ע עַל־פִּ֔י וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּ֛ה נָגַ֥ע זֶ֖ה עַל־שְׂפָתֶ֑יךָ וְסָ֣ר עֲוֺנֶ֔ךָ וְחַטָּאתְךָ֖ תְּכֻפָּֽר׃
Translated:
touched it to my lips, and declared,
“Now that this has touched your lips,
Your guilt shall depart
And your sin be purged away.”
Transliteration: vayaga al-fiy vayomer hineh naga zeh al-shefateykha vesar avonekha vechatatekha tekhufar

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁמַ֞ע אֶת־ק֤וֹל אֲדֹנָי֙ אֹמֵ֔ר אֶת־מִ֥י אֶשְׁלַ֖ח וּמִ֣י יֵֽלֶךְ־לָ֑נוּ וָאֹמַ֖ר הִנְנִ֥י שְׁלָחֵֽנִי׃
Translated: Then I heard the voice of my Sovereign saying, “Whom shall I send? Who will go for us?” And I said, “Here am I; send me.”
Transliteration: vaeshema et-kvol adonay omer et-miy eshelach umiy eilekhe-lanu vaomar hineniy shelacheniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֵ֥ךְ וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה שִׁמְע֤וּ שָׁמ֙וֹעַ֙ וְאַל־תָּבִ֔ינוּ וּרְא֥וּ רָא֖וֹ וְאַל־תֵּדָֽעוּ׃
Translated:
And [God] said, “Go, say to that people:
‘Hear, indeed, but do not understand;
See, indeed, but do not grasp.’
Transliteration: vayomer lekhe veamareta laam hazeh shimeu shamvoa veal-taviynu ureu ravo veal-tedau

Hebrew: הַשְׁמֵן֙ לֵב־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְאׇזְנָ֥יו הַכְבֵּ֖ד וְעֵינָ֣יו הָשַׁ֑ע פֶּן־יִרְאֶ֨ה בְעֵינָ֜יו וּבְאׇזְנָ֣יו יִשְׁמָ֗ע וּלְבָב֥וֹ יָבִ֛ין וָשָׁ֖ב וְרָ֥פָא לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Dull that people’s mind,
Stop its ears,
And seal its eyes—
Lest, seeing with its eyes
And hearing with its ears,
It also grasp with its mind,
And repent and save itself.”
Transliteration: hashemen lev-haam hazeh veׇzenayv hakheved veeynayv hasha fen-yireeh veeynayv uveׇzenayv yishema ulevavvo yaviyn vashav verafa lvo

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֕ר עַד־מָתַ֖י אֲדֹנָ֑י וַיֹּ֡אמֶר עַ֣ד אֲשֶׁר֩ אִם־שָׁא֨וּ עָרִ֜ים מֵאֵ֣ין יוֹשֵׁ֗ב וּבָתִּים֙ מֵאֵ֣ין אָדָ֔ם וְהָאֲדָמָ֖ה תִּשָּׁאֶ֥ה שְׁמָמָֽה׃
Translated:
I asked, “How long, my Sovereign?” And [God] replied:
“Till towns lie waste without inhabitants
And houses without people,
And the ground lies waste and desolate—
Transliteration: vaomar ad-matay adonay vayomer ad asher im-shau ariym meeyn yvoshev uvatiym meeyn adam vehaadamah tishaeh shemamah

Hebrew: וְרִחַ֥ק יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־הָאָדָ֑ם וְרַבָּ֥ה הָעֲזוּבָ֖ה בְּקֶ֥רֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
For GOD will banish the population—
And deserted sites are many
In the midst of the land.
Transliteration: verichak yehovah et-haadam veravah haazuvah vekerev haarets

Hebrew: וְע֥וֹד בָּהּ֙ עֲשִׂ֣רִיָּ֔ה וְשָׁ֖בָה וְהָיְתָ֣ה לְבָעֵ֑ר כָּאֵלָ֣ה וְכָאַלּ֗וֹן אֲשֶׁ֤ר בְּשַׁלֶּ֙כֶת֙ מַצֶּ֣בֶת בָּ֔ם זֶ֥רַע קֹ֖דֶשׁ מַצַּבְתָּֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated: “But while a tenth part yet remains in it, it shall repent. It shall be ravaged like the terebinth and the oak, of which stumps are left even when they are felled: its stump shall be a holy seed.”
Transliteration: vevod vah ashiriyah veshavah vehayetah levaer khaelah vekhaalvon asher veshalekhet matsevet vam zera kodesh matsavetah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י בִּימֵ֣י אָ֠חָ֠ז בֶּן־יוֹתָ֨ם בֶּן־עֻזִּיָּ֜הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֗ה עָלָ֣ה רְצִ֣ין מֶֽלֶךְ־אֲ֠רָ֠ם וּפֶ֨קַח בֶּן־רְמַלְיָ֤הוּ מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה עָלֶ֑יהָ וְלֹ֥א יָכֹ֖ל לְהִלָּחֵ֥ם עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: In the reign of Ahaz son of Jotham son of Uzziah, king of Judah, King Rezin of Aram and King Pekah son of Remaliah of Israel marched upon Jerusalem to attack it; but they were not able to attack it.
Transliteration: vayehiy viymey achaz ven-yvotam ven-uziyahu melekhe yehudah alah retsiyn melekhe-aram ufekach ven-remaleyahu melekhe-yisherael yerushala͏im lamilechamah aleyha velo yakhol lehilachem aleyha

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֗ד לְבֵ֤ית דָּוִד֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר נָ֥חָה אֲרָ֖ם עַל־אֶפְרָ֑יִם וַיָּ֤נַע לְבָבוֹ֙ וּלְבַ֣ב עַמּ֔וֹ כְּנ֥וֹעַ עֲצֵי־יַ֖עַר מִפְּנֵי־רֽוּחַ׃ {ס}
Translated: Now, when it was reported to the House of David that Aram had allied itself with Ephraim, their hearts and the hearts of their people trembled as trees of the forest sway before a wind.
Transliteration: vayugad leveyt david lemor nachah aram al-eferayiim vayana levavvo ulevav amvo khenvoa atsey-yaar mifeney-rucha {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָה֮ אֶֽל־יְשַֽׁעְיָ֒הוּ֒ צֵא־נָא֙ לִקְרַ֣את אָחָ֔ז אַתָּ֕ה וּשְׁאָ֖ר יָשׁ֣וּב בְּנֶ֑ךָ אֶל־קְצֵ֗ה תְּעָלַת֙ הַבְּרֵכָ֣ה הָעֶלְיוֹנָ֔ה אֶל־מְסִלַּ֖ת שְׂדֵ֥ה כוֹבֵֽס׃
Translated: But G<small>OD</small> said to Isaiah, “Go out with your son Shear-jashub to meet Ahaz at the end of the conduit of the Upper Pool, by the road of the Fuller’s Field.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-yeshaeyahu tse-na likerat achaz atah ushear yashuv venekha el-ketseh tealat haverekhah haeleyvonah el-mesilat shedeh khvoves

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵ֠לָ֠יו הִשָּׁמֵ֨ר וְהַשְׁקֵ֜ט אַל־תִּירָ֗א וּלְבָֽבְךָ֙ אַל־יֵרַ֔ךְ מִשְּׁנֵ֨י זַנְב֧וֹת הָאוּדִ֛ים הָעֲשֵׁנִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה בׇּחֳרִי־אַ֛ף רְצִ֥ין וַאֲרָ֖ם וּבֶן־רְמַלְיָֽהוּ׃
Translated: And say to him: Be firm and be calm. Do not be afraid and do not lose heart on account of those two smoking stubs of firebrands, on account of the raging of Rezin and his Arameans and the son of Remaliah.
Transliteration: veamareta elayv hishamer vehasheket al-tiyra ulevavekha al-eirakhe misheney zanevvot haudiym haasheniym haeleh vׇchoriy-af retsiyn vaaram uven-remaleyahu

Hebrew: יַ֗עַן כִּֽי־יָעַ֥ץ עָלֶ֛יךָ אֲרָ֖ם רָעָ֑ה אֶפְרַ֥יִם וּבֶן־רְמַלְיָ֖הוּ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Because the Arameans—with Ephraim and the son of Remaliah—have plotted against you, saying,
Transliteration: yaan khiy-yaats aleykha aram raah eferayiim uven-remaleyahu lemor

Hebrew: נַעֲלֶ֤ה בִֽיהוּדָה֙ וּנְקִיצֶ֔נָּה וְנַבְקִעֶ֖נָּה אֵלֵ֑ינוּ וְנַמְלִ֥יךְ מֶ֙לֶךְ֙ בְּתוֹכָ֔הּ אֵ֖ת בֶּן־טָֽבְאַֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: ‘We will march against Judah and invade and conquer it, and we will set up as king in it the son of Tabeel,’
Transliteration: naaleh viyhudah unekiytsenah venavekienah eleynu venameliykhe melekhe vetvokhah et ven-taveal {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה לֹ֥א תָק֖וּם וְלֹ֥א תִֽהְיֶֽה׃
Translated:
thus said my Sovereign GOD:
It shall not succeed,
It shall not come to pass.
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih lo takum velo tiheyeh

Hebrew: כִּ֣י רֹ֤אשׁ אֲרָם֙ דַּמֶּ֔שֶׂק וְרֹ֥אשׁ דַּמֶּ֖שֶׂק רְצִ֑ין וּבְע֗וֹד שִׁשִּׁ֤ים וְחָמֵשׁ֙ שָׁנָ֔ה יֵחַ֥ת אֶפְרַ֖יִם מֵעָֽם׃
Translated:
For the chief city of Aram is Damascus,
And the chief of Damascus is Rezin;
Transliteration: khiy rosh aram dameshek verosh dameshek retsiyn uvevod shishiym vechamesh shanah eichat eferayiim meam

Hebrew: וְרֹ֤אשׁ אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ שֹׁמְר֔וֹן וְרֹ֥אשׁ שֹׁמְר֖וֹן בֶּן־רְמַלְיָ֑הוּ אִ֚ם לֹ֣א תַאֲמִ֔ינוּ כִּ֖י לֹ֥א תֵאָמֵֽנוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
The chief city of Ephraim is Samaria,
And the chief of Samaria is the son of Remaliah.
And in another sixty-five years,
Ephraim shall be shattered as a people.
If you will not believe, for you cannot be trusted…”
Transliteration: verosh eferayiim shomervon verosh shomervon ven-remaleyahu im lo taamiynu khiy lo teamenu {f}

Hebrew: וַיּ֣וֹסֶף יְהֹוָ֔ה דַּבֵּ֥ר אֶל־אָחָ֖ז לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> spoke further to Ahaz:
Transliteration: vayyvosef yehovah daver el-achaz lemor

Hebrew: שְׁאַל־לְךָ֣ א֔וֹת מֵעִ֖ם יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ הַעְמֵ֣ק שְׁאָ֔לָה א֖וֹ הַגְבֵּ֥הַּ לְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: “Ask for a sign from the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, anywhere down to Sheol or up to the sky.”
Transliteration: sheal-lekha vot meim yehovah eloheykha haemek shealah vo hageveha lemaelah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אָחָ֑ז לֹא־אֶשְׁאַ֥ל וְלֹֽא־אֲנַסֶּ֖ה אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But Ahaz replied, “I will not ask, and I will not test G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: vayomer achaz lo-esheal velo-anaseh et-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֖א בֵּ֣ית דָּוִ֑ד הַמְעַ֤ט מִכֶּם֙ הַלְא֣וֹת אֲנָשִׁ֔ים כִּ֥י תַלְא֖וּ גַּ֥ם אֶת־אֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated: “Listen, House of David,” [Isaiah] retorted, “is it not enough for you to treat the agents as helpless that you also treat my God as helpless?
Transliteration: vayomer shimeu-na veyt david hameat mikhem halevot anashiym khiy taleu gam et-elohay

Hebrew: לָ֠כֵ֠ן יִתֵּ֨ן אֲדֹנָ֥י ה֛וּא לָכֶ֖ם א֑וֹת הִנֵּ֣ה הָעַלְמָ֗ה הָרָה֙ וְיֹלֶ֣דֶת בֵּ֔ן וְקָרָ֥את שְׁמ֖וֹ עִמָּ֥נוּ אֵֽל׃
Translated: Assuredly, my Sovereign will give you a sign nonetheless! Look, the young woman is with child and about to give birth to a son. Let her name him Immanuel.
Transliteration: lakhen yiten adonay hu lakhem vot hineh haalemah harah veyoledet ven vekarat shemvo imanu el

Hebrew: חֶמְאָ֥ה וּדְבַ֖שׁ יֹאכֵ֑ל לְדַעְתּ֛וֹ מָא֥וֹס בָּרָ֖ע וּבָח֥וֹר בַּטּֽוֹב׃
Translated: (By the time he learns to reject the bad and choose the good, people will be feeding on curds and honey.)
Transliteration: chemeah udevash yokhel ledaetvo mavos vara uvachvor vatvov

Hebrew: כִּ֠י בְּטֶ֨רֶם יֵדַ֥ע הַנַּ֛עַר מָאֹ֥ס בָּרָ֖ע וּבָחֹ֣ר בַּטּ֑וֹב תֵּעָזֵ֤ב הָאֲדָמָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַתָּ֣ה קָ֔ץ מִפְּנֵ֖י שְׁנֵ֥י מְלָכֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: For before the lad knows to reject the bad and choose the good, the ground whose two kings you dread shall be abandoned.
Transliteration: khiy veterem eida hanaar maos vara uvachor vatvov teazev haadamah asher atah kats mifeney sheney melakheyha

Hebrew: יָבִ֨יא יְהֹוָ֜ה עָלֶ֗יךָ וְעַֽל־עַמְּךָ֮ וְעַל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֒יךָ֒ יָמִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־בָ֔אוּ לְמִיּ֥וֹם סוּר־אֶפְרַ֖יִם מֵעַ֣ל יְהוּדָ֑ה אֵ֖ת מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃ {פ}
Translated: G<small>OD</small> will cause to come upon you and your people and your ancestral house such days as have not come since Ephraim turned away from Judah—that selfsame king of Assyria!
Transliteration: yaviy yehovah aleykha veal-amekha veal-veyt aviykha yamiym asher lo-vau lemiyyvom sur-eferayiim meal yehudah et melekhe ashur {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יִשְׁרֹ֤ק יְהֹוָה֙ לַזְּב֔וּב אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּקְצֵ֖ה יְאֹרֵ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם וְלַ֨דְּבוֹרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּאֶ֥רֶץ אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: “In that day, G<small>OD</small> will whistle to the flies at the ends of the water channels of Egypt and to the bees in the land of Assyria;
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu yisherok yehovah lazevuv asher viketseh yeorey mitserayiim veladevvorah asher veerets ashur

Hebrew: וּבָ֨אוּ וְנָח֤וּ כֻלָּם֙ בְּנַחֲלֵ֣י הַבַּתּ֔וֹת וּבִנְקִיקֵ֖י הַסְּלָעִ֑ים וּבְכֹל֙ הַנַּ֣עֲצוּצִ֔ים וּבְכֹ֖ל הַנַּהֲלֹלִֽים׃
Translated: and they shall all come and alight in the rugged wadis, and in the clefts of the rocks, and in all the thornbrakes, and in all the watering places.
Transliteration: uvau venachu khulam venachaley havatvot uvinekiykey haselaiym uvekhol hanaatsutsiym uvekhol hanahaloliym

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֡וּא יְגַלַּ֣ח אֲדֹנָי֩ בְּתַ֨עַר הַשְּׂכִירָ֜ה בְּעֶבְרֵ֤י נָהָר֙ בְּמֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר אֶת־הָרֹ֖אשׁ וְשַׂ֣עַר הָרַגְלָ֑יִם וְגַ֥ם אֶת־הַזָּקָ֖ן תִּסְפֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: “In that day, my Sovereign will cut away with the razor that is hired beyond the Euphrates—with the king of Assyria—the hair of the head and the hair of the legs, and it shall clip off the beard as well.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yegalach adonay vetaar hashekhiyrah veeverey nahar vemelekhe ashur et-harosh veshaar haragelayiim vegam et-hazakan tisefeh {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא יְחַיֶּה־אִ֛ישׁ עֶגְלַ֥ת בָּקָ֖ר וּשְׁתֵּי־צֹֽאן׃
Translated: And in that day, each household shall save alive a heifer of the herd and two animals of the flock.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu yechayeh-iysh egelat vakar ushetey-tson

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה מֵרֹ֛ב עֲשׂ֥וֹת חָלָ֖ב יֹאכַ֣ל חֶמְאָ֑ה כִּֽי־חֶמְאָ֤ה וּדְבַשׁ֙ יֹאכֵ֔ל כׇּל־הַנּוֹתָ֖ר בְּקֶ֥רֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated: (And they shall obtain so much milk that they shall eat curds.) Thus everyone who is left in the land shall feed on curds and honey.
Transliteration: vehayah merov ashvot chalav yokhal chemeah khiy-chemeah udevash yokhel khׇl-hanvotar vekerev haarets {s}

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא יִהְיֶ֣ה כׇל־מָק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֧ר יִֽהְיֶה־שָּׁ֛ם אֶ֥לֶף גֶּ֖פֶן בְּאֶ֣לֶף כָּ֑סֶף לַשָּׁמִ֥יר וְלַשַּׁ֖יִת יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: “For in that day, every spot where there could stand a thousand vines worth a thousand shekels of silver shall become a wilderness of thornbush and thistle.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu yiheyeh khׇl-makvom asher yiheyeh-sham elef gefen veelef khasef lashamiyr velashayiit yiheyeh

Hebrew: בַּחִצִּ֥ים וּבַקֶּ֖שֶׁת יָ֣בוֹא שָׁ֑מָּה כִּֽי־שָׁמִ֥יר וָשַׁ֖יִת תִּֽהְיֶ֥ה כׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: One will have to go there with bow and arrows, for the country shall be all thornbushes and thistles.
Transliteration: vachitsiym uvakeshet yavvo shamah khiy-shamiyr vashayiit tiheyeh khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: וְכֹ֣ל הֶהָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר בַּמַּעְדֵּר֙ יֵעָ֣דֵר֔וּן לֹא־תָב֣וֹא שָׁ֔מָּה יִרְאַ֖ת שָׁמִ֣יר וָשָׁ֑יִת וְהָיָה֙ לְמִשְׁלַ֣ח שׁ֔וֹר וּלְמִרְמַ֖ס שֶֽׂה׃ {פ}
Translated: But the perils of thornbush and thistle shall not spread to any of the hills that could only be tilled with a hoe; and here cattle shall be let loose, and sheep and goats shall tramp about.”
Transliteration: vekhol hehariym asher vamaeder eiaderun lo-tavvo shamah yireat shamiyr vashayiit vehayah lemishelach shvor ulemiremas sheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י קַח־לְךָ֖ גִּלָּי֣וֹן גָּד֑וֹל וּכְתֹ֤ב עָלָיו֙ בְּחֶ֣רֶט אֱנ֔וֹשׁ לְמַהֵ֥ר שָׁלָ֖ל חָ֥שׁ בַּֽז׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to me, “Get yourself a large sheet and write on it in common script ‘For Maher-shalal-hash-baz’;
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay kach-lekha gilayvon gadvol ukhetov alayv vecheret envosh lemaher shalal chash vaz

Hebrew: וְאָעִ֣ידָה לִּ֔י עֵדִ֖ים נֶאֱמָנִ֑ים אֵ֚ת אוּרִיָּ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶת־זְכַרְיָ֖הוּ בֶּ֥ן יְבֶרֶכְיָֽהוּ׃
Translated: and call reliable witnesses, the priest Uriah and Zechariah son of Jeberechiah, to witness for Me.”
Transliteration: veaiydah liy ediym neemaniym et uriyah hakhohen veet-zekhareyahu ven yeverekheyahu

Hebrew: וָֽאֶקְרַב֙ אֶל־הַנְּבִיאָ֔ה וַתַּ֖הַר וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן {ס} וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י קְרָ֣א שְׁמ֔וֹ מַהֵ֥ר שָׁלָ֖ל חָ֥שׁ בַּֽז׃
Translated: I was intimate with the prophetess, and she conceived and bore a son; and G<small>OD</small> said to me, “Name him Maher-shalal-hash-baz.
Transliteration: vaekerav el-haneviyah vatahar vateled ven {s} vayomer yehovah elay kera shemvo maher shalal chash vaz

Hebrew: כִּ֗י בְּטֶ֙רֶם֙ יֵדַ֣ע הַנַּ֔עַר קְרֹ֖א אָבִ֣י וְאִמִּ֑י יִשָּׂ֣א ׀ אֶת־חֵ֣יל דַּמֶּ֗שֶׂק וְאֵת֙ שְׁלַ֣ל שֹׁמְר֔וֹן לִפְנֵ֖י מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃ {ס}
Translated: For before the boy learns to call ‘Father’ and ‘Mother,’ the wealth of Damascus and the spoils of Samaria, and the delights of Rezin and of the son of Remaliah, shall be carried off before the king of Assyria.”
Transliteration: khiy veterem eida hanaar kero aviy veimiy yisha et-cheyl dameshek veet shelal shomervon lifeney melekhe ashur {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣סֶף יְהֹוָ֔ה דַּבֵּ֥ר אֵלַ֛י ע֖וֹד לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Again G<small>OD</small> spoke to me, thus:
Transliteration: vayosef yehovah daver elay vod lemor

Hebrew: יַ֗עַן כִּ֤י מָאַס֙ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה אֵ֚ת מֵ֣י הַשִּׁלֹ֔חַ הַהֹלְכִ֖ים לְאַ֑ט וּמְשׂ֥וֹשׂ אֶת־רְצִ֖ין וּבֶן־רְמַלְיָֽהוּ׃
Translated:
“Because that people has spurned
The gently flowing waters of Siloam”—
Transliteration: yaan khiy maas haam hazeh et mey hashilocha haholekhiym leat umeshvosh et-retsiyn uven-remaleyahu

Hebrew: וְלָכֵ֡ן הִנֵּ֣ה אֲדֹנָי֩ מַעֲלֶ֨ה עֲלֵיהֶ֜ם אֶת־מֵ֣י הַנָּהָ֗ר הָעֲצוּמִים֙ וְהָ֣רַבִּ֔ים אֶת־מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּׁ֖וּר וְאֶת־כׇּל־כְּבוֹד֑וֹ וְעָלָה֙ עַל־כׇּל־אֲפִיקָ֔יו וְהָלַ֖ךְ עַל־כׇּל־גְּדוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
The Sovereign will bring up against them
The mighty, massive waters of the Euphrates,
The king of Assyria and all his multitude.
It shall rise above all its channels,
And flow over all its beds,
Transliteration: velakhen hineh adonay maaleh aleyhem et-mey hanahar haatsumiym veharaviym et-melekhe ashur veet-khׇl-khevvodvo vealah al-khׇl-afiykayv vehalakhe al-khׇl-gedvotayv

Hebrew: וְחָלַ֤ף בִּֽיהוּדָה֙ שָׁטַ֣ף וְעָבַ֔ר עַד־צַוָּ֖אר יַגִּ֑יעַ וְהָיָה֙ מֻטּ֣וֹת כְּנָפָ֔יו מְלֹ֥א רֹחַב־אַרְצְךָ֖ עִמָּ֥נוּ אֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
And swirl through Judah like a flash flood
Reaching up to the neck.
But with us is God,
Whose wings are spread
As wide as your land is broad!
Transliteration: vechalaf viyhudah shataf veavar ad-tsavar yagiya vehayah mutvot khenafayv melo rochav-aretsekha imanu el {s}

Hebrew: רֹ֤עוּ עַמִּים֙ וָחֹ֔תּוּ וְהַֽאֲזִ֔ינוּ כֹּ֖ל מֶרְחַקֵּי־אָ֑רֶץ הִתְאַזְּר֣וּ וָחֹ֔תּוּ הִֽתְאַזְּר֖וּ וָחֹֽתּוּ׃
Translated:
Band together, O peoples—you shall be broken!
Listen to this, you remotest parts of the earth:
Gird yourselves—you shall be broken;
Gird yourselves—you shall be broken!
Transliteration: rou amiym vachotu vehaaziynu khol merechakey-arets hiteazeru vachotu hiteazeru vachotu

Hebrew: עֻ֥צוּ עֵצָ֖ה וְתֻפָ֑ר דַּבְּר֤וּ דָבָר֙ וְלֹ֣א יָק֔וּם כִּ֥י עִמָּ֖נוּ אֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
Hatch a plot—it shall be foiled;
Agree on action—it shall not succeed.
For with us is God!
Transliteration: utsu etsah vetufar daveru davar velo yakum khiy imanu el {s}

Hebrew: כִּי֩ כֹ֨ה אָמַ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֵלַ֖י כְּחֶזְקַ֣ת הַיָּ֑ד וְיִסְּרֵ֕נִי מִלֶּ֛כֶת בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ הָֽעָם־הַזֶּ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: For this is what G<small>OD</small> said to me, upon taking me by the hand and charging me not to walk in the path of that people:
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah elay khechezekat hayad veyisereniy milekhet vederekhe haam-hazeh lemor

Hebrew: לֹא־תֹאמְר֣וּן קֶ֔שֶׁר לְכֹ֧ל אֲשֶׁר־יֹאמַ֛ר הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה קָ֑שֶׁר וְאֶת־מוֹרָא֥וֹ לֹא־תִֽירְא֖וּ וְלֹ֥א תַעֲרִֽיצוּ׃
Translated:
“You must not call conspiracy
All that that people calls conspiracy,
Nor revere what it reveres,
Nor hold it in awe.
Transliteration: lo-tomerun kesher lekhol asher-yomar haam hazeh kasher veet-mvoravo lo-tiyreu velo taariytsu

Hebrew: אֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת אֹת֣וֹ תַקְדִּ֑ישׁוּ וְה֥וּא מוֹרַאֲכֶ֖ם וְה֥וּא מַעֲרִֽצְכֶֽם׃
Translated:
None but GOD of Hosts
Shall you account holy;
Give reverence to [God] alone,
Hold [God] alone in awe.
Transliteration: et-yehovah tsevavot otvo takediyshu vehu mvoraakhem vehu maaritsekhem

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֖ה לְמִקְדָּ֑שׁ וּלְאֶ֣בֶן נֶ֠גֶף וּלְצ֨וּר מִכְשׁ֜וֹל לִשְׁנֵ֨י בָתֵּ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לְפַ֣ח וּלְמוֹקֵ֔שׁ לְיוֹשֵׁ֖ב יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
[God] shall become a sanctuary,
A stone people strike against:
A rock people stumble over
For the two Houses of Israel,
And a trap and a snare for those
Who dwell in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vehayah lemikedash uleeven negef uletsur mikheshvol lisheney vatey yisherael lefach ulemvokesh leyvoshev yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וְכָ֥שְׁלוּ בָ֖ם רַבִּ֑ים וְנָפְל֣וּ וְנִשְׁבָּ֔רוּ וְנוֹקְשׁ֖וּ וְנִלְכָּֽדוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
The masses shall trip over these
And shall fall and be injured,
Shall be snared and be caught.
Transliteration: vekhashelu vam raviym venafelu venishevaru venvokeshu venilekhadu {f}

Hebrew: צ֖וֹר תְּעוּדָ֑ה חֲת֥וֹם תּוֹרָ֖ה בְּלִמֻּדָֽי׃
Translated:
Bind up the message,
Seal the instruction with My disciples.”
Transliteration: tsvor teudah chatvom tvorah velimuday

Hebrew: וְחִכִּ֙יתִי֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה הַמַּסְתִּ֥יר פָּנָ֖יו מִבֵּ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְקִוֵּ֖יתִי־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: So I will wait for G<small>OD</small>, whose face is hidden from the House of Jacob, and in whom I will trust.
Transliteration: vechikhiytiy layhovah hamasetiyr fanayv miveyt yaakov vekiveytiy-lvo

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה אָנֹכִ֗י וְהַיְלָדִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתַן־לִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לְאֹת֥וֹת וּלְמוֹפְתִ֖ים בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מֵעִם֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת הַשֹּׁכֵ֖ן בְּהַ֥ר צִיּֽוֹן׃ {ס}
Translated: Here stand I and the children G<small>OD</small> has given me as signs and portents in Israel from G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, who dwells on Mount Zion.
Transliteration: hineh anokhiy vehayeladiym asher natan-liy yehovah leotvot ulemvofetiym veyisherael meim yehovah tsevavot hashokhen vehar tsiyyvon {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יֹאמְר֣וּ אֲלֵיכֶ֗ם דִּרְשׁ֤וּ אֶל־הָֽאֹבוֹת֙ וְאֶל־הַיִּדְּעֹנִ֔ים הַֽמְצַפְצְפִ֖ים וְהַמַּהְגִּ֑ים הֲלוֹא־עַם֙ אֶל־אֱלֹהָ֣יו יִדְרֹ֔שׁ בְּעַ֥ד הַחַיִּ֖ים אֶל־הַמֵּתִֽים׃
Translated: Now, should people say to you, “Inquire of the ghosts and familiar spirits that chirp and moan; for a people may inquire of its divine beings—of the dead on behalf of the living—
Transliteration: vekhiy-yomeru aleykhem direshu el-haovvot veel-hayideoniym hametsafetsefiym vehamahegiym halvo-am el-elohayv yiderosh vead hachayiym el-hametiym

Hebrew: לְתוֹרָ֖ה וְלִתְעוּדָ֑ה אִם־לֹ֤א יֹֽאמְרוּ֙ כַּדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵֽין־ל֖וֹ שָֽׁחַר׃
Translated: for instruction and message,” surely, for those who speak thus there shall be no dawn.
Transliteration: letvorah veliteudah im-lo yomeru khadavar hazeh asher eyn-lvo shachar

Hebrew: וְעָ֥בַר בָּ֖הּ נִקְשֶׁ֣ה וְרָעֵ֑ב וְהָיָ֨ה כִֽי־יִרְעַ֜ב וְהִתְקַצַּ֗ף וְקִלֵּ֧ל בְּמַלְכּ֛וֹ וּבֵאלֹהָ֖יו וּפָנָ֥ה לְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: And they shall go about in it wretched and hungry; and when they are hungry, they shall rage and revolt against their king and their divine beings. They may turn their face upward
Transliteration: veavar vah nikesheh veraev vehayah khiy-yireav vehitekatsaf vekilel vemalekhvo uvelohayv ufanah lemaelah

Hebrew: וְאֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ יַבִּ֑יט וְהִנֵּ֨ה צָרָ֤ה וַֽחֲשֵׁכָה֙ מְע֣וּף צוּקָ֔ה וַאֲפֵלָ֖ה מְנֻדָּֽח׃
Translated:
or they may look below, but behold
Distress and darkness, with no daybreak;
Straitness and gloom, with no dawn.
Transliteration: veel-erets yaviyt vehineh tsarah vachashekhah meuf tsukah vaafelah menudach

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֣א מוּעָף֮ לַאֲשֶׁ֣ר מוּצָ֣ק לָהּ֒ כָּעֵ֣ת הָרִאשׁ֗וֹן הֵקַ֞ל אַ֤רְצָה זְבֻלוּן֙ וְאַ֣רְצָה נַפְתָּלִ֔י וְהָאַחֲר֖וֹן הִכְבִּ֑יד דֶּ֤רֶךְ הַיָּם֙ עֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן גְּלִ֖יל הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: For if there were to be any break of day for that [land] that is in straits, only the former [king] would have brought abasement to the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali—while the later one would have brought honor to the Way of the Sea, the other side of the Jordan, and Galilee of the Nations.
Transliteration: khiy lo muaf laasher mutsak lah khaet harishvon hekal aretsah zevulun vearetsah nafetaliy vehaacharvon hikheviyd derekhe hayam ever hayareden geliyl hagvoyim

Hebrew: הָעָם֙ הַהֹלְכִ֣ים בַּחֹ֔שֶׁךְ רָא֖וּ א֣וֹר גָּד֑וֹל יֹֽשְׁבֵי֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ צַלְמָ֔וֶת א֖וֹר נָגַ֥הּ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
The people that walked in darkness
Have seen a brilliant light;
On those who dwelt in a land of gloom
Light has dawned.
Transliteration: haam haholekhiym vachoshekhe rau vor gadvol yoshevey veerets tsalemavet vor nagah aleyhem

Hebrew: הִרְבִּ֣יתָ הַגּ֔וֹי (לא) [ל֖וֹ] הִגְדַּ֣לְתָּ הַשִּׂמְחָ֑ה שָׂמְח֤וּ לְפָנֶ֙יךָ֙ כְּשִׂמְחַ֣ת בַּקָּצִ֔יר כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יָגִ֖ילוּ בְּחַלְּקָ֥ם שָׁלָֽל׃
Translated:
You have magnified that nation,
Have given it great joy;
They have rejoiced before You
As they rejoice at reaping time,
As they exult
When dividing spoil.
Transliteration: hireviyta hagvoy (l) [lvo] higedaleta hashimechah shamechu lefaneykha kheshimechat vakatsiyr khaasher yagiylu vechalekam shalal

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ אֶת־עֹ֣ל סֻבֳּל֗וֹ וְאֵת֙ מַטֵּ֣ה שִׁכְמ֔וֹ שֵׁ֖בֶט הַנֹּגֵ֣שׂ בּ֑וֹ הַחִתֹּ֖תָ כְּי֥וֹם מִדְיָֽן׃
Translated:
For the yoke that they bore
And the stick on their back—
The rod of their taskmaster—
You have broken as on the day of Midian.
Transliteration: khiy et-ol suvolvo veet mateh shikhemvo shevet hanogesh vvo hachitota kheyvom mideyan

Hebrew: כִּ֤י כׇל־סְאוֹן֙ סֹאֵ֣ן בְּרַ֔עַשׁ וְשִׂמְלָ֖ה מְגוֹלָלָ֣ה בְדָמִ֑ים וְהָיְתָ֥ה לִשְׂרֵפָ֖ה מַאֲכֹ֥לֶת אֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
Truly, all the boots put on to stamp with
And all the garments donned in infamy
Have been fed to the flames,
Devoured by fire.
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-sevon soen veraash veshimelah megvolalah vedamiym vehayetah lisherefah maakholet esh

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יֶ֣לֶד יֻלַּד־לָ֗נוּ בֵּ֚ן נִתַּן־לָ֔נוּ וַתְּהִ֥י הַמִּשְׂרָ֖ה עַל־שִׁכְמ֑וֹ וַיִּקְרָ֨א שְׁמ֜וֹ פֶּ֠לֶא יוֹעֵץ֙ אֵ֣ל גִּבּ֔וֹר אֲבִי־עַ֖ד שַׂר־שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated:
For a child has been born to us,
A son has been given us.
And authority has settled on his shoulders.
He has been named
“The Mighty God is planning grace;
The Eternal Father, a peaceable ruler”—
Transliteration: khiy-yeled yulad-lanu ven nitan-lanu vatehiy hamisherah al-shikhemvo vayikera shemvo fele yvoets el givvor aviy-ad shar-shalvom

Hebrew: (לם רבה) [לְמַרְבֵּ֨ה] הַמִּשְׂרָ֜ה וּלְשָׁל֣וֹם אֵֽין־קֵ֗ץ עַל־כִּסֵּ֤א דָוִד֙ וְעַל־מַמְלַכְתּ֔וֹ לְהָכִ֤ין אֹתָהּ֙ וּֽלְסַעֲדָ֔הּ בְּמִשְׁפָּ֖ט וּבִצְדָקָ֑ה מֵֽעַתָּה֙ וְעַד־עוֹלָ֔ם קִנְאַ֛ת יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת תַּעֲשֶׂה־זֹּֽאת׃ {פ}
Translated:
In token of abundant authority
And of peace without limit
Upon David’s throne and kingdom,
That it may be firmly established
In justice and in equity
Now and evermore.
The zeal of GOD of Hosts
Shall bring this to pass.
Transliteration: (lm rvh) [lemareveh] hamisherah uleshalvom eyn-kets al-khise david veal-mamelakhetvo lehakhiyn otah ulesaadah vemishefat uvitsedakah meatah vead-volam kineat yehovah tsevavot taasheh-zot {f}

Hebrew: דָּבָ֛ר שָׁלַ֥ח אֲדֹנָ֖י בְּיַעֲקֹ֑ב וְנָפַ֖ל בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
The Sovereign
Let loose a word against Jacob
And it fell upon Israel.
Transliteration: davar shalach adonay veyaakov venafal veyisherael

Hebrew: וְיָֽדְעוּ֙ הָעָ֣ם כֻּלּ֔וֹ אֶפְרַ֖יִם וְיוֹשֵׁ֣ב שֹׁמְר֑וֹן בְּגַאֲוָ֛ה וּבְגֹ֥דֶל לֵבָ֖ב לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated:
But all the people noted—
Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria—
In arrogance and haughtiness:
Transliteration: veyadeu haam khulvo eferayiim veyvoshev shomervon vegaavah uvegodel levav lemor

Hebrew: לְבֵנִ֥ים נָפָ֖לוּ וְגָזִ֣ית נִבְנֶ֑ה שִׁקְמִ֣ים גֻּדָּ֔עוּ וַאֲרָזִ֖ים נַחֲלִֽיף׃
Translated:
“Bricks have fallen—
We’ll rebuild with dressed stone;
Sycamores have been felled—
We’ll grow cedars instead!”
Transliteration: leveniym nafalu vegaziyt niveneh shikemiym gudau vaaraziym nachaliyf

Hebrew: וַיְשַׂגֵּ֧ב יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־צָרֵ֥י רְצִ֖ין עָלָ֑יו וְאֶת־אֹיְבָ֖יו יְסַכְסֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
So GOD let the enemies of Rezin
Triumph over it
And stirred up its foes—
Transliteration: vayeshagev yehovah et-tsarey retsiyn alayv veet-oyevayv yesakhesekhe

Hebrew: אֲרָ֣ם מִקֶּ֗דֶם וּפְלִשְׁתִּים֙ מֵאָח֔וֹר וַיֹּאכְל֥וּ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּכׇל־פֶּ֑ה בְּכׇל־זֹאת֙ לֹא־שָׁ֣ב אַפּ֔וֹ וְע֖וֹד יָד֥וֹ נְטוּיָֽה׃
Translated:
Aram from the east
And Philistia from the west—
Who devoured Israel
With greedy mouths.
Yet God’s anger has not turned back,
And the divine arm is outstretched still.
Transliteration: aram mikedem ufelishetiym meachvor vayokhelu et-yisherael vekhׇl-feh vekhׇl-zot lo-shav afvo vevod yadvo netuyah

Hebrew: וְהָעָ֥ם לֹא־שָׁ֖ב עַד־הַמַּכֵּ֑הוּ וְאֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת לֹ֥א דָרָֽשׁוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
For this people has not turned back
To the One who struck it;
They have not sought
GOD of Hosts.
Transliteration: vehaam lo-shav ad-hamakhehu veet-yehovah tsevavot lo darashu {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּכְרֵ֨ת יְהֹוָ֜ה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֗ל רֹ֧אשׁ וְזָנָ֛ב כִּפָּ֥ה וְאַגְמ֖וֹן י֥וֹם אֶחָֽד׃
Translated:
So GOD will cut off from Israel
Head and tail,
Palm branch and reed,
In a single day.
Transliteration: vayakheret yehovah miyisherael rosh vezanav khifah veagemvon yvom echad

Hebrew: זָקֵ֥ן וּנְשֽׂוּא־פָנִ֖ים ה֣וּא הָרֹ֑אשׁ וְנָבִ֥יא מֽוֹרֶה־שֶּׁ֖קֶר ה֥וּא הַזָּנָֽב׃
Translated:
Elders and magnates—
Such are the heads;
Prophets who give false instruction,
Such are the tails
Transliteration: zaken uneshu-faniym hu harosh venaviy mvoreh-sheker hu hazanav

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֛וּ מְאַשְּׁרֵ֥י הָֽעָם־הַזֶּ֖ה מַתְעִ֑ים וּמְאֻשָּׁרָ֖יו מְבֻלָּעִֽים׃
Translated:
That people’s leaders have been misleaders,
So those who are led have been confused.
Transliteration: vayiheyu measherey haam-hazeh mateiym umeusharayv mevulaiym

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֨ן עַל־בַּחוּרָ֜יו לֹא־יִשְׂמַ֣ח ׀ אֲדֹנָ֗י וְאֶת־יְתֹמָ֤יו וְאֶת־אַלְמְנוֹתָיו֙ לֹ֣א יְרַחֵ֔ם כִּ֤י כֻלּוֹ֙ חָנֵ֣ף וּמֵרַ֔ע וְכׇל־פֶּ֖ה דֹּבֵ֣ר נְבָלָ֑ה בְּכׇל־זֹאת֙ לֹא־שָׁ֣ב אַפּ֔וֹ וְע֖וֹד יָד֥וֹ נְטוּיָֽה׃
Translated:
That is why the Sovereign
Will not spare their youths,
Nor show compassion
To their orphans and widows;
For all are ungodly and wicked,
And every mouth speaks impiety.
Transliteration: al-khen al-vachurayv lo-yishemach adonay veet-yetomayv veet-alemenvotayv lo yerachem khiy khulvo chanef umera vekhׇl-feh dover nevalah vekhׇl-zot lo-shav afvo vevod yadvo netuyah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־בָעֲרָ֤ה כָאֵשׁ֙ רִשְׁעָ֔ה שָׁמִ֥יר וָשַׁ֖יִת תֹּאכֵ֑ל וַתִּצַּת֙ בְּסִֽבְכֵ֣י הַיַּ֔עַר וַיִּֽתְאַבְּכ֖וּ גֵּא֥וּת עָשָֽׁן׃
Translated:
Already wickedness has blazed forth like a fire
Devouring thorn and thistle.
It has kindled the thickets of the wood,
Which have turned into billowing smoke.
Yet God’s anger has not turned back,
And the divine arm is outstretched still.
Transliteration: khiy-vaarah khaesh risheah shamiyr vashayiit tokhel vatitsat vesivekhey hayaar vayiteavekhu geut ashan

Hebrew: בְּעֶבְרַ֛ת יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת נֶעְתַּ֣ם אָ֑רֶץ וַיְהִ֤י הָעָם֙ כְּמַאֲכֹ֣לֶת אֵ֔שׁ אִ֥ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֖יו לֹ֥א יַחְמֹֽלוּ׃
Translated:
By the fury of GOD of Hosts,
The earth was shaken.
Next, the people became like devouring fire:
Not one of them spared the others.
Transliteration: veeverat yehovah tsevavot neetam arets vayehiy haam khemaakholet esh iysh el-achiyv lo yachemolu

Hebrew: וַיִּגְזֹ֤ר עַל־יָמִין֙ וְרָעֵ֔ב וַיֹּ֥אכַל עַל־שְׂמֹ֖אול וְלֹ֣א שָׂבֵ֑עוּ אִ֥ישׁ בְּשַׂר־זְרֹע֖וֹ יֹאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated:
They snatched on the right, but remained hungry,
And consumed on the left without being sated.
Each devoured the flesh of its own kindred—
Transliteration: vayigezor al-yamiyn veraev vayokhal al-shemovl velo shaveu iysh veshar-zerovo yokhelu

Hebrew: מְנַשֶּׁ֣ה אֶת־אֶפְרַ֗יִם וְאֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ אֶת־מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה יַחְדָּ֥ו הֵ֖מָּה עַל־יְהוּדָ֑ה בְּכׇל־זֹאת֙ לֹא־שָׁ֣ב אַפּ֔וֹ וְע֖וֹד יָד֥וֹ נְטוּיָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Manasseh Ephraim’s, and Ephraim Manasseh’s,
And both of them against Judah!
Yet God’s anger has not turned back,
And the divine arm is outstretched still.
Transliteration: menasheh et-eferayiim veeferayiim et-menasheh yachedav hemah al-yehudah vekhׇl-zot lo-shav afvo vevod yadvo netuyah {s}

Hebrew: ה֥וֹי הַחֹֽקְקִ֖ים חִקְקֵי־אָ֑וֶן וּֽמְכַתְּבִ֥ים עָמָ֖ל כִּתֵּֽבוּ׃
Translated:
Ha!
Those who write out evil writs
And compose iniquitous documents,
Transliteration: hvoy hachokekiym chikekey-aven umekhateviym amal khitevu

Hebrew: לְהַטּ֤וֹת מִדִּין֙ דַּלִּ֔ים וְלִגְזֹ֕ל מִשְׁפַּ֖ט עֲנִיֵּ֣י עַמִּ֑י לִֽהְי֤וֹת אַלְמָנוֹת֙ שְׁלָלָ֔ם וְאֶת־יְתוֹמִ֖ים יָבֹֽזּוּ׃
Translated:
To subvert the cause of the poor,
To rob of their rights the needy of My people;
That widows may be their spoil,
And fatherless children their booty!
Transliteration: lehatvot midiyn daliym veligezol mishefat aniyey amiy liheyvot alemanvot shelalam veet-yetvomiym yavozu

Hebrew: וּמַֽה־תַּעֲשׂוּ֙ לְי֣וֹם פְּקֻדָּ֔ה וּלְשׁוֹאָ֖ה מִמֶּרְחָ֣ק תָּב֑וֹא עַל־מִי֙ תָּנ֣וּסוּ לְעֶזְרָ֔ה וְאָ֥נָה תַעַזְב֖וּ כְּבוֹדְכֶֽם׃
Translated:
What will you do on the day of punishment,
When the calamity comes from afar?
To whom will you flee for help,
And how will you save your carcasses
Transliteration: umah-taashu leyvom fekudah uleshvoah mimerechak tavvo al-miy tanusu leezerah veanah taazevu khevvodekhem

Hebrew: בִּלְתִּ֤י כָרַע֙ תַּ֣חַת אַסִּ֔יר וְתַ֥חַת הֲרוּגִ֖ים יִפֹּ֑לוּ בְּכׇל־זֹאת֙ לֹא־שָׁ֣ב אַפּ֔וֹ וְע֖וֹד יָד֥וֹ נְטוּיָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
From collapsing under [fellow] prisoners,
From falling beneath the slain?
Yet God’s anger has not turned back,
And the divine arm is outstretched still.
Transliteration: viletiy khara tachat asiyr vetachat harugiym yifolu vekhׇl-zot lo-shav afvo vevod yadvo netuyah {f}

Hebrew: ה֥וֹי אַשּׁ֖וּר שֵׁ֣בֶט אַפִּ֑י וּמַטֶּה־ה֥וּא בְיָדָ֖ם זַעְמִֽי׃
Translated:
Ha!
Assyria, rod of My anger,
In whose hand, as a staff, is My fury!
Transliteration: hvoy ashur shevet afiy umateh-hu veyadam zaemiy

Hebrew: בְּג֤וֹי חָנֵף֙ אֲשַׁלְּחֶ֔נּוּ וְעַל־עַ֥ם עֶבְרָתִ֖י אֲצַוֶּ֑נּוּ לִשְׁלֹ֤ל שָׁלָל֙ וְלָבֹ֣ז בַּ֔ז (ולשימו) [וּלְשׂוּמ֥וֹ] מִרְמָ֖ס כְּחֹ֥מֶר חוּצֽוֹת׃
Translated:
I send him against an ungodly nation,
I charge him against a people that provokes Me,
To take its spoil and to seize its booty
And to make it a thing trampled
Like the mire of the streets.
Transliteration: vegvoy chanef ashalechenu veal-am everatiy atsavenu lishelol shalal velavoz vaz (vlshymv) [uleshumvo] miremas khechomer chutsvot

Hebrew: וְהוּא֙ לֹא־כֵ֣ן יְדַמֶּ֔ה וּלְבָב֖וֹ לֹא־כֵ֣ן יַחְשֹׁ֑ב כִּ֚י לְהַשְׁמִ֣יד בִּלְבָב֔וֹ וּלְהַכְרִ֥ית גּוֹיִ֖ם לֹ֥א מְעָֽט׃
Translated:
But he has evil plans,
His mind harbors evil designs;
For he means to destroy,
To wipe out nations, not a few.
Transliteration: vehu lo-khen yedameh ulevavvo lo-khen yacheshov khiy lehashemiyd vilevavvo ulehakheriyt gvoyim lo meat

Hebrew: כִּ֖י יֹאמַ֑ר הֲלֹ֥א שָׂרַ֛י יַחְדָּ֖ו מְלָכִֽים׃
Translated:
For he thinks,
“After all, I have kings as my captains!
Transliteration: khiy yomar halo sharay yachedav melakhiym

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֥א כְּכַרְכְּמִ֖ישׁ כַּלְנ֑וֹ אִם־לֹ֤א כְאַרְפַּד֙ חֲמָ֔ת אִם־לֹ֥א כְדַמֶּ֖שֶׂק שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Was Calno any different from Carchemish?
Or Hamath from Arpad?
Or Samaria from Damascus?
Transliteration: halo khekharekhemiysh khalenvo im-lo khearefad chamat im-lo khedameshek shomervon

Hebrew: כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ מָצְאָ֣ה יָדִ֔י לְמַמְלְכֹ֖ת הָאֱלִ֑יל וּפְסִ֣ילֵיהֶ֔ם מִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וּמִשֹּׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Since I was able to seize
The insignificant kingdoms,
Whose images exceeded
Jerusalem’s and Samaria’s,
Transliteration: khaasher matseah yadiy lemamelekhot haeliyl ufesiyleyhem miyrushala͏im umishomervon

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֗א כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֛יתִי לְשֹׁמְר֖וֹן וְלֶאֱלִילֶ֑יהָ כֵּ֛ן אֶעֱשֶׂ֥ה לִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וְלַעֲצַבֶּֽיהָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Shall I not do to Jerusalem and her images
What I did to Samaria and her idols?”
Transliteration: halo khaasher ashiytiy leshomervon veleeliyleyha khen eesheh liyrushala͏im velaatsaveyha {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּֽי־יְבַצַּ֤ע אֲדֹנָי֙ אֶת־כׇּל־מַֽעֲשֵׂ֔הוּ בְּהַ֥ר צִיּ֖וֹן וּבִירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם אֶפְקֹ֗ד עַל־פְּרִֽי־גֹ֙דֶל֙ לְבַ֣ב מֶלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֔וּר וְעַל־תִּפְאֶ֖רֶת ר֥וּם עֵינָֽיו׃
Translated: But when all of my Sovereign’s purpose has been carried out on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, the majestic pride and overbearing arrogance of the king of Assyria will be punished.
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-yevatsa adonay et-khׇl-maashehu vehar tsiyyvon uviyrushala͏im efekod al-feriy-godel levav melekhe-ashur veal-tifeeret rum eynayv

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אָמַ֗ר בְּכֹ֤חַ יָדִי֙ עָשִׂ֔יתִי וּבְחׇכְמָתִ֖י כִּ֣י נְבֻנ֑וֹתִי וְאָסִ֣יר ׀ גְּבוּלֹ֣ת עַמִּ֗ים (ועתידתיהם) [וַעֲתֽוּדֹתֵיהֶם֙] שׁוֹשֵׂ֔תִי וְאוֹרִ֥יד כַּאבִּ֖יר יוֹשְׁבִֽים׃
Translated:
For he thought,
“By the might of my hand have I wrought it,
By my skill, for I am clever:
I have erased the borders of peoples;
I have plundered their treasures,
And exiled their vast populations.
Transliteration: khiy amar vekhocha yadiy ashiytiy uvechׇkhematiy khiy nevunvotiy veasiyr gevulot amiym (vtydtyhm) [vaatudoteyhem] shvoshetiy vevoriyd khaviyr yvosheviym

Hebrew: וַתִּמְצָ֨א כַקֵּ֤ן <small>׀</small> יָדִי֙ לְחֵ֣יל הָעַמִּ֔ים וְכֶֽאֱסֹף֙ בֵּיצִ֣ים עֲזֻב֔וֹת כׇּל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲנִ֣י אָסָ֑פְתִּי וְלֹ֤א הָיָה֙ נֹדֵ֣ד כָּנָ֔ף וּפֹצֶ֥ה פֶ֖ה וּמְצַפְצֵֽף׃
Translated:
I was able to seize, like a nest,
The wealth of peoples;
As one gathers abandoned eggs,
So I gathered all the earth:
Nothing so much as flapped a wing
Or opened a mouth to peep.”
Transliteration: vatimetsa khaken <small></small> yadiy lecheyl haamiym vekheesof veytsiym azuvvot khׇl-haarets aniy asafetiy velo hayah noded khanaf ufotseh feh umetsafetsef

Hebrew: הֲיִתְפָּאֵר֙ הַגַּרְזֶ֔ן עַ֖ל הַחֹצֵ֣ב בּ֑וֹ אִם־יִתְגַּדֵּ֤ל הַמַּשּׂוֹר֙ עַל־מְנִיפ֔וֹ כְּהָנִ֥יף שֵׁ֙בֶט֙ וְאֶת־מְרִימָ֔יו כְּהָרִ֥ים מַטֶּ֖ה לֹא־עֵֽץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Does an ax boast over one who hews with it,
Or a saw magnify itself above one who wields it?
As though the rod raised one who lifts it,
As though the staff lifted the person!
