Transliteration: hayitefaer hagarezen al hachotsev vvo im-yitegadel hamashvor al-meniyfvo khehaniyf shevet veet-meriymayv khehariym mateh lo-ets {f}

Hebrew: לָ֠כֵן יְשַׁלַּ֨ח הָאָד֜וֹן יְהֹוָ֧ה צְבָא֛וֹת בְּמִשְׁמַנָּ֖יו רָז֑וֹן וְתַ֧חַת כְּבֹד֛וֹ יֵקַ֥ד יְקֹ֖ד כִּיק֥וֹד אֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
The Sovereign GOD of Hosts will send
A wasting away in its fatness;
And under its body shall burn
A burning like that of fire,
Destroying frame and flesh.
It shall be like an invalid who pines away.
Transliteration: lakhen yeshalach haadvon yehovah tsevavot vemishemanayv razvon vetachat khevodvo eikad yekod khiykvod esh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה אֽוֹר־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לְאֵ֔שׁ וּקְדוֹשׁ֖וֹ לְלֶהָבָ֑ה וּבָעֲרָ֗ה וְאָכְלָ֛ה שִׁית֥וֹ וּשְׁמִיר֖וֹ בְּי֥וֹם אֶחָֽד׃
Translated:
The Light of Israel will be fire
And its Holy One flame.
It will burn and consume its thorns
And its thistles in a single day,
Transliteration: vehayah vor-yisherael leesh ukedvoshvo lelehavah uvaarah veakhelah shiytvo ushemiyrvo veyvom echad

Hebrew: וּכְב֤וֹד יַעְרוֹ֙ וְכַרְמִלּ֔וֹ מִנֶּ֥פֶשׁ וְעַד־בָּשָׂ֖ר יְכַלֶּ֑ה וְהָיָ֖ה כִּמְסֹ֥ס נֹסֵֽס׃
Translated: And the mass of its scrub and its farmland.
Transliteration: ukhevvod yaervo vekharemilvo minefesh vead-vashar yekhaleh vehayah khimesos noses

Hebrew: וּשְׁאָ֥ר עֵ֛ץ יַעְר֖וֹ מִסְפָּ֣ר יִהְי֑וּ וְנַ֖עַר יִכְתְּבֵֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
What trees remain of its scrub
Shall be so few that a child may record them.
Transliteration: ushear ets yaervo misefar yiheyu venaar yikhetevem {s}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא לֹא־יוֹסִ֨יף ע֜וֹד שְׁאָ֤ר יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וּפְלֵיטַ֣ת בֵּֽית־יַעֲקֹ֔ב לְהִשָּׁעֵ֖ן עַל־מַכֵּ֑הוּ וְנִשְׁעַ֗ן עַל־יְהֹוָ֛ה קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בֶּאֱמֶֽת׃
Translated:
And in that day,
The remnant of Israel
And the escaped of the House of Jacob
Shall lean no more upon him that beats it,
But shall lean sincerely
On GOD, the Holy One of Israel.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu lo-yvosiyf vod shear yisherael ufeleytat veyt-yaakov lehishaen al-makhehu venishean al-yehovah kedvosh yisherael veemet

Hebrew: שְׁאָ֥ר יָשׁ֖וּב שְׁאָ֣ר יַעֲקֹ֑ב אֶל־אֵ֖ל גִּבּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Only a remnant shall return,
Only a remnant of Jacob,
To Mighty God.
Transliteration: shear yashuv shear yaakov el-el givvor

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־יִהְיֶ֞ה עַמְּךָ֤ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ כְּח֣וֹל הַיָּ֔ם שְׁאָ֖ר יָשׁ֣וּב בּ֑וֹ כִּלָּי֥וֹן חָר֖וּץ שׁוֹטֵ֥ף צְדָקָֽה׃
Translated:
Even if your people, O Israel,
Should be as the sands of the sea,
Only a remnant of it shall return.
Destruction is decreed;
Retribution comes like a flood!
Transliteration: khiy im-yiheyeh amekha yisherael khechvol hayam shear yashuv vvo khilayvon charuts shvotef tsedakah

Hebrew: כִּ֥י כָלָ֖ה וְנֶחֱרָצָ֑ה אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ צְבָא֔וֹת עֹשֶׂ֖ה בְּקֶ֥רֶב כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
For my Sovereign GOD of Hosts is carrying out
A decree of destruction upon all the land.
Transliteration: khiy khalah venecheratsah adonay yehovih tsevavot osheh vekerev khׇl-haarets {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּֽה־אָמַ֞ר אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ צְבָא֔וֹת אַל־תִּירָ֥א עַמִּ֛י יֹשֵׁ֥ב צִיּ֖וֹן מֵאַשּׁ֑וּר בַּשֵּׁ֣בֶט יַכֶּ֔כָּה וּמַטֵּ֥הוּ יִשָּֽׂא־עָלֶ֖יךָ בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said my Sovereign G<small>OD</small> of Hosts: “O My people that dwells in Zion, have no fear of Assyria, who beats you with a rod and wields his staff over you as did the Egyptians.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar adonay yehovih tsevavot al-tiyra amiy yoshev tsiyyvon meashur vashevet yakhekhah umatehu yisha-aleykha vederekhe mitserayiim

Hebrew: כִּי־ע֖וֹד מְעַ֣ט מִזְעָ֑ר וְכָ֣לָה זַ֔עַם וְאַפִּ֖י עַל־תַּבְלִיתָֽם׃
Translated: For very soon My wrath will have spent itself, and My anger that was bent on wasting them.”
Transliteration: khiy-vod meat mizear vekhalah zaam veafiy al-taveliytam

Hebrew: וְעוֹרֵ֨ר עָלָ֜יו יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ שׁ֔וֹט כְּמַכַּ֥ת מִדְיָ֖ן בְּצ֣וּר עוֹרֵ֑ב וּמַטֵּ֙הוּ֙ עַל־הַיָּ֔ם וּנְשָׂא֖וֹ בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> of Hosts will brandish a scourge over Assyria as when Midian was beaten at the Rock of Oreb, and will wield a staff [over him] as was done to the Egyptians by the sea.
Transliteration: vevorer alayv yehovah tsevavot shvot khemakhat mideyan vetsur vorev umatehu al-hayam uneshavo vederekhe mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יָס֤וּר סֻבֳּלוֹ֙ מֵעַ֣ל שִׁכְמֶ֔ךָ וְעֻלּ֖וֹ מֵעַ֣ל צַוָּארֶ֑ךָ וְחֻבַּ֥ל עֹ֖ל מִפְּנֵי־שָֽׁמֶן׃
Translated:
And in that day,
His burden shall drop from your back,
And his yoke from your neck;
The yoke shall be destroyed because of fatness.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu yasur suvolvo meal shikhemekha veulvo meal tsavarekha vechuval ol mifeney-shamen

Hebrew: בָּ֥א עַל־עַיַּ֖ת עָבַ֣ר בְּמִגְר֑וֹן לְמִכְמָ֖שׂ יַפְקִ֥יד כֵּלָֽיו׃
Translated:
He advanced upon Aiath,
He proceeded to Migron,
At Michmas he deposited his baggage.
Transliteration: va al-ayat avar vemigervon lemikhemash yafekiyd khelayv

Hebrew: עָֽבְרוּ֙ מַעְבָּרָ֔ה גֶּ֖בַע מָל֣וֹן לָ֑נוּ חָֽרְדָה֙ הָרָמָ֔ה גִּבְעַ֥ת שָׁא֖וּל נָֽסָה׃
Translated:
They made the crossing;
“Geba is to be our night quarters!”
Ramah was alarmed;
Gibeah of Saul took to flight.
Transliteration: averu maevarah geva malvon lanu charedah haramah giveat shaul nasah

Hebrew: צַהֲלִ֥י קוֹלֵ֖ךְ בַּת־גַּלִּ֑ים הַקְשִׁ֥יבִי לַ֖יְשָׁה עֲנִיָּ֥ה עֲנָתֽוֹת׃
Translated:
“Give a shrill cry, O Bath-gallim!
Hearken, Laishah!
Take up the cry, Anathoth!”
Transliteration: tsahaliy kvolekhe vat-galiym hakeshiyviy layeshah aniyah anatvot

Hebrew: נָֽדְדָ֖ה מַדְמֵנָ֑ה יֹשְׁבֵ֥י הַגֵּבִ֖ים הֵעִֽיזוּ׃
Translated:
Madmenah ran away;
The dwellers of Gebim sought refuge.
Transliteration: nadedah mademenah yoshevey hageviym heiyzu

Hebrew: ע֥וֹד הַיּ֖וֹם בְּנֹ֣ב לַעֲמֹ֑ד יְנֹפֵ֤ף יָדוֹ֙ הַ֣ר (בית) [בַּת־]צִיּ֔וֹן גִּבְעַ֖ת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {פ}
Translated:
This same day at Nob
He shall stand and wave his hand.
O mount of Fair Zion!
O hill of Jerusalem!
Transliteration: vod hayyvom venov laamod yenofef yadvo har (vyt) [vat-]tsiyyvon giveat yerushala͏im {f}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה הָאָדוֹן֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת מְסָעֵ֥ף פֻּארָ֖ה בְּמַעֲרָצָ֑ה וְרָמֵ֤י הַקּוֹמָה֙ גְּדוּעִ֔ים וְהַגְּבֹהִ֖ים יִשְׁפָּֽלוּ׃
Translated:
Lo! The Sovereign GOD of Hosts
Will hew off the tree-crowns with an ax:
The tall ones shall be felled,
The lofty ones cut down:
Transliteration: hineh haadvon yehovah tsevavot mesaef furah vemaaratsah veramey hakvomah geduiym vehagevohiym yishefalu

Hebrew: וְנִקַּ֛ף סִֽבְכֵ֥י הַיַּ֖עַר בַּבַּרְזֶ֑ל וְהַלְּבָנ֖וֹן בְּאַדִּ֥יר יִפּֽוֹל׃ {ס}
Translated:
The thickets of the forest shall be hacked away with iron,
And the Lebanon trees shall fall in their majesty.
Transliteration: venikaf sivekhey hayaar vavarezel vehalevanvon veadiyr yifvol {s}

Hebrew: וְיָצָ֥א חֹ֖טֶר מִגֵּ֣זַע יִשָׁ֑י וְנֵ֖צֶר מִשׇּׁרָשָׁ֥יו יִפְרֶֽה׃
Translated:
But a shoot shall grow out of the stump of Jesse,
A twig shall sprout from his stock.
Transliteration: veyatsa choter migeza yishay venetser mishׇrashayv yifereh

Hebrew: וְנָחָ֥ה עָלָ֖יו ר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָ֑ה ר֧וּחַ חׇכְמָ֣ה וּבִינָ֗ה ר֤וּחַ עֵצָה֙ וּגְבוּרָ֔ה ר֥וּחַ דַּ֖עַת וְיִרְאַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
The spirit of GOD shall alight upon him:
A spirit of wisdom and insight,
A spirit of counsel and valor,
A spirit of devotion and reverence for GOD.
Transliteration: venachah alayv rucha yehovah rucha chׇkhemah uviynah rucha etsah ugevurah rucha daat veyireat yehovah

Hebrew: וַהֲרִיח֖וֹ בְּיִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹֽא־לְמַרְאֵ֤ה עֵינָיו֙ יִשְׁפּ֔וֹט וְלֹא־לְמִשְׁמַ֥ע אׇזְנָ֖יו יוֹכִֽיחַ׃
Translated:
He shall sense the truth by his reverence for GOD:
He shall not judge by what his eyes behold,
Nor decide by what his ears perceive.
Transliteration: vahariychvo veyireat yehovah velo-lemareeh eynayv yishefvot velo-lemishema ׇzenayv yvokhiycha

Hebrew: וְשָׁפַ֤ט בְּצֶ֙דֶק֙ דַּלִּ֔ים וְהוֹכִ֥יחַ בְּמִישׁ֖וֹר לְעַנְוֵי־אָ֑רֶץ וְהִֽכָּה־אֶ֙רֶץ֙ בְּשֵׁ֣בֶט פִּ֔יו וּבְר֥וּחַ שְׂפָתָ֖יו יָמִ֥ית רָשָֽׁע׃
Translated:
Thus he shall judge the poor with equity
And decide with justice for the lowly of the land.
He shall strike down a land with the rod of his mouth
And slay the wicked with the breath of his lips.
Transliteration: veshafat vetsedek daliym vehvokhiycha vemiyshvor leanevey-arets vehikhah-erets veshevet fiyv uverucha shefatayv yamiyt rasha

Hebrew: וְהָ֥יָה צֶ֖דֶק אֵז֣וֹר מׇתְנָ֑יו וְהָאֱמוּנָ֖ה אֵז֥וֹר חֲלָצָֽיו׃
Translated:
Justice shall be the girdle of his loins,
And faithfulness the girdle of his waist.
Transliteration: vehayah tsedek ezvor mׇtenayv vehaemunah ezvor chalatsayv

Hebrew: וְגָ֤ר זְאֵב֙ עִם־כֶּ֔בֶשׂ וְנָמֵ֖ר עִם־גְּדִ֣י יִרְבָּ֑ץ וְעֵ֨גֶל וּכְפִ֤יר וּמְרִיא֙ יַחְדָּ֔ו וְנַ֥עַר קָטֹ֖ן נֹהֵ֥ג בָּֽם׃
Translated:
The wolf shall dwell with the lamb,
The leopard lie down with the kid;
The calf, the beast of prey, and the fatling together,
With a little child to herd them.
Transliteration: vegar zeev im-khevesh venamer im-gediy yirevats veegel ukhefiyr umeriy yachedav venaar katon noheg vam

Hebrew: וּפָרָ֤ה וָדֹב֙ תִּרְעֶ֔ינָה יַחְדָּ֖ו יִרְבְּצ֣וּ יַלְדֵיהֶ֑ן וְאַרְיֵ֖ה כַּבָּקָ֥ר יֹאכַל־תֶּֽבֶן׃
Translated:
The cow and the bear shall graze,
Their young shall lie down together;
And the lion, like the ox, shall eat straw.
Transliteration: ufarah vadov tireeynah yachedav yirevetsu yaledeyhen veareeih khavakar yokhal-teven

Hebrew: וְשִֽׁעֲשַׁ֥ע יוֹנֵ֖ק עַל־חֻ֣ר פָּ֑תֶן וְעַל֙ מְאוּרַ֣ת צִפְעוֹנִ֔י גָּמ֖וּל יָד֥וֹ הָדָֽה׃
Translated:
A babe shall play
Over a viper’s hole,
And an infant pass its hand
Over an adder’s den.
Transliteration: veshiasha yvonek al-chur faten veal meurat tsifevoniy gamul yadvo hadah

Hebrew: לֹא־יָרֵ֥עוּ וְלֹֽא־יַשְׁחִ֖יתוּ בְּכׇל־הַ֣ר קׇדְשִׁ֑י כִּֽי־מָלְאָ֣ה הָאָ֗רֶץ דֵּעָה֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּמַּ֖יִם לַיָּ֥ם מְכַסִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
In all of My sacred mount
Nothing evil or vile shall be done;
For the land shall be filled with devotion to GOD
As water covers the sea.
Transliteration: lo-yareu velo-yashechiytu vekhׇl-har kׇdeshiy khiy-maleah haarets deah et-yehovah khamayiim layam mekhasiym {s}

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא שֹׁ֣רֶשׁ יִשַׁ֗י אֲשֶׁ֤ר עֹמֵד֙ לְנֵ֣ס עַמִּ֔ים אֵלָ֖יו גּוֹיִ֣ם יִדְרֹ֑שׁוּ וְהָיְתָ֥ה מְנֻחָת֖וֹ כָּבֽוֹד׃ {פ}
Translated:
In that day,
The stock of Jesse that has remained standing
Shall become a standard to peoples—
Nations shall seek his counsel
And his abode shall be honored.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu shoresh yishay asher omed lenes amiym elayv gvoyim yideroshu vehayetah menuchatvo khavvod {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יוֹסִ֨יף אֲדֹנָ֤י ׀ שֵׁנִית֙ יָד֔וֹ לִקְנ֖וֹת אֶת־שְׁאָ֣ר עַמּ֑וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִשָּׁאֵר֩ מֵאַשּׁ֨וּר וּמִמִּצְרַ֜יִם וּמִפַּתְר֣וֹס וּמִכּ֗וּשׁ וּמֵעֵילָ֤ם וּמִשִּׁנְעָר֙ וּמֵ֣חֲמָ֔ת וּמֵאִיֵּ֖י הַיָּֽם׃
Translated: In that day, my Sovereign will apply a divine hand again to redeeming the other part of this people from Assyria—as also from Egypt, Pathros, Cush, Elam, Shinar, Hamath, and the coastlands.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu yvosiyf adonay sheniyt yadvo likenvot et-shear amvo asher yishaer meashur umimitserayiim umifatervos umikhush umeeylam umishinear umechamat umeiyey hayam

Hebrew: וְנָשָׂ֥א נֵס֙ לַגּוֹיִ֔ם וְאָסַ֖ף נִדְחֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּנְפֻצ֤וֹת יְהוּדָה֙ יְקַבֵּ֔ץ מֵאַרְבַּ֖ע כַּנְפ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
[God] will hold up a signal to the nations
And assemble the banished of Israel,
And gather the dispersed of Judah
From the four corners of the earth.
Transliteration: venasha nes lagvoyim veasaf nidechey yisherael unefutsvot yehudah yekavets meareva khanefvot haarets

Hebrew: וְסָ֙רָה֙ קִנְאַ֣ת אֶפְרַ֔יִם וְצֹרְרֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה יִכָּרֵ֑תוּ אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ לֹא־יְקַנֵּ֣א אֶת־יְהוּדָ֔ה וִיהוּדָ֖ה לֹא־יָצֹ֥ר אֶת־אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Then Ephraim’s envy shall cease
And Judah’s harassment shall end;
Ephraim shall not envy Judah,
And Judah shall not harass Ephraim.
Transliteration: vesarah kineat eferayiim vetsorerey yehudah yikharetu eferayiim lo-yekane et-yehudah viyhudah lo-yatsor et-eferayiim

Hebrew: וְעָפ֨וּ בְכָתֵ֤ף פְּלִשְׁתִּים֙ יָ֔מָּה יַחְדָּ֖ו יָבֹ֣זּוּ אֶת־בְּנֵי־קֶ֑דֶם אֱד֤וֹם וּמוֹאָב֙ מִשְׁל֣וֹחַ יָדָ֔ם וּבְנֵ֥י עַמּ֖וֹן מִשְׁמַעְתָּֽם׃
Translated:
They shall pounce on the back of Philistia to the west,
And together plunder the peoples of the east;
Edom and Moab shall be subject to them
And the children of Ammon shall obey them.
Transliteration: veafu vekhatef felishetiym yamah yachedav yavozu et-veney-kedem edvom umvoav mishelvocha yadam uveney amvon mishemaetam

Hebrew: וְהֶחֱרִ֣ים יְהֹוָ֗ה אֵ֚ת לְשׁ֣וֹן יָם־מִצְרַ֔יִם וְהֵנִ֥יף יָד֛וֹ עַל־הַנָּהָ֖ר בַּעְיָ֣ם רוּח֑וֹ וְהִכָּ֙הוּ֙ לְשִׁבְעָ֣ה נְחָלִ֔ים וְהִדְרִ֖יךְ בַּנְּעָלִֽים׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> will dry up the tongue of the Egyptian sea—and will raise a hand over the Euphrates with a mighty wind and break it into seven wadis, so that it can be trodden dry-shod.
Transliteration: vehecheriym yehovah et leshvon yam-mitserayiim veheniyf yadvo al-hanahar vaeyam ruchvo vehikhahu leshiveah nechaliym vehideriykhe vanealiym

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֣ה מְסִלָּ֔ה לִשְׁאָ֣ר עַמּ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִשָּׁאֵ֖ר מֵאַשּׁ֑וּר כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר הָֽיְתָה֙ לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּי֥וֹם עֲלֹת֖וֹ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Thus there shall be a highway for the other part of this people out of Assyria, such as there was for Israel when it left the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vehayetah mesilah lishear amvo asher yishaer meashur khaasher hayetah leyisherael veyvom alotvo meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא אוֹדְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י אָנַ֖פְתָּ בִּ֑י יָשֹׁ֥ב אַפְּךָ֖ וּֽתְנַחֲמֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
In that day, you shall say:
“I give thanks to You, O GOD!
Although You were wroth with me,
Your wrath has turned back and You comfort me.
Transliteration: veamareta vayyvom hahu vodekha yehovah khiy anafeta viy yashov afekha utenachameniy

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה אֵ֧ל יְשׁוּעָתִ֛י אֶבְטַ֖ח וְלֹ֣א אֶפְחָ֑ד כִּֽי־עׇזִּ֤י וְזִמְרָת֙ יָ֣הּ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַֽיְהִי־לִ֖י לִישׁוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
Behold the God who gives me triumph!
I am confident, unafraid;
For Yah—GOD—is my strength and might,
And has been my deliverance.”
Transliteration: hineh el yeshuatiy evetach velo efechad khiy-ׇziy vezimerat yah yehovah vayehiy-liy liyshuah

Hebrew: וּשְׁאַבְתֶּם־מַ֖יִם בְּשָׂשׂ֑וֹן מִמַּעַיְנֵ֖י הַיְשׁוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
Joyfully shall you draw water
From the fountains of triumph,
Transliteration: usheavetem-mayiim veshashvon mimaayeney hayeshuah

Hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֞ם בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא הוֹד֤וּ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ קִרְא֣וּ בִשְׁמ֔וֹ הוֹדִ֥יעוּ בָעַמִּ֖ים עֲלִילֹתָ֑יו הַזְכִּ֕ירוּ כִּ֥י נִשְׂגָּ֖ב שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
And you shall say on that day:
“Praise GOD, proclaim the divine name.
Make God’s deeds known among the peoples;
Declare that the divine name is exalted.
Transliteration: vaamaretem vayyvom hahu hvodu layhovah kireu vishemvo hvodiyu vaamiym aliylotayv hazekhiyru khiy nishegav shemvo

Hebrew: זַמְּר֣וּ יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י גֵא֖וּת עָשָׂ֑ה (מידעת) [מוּדַ֥עַת] זֹ֖את בְּכׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Hymn GOD,
Who has done gloriously;
Let this be made known
In all the world!
Transliteration: zameru yehovah khiy geut ashah (mydt) [mudaat] zot vekhׇl-haarets

Hebrew: צַהֲלִ֥י וָרֹ֖נִּי יוֹשֶׁ֣בֶת צִיּ֑וֹן כִּי־גָד֥וֹל בְּקִרְבֵּ֖ךְ קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
Oh, shout for joy,
You who dwell in Zion!
For great in your midst
Is the Holy One of Israel.”
Transliteration: tsahaliy varoniy yvoshevet tsiyyvon khiy-gadvol vekirevekhe kedvosh yisherael {s}

Hebrew: מַשָּׂ֖א בָּבֶ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָזָ֔ה יְשַֽׁעְיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־אָמֽוֹץ׃
Translated: The “Babylon” Pronouncement, a prophecy of Isaiah son of Amoz.
Transliteration: masha vavel asher chazah yeshaeyahu ven-amvots

Hebrew: עַ֤ל הַר־נִשְׁפֶּה֙ שְֽׂאוּ־נֵ֔ס הָרִ֥ימוּ ק֖וֹל לָהֶ֑ם הָנִ֣יפוּ יָ֔ד וְיָבֹ֖אוּ פִּתְחֵ֥י נְדִיבִֽים׃
Translated:
“Raise a standard upon a bare hill,
Cry aloud to them;
Wave a hand, and let them enter
The gates of the nobles!
Transliteration: al har-nishefeh sheu-nes hariymu kvol lahem haniyfu yad veyavou fitechey nediyviym

Hebrew: אֲנִ֥י צִוֵּ֖יתִי לִמְקֻדָּשָׁ֑י גַּ֣ם קָרָ֤אתִי גִבּוֹרַי֙ לְאַפִּ֔י עַלִּיזֵ֖י גַּאֲוָתִֽי׃
Translated:
I have summoned My purified guests
To execute My wrath;
Behold, I have called My stalwarts,
My proudly exultant ones.”
Transliteration: aniy tsiveytiy limekudashay gam karatiy givvoray leafiy aliyzey gaavatiy

Hebrew: ק֥וֹל הָמ֛וֹן בֶּהָרִ֖ים דְּמ֣וּת עַם־רָ֑ב ק֠וֹל שְׁא֞וֹן מַמְלְכ֤וֹת גּוֹיִם֙ נֶאֱסָפִ֔ים יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת מְפַקֵּ֖ד צְבָ֥א מִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Hark! a tumult on the mountains—
As of a mighty force;
Hark! an uproar of kingdoms,
Nations assembling!
GOD of Hosts is mustering
A host for war.
Transliteration: kvol hamvon vehariym demut am-rav kvol shevon mamelekhvot gvoyim neesafiym yehovah tsevavot mefaked tseva milechamah

Hebrew: בָּאִ֛ים מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מֶרְחָ֖ק מִקְצֵ֣ה הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם יְהֹוָה֙ וּכְלֵ֣י זַעְמ֔וֹ לְחַבֵּ֖ל כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated:
They come from a distant land,
From the end of the sky—
GOD with the weapons of divine wrath—
To ravage all the earth!
Transliteration: vaiym meerets merechak miketseh hashamayiim yehovah ukheley zaemvo lechavel khׇl-haarets {s}

Hebrew: הֵילִ֕ילוּ כִּ֥י קָר֖וֹב י֣וֹם יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּשֹׁ֖ד מִשַּׁדַּ֥י יָבֽוֹא׃
Translated:
Howl!
For the day of GOD is near;
It shall come like havoc from Shaddai.
Transliteration: heyliylu khiy karvov yvom yehovah kheshod mishaday yavvo

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֖ן כׇּל־יָדַ֣יִם תִּרְפֶּ֑ינָה וְכׇל־לְבַ֥ב אֱנ֖וֹשׁ יִמָּֽס׃
Translated:
Therefore all hands shall grow limp,
And every human heart shall sink;
Transliteration: al-khen khׇl-yadayiim tirefeynah vekhׇl-levav envosh yimas

Hebrew: וְֽנִבְהָ֓לוּ ׀ צִירִ֤ים וַחֲבָלִים֙ יֹֽאחֵז֔וּן כַּיּוֹלֵדָ֖ה יְחִיל֑וּן אִ֤ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ יִתְמָ֔הוּ פְּנֵ֥י לְהָבִ֖ים פְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
And, overcome by terror,
They shall be seized by pangs and throes,
Writhe like a woman in travail.
All shall gaze at each other in horror,
Their faces livid with fright.
Transliteration: venivehalu tsiyriym vachavaliym yochezun khayyvoledah yechiylun iysh el-reehu yitemahu feney lehaviym feneyhem

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה יוֹם־יְהֹוָה֙ בָּ֔א אַכְזָרִ֥י וְעֶבְרָ֖ה וַחֲר֣וֹן אָ֑ף לָשׂ֤וּם הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ לְשַׁמָּ֔ה וְחַטָּאֶ֖יהָ יַשְׁמִ֥יד מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
Translated:
Lo! The day of GOD is coming
With pitiless fury and wrath,
To make the earth a desolation,
To wipe out the sinners upon it.
Transliteration: hineh yvom-yehovah va akhezariy veeverah vacharvon af lashum haarets leshamah vechataeyha yashemiyd mimenah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־כוֹכְבֵ֤י הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ וּכְסִ֣ילֵיהֶ֔ם לֹ֥א יָהֵ֖לּוּ אוֹרָ֑ם חָשַׁ֤ךְ הַשֶּׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ בְּצֵאת֔וֹ וְיָרֵ֖חַ לֹא־יַגִּ֥יהַּ אוֹרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The stars and constellations of heaven
Shall not give off their light;
The sun shall be dark when it rises,
And the moon shall diffuse no glow.
Transliteration: khiy-khvokhevey hashamayiim ukhesiyleyhem lo yahelu voram chashakhe hashemesh vetsetvo veyarecha lo-yagiyha vorvo

Hebrew: וּפָקַדְתִּ֤י עַל־תֵּבֵל֙ רָעָ֔ה וְעַל־רְשָׁעִ֖ים עֲוֺנָ֑ם וְהִשְׁבַּתִּי֙ גְּא֣וֹן זֵדִ֔ים וְגַאֲוַ֥ת עָרִיצִ֖ים אַשְׁפִּֽיל׃
Translated:
“And I will requite to the world its evil,
And to the wicked their iniquity;
I will put an end to the pride of the arrogant
And humble the haughtiness of tyrants.
Transliteration: ufakadetiy al-tevel raah veal-reshaiym avonam vehishevatiy gevon zediym vegaavat ariytsiym ashefiyl

Hebrew: אוֹקִ֥יר אֱנ֖וֹשׁ מִפָּ֑ז וְאָדָ֖ם מִכֶּ֥תֶם אוֹפִֽיר׃
Translated:
I will make people scarcer than fine gold,
And mortals [more scarce] than gold of Ophir.”
Transliteration: vokiyr envosh mifaz veadam mikhetem vofiyr

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּן֙ שָׁמַ֣יִם אַרְגִּ֔יז וְתִרְעַ֥שׁ הָאָ֖רֶץ מִמְּקוֹמָ֑הּ בְּעֶבְרַת֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת וּבְי֖וֹם חֲר֥וֹן אַפּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Therefore shall heaven be shaken,
And earth leap out of its place,
At the fury of GOD of Hosts
On the day of God’s burning wrath.
Transliteration: al-khen shamayiim aregiyz vetireash haarets mimekvomah veeverat yehovah tsevavot uveyvom charvon afvo

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ כִּצְבִ֣י מֻדָּ֔ח וּכְצֹ֖אן וְאֵ֣ין מְקַבֵּ֑ץ אִ֤ישׁ אֶל־עַמּוֹ֙ יִפְנ֔וּ וְאִ֥ישׁ אֶל־אַרְצ֖וֹ יָנֽוּסוּ׃
Translated:
Then like gazelles that are chased,
And like sheep that no one gathers,
Each man shall turn back to his people,
They shall flee every one to his land.
Transliteration: vehayah khitseviy mudach ukhetson veeyn mekavets iysh el-amvo yifenu veiysh el-aretsvo yanusu

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַנִּמְצָ֖א יִדָּקֵ֑ר וְכׇל־הַנִּסְפֶּ֖ה יִפּ֥וֹל בֶּחָֽרֶב׃
Translated:
All who remain shall be pierced through,
All who are caught
Shall fall by the sword.
Transliteration: khׇl-hanimetsa yidaker vekhׇl-hanisefeh yifvol vecharev

Hebrew: וְעֹלְלֵיהֶ֥ם יְרֻטְּשׁ֖וּ לְעֵינֵיהֶ֑ם יִשַּׁ֙סּוּ֙ בָּתֵּיהֶ֔ם וּנְשֵׁיהֶ֖ם (תשגלנה) [תִּשָּׁכַֽבְנָה]׃
Translated:
And their babes shall be dashed to pieces in their sight,
Their homes shall be plundered,
And their wives shall be raped.
Transliteration: veoleleyhem yeruteshu leeyneyhem yishasu vateyhem unesheyhem (tshglnh) [tishakhavenah]

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֛י מֵעִ֥יר עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם אֶת־מָדָ֑י אֲשֶׁר־כֶּ֙סֶף֙ לֹ֣א יַחְשֹׁ֔בוּ וְזָהָ֖ב לֹ֥א יַחְפְּצוּ־בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
“Behold,
I stir up the Medes against them,
Who do not value silver
Or delight in gold.
Transliteration: hineniy meiyr aleyhem et-maday asher-khesef lo yacheshovu vezahav lo yachefetsu-vvo

Hebrew: וּקְשָׁת֖וֹת נְעָרִ֣ים תְּרַטַּ֑שְׁנָה וּפְרִי־בֶ֙טֶן֙ לֹ֣א יְרַחֵ֔מוּ עַל־בָּנִ֖ים לֹא־תָח֥וּס עֵינָֽם׃
Translated:
Their bows shall shatter the young;
They shall show no pity to infants,
They shall not spare the children.”
Transliteration: ukeshatvot neariym teratashenah uferiy-veten lo yerachemu al-vaniym lo-tachus eynam

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֤ה בָבֶל֙ צְבִ֣י מַמְלָכ֔וֹת תִּפְאֶ֖רֶת גְּא֣וֹן כַּשְׂדִּ֑ים כְּמַהְפֵּכַ֣ת אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶת־סְדֹ֖ם וְאֶת־עֲמֹרָֽה׃
Translated:
And Babylon, glory of kingdoms,
Proud splendor of the Chaldeans,
Shall become like Sodom and Gomorrah
Overturned by God.
Transliteration: vehayetah vavel tseviy mamelakhvot tifeeret gevon khashediym khemahefekhat Elohim et-sedom veet-amorah

Hebrew: לֹא־תֵשֵׁ֣ב לָנֶ֔צַח וְלֹ֥א תִשְׁכֹּ֖ן עַד־דּ֣וֹר וָד֑וֹר וְלֹא־יַהֵ֥ל שָׁם֙ עֲרָבִ֔י וְרֹעִ֖ים לֹא־יַרְבִּ֥צוּ שָֽׁם׃
Translated:
Nevermore shall it be settled
Nor dwelt in through all the ages.
No Arab shall pitch his tent there,
No shepherds make flocks lie down there.
Transliteration: lo-teshev lanetsach velo tishekhon ad-dvor vadvor velo-yahel sham araviy veroiym lo-yarevitsu sham

Hebrew: וְרָבְצוּ־שָׁ֣ם צִיִּ֔ים וּמָלְא֥וּ בָתֵּיהֶ֖ם אֹחִ֑ים וְשָׁ֤כְנוּ שָׁם֙ בְּנ֣וֹת יַעֲנָ֔ה וּשְׂעִירִ֖ים יְרַקְּדוּ־שָֽׁם׃
Translated:
But beasts shall lie down there,
And the houses be filled with owls;
There shall ostriches make their home,
And there shall satyrs dance.
Transliteration: veravetsu-sham tsiyiym umaleu vateyhem ochiym veshakhenu sham venvot yaanah usheiyriym yerakedu-sham

Hebrew: וְעָנָ֤ה אִיִּים֙ בְּאַלְמְנוֹתָ֔יו וְתַנִּ֖ים בְּהֵ֣יכְלֵי עֹ֑נֶג וְקָר֤וֹב לָבוֹא֙ עִתָּ֔הּ וְיָמֶ֖יהָ לֹ֥א יִמָּשֵֽׁכוּ׃
Translated:
And jackals shall abide in its castles
And dragons in the palaces of pleasure.
Her hour is close at hand;
Her days will not be long.
Transliteration: veanah iyiym vealemenvotayv vetaniym veheykheley oneg vekarvov lavvo itah veyameyha lo yimashekhu

Hebrew: כִּי֩ יְרַחֵ֨ם יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֗ב וּבָחַ֥ר עוֹד֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְהִנִּיחָ֖ם עַל־אַדְמָתָ֑ם וְנִלְוָ֤ה הַגֵּר֙ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וְנִסְפְּח֖וּ עַל־בֵּ֥ית יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: But G<small>OD</small> will pardon Jacob, and will again choose Israel, and will settle them on their own soil. And strangers shall join them and shall cleave to the House of Jacob.
Transliteration: khiy yerachem yehovah et-yaakov uvachar vod veyisherael vehiniycham al-adematam venilevah hager aleyhem venisefechu al-veyt yaakov

Hebrew: וּלְקָח֣וּם עַמִּים֮ וֶהֱבִיא֣וּם אֶל־מְקוֹמָם֒ וְהִֽתְנַחֲל֣וּם בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל עַ֚ל אַדְמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה לַעֲבָדִ֖ים וְלִשְׁפָח֑וֹת וְהָיוּ֙ שֹׁבִ֣ים לְשֹׁבֵיהֶ֔ם וְרָד֖וּ בְּנֹגְשֵׂיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: For peoples shall take them and bring them to their homeland; and the House of Israel shall possess them as slaves and handmaids on G<small>OD</small>’s soil. They shall be captors of their captors and masters to their taskmasters.
Transliteration: ulekachum amiym veheviyum el-mekvomam vehitenachalum veyt-yisherael al ademat yehovah laavadiym velishefachvot vehayu shoviym leshoveyhem veradu venogesheyhem {s}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה בְּי֨וֹם הָנִ֤יחַ יְהֹוָה֙ לְךָ֔ מֵֽעׇצְבְּךָ֖ וּמִֽרׇגְזֶ֑ךָ וּמִן־הָעֲבֹדָ֥ה הַקָּשָׁ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֻבַּד־בָּֽךְ׃
Translated: And when G<small>OD</small> has given you rest from your sorrow and trouble, and from the hard service that you were made to serve,
Transliteration: vehayah veyvom haniycha yehovah lekha meׇtsevekha umirׇgezekha umin-haavodah hakashah asher uvad-vakhe

Hebrew: וְנָשָׂ֜אתָ הַמָּשָׁ֥ל הַזֶּ֛ה עַל־מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶ֖ל וְאָמָ֑רְתָּ אֵ֚יךְ שָׁבַ֣ת נֹגֵ֔שׂ שָׁבְתָ֖ה מַדְהֵבָֽה׃
Translated:
you shall recite this song of scorn over the king of Babylon:
How is the taskmaster vanished,
How is oppression ended!
Transliteration: venashata hamashal hazeh al-melekhe vavel veamareta eykhe shavat nogesh shavetah madehevah

Hebrew: שָׁבַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה מַטֵּ֣ה רְשָׁעִ֑ים שֵׁ֖בֶט מֹשְׁלִֽים׃
Translated:
GOD has broken the staff of the wicked,
The rod of tyrants,
Transliteration: shavar yehovah mateh reshaiym shevet mosheliym

Hebrew: מַכֶּ֤ה עַמִּים֙ בְּעֶבְרָ֔ה מַכַּ֖ת בִּלְתִּ֣י סָרָ֑ה רֹדֶ֤ה בָאַף֙ גּוֹיִ֔ם מֻרְדָּ֖ף בְּלִ֥י חָשָֽׂךְ׃
Translated:
That smote peoples in wrath
With stroke unceasing,
That belabored nations in fury
In relentless pursuit.
Transliteration: makheh amiym veeverah makhat viletiy sarah rodeh vaaf gvoyim muredaf veliy chashakhe

Hebrew: נָ֥חָה שָׁקְטָ֖ה כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ פָּצְח֖וּ רִנָּֽה׃
Translated:
All the earth is calm, untroubled;
Loudly it cheers.
Transliteration: nachah shaketah khׇl-haarets fatsechu rinah

Hebrew: גַּם־בְּרוֹשִׁ֛ים שָׂמְח֥וּ לְךָ֖ אַרְזֵ֣י לְבָנ֑וֹן מֵאָ֣ז שָׁכַ֔בְתָּ לֹא־יַעֲלֶ֥ה הַכֹּרֵ֖ת עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
Even pines rejoice at your fate,
And cedars of Lebanon:
“Now that you have lain down,
None shall come up to fell us.”
Transliteration: gam-vervoshiym shamechu lekha arezey levanvon meaz shakhaveta lo-yaaleh hakhoret aleynu

Hebrew: שְׁא֗וֹל מִתַּ֛חַת רָגְזָ֥ה לְךָ֖ לִקְרַ֣את בּוֹאֶ֑ךָ עוֹרֵ֨ר לְךָ֤ רְפָאִים֙ כׇּל־עַתּ֣וּדֵי אָ֔רֶץ הֵקִים֙ מִכִּסְאוֹתָ֔ם כֹּ֖ל מַלְכֵ֥י גוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
Sheol below was astir
To greet your coming—
Rousing for you the shades
Of all earth’s chieftains,
Raising from their thrones
All the kings of nations.
Transliteration: shevol mitachat ragezah lekha likerat vvoekha vorer lekha refaiym khׇl-atudey arets hekiym mikhisevotam khol malekhey gvoyim

Hebrew: כֻּלָּ֣ם יַעֲנ֔וּ וְיֹאמְר֖וּ אֵלֶ֑יךָ גַּם־אַתָּ֛ה חֻלֵּ֥יתָ כָמ֖וֹנוּ אֵלֵ֥ינוּ נִמְשָֽׁלְתָּ׃
Translated:
All speak up and say to you,
“So you have been stricken as we were,
You have become like us!
Transliteration: khulam yaanu veyomeru eleykha gam-atah chuleyta khamvonu eleynu nimeshaleta

Hebrew: הוּרַ֥ד שְׁא֛וֹל גְּאוֹנֶ֖ךָ הֶמְיַ֣ת נְבָלֶ֑יךָ תַּחְתֶּ֙יךָ֙ יֻצַּ֣ע רִמָּ֔ה וּמְכַסֶּ֖יךָ תּוֹלֵעָֽה׃
Translated:
Your pomp is brought down to Sheol,
And the strains of your lutes!
Worms are to be your bed,
Maggots your blanket!”
Transliteration: hurad shevol gevonekha hemeyat nevaleykha tacheteykha yutsa rimah umekhaseykha tvoleah

Hebrew: אֵ֛יךְ נָפַ֥לְתָּ מִשָּׁמַ֖יִם הֵילֵ֣ל בֶּן־שָׁ֑חַר נִגְדַּ֣עְתָּ לָאָ֔רֶץ חוֹלֵ֖שׁ עַל־גּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
How are you fallen from heaven,
O Shining One, son of Dawn!
How are you felled to earth,
O vanquisher of nations!
Transliteration: eykhe nafaleta mishamayiim heylel ven-shachar nigedaeta laarets chvolesh al-gvoyim

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה אָמַ֤רְתָּ בִֽלְבָבְךָ֙ הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם אֶעֱלֶ֔ה מִמַּ֥עַל לְכוֹכְבֵי־אֵ֖ל אָרִ֣ים כִּסְאִ֑י וְאֵשֵׁ֥ב בְּהַר־מוֹעֵ֖ד בְּיַרְכְּתֵ֥י צָפֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Once you thought in your heart,
“I will climb to the sky;
Higher than the stars of God
I will set my throne.
I will sit in the mount of assembly,
On the summit of Zaphon:
Transliteration: veatah amareta vilevavekha hashamayiim eeleh mimaal lekhvokhevey-el ariym khiseiy veeshev vehar-mvoed veyarekhetey tsafvon

Hebrew: אֶעֱלֶ֖ה עַל־בָּ֣מֳתֵי עָ֑ב אֶדַּמֶּ֖ה לְעֶלְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
I will mount the back of a cloud—
I will match the Most High.”
Transliteration: eeleh al-vamotey av edameh leeleyvon

Hebrew: אַ֧ךְ אֶל־שְׁא֛וֹל תּוּרָ֖ד אֶל־יַרְכְּתֵי־בֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Instead, you are brought down to Sheol,
To the bottom of the Pit.
Transliteration: akhe el-shevol turad el-yarekhetey-vvor

Hebrew: רֹאֶ֙יךָ֙ אֵלֶ֣יךָ יַשְׁגִּ֔יחוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ יִתְבּוֹנָ֑נוּ הֲזֶ֤ה הָאִישׁ֙ מַרְגִּ֣יז הָאָ֔רֶץ מַרְעִ֖ישׁ מַמְלָכֽוֹת׃
Translated:
They who behold you stare;
They peer at you closely:
“Is this the man
Who shook the earth,
Who made realms tremble,
Transliteration: roeykha eleykha yashegiychu eleykha yitevvonanu hazeh haiysh maregiyz haarets mareiysh mamelakhvot

Hebrew: שָׂ֥ם תֵּבֵ֛ל כַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר וְעָרָ֣יו הָרָ֑ס אֲסִירָ֖יו לֹא־פָ֥תַח בָּֽיְתָה׃
Translated:
Who made the world like a waste
And wrecked its towns,
Who never released his prisoners to their homes?”
Transliteration: sham tevel khamidevar vearayv haras asiyrayv lo-fatach vayetah

Hebrew: כׇּל־מַלְכֵ֥י גוֹיִ֖ם כֻּלָּ֑ם שָׁכְב֥וּ בְכָב֖וֹד אִ֥ישׁ בְּבֵיתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
All the kings of nations
Were laid, every one, in honor
Each in his tomb;
Transliteration: khׇl-malekhey gvoyim khulam shakhevu vekhavvod iysh veveytvo

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה הׇשְׁלַ֤כְתָּ מִֽקִּבְרְךָ֙ כְּנֵ֣צֶר נִתְעָ֔ב לְבֻ֥שׁ הֲרֻגִ֖ים מְטֹ֣עֲנֵי חָ֑רֶב יוֹרְדֵ֥י אֶל־אַבְנֵי־ב֖וֹר כְּפֶ֥גֶר מוּבָֽס׃
Translated:
While you were left lying unburied,
Like loathsome carrion,
Like a trampled corpse
[In] the clothing of slain gashed by the sword
Who sink to the very stones of the Pit.
Transliteration: veatah hׇshelakheta mikiverekha khenetser niteav levush harugiym metoaney charev yvoredey el-aveney-vvor khefeger muvas

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תֵחַ֤ד אִתָּם֙ בִּקְבוּרָ֔ה כִּי־אַרְצְךָ֥ שִׁחַ֖תָּ עַמְּךָ֣ הָרָ֑גְתָּ לֹא־יִקָּרֵ֥א לְעוֹלָ֖ם זֶ֥רַע מְרֵעִֽים׃
Translated:
You shall not have a burial like them;
Because you destroyed your country,
Murdered your people.
Let the breed of evildoers
Nevermore be named!
Transliteration: lo-techad itam vikevurah khiy-aretsekha shichata amekha harageta lo-yikare levolam zera mereiym

Hebrew: הָכִ֧ינוּ לְבָנָ֛יו מַטְבֵּ֖חַ בַּעֲוֺ֣ן אֲבוֹתָ֑ם בַּל־יָקֻ֙מוּ֙ וְיָ֣רְשׁוּ אָ֔רֶץ וּמָלְא֥וּ פְנֵי־תֵבֵ֖ל עָרִֽים׃
Translated:
Prepare a slaughtering block for his sons
Because of the guilt of their father.
Let them not arise to possess the earth!
Then the world’s face shall be covered with towns.
Transliteration: hakhiynu levanayv matevecha vaavon avvotam val-yakumu veyareshu arets umaleu feney-tevel ariym

Hebrew: וְקַמְתִּ֣י עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֑וֹת וְהִכְרַתִּ֨י לְבָבֶ֜ל שֵׁ֥ם וּשְׁאָ֛ר וְנִ֥ין וָנֶ֖כֶד נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: I will rise up against them—declares G<small>OD</small> of Hosts—and will wipe out from Babylon name and remnant, kith and kin—declares G<small>OD</small>—
Transliteration: vekametiy aleyhem neum yehovah tsevavot vehikheratiy levavel shem ushear veniyn vanekhed neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֛יהָ לְמוֹרַ֥שׁ קִפֹּ֖ד וְאַגְמֵי־מָ֑יִם וְטֵאטֵאתִ֙יהָ֙ בְּמַטְאֲטֵ֣א הַשְׁמֵ֔ד נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: and I will make it a home of bitterns, pools of water. I will sweep it with a broom of extermination—declares G<small>OD</small> of Hosts.
Transliteration: veshametiyha lemvorash kifod veagemey-mayiim vetetetiyha vemateate hashemed neum yehovah tsevavot {s}

Hebrew: נִשְׁבַּ֛ע יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־לֹ֞א כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר דִּמִּ֙יתִי֙ כֵּ֣ן הָיָ֔תָה וְכַאֲשֶׁ֥ר יָעַ֖צְתִּי הִ֥יא תָקֽוּם׃
Translated:
GOD of Hosts has sworn this oath:
“As I have designed, so shall it happen;
What I have planned, that shall come to pass:
Transliteration: nisheva yehovah tsevavot lemor im-lo khaasher dimiytiy khen hayatah vekhaasher yaatsetiy hiy takum

Hebrew: לִשְׁבֹּ֤ר אַשּׁוּר֙ בְּאַרְצִ֔י וְעַל־הָרַ֖י אֲבוּסֶ֑נּוּ וְסָ֤ר מֵֽעֲלֵיהֶם֙ עֻלּ֔וֹ וְסֻ֨בֳּל֔וֹ מֵעַ֥ל שִׁכְמ֖וֹ יָסֽוּר׃
Translated:
To break Assyria in My land,
To crush him on My mountain.”
And his yoke shall drop off them,
And his burden shall drop from their backs.
Transliteration: lishevor ashur vearetsiy veal-haray avusenu vesar mealeyhem ulvo vesuvolvo meal shikhemvo yasur

Hebrew: זֹ֛את הָעֵצָ֥ה הַיְּעוּצָ֖ה עַל־כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְזֹ֛את הַיָּ֥ד הַנְּטוּיָ֖ה עַל־כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
That is the plan that is planned
For all the earth;
That is why an arm is poised
Over all the nations.
Transliteration: zot haetsah hayeutsah al-khׇl-haarets vezot hayad hanetuyah al-khׇl-hagvoyim

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֧ה צְבָא֛וֹת יָעָ֖ץ וּמִ֣י יָפֵ֑ר וְיָד֥וֹ הַנְּטוּיָ֖ה וּמִ֥י יְשִׁיבֶֽנָּה׃ {פ}
Translated:
For GOD of Hosts has planned,
Who then can foil it?
It is the divine arm that is poised,
And who can stay it?
Transliteration: khiy-yehovah tsevavot yaats umiy yafer veyadvo hanetuyah umiy yeshiyvenah {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַת־מ֖וֹת הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אָחָ֑ז הָיָ֖ה הַמַּשָּׂ֥א הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: This pronouncement was made in the year that King Ahaz died:
Transliteration: vishenat-mvot hamelekhe achaz hayah hamasha hazeh

Hebrew: אַֽל־תִּשְׂמְחִ֤י פְלֶ֙שֶׁת֙ כֻּלֵּ֔ךְ כִּ֥י נִשְׁבַּ֖ר שֵׁ֣בֶט מַכֵּ֑ךְ כִּֽי־מִשֹּׁ֤רֶשׁ נָחָשׁ֙ יֵ֣צֵא צֶ֔פַע וּפִרְי֖וֹ שָׂרָ֥ף מְעוֹפֵֽף׃
Translated:
Rejoice not, all Philistia,
Because the staff of him that beat you is broken.
For from the stock of a snake there sprouts an asp,
A flying seraph branches out from it.
Transliteration: al-tishemechiy feleshet khulekhe khiy nishevar shevet makhekhe khiy-mishoresh nachash eitse tsefa ufireyvo sharaf mevofef

Hebrew: וְרָעוּ֙ בְּכוֹרֵ֣י דַלִּ֔ים וְאֶבְיוֹנִ֖ים לָבֶ֣טַח יִרְבָּ֑צוּ וְהֵמַתִּ֤י בָרָעָב֙ שׇׁרְשֵׁ֔ךְ וּשְׁאֵרִיתֵ֖ךְ יַהֲרֹֽג׃
Translated:
The first-born of the poor shall graze
And the destitute lie down secure.
I will kill your stock by famine,
And it shall slay the very last of you.
Transliteration: verau vekhvorey daliym veeveyvoniym lavetach yirevatsu vehematiy varaav shׇreshekhe usheeriytekhe yaharog

Hebrew: הֵילִ֤ילִֽי שַׁ֙עַר֙ זַֽעֲקִי־עִ֔יר נָמ֖וֹג פְּלֶ֣שֶׁת כֻּלֵּ֑ךְ כִּ֤י מִצָּפוֹן֙ עָשָׁ֣ן בָּ֔א וְאֵ֥ין בּוֹדֵ֖ד בְּמוֹעָדָֽיו׃
Translated:
Howl, O gate; cry out, O city;
Quake, all Philistia!
For a stout one is coming from the north
And there is no straggler in his ranks.
Transliteration: heyliyliy shaar zaakiy-iyr namvog feleshet khulekhe khiy mitsafvon ashan va veeyn vvoded vemvoadayv

Hebrew: וּמַֽה־יַּעֲנֶ֖ה מַלְאֲכֵי־ג֑וֹי כִּ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ יִסַּ֣ד צִיּ֔וֹן וּבָ֥הּ יֶחֱס֖וּ עֲנִיֵּ֥י עַמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
And what will he answer the messengers of any nation?
That Zion has been established by GOD:
In it, the needy of this covenanted people shall find shelter.
Transliteration: umah-yaaneh maleakhey-gvoy khiy yehovah yisad tsiyyvon uvah yechesu aniyey amvo {f}

Hebrew: מַשָּׂ֖א מוֹאָ֑ב כִּ֠י בְּלֵ֞יל שֻׁדַּ֨ד עָ֤ר מוֹאָב֙ נִדְמָ֔ה כִּ֗י בְּלֵ֛יל שֻׁדַּ֥ד קִיר־מוֹאָ֖ב נִדְמָֽה׃
Translated:
The “Moab” Pronouncement.
Ah, in the night Ar was sacked,
Moab was ruined;
Ah, in the night Kir was sacked,
Moab was ruined.
Transliteration: masha mvoav khiy veleyl shudad ar mvoav nidemah khiy veleyl shudad kiyr-mvoav nidemah

Hebrew: עָלָ֨ה הַבַּ֧יִת וְדִיבֹ֛ן הַבָּמ֖וֹת לְבֶ֑כִי עַל־נְב֞וֹ וְעַ֤ל מֵֽידְבָא֙ מוֹאָ֣ב יְיֵלִ֔יל בְּכׇל־רֹאשָׁ֣יו קׇרְחָ֔ה כׇּל־זָקָ֖ן גְּרוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
He went up to the temple to weep,
Dibon [went] to the outdoor shrines.
Over Nebo and Medeba
Moab is wailing;
On every head is baldness,
Every beard is shorn.
Transliteration: alah havayiit vediyvon havamvot levekhiy al-nevvo veal meydeva mvoav yeeiliyl vekhׇl-roshayv kׇrechah khׇl-zakan geruah

Hebrew: בְּחוּצֹתָ֖יו חָ֣גְרוּ שָׂ֑ק עַ֣ל גַּגּוֹתֶ֧יהָ וּבִרְחֹבֹתֶ֛יהָ כֻּלֹּ֥ה יְיֵלִ֖יל יֹרֵ֥ד בַּבֶּֽכִי׃
Translated:
In its streets, they are girt with sackcloth;
On its roofs, in its squares,
Everyone is wailing,
Streaming with tears.
Transliteration: vechutsotayv chageru shak al gagvoteyha uvirechovoteyha khuloh yeeiliyl yored vavekhiy

Hebrew: וַתִּזְעַ֤ק חֶשְׁבּוֹן֙ וְאֶלְעָלֵ֔ה עַד־יַ֖הַץ נִשְׁמַ֣ע קוֹלָ֑ם עַל־כֵּ֗ן חֲלֻצֵ֤י מוֹאָב֙ יָרִ֔יעוּ נַפְשׁ֖וֹ יָ֥רְעָה לּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Heshbon and Elealeh cry out,
Their voice carries to Jahaz.
Therefore,
The shock troops of Moab shout,
His body is convulsed.
Transliteration: vatizeak cheshevvon veelealeh ad-yahats nishema kvolam al-khen chalutsey mvoav yariyu nafeshvo yareah lvo

Hebrew: לִבִּי֙ לְמוֹאָ֣ב יִזְעָ֔ק בְּרִיחֶ֕הָ עַד־צֹ֖עַר עֶגְלַ֣ת שְׁלִשִׁיָּ֑ה כִּ֣י ׀ מַעֲלֵ֣ה הַלּוּחִ֗ית בִּבְכִי֙ יַֽעֲלֶה־בּ֔וֹ כִּ֚י דֶּ֣רֶךְ חוֹרֹנַ֔יִם זַעֲקַת־שֶׁ֖בֶר יְעֹעֵֽרוּ׃
Translated:
My heart cries out for Moab—
His fugitives flee down to Zoar,
To Eglath-shelishiyah.
For the ascent of Luhith
They ascend with weeping;
On the road to Horonaim
They raise a cry of anguish.
Transliteration: liviy lemvoav yizeak veriycheha ad-tsoar egelat shelishiyah khiy maaleh haluchiyt vivekhiy yaaleh-vvo khiy derekhe chvoronayiim zaakat-shever yeoeru

Hebrew: כִּי־מֵ֥י נִמְרִ֖ים מְשַׁמּ֣וֹת יִֽהְי֑וּ כִּֽי־יָבֵ֤שׁ חָצִיר֙ כָּ֣לָה דֶ֔שֶׁא יֶ֖רֶק לֹ֥א הָיָֽה׃
Translated:
Ah, the Waters of Nimrim
Are become a desolation;
The grass is sear,
The herbage is gone,
Vegetation is vanished.
Transliteration: khiy-mey nimeriym meshamvot yiheyu khiy-yavesh chatsiyr khalah deshe yerek lo hayah

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֖ן יִתְרָ֣ה עָשָׂ֑ה וּ֨פְקֻדָּתָ֔ם עַ֛ל נַ֥חַל הָעֲרָבִ֖ים יִשָּׂאֽוּם׃
Translated:
Therefore,
The gains they have made, and their stores,
They carry to the Wadi of Willows.
Transliteration: al-khen yiterah ashah ufekudatam al nachal haaraviym yishaum

Hebrew: כִּי־הִקִּ֥יפָה הַזְּעָקָ֖ה אֶת־גְּב֣וּל מוֹאָ֑ב עַד־אֶגְלַ֙יִם֙ יִלְלָתָ֔הּ וּבְאֵ֥ר אֵילִ֖ים יִלְלָתָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Ah, the cry has compassed
The country of Moab:
All the way to Eglaim her wailing,
Even at Beer-elim her wailing!
Transliteration: khiy-hikiyfah hazeakah et-gevul mvoav ad-egelayiim yilelatah uveer eyliym yilelatah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י מֵ֤י דִימוֹן֙ מָ֣לְאוּ דָ֔ם כִּֽי־אָשִׁ֥ית עַל־דִּימ֖וֹן נוֹסָפ֑וֹת לִפְלֵיטַ֤ת מוֹאָב֙ אַרְיֵ֔ה וְלִשְׁאֵרִ֖ית אֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Ah, the waters of Dimon are full of blood
For I pour added [water] on Dimon;
I drench it—for Moab’s refugees—
With soil for its remnant.
Transliteration: khiy mey diymvon maleu dam khiy-ashiyt al-diymvon nvosafvot lifeleytat mvoav areeih velisheeriyt adamah

Hebrew: שִׁלְחוּ־כַ֥ר מֹשֵֽׁל־אֶ֖רֶץ מִסֶּ֣לַע מִדְבָּ֑רָה אֶל־הַ֖ר בַּת־צִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Dispatch as messenger
The ruler of the land,
From Sela in the wilderness
To the mount of Fair Zion:
Transliteration: shilechu-khar moshel-erets misela midevarah el-har vat-tsiyyvon

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה כְעוֹף־נוֹדֵ֖ד קֵ֣ן מְשֻׁלָּ֑ח תִּֽהְיֶ֙ינָה֙ בְּנ֣וֹת מוֹאָ֔ב מַעְבָּרֹ֖ת לְאַרְנֽוֹן׃
Translated:
“Like fugitive birds,
Like nestlings driven away,
Moab’s villagers linger
By the fords of the Arnon.
Transliteration: vehayah khevof-nvoded ken meshulach tiheyeynah venvot mvoav maevarot learenvon

Hebrew: (הביאו) [הָבִ֤יאִי] עֵצָה֙ עֲשׂ֣וּ פְלִילָ֔ה שִׁ֧יתִי כַלַּ֛יִל צִלֵּ֖ךְ בְּת֣וֹךְ צׇהֳרָ֑יִם סַתְּרִי֙ נִדָּחִ֔ים נֹדֵ֖ד אַל־תְּגַלִּֽי׃
Translated:
Give advice,
Offer counsel.
At high noon make
Your shadow like night:
Conceal the outcasts,
Betray not the fugitives.
Transliteration: (hvyv) [haviyiy] etsah ashu feliylah shiytiy khalayiil tsilekhe vetvokhe tsׇhorayiim sateriy nidachiym noded al-tegaliy

Hebrew: יָג֤וּרוּ בָךְ֙ נִדָּחַ֔י מוֹאָ֛ב הֱוִי־סֵ֥תֶר לָ֖מוֹ מִפְּנֵ֣י שׁוֹדֵ֑ד כִּֽי־אָפֵ֤ס הַמֵּץ֙ כָּ֣לָה שֹׁ֔ד תַּ֥מּוּ רֹמֵ֖ס מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Let Moab’s outcasts
Find asylum in you;
Be a shelter for them
Against the despoiler.”
For violence has vanished,
Rapine is ended,
And marauders have perished from this land.
Transliteration: yaguru vakhe nidachay mvoav heviy-seter lamvo mifeney shvoded khiy-afes hamets khalah shod tamu romes min-haarets {s}

Hebrew: וְהוּכַ֤ן בַּחֶ֙סֶד֙ כִּסֵּ֔א וְיָשַׁ֥ב עָלָ֛יו בֶּאֱמֶ֖ת בְּאֹ֣הֶל דָּוִ֑ד שֹׁפֵ֛ט וְדֹרֵ֥שׁ מִשְׁפָּ֖ט וּמְהִ֥ר צֶֽדֶק׃
Translated:
And a throne shall be established in goodness
In the tent of David,
And on it shall sit in faithfulness
A ruler devoted to justice
And zealous for equity.
Transliteration: vehukhan vachesed khise veyashav alayv veemet veohel david shofet vedoresh mishefat umehir tsedek

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֥עְנוּ גְאוֹן־מוֹאָ֖ב גֵּ֣א מְאֹ֑ד גַּאֲוָת֧וֹ וּגְאוֹנ֛וֹ וְעֶבְרָת֖וֹ לֹא־כֵ֥ן בַּדָּֽיו׃
Translated:
“We have heard of Moab’s pride—
Most haughty is he—
Of his pride and haughtiness and arrogance,
And of the iniquity in him.”
Transliteration: shamaenu gevon-mvoav ge meod gaavatvo ugevonvo veeveratvo lo-khen vadayv

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן יְיֵלִ֥יל מוֹאָ֛ב לְמוֹאָ֖ב כֻּלֹּ֣ה יְיֵלִ֑יל לַאֲשִׁישֵׁ֧י קִיר־חֲרֶ֛שֶׂת תֶּהְגּ֖וּ אַךְ־נְכָאִֽים׃
Translated:
Ah, let Moab howl;
Let all in Moab howl!
For the raisin-cakes of Kir-hareseth
You shall moan most pitifully.
Transliteration: lakhen yeeiliyl mvoav lemvoav khuloh yeeiliyl laashiyshey kiyr-chareshet tehegu akhe-nekhaiym

Hebrew: כִּ֣י שַׁדְמוֹת֩ חֶשְׁבּ֨וֹן אֻמְלָ֜ל גֶּ֣פֶן שִׂבְמָ֗ה בַּעֲלֵ֤י גוֹיִם֙ הָלְמ֣וּ שְׂרוּקֶּ֔יהָ עַד־יַעְזֵ֥ר נָגָ֖עוּ תָּ֣עוּ מִדְבָּ֑ר שְׁלֻ֣חוֹתֶ֔יהָ נִטְּשׁ֖וּ עָ֥בְרוּ יָֽם׃
Translated:
The vineyards of Heshbon are withered,
And the vines of Sibmah;
Their tendrils spread
To Baale-goiim,
And reached to Jazer,
And strayed to the desert;
Their shoots spread out
And crossed the sea.
Transliteration: khiy shademvot cheshevvon umelal gefen shivemah vaaley gvoyim halemu sherukeyha ad-yaezer nagau tau midevar sheluchvoteyha niteshu averu yam

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֡ן אֶבְכֶּ֞ה בִּבְכִ֤י יַעְזֵר֙ גֶּ֣פֶן שִׂבְמָ֔ה אֲרַיָּ֙וֶךְ֙ דִּמְעָתִ֔י חֶשְׁבּ֖וֹן וְאֶלְעָלֵ֑ה כִּ֧י עַל־קֵיצֵ֛ךְ וְעַל־קְצִירֵ֖ךְ הֵידָ֥ד נָפָֽל׃
Translated:
Therefore,
As I weep for Jazer,
So I weep for Sibmah’s vines;
O Heshbon and Elealeh,
I drench you with my tears.
Ended are the shouts
Over your fig and grain harvests.
Transliteration: al-khen evekheh vivekhiy yaezer gefen shivemah arayavekhe dimeatiy cheshevvon veelealeh khiy al-keytsekhe veal-ketsiyrekhe heydad nafal

Hebrew: וְנֶאֱסַ֨ף שִׂמְחָ֤ה וָגִיל֙ מִן־הַכַּרְמֶ֔ל וּבַכְּרָמִ֥ים לֹֽא־יְרֻנָּ֖ן לֹ֣א יְרֹעָ֑ע יַ֗יִן בַּיְקָבִ֛ים לֹא־יִדְרֹ֥ךְ הַדֹּרֵ֖ךְ הֵידָ֥ד הִשְׁבַּֽתִּי׃
Translated:
Rejoicing and gladness
Are gone from the farmland;
In the vineyards no shouting
Or cheering is heard.
No more does the treader
Tread wine in the presses—
The shouts have been silenced.
Transliteration: veneesaf shimechah vagiyl min-hakharemel uvakheramiym lo-yerunan lo yeroa yayiin vayekaviym lo-yiderokhe hadorekhe heydad hishevatiy

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּן֙ מֵעַ֣י לְמוֹאָ֔ב כַּכִּנּ֖וֹר יֶהֱמ֑וּ וְקִרְבִּ֖י לְקִ֥יר חָֽרֶשׂ׃
Translated:
Therefore,
Like a lyre my heart moans for Moab,
And my very soul for Kir-heres.
Transliteration: al-khen meay lemvoav khakhinvor yehemu vekireviy lekiyr charesh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֧ה כִֽי־נִרְאָ֛ה כִּֽי־נִלְאָ֥ה מוֹאָ֖ב עַל־הַבָּמָ֑ה וּבָ֧א אֶל־מִקְדָּשׁ֛וֹ לְהִתְפַּלֵּ֖ל וְלֹ֥א יוּכָֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: And when it has become apparent that Moab has gained nothing in the outdoor shrine, he shall come to pray in his temple—but to no avail.
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-nireah khiy-nileah mvoav al-havamah uva el-mikedashvo lehitefalel velo yukhal {s}

Hebrew: זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־מוֹאָ֖ב מֵאָֽז׃
Translated: That is the word that G<small>OD</small> spoke concerning Moab long ago.
Transliteration: zeh hadavar asher diver yehovah el-mvoav meaz

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָה֮ לֵאמֹר֒ בְּשָׁלֹ֤שׁ שָׁנִים֙ כִּשְׁנֵ֣י שָׂכִ֔יר וְנִקְלָה֙ כְּב֣וֹד מוֹאָ֔ב בְּכֹ֖ל הֶהָמ֣וֹן הָרָ֑ב וּשְׁאָ֥ר מְעַ֛ט מִזְעָ֖ר ל֥וֹא כַבִּֽיר׃ {פ}
Translated: And now G<small>OD</small> has spoken: In three years, fixed like the years of a hired laborer, Moab’s population, with all its huge multitude, shall shrink. Only a remnant shall be left, of no consequence.
Transliteration: veatah diver yehovah lemor veshalosh shaniym khisheney shakhiyr venikelah khevvod mvoav vekhol hehamvon harav ushear meat mizear lvo khaviyr {f}

Hebrew: מַשָּׂ֖א דַּמָּ֑שֶׂק הִנֵּ֤ה דַמֶּ֙שֶׂק֙ מוּסָ֣ר מֵעִ֔יר וְהָיְתָ֖ה מְעִ֥י מַפָּלָֽה׃
Translated:
The “Damascus” Pronouncement.
Behold,
Damascus shall cease to be a city;
It shall become a heap of ruins.
Transliteration: masha damashek hineh dameshek musar meiyr vehayetah meiy mafalah

Hebrew: עֲזֻב֖וֹת עָרֵ֣י עֲרֹעֵ֑ר לַעֲדָרִ֣ים תִּֽהְיֶ֔ינָה וְרָבְצ֖וּ וְאֵ֥ין מַחֲרִֽיד׃
Translated:
The towns of Aroer shall be deserted;
They shall be a place for flocks
To lie down, with none disturbing.
Transliteration: azuvvot arey aroer laadariym tiheyeynah veravetsu veeyn machariyd

Hebrew: וְנִשְׁבַּ֤ת מִבְצָר֙ מֵאֶפְרַ֔יִם וּמַמְלָכָ֥ה מִדַּמֶּ֖שֶׂק וּשְׁאָ֣ר אֲרָ֑ם כִּכְב֤וֹד בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ יִֽהְי֔וּ נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated:
Fortresses shall cease from Ephraim,
And sovereignty from Damascus;
The remnant of Aram shall become
Like the mass of Israelites
—declares GOD of Hosts.
Transliteration: venishevat mivetsar meeferayiim umamelakhah midameshek ushear aram khikhevvod veney-yisherael yiheyu neum yehovah tsevavot {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא יִדַּ֖ל כְּב֣וֹד יַעֲקֹ֑ב וּמִשְׁמַ֥ן בְּשָׂר֖וֹ יֵרָזֶֽה׃
Translated:
In that day,
The mass of Jacob shall dwindle,
And the fatness of his body become lean:
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu yidal khevvod yaakov umisheman vesharvo eirazeh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כֶּֽאֱסֹף֙ קָצִ֣יר קָמָ֔ה וּזְרֹע֖וֹ שִׁבֳּלִ֣ים יִקְצ֑וֹר וְהָיָ֛ה כִּמְלַקֵּ֥ט שִׁבֳּלִ֖ים בְּעֵ֥מֶק רְפָאִֽים׃
Translated:
After being like the standing grain
Harvested by the reaper—
Who reaps ears by the armful—
He shall be like the ears that are gleaned
In the Valley of Rephaim.
Transliteration: vehayah kheesof katsiyr kamah uzerovo shivoliym yiketsvor vehayah khimelaket shivoliym veemek refaiym

Hebrew: וְנִשְׁאַר־בּ֤וֹ עֽוֹלֵלֹת֙ כְּנֹ֣קֶף זַ֔יִת שְׁנַ֧יִם שְׁלֹשָׁ֛ה גַּרְגְּרִ֖ים בְּרֹ֣אשׁ אָמִ֑יר אַרְבָּעָ֣ה חֲמִשָּׁ֗ה בִּסְעִפֶ֙יהָ֙ פֹּֽרִיָּ֔ה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Only gleanings shall be left of him,
As when one beats an olive tree:
Two berries or three on the topmost branch,
Four or five on the boughs of the crown
—declares the ETERNAL, the God of Israel.
Transliteration: venishear-vvo volelot khenokef zayiit shenayiim sheloshah garegeriym verosh amiyr arevaah chamishah viseifeyha foriyah neum-yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא יִשְׁעֶ֥ה הָאָדָ֖ם עַל־עֹשֵׂ֑הוּ וְעֵינָ֕יו אֶל־קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תִּרְאֶֽינָה׃
Translated: In that day, people shall turn to their Maker, their eyes look to the Holy One of Israel;
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yisheeh haadam al-oshehu veeynayv el-kedvosh yisherael tireeynah

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א יִשְׁעֶ֔ה אֶל־הַֽמִּזְבְּח֖וֹת מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדָ֑יו וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשׂ֤וּ אֶצְבְּעֹתָיו֙ לֹ֣א יִרְאֶ֔ה וְהָאֲשֵׁרִ֖ים וְהָחַמָּנִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: they shall not turn to the altars that their own hands made, or look to the sacred posts and incense stands that their own fingers wrought.
Transliteration: velo yisheeh el-hamizevechvot maasheh yadayv vaasher ashu etseveotayv lo yireeh vehaasheriym vehachamaniym {s}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֨וֹם הַה֜וּא יִהְי֣וּ ׀ עָרֵ֣י מָעוּזּ֗וֹ כַּעֲזוּבַ֤ת הַחֹ֙רֶשׁ֙ וְהָ֣אָמִ֔יר אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָֽזְב֔וּ מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהָיְתָ֖ה שְׁמָמָֽה׃
Translated: In that day, their fortress cities shall be like the deserted sites that the Horesh and the Amir abandoned because of the Israelites; and there shall be desolation.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yiheyu arey mauzvo khaazuvat hachoresh vehaamiyr asher azevu mifeney veney yisherael vehayetah shemamah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י שָׁכַ֙חַתְּ֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׁעֵ֔ךְ וְצ֥וּר מָעֻזֵּ֖ךְ לֹ֣א זָכָ֑רְתְּ עַל־כֵּ֗ן תִּטְּעִי֙ נִטְעֵ֣י נַעֲמָנִ֔ים וּזְמֹ֥רַת זָ֖ר תִּזְרָעֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Truly, you have forgotten the God who saves you
And have not remembered the Rock who shelters you;
That is why, though you plant a delightful sapling,
What you sow proves a disappointing slip.
Transliteration: khiy shakhachate elohey yisheekhe vetsur mauzekhe lo zakharete al-khen titeiy niteey naamaniym uzemorat zar tizeraenu

Hebrew: בְּי֤וֹם נִטְעֵךְ֙ תְּשַׂגְשֵׂ֔גִי וּבַבֹּ֖קֶר זַרְעֵ֣ךְ תַּפְרִ֑יחִי נֵ֥ד קָצִ֛יר בְּי֥וֹם נַחֲלָ֖ה וּכְאֵ֥ב אָנֽוּשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated:
On the day that you plant, you see it grow;
On the morning you sow, you see it bud—
But the branches wither away
On a day of sickness and mortal agony.
Transliteration: veyvom niteekhe teshageshegiy uvavoker zareekhe taferiychiy ned katsiyr veyvom nachalah ukheev anush {s}

Hebrew: ה֗וֹי הֲמוֹן֙ עַמִּ֣ים רַבִּ֔ים כַּהֲמ֥וֹת יַמִּ֖ים יֶהֱמָי֑וּן וּשְׁא֣וֹן לְאֻמִּ֔ים כִּשְׁא֛וֹן מַ֥יִם כַּבִּירִ֖ים יִשָּׁאֽוּן׃
Translated:
Ah, the roar of many peoples
That roar as roars the sea,
The rage of nations that rage
As rage the mighty waters—
Transliteration: hvoy hamvon amiym raviym khahamvot yamiym yehemayun ushevon leumiym khishevon mayiim khaviyriym yishaun

Hebrew: לְאֻמִּ֗ים כִּשְׁא֞וֹן מַ֤יִם רַבִּים֙ יִשָּׁא֔וּן וְגָ֥עַר בּ֖וֹ וְנָ֣ס מִמֶּרְחָ֑ק וְרֻדַּ֗ף כְּמֹ֤ץ הָרִים֙ לִפְנֵי־ר֔וּחַ וּכְגַלְגַּ֖ל לִפְנֵ֥י סוּפָֽה׃
Translated:
Nations raging like massive waters!
But [God] shouts at them, and they flee far away,
Driven like chaff before winds in the hills,
And like tumbleweed before a gale.
Transliteration: leumiym khishevon mayiim raviym yishaun vegaar vvo venas mimerechak verudaf khemots hariym lifeney-rucha ukhegalegal lifeney sufah

Hebrew: לְעֵ֥ת עֶ֙רֶב֙ וְהִנֵּ֣ה בַלָּהָ֔ה בְּטֶ֥רֶם בֹּ֖קֶר אֵינֶ֑נּוּ זֶ֚ה חֵ֣לֶק שׁוֹסֵ֔ינוּ וְגוֹרָ֖ל לְבֹזְזֵֽינוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
At eventide, lo, terror!
By morning, it is no more.
Such is the lot of our despoilers,
The portion of them that plunder us.
Transliteration: leet erev vehineh valahah veterem voker eynenu zeh chelek shvoseynu vegvoral levozezeynu {f}

Hebrew: ה֥וֹי אֶ֖רֶץ צִלְצַ֣ל כְּנָפָ֑יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר מֵעֵ֖בֶר לְנַהֲרֵי־כֽוּשׁ׃
Translated:
Ah,
land in the deep shadow of wings,
Beyond the rivers of Cush!
Transliteration: hvoy erets tsiletsal khenafayiim asher meever lenaharey-khush

Hebrew: הַשֹּׁלֵ֨חַ בַּיָּ֜ם צִירִ֗ים וּבִכְלֵי־גֹ֘מֶא֮ עַל־פְּנֵי־מַ֒יִם֒ לְכ֣וּ ׀ מַלְאָכִ֣ים קַלִּ֗ים אֶל־גּוֹי֙ מְמֻשָּׁ֣ךְ וּמוֹרָ֔ט אֶל־עַ֥ם נוֹרָ֖א מִן־ה֣וּא וָהָ֑לְאָה גּ֚וֹי קַו־קָ֣ו וּמְבוּסָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־בָּזְא֥וּ נְהָרִ֖ים אַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Go, swift messengers,
To a nation far and remote,
To a people thrust forth and away—
A nation of gibber and chatter—
Whose land is cut off by streams;
Which sends out envoys by sea,
In papyrus vessels upon the water!
Transliteration: hasholecha vayam tsiyriym uvikheley-gome al-feney-mayiim lekhu maleakhiym kaliym el-gvoy memushakhe umvorat el-am nvora min-hu vahaleah gvoy kav-kav umevusah asher-vazeu nehariym aretsvo

Hebrew: כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י תֵבֵ֖ל וְשֹׁ֣כְנֵי אָ֑רֶץ כִּנְשֹׂא־נֵ֤ס הָרִים֙ תִּרְא֔וּ וְכִתְקֹ֥עַ שׁוֹפָ֖ר תִּשְׁמָֽעוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
[Say this:]
“All you who live in the world
And inhabit the earth,
When a flag is raised in the hills, take note!
When a ram’s horn is blown, give heed!”
Transliteration: khׇl-yoshevey tevel veshokheney arets khinesho-nes hariym tireu vekhitekoa shvofar tishemau {s}

Hebrew: כִּי֩ כֹ֨ה אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י (אשקוטה) [אֶשְׁקֳטָ֖ה] וְאַבִּ֣יטָה בִמְכוֹנִ֑י כְּחֹ֥ם צַח֙ עֲלֵי־א֔וֹר כְּעָ֥ב טַ֖ל בְּחֹ֥ם קָצִֽיר׃
Translated:
For thus GOD said to me:
“I rest calm and confident in My habitation—
Like a scorching heat upon sprouts,
Like a rain-cloud in the heat of reaping time.”
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah elay (shkvth) [eshekotah] veaviytah vimekhvoniy khechom tsach aley-vor kheav tal vechom katsiyr

Hebrew: כִּֽי־לִפְנֵ֤י קָצִיר֙ כְּתׇם־פֶּ֔רַח וּבֹ֥סֶר גֹּמֵ֖ל יִֽהְיֶ֣ה נִצָּ֑הֿ וְכָרַ֤ת הַזַּלְזַלִּים֙ בַּמַּזְמֵר֔וֹת וְאֶת־הַנְּטִישׁ֖וֹת הֵסִ֥יר הֵתַֽז׃
Translated:
For before the harvest, yet after the budding,
When the blossom has hardened into berries,
[God] will trim away the twigs with pruning hooks,
And lop off the trailing branches.
Transliteration: khiy-lifeney katsiyr khetׇm-ferach uvoser gomel yiheyeh nitsahֿ vekharat hazalezaliym vamazemervot veet-hanetiyshvot hesiyr hetaz

Hebrew: יֵעָזְב֤וּ יַחְדָּו֙ לְעֵ֣יט הָרִ֔ים וּֽלְבֶהֱמַ֖ת הָאָ֑רֶץ וְקָ֤ץ עָלָיו֙ הָעַ֔יִט וְכׇל־בֶּהֱמַ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ עָלָ֥יו תֶּחֱרָֽף׃ {ס}
Translated:
They shall all be left
To the kites of the hills
And to the beasts of the earth;
The kites shall summer on them
And all the beasts of the earth shall winter on them.
Transliteration: eiazevu yachedav leeyt hariym ulevehemat haarets vekats alayv haayiit vekhׇl-vehemat haarets alayv techeraf {s}

Hebrew: בָּעֵת֩ הַהִ֨יא יוּבַל־שַׁ֜י לַיהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֗וֹת עַ֚ם מְמֻשָּׁ֣ךְ וּמוֹרָ֔ט וּמֵעַ֥ם נוֹרָ֖א מִן־ה֣וּא וָהָ֑לְאָה גּ֣וֹי ׀ קַו־קָ֣ו וּמְבוּסָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר בָּזְא֤וּ נְהָרִים֙ אַרְצ֔וֹ אֶל־מְק֛וֹם שֵׁם־יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת הַר־צִיּֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated:
In that time,
Tribute shall be brought to GOD of Hosts
[From] a people far and remote,
From a people thrust forth and away—
A nation of gibber and chatter,
Whose land is cut off by streams—
At the place where the name of GOD of Hosts abides,
At Mount Zion.
Transliteration: vaet hahiy yuval-shay layhovah tsevavot am memushakhe umvorat umeam nvora min-hu vahaleah gvoy kav-kav umevusah asher vazeu nehariym aretsvo el-mekvom shem-yehovah tsevavot har-tsiyyvon {f}

Hebrew: מַשָּׂ֖א מִצְרָ֑יִם הִנֵּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה רֹכֵ֨ב עַל־עָ֥ב קַל֙ וּבָ֣א מִצְרַ֔יִם וְנָע֞וּ אֱלִילֵ֤י מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ מִפָּנָ֔יו וּלְבַ֥ב מִצְרַ֖יִם יִמַּ֥ס בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The “Egypt” Pronouncement.
Mounted on a swift cloud,
GOD will come to Egypt;
Egypt’s idols shall tremble in response,
And the heart of the Egyptians shall sink within them.
Transliteration: masha mitserayiim hineh yehovah rokhev al-av kal uva mitserayiim venau eliyley mitserayiim mifanayv ulevav mitserayiim yimas vekirevvo

Hebrew: וְסִכְסַכְתִּ֤י מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וְנִלְחֲמ֥וּ אִישׁ־בְּאָחִ֖יו וְאִ֣ישׁ בְּרֵעֵ֑הוּ עִ֣יר בְּעִ֔יר מַמְלָכָ֖ה בְּמַמְלָכָֽה׃
Translated:
“I will incite Egyptian against Egyptian:
They shall war with each other,
Neighbor with neighbor,
City with city
And kingdom with kingdom.
Transliteration: vesikhesakhetiy mitserayiim vemitserayiim venilechamu iysh-veachiyv veiysh vereehu iyr veiyr mamelakhah vemamelakhah

Hebrew: וְנָבְקָ֤ה רוּחַ־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ בְּקִרְבּ֔וֹ וַעֲצָת֖וֹ אֲבַלֵּ֑עַ וְדָרְשׁ֤וּ אֶל־הָֽאֱלִילִים֙ וְאֶל־הָ֣אִטִּ֔ים וְאֶל־הָאֹב֖וֹת וְאֶל־הַיִּדְּעֹנִֽים׃
Translated:
Egypt shall be drained of spirit,
And I will confound its plans;
So they will consult the idols and the shades
And the ghosts and the familiar spirits.
Transliteration: venavekah rucha-mitserayiim vekirevvo vaatsatvo avalea vedareshu el-haeliyliym veel-haitiym veel-haovvot veel-hayideoniym

Hebrew: וְסִכַּרְתִּי֙ אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּיַ֖ד אֲדֹנִ֣ים קָשֶׁ֑ה וּמֶ֤לֶךְ עַז֙ יִמְשׇׁל־בָּ֔ם נְאֻ֥ם הָאָד֖וֹן יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃
Translated:
And I will place the Egyptians
At the mercy of a harsh master,
And a ruthless king shall rule them”
—declares the Sovereign, GOD of Hosts.
Transliteration: vesikharetiy et-mitserayiim veyad adoniym kasheh umelekhe az yimeshׇl-vam neum haadvon yehovah tsevavot

Hebrew: וְנִשְּׁתוּ־מַ֖יִם מֵֽהַיָּ֑ם וְנָהָ֖ר יֶחֱרַ֥ב וְיָבֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
Water shall fail from the seas,
Rivers dry up and be parched,
Transliteration: venishetu-mayiim mehayam venahar yecherav veyavesh

Hebrew: וְהֶאֶזְנִ֣יחוּ נְהָר֔וֹת דָּלְל֥וּ וְחָרְב֖וּ יְאֹרֵ֣י מָצ֑וֹר קָנֶ֥ה וָס֖וּף קָמֵֽלוּ׃
Translated:
Channels turn foul as they ebb,
And Egypt’s canals run dry.
Reed and rush shall decay,
Transliteration: veheezeniychu neharvot dalelu vecharevu yeorey matsvor kaneh vasuf kamelu

Hebrew: עָר֥וֹת עַל־יְא֖וֹר עַל־פִּ֣י יְא֑וֹר וְכֹל֙ מִזְרַ֣ע יְא֔וֹר יִיבַ֥שׁ נִדַּ֖ף וְאֵינֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
And the Nile papyrus by the Nile-side
And everything sown by the Nile
Shall wither, blow away, and vanish.
Transliteration: arvot al-yevor al-fiy yevor vekhol mizera yevor yiyvash nidaf veeynenu

Hebrew: וְאָנוּ֙ הַדַּיָּגִ֔ים וְאָ֣בְל֔וּ כׇּל־מַשְׁלִיכֵ֥י בַיְא֖וֹר חַכָּ֑ה וּפֹרְשֵׂ֥י מִכְמֹ֛רֶת עַל־פְּנֵי־מַ֖יִם אֻמְלָֽלוּ׃
Translated:
The fishermen shall lament;
All who cast lines in the Nile shall mourn,
And those who spread nets on the water shall languish.
Transliteration: veanu hadayagiym veavelu khׇl-masheliykhey vayevor chakhah uforeshey mikhemoret al-feney-mayiim umelalu

Hebrew: וּבֹ֛שׁוּ עֹבְדֵ֥י פִשְׁתִּ֖ים שְׂרִיק֑וֹת וְאֹרְגִ֖ים חוֹרָֽי׃
Translated:
The flax workers, too, shall be dismayed,
Both carders and weavers chagrined.
Transliteration: uvoshu ovedey fishetiym sheriykvot veoregiym chvoray

Hebrew: וְהָי֥וּ שָׁתֹתֶ֖יהָ מְדֻכָּאִ֑ים כׇּל־עֹ֥שֵׂי שֶׂ֖כֶר אַגְמֵי־נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated:
Her foundations shall be crushed,
And all who make dams shall be despondent.
Transliteration: vehayu shatoteyha medukhaiym khׇl-oshey shekher agemey-nafesh

Hebrew: אַךְ־אֱוִלִים֙ שָׂ֣רֵי צֹ֔עַן חַכְמֵי֙ יֹעֲצֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה עֵצָ֖ה נִבְעָרָ֑ה אֵ֚יךְ תֹּאמְר֣וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה בֶּן־חֲכָמִ֥ים אֲנִ֖י בֶּן־מַלְכֵי־קֶֽדֶם׃
Translated:
Utter fools are the nobles of Tanis;
The sagest of Pharaoh’s advisers
[Have made] absurd predictions.
How can you say to Pharaoh,
“I am a scion of sages,
A scion of Kedemite kings”?
Transliteration: akhe-eviliym sharey tsoan chakhemey yoatsey fareoh etsah nivearah eykhe tomeru el-fareoh ven-chakhamiym aniy ven-malekhey-kedem

Hebrew: אַיָּם֙ אֵפ֣וֹא חֲכָמֶ֔יךָ וְיַגִּ֥ידוּ נָ֖א לָ֑ךְ וְיֵ֣דְע֔וּ מַה־יָּעַ֛ץ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת עַל־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Where, indeed, are your sages?
Let them tell you, let them discover
What GOD of Hosts has planned against Egypt.
Transliteration: ayam efvo chakhameykha veyagiydu na lakhe veeideu mah-yaats yehovah tsevavot al-mitserayiim

Hebrew: נֽוֹאֲלוּ֙ שָׂ֣רֵי צֹ֔עַן נִשְּׁא֖וּ שָׂ֣רֵי נֹ֑ף הִתְע֥וּ אֶת־מִצְרַ֖יִם פִּנַּ֥ת שְׁבָטֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
The nobles of Tanis have been fools,
The nobles of Memphis deluded;
Egypt has been led astray
By the chiefs of her tribes.
Transliteration: nvoalu sharey tsoan nisheu sharey nof hiteu et-mitserayiim finat shevateyha

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֛ה מָסַ֥ךְ בְּקִרְבָּ֖הּ ר֣וּחַ עִוְעִ֑ים וְהִתְע֤וּ אֶת־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ בְּכׇֽל־מַעֲשֵׂ֔הוּ כְּהִתָּע֥וֹת שִׁכּ֖וֹר בְּקִיאֽוֹ׃
Translated:
GOD has mixed within her
A spirit of distortion,
Which shall lead Egypt astray in all her undertakings
As a vomiting drunkard goes astray;
Transliteration: yehovah masakhe vekirevah rucha iveiym vehiteu et-mitserayiim vekhׇl-maashehu khehitavot shikhvor vekiyvo

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְמִצְרַ֖יִם מַעֲשֶׂ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר יַעֲשֶׂ֛ה רֹ֥אשׁ וְזָנָ֖ב כִּפָּ֥ה וְאַגְמֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Nothing shall be achieved in Egypt
By either head or tail,
Palm branch or reed.
Transliteration: velo-yiheyeh lemitserayiim maasheh asher yaasheh rosh vezanav khifah veagemvon

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא יִהְיֶ֥ה מִצְרַ֖יִם כַּנָּשִׁ֑ים וְחָרַ֣ד ׀ וּפָחַ֗ד מִפְּנֵי֙ תְּנוּפַת֙ יַד־יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר־ה֖וּא מֵנִ֥יף עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: In that day, the Egyptians shall be like women, trembling and terrified because G<small>OD</small> of Hosts will raise a divine hand against them.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yiheyeh mitserayiim khanashiym vecharad ufachad mifeney tenufat yad-yehovah tsevavot asher-hu meniyf alayv

Hebrew: וְ֠הָיְתָ֠ה אַדְמַ֨ת יְהוּדָ֤ה לְמִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לְחׇגָּ֔א כֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַזְכִּ֥יר אֹתָ֛הּ אֵלָ֖יו יִפְחָ֑ד מִפְּנֵ֗י עֲצַת֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר־ה֖וּא יוֹעֵ֥ץ עָלָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: And the land of Judah shall also be the dread of the Egyptians; they shall quake whenever anybody mentions it to them, because of what G<small>OD</small> of Hosts is planning against them.
Transliteration: vehayetah ademat yehudah lemitserayiim lechׇga khol asher yazekhiyr otah elayv yifechad mifeney atsat yehovah tsevavot asher-hu yvoets alayv {s}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֡וּא יִהְיוּ֩ חָמֵ֨שׁ עָרִ֜ים בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֗יִם מְדַבְּרוֹת֙ שְׂפַ֣ת כְּנַ֔עַן וְנִשְׁבָּע֖וֹת לַיהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֑וֹת עִ֣יר הַהֶ֔רֶס יֵאָמֵ֖ר לְאֶחָֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: In that day, there shall be several towns in the land of Egypt speaking the language of Canaan and swearing loyalty to G<small>OD</small> of Hosts; one shall be called Town of Heres.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yiheyu chamesh ariym veerets mitserayiim medavervot shefat khenaan venishevavot layhovah tsevavot iyr haheres eiamer leechat {s}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יִֽהְיֶ֤ה מִזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה בְּת֖וֹךְ אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וּמַצֵּבָ֥ה אֵצֶל־גְּבוּלָ֖הּ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: In that day, there shall be an altar to G<small>OD</small> inside the land of Egypt and a pillar to G<small>OD</small> at its border.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yiheyeh mizevecha layhovah vetvokhe erets mitserayiim umatsevah etsel-gevulah layhovah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה לְא֥וֹת וּלְעֵ֛ד לַיהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם כִּֽי־יִצְעֲק֤וּ אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י לֹחֲצִ֔ים וְיִשְׁלַ֥ח לָהֶ֛ם מוֹשִׁ֥יעַ וָרָ֖ב וְהִצִּילָֽם׃
Translated: They shall serve as a symbol and reminder of G<small>OD</small> of Hosts in the land of Egypt, so that when [the Egyptians] cry out to G<small>OD</small> against oppressors, a savior and champion will be sent to deliver them.
Transliteration: vehayah levot uleed layhovah tsevavot veerets mitserayiim khiy-yitseaku el-yehovah mifeney lochatsiym veyishelach lahem mvoshiya varav vehitsiylam

Hebrew: וְנוֹדַ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ לְמִצְרַ֔יִם וְיָדְע֥וּ מִצְרַ֛יִם אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וְעָֽבְדוּ֙ זֶ֣בַח וּמִנְחָ֔ה וְנָדְרוּ־נֵ֥דֶר לַיהֹוָ֖ה וְשִׁלֵּֽמוּ׃
Translated: For the Egyptians will be made to know G<small>OD</small>, and the Egyptians shall acknowledge G<small>OD</small> in that day, and they shall serve with sacrifice and oblation and shall make vows to G<small>OD</small> and fulfill them.
Transliteration: venvoda yehovah lemitserayiim veyadeu mitserayiim et-yehovah vayyvom hahu veavedu zevach uminechah venaderu-neder layhovah veshilemu

Hebrew: וְנָגַ֧ף יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מִצְרַ֖יִם נָגֹ֣ף וְרָפ֑וֹא וְשָׁ֙בוּ֙ עַד־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְנֶעְתַּ֥ר לָהֶ֖ם וּרְפָאָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: G<small>OD</small> will first afflict and then heal the Egyptians: when they turn back, G<small>OD</small> will respond to their entreaties and heal them.
Transliteration: venagaf yehovah et-mitserayiim nagof verafvo veshavu ad-yehovah veneetar lahem urefaam {s}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא תִּהְיֶ֨ה מְסִלָּ֤ה מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ אַשּׁ֔וּרָה וּבָא־אַשּׁ֥וּר בְּמִצְרַ֖יִם וּמִצְרַ֣יִם בְּאַשּׁ֑וּר וְעָבְד֥וּ מִצְרַ֖יִם אֶת־אַשּֽׁוּר׃ {ס}
Translated: In that day, there shall be a highway from Egypt to Assyria. The Assyrians shall join with the Egyptians and Egyptians with the Assyrians, and then the Egyptians together with the Assyrians shall serve [G<small>OD</small>].
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu tiheyeh mesilah mimitserayiim ashurah uva-ashur vemitserayiim umitserayiim veashur veavedu mitserayiim et-ashur {s}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יִהְיֶ֤ה יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ שְׁלִ֣ישִׁיָּ֔ה לְמִצְרַ֖יִם וּלְאַשּׁ֑וּר בְּרָכָ֖ה בְּקֶ֥רֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: In that day, Israel shall be a third partner with Egypt and Assyria as a blessing on earth;
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yiheyeh yisherael sheliyshiyah lemitserayiim uleashur verakhah vekerev haarets

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֧ר בֵּרְכ֛וֹ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת לֵאמֹ֑ר בָּר֨וּךְ עַמִּ֜י מִצְרַ֗יִם וּמַעֲשֵׂ֤ה יָדַי֙ אַשּׁ֔וּר וְנַחֲלָתִ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: for G<small>OD</small> of Hosts will bless them, saying, “Blessed be My people Egypt, My handiwork Assyria, and My very own Israel.”
Transliteration: asher verekhvo yehovah tsevavot lemor varukhe amiy mitserayiim umaasheh yaday ashur venachalatiy yisherael {s}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת בֹּ֤א תַרְתָּן֙ אַשְׁדּ֔וֹדָה בִּשְׁלֹ֣חַ אֹת֔וֹ סַֽרְג֖וֹן מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֑וּר וַיִּלָּ֥חֶם בְּאַשְׁדּ֖וֹד וַֽיִּלְכְּדָֽהּ׃
Translated: It was the year that the Tartan came to Ashdod—being sent by King Sargon of Assyria—and attacked Ashdod and took it.
Transliteration: vishenat vo taretan ashedvodah vishelocha otvo saregvon melekhe ashur vayilachem veashedvod vayilekhedah

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֗יא דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָה֮ בְּיַ֣ד יְשַֽׁעְיָ֣הוּ בֶן־אָמוֹץ֮ לֵאמֹר֒ לֵ֗ךְ וּפִתַּחְתָּ֤ הַשַּׂק֙ מֵעַ֣ל מׇתְנֶ֔יךָ וְנַעַלְךָ֥ תַחֲלֹ֖ץ מֵעַ֣ל רַגְלֶ֑ךָ וַיַּ֣עַשׂ כֵּ֔ן הָלֹ֖ךְ עָר֥וֹם וְיָחֵֽף׃ {ס}
Translated: Previously, G<small>OD</small> had spoken to Isaiah son of Amoz, saying, “Go, untie the sackcloth from your loins and take your sandals off your feet,” which he had done, going naked and barefoot.
Transliteration: vaet hahiy diver yehovah veyad yeshaeyahu ven-amvots lemor lekhe ufitacheta hashak meal mׇteneykha venaalekha tachalots meal ragelekha vayaash khen halokhe arvom veyachef {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלַ֛ךְ עַבְדִּ֥י יְשַֽׁעְיָ֖הוּ עָר֣וֹם וְיָחֵ֑ף שָׁלֹ֤שׁ שָׁנִים֙ א֣וֹת וּמוֹפֵ֔ת עַל־מִצְרַ֖יִם וְעַל־כּֽוּשׁ׃
Translated: And now G<small>OD</small> said, “It is a sign and a portent for Egypt and Cush. Just as My servant Isaiah has gone naked and barefoot for three years,
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah khaasher halakhe avediy yeshaeyahu arvom veyachef shalosh shaniym vot umvofet al-mitserayiim veal-khush

Hebrew: כֵּ֣ן יִנְהַ֣ג מֶֽלֶךְ־אַ֠שּׁ֠וּר אֶת־שְׁבִ֨י מִצְרַ֜יִם וְאֶת־גָּל֥וּת כּ֛וּשׁ נְעָרִ֥ים וּזְקֵנִ֖ים עָר֣וֹם וְיָחֵ֑ף וַחֲשׂוּפַ֥י שֵׁ֖ת עֶרְוַ֥ת מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: so shall the king of Assyria drive off the captives of Egypt and the exiles of Cush, young and old, naked and barefoot and with bared buttocks—to the shame of Egypt!
Transliteration: khen yinehag melekhe-ashur et-sheviy mitserayiim veet-galut khush neariym uzekeniym arvom veyachef vachashufay shet erevat mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְחַתּ֖וּ וָבֹ֑שׁוּ מִכּוּשׁ֙ מַבָּטָ֔ם וּמִן־מִצְרַ֖יִם תִּפְאַרְתָּֽם׃
Translated: And they shall be dismayed and chagrined because of Cush their hope and Egypt their boast.
Transliteration: vechatu vavoshu mikhush mavatam umin-mitserayiim tifearetam

Hebrew: וְ֠אָמַ֠ר יֹשֵׁ֨ב הָאִ֣י הַזֶּה֮ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַהוּא֒ הִנֵּה־כֹ֣ה מַבָּטֵ֗נוּ אֲשֶׁר־נַ֤סְנוּ שָׁם֙ לְעֶזְרָ֔ה לְהִ֨נָּצֵ֔ל מִפְּנֵ֖י מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֑וּר וְאֵ֖יךְ נִמָּלֵ֥ט אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: In that day, the dwellers of this coastland shall say, ‘If this could happen to those we looked to, to whom we fled for help and rescue from the king of Assyria, how can we ourselves escape?’”
Transliteration: veamar yoshev haiy hazeh vayyvom hahu hineh-khoh mavatenu asher-nasenu sham leezerah lehinatsel mifeney melekhe ashur veeykhe nimalet anachenu {f}

Hebrew: מַשָּׂ֖א מִדְבַּר־יָ֑ם כְּסוּפ֤וֹת בַּנֶּ֙גֶב֙ לַחֲלֹ֔ף מִמִּדְבָּ֣ר בָּ֔א מֵאֶ֖רֶץ נוֹרָאָֽה׃
Translated:
The “Desert of the Sea” Pronouncement.
Like the gales
That race through the Negeb,
It comes from the desert,
The terrible land.
Transliteration: masha midevar-yam khesufvot vanegev lachalof mimidevar va meerets nvoraah

Hebrew: חָז֥וּת קָשָׁ֖ה הֻגַּד־לִ֑י הַבּוֹגֵ֤ד <small>׀</small> בּוֹגֵד֙ וְהַשּׁוֹדֵ֣ד <small>׀</small> שׁוֹדֵ֔ד עֲלִ֤י עֵילָם֙ צוּרִ֣י מָדַ֔י כׇּל־אַנְחָתָ֖הֿ הִשְׁבַּֽתִּי׃
Translated:
A harsh prophecy
Has been announced to me:
“The betrayer is betraying,
The ravager ravaging.
Advance, Elam!
Lay siege, Media!
I have put an end
To all her sighing.”
Transliteration: chazut kashah hugad-liy havvoged <small></small> vvoged vehashvoded <small></small> shvoded aliy eylam tsuriy maday khׇl-anechatahֿ hishevatiy

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֗ן מָלְא֤וּ מׇתְנַי֙ חַלְחָלָ֔ה צִירִ֣ים אֲחָז֔וּנִי כְּצִירֵ֖י יוֹלֵדָ֑ה נַעֲוֵ֣יתִי מִשְּׁמֹ֔עַ נִבְהַ֖לְתִּי מֵרְאֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Therefore my loins
Are seized with trembling;
I am gripped by pangs
Like a woman in travail,
Too anguished to hear,
Too frightened to see.
Transliteration: al-khen maleu mׇtenay chalechalah tsiyriym achazuniy khetsiyrey yvoledah naaveytiy mishemoa nivehaletiy merevot

Hebrew: תָּעָ֣ה לְבָבִ֔י פַּלָּצ֖וּת בִּֽעֲתָ֑תְנִי אֵ֚ת נֶ֣שֶׁף חִשְׁקִ֔י שָׂ֥ם לִ֖י לַחֲרָדָֽה׃
Translated:
My mind is confused,
I shudder in panic.
My night of pleasure
He has turned to terror:
Transliteration: taah levaviy falatsut viatateniy et neshef chishekiy sham liy lacharadah

Hebrew: עָרֹ֧ךְ הַשֻּׁלְחָ֛ן צָפֹ֥ה הַצָּפִ֖ית אָכ֣וֹל שָׁתֹ֑ה ק֥וּמוּ הַשָּׂרִ֖ים מִשְׁח֥וּ מָגֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated:
“Set the table!”
To “Let the watchman watch!”
“Eat and drink!”
To “Up, officers! Grease the shields!”
Transliteration: arokhe hashulechan tsafoh hatsafiyt akhvol shatoh kumu hashariym mishechu magen {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֥ה אָמַ֛ר אֵלַ֖י אֲדֹנָ֑י לֵ֚ךְ הַעֲמֵ֣ד הַֽמְצַפֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִרְאֶ֖ה יַגִּֽיד׃
Translated:
For thus my Sovereign said to me:
“Go, set up a sentry;
Let him announce what he sees.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar elay adonay lekhe haamed hametsafeh asher yireeh yagiyd

Hebrew: וְרָ֣אָה רֶ֗כֶב צֶ֚מֶד פָּרָשִׁ֔ים רֶ֥כֶב חֲמ֖וֹר רֶ֣כֶב גָּמָ֑ל וְהִקְשִׁ֥יב קֶ֖שֶׁב רַב־קָֽשֶׁב׃
Translated:
He will see mounted men,
Horsemen in pairs—
Riders on donkeys,
Riders on camels—
And he will listen closely,
Most attentively.”
Transliteration: veraah rekhev tsemed farashiym rekhev chamvor rekhev gamal vehikeshiyv keshev rav-kashev

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֖א אַרְיֵ֑ה עַל־מִצְפֶּ֣ה ׀ אֲדֹנָ֗י אָנֹכִ֞י עֹמֵ֤ד תָּמִיד֙ יוֹמָ֔ם וְעַ֨ל־מִשְׁמַרְתִּ֔י אָנֹכִ֥י נִצָּ֖ב כׇּל־הַלֵּילֽוֹת׃
Translated:
And [like] a lion he called out:
“On my Sovereign’s lookout I stand
Ever by day,
And at my post I watch
Every night.
Transliteration: vayikera areeih al-mitsefeh adonay anokhiy omed tamiyd yvomam veal-mishemaretiy anokhiy nitsav khׇl-haleylvot

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּה־זֶ֥ה בָא֙ רֶ֣כֶב אִ֔ישׁ צֶ֖מֶד פָּרָשִׁ֑ים וַיַּ֣עַן וַיֹּ֗אמֶר נָפְלָ֤ה נָֽפְלָה֙ בָּבֶ֔ל וְכׇל־פְּסִילֵ֥י אֱלֹהֶ֖יהָ שִׁבַּ֥ר לָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
And there they come, mounted men—
Horsemen in pairs!”
Then he spoke up and said,
“Fallen, fallen is Babylon,
And all the images of her gods
Have crashed to the ground!”
Transliteration: vehineh-zeh va rekhev iysh tsemed farashiym vayaan vayomer nafelah nafelah vavel vekhׇl-fesiyley eloheyha shivar laarets

Hebrew: מְדֻשָׁתִ֖י וּבֶן־גׇּרְנִ֑י אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁמַ֗עְתִּי מֵאֵ֨ת יְהֹוָ֧ה צְבָא֛וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הִגַּ֥דְתִּי לָכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
My threshing, the product of my threshing floor:
What I have heard from GOD of Hosts,
The God of Israel—
That I have told to you.
Transliteration: medushatiy uven-gׇreniy asher shamaetiy meet yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael higadetiy lakhem {f}

Hebrew: מַשָּׂ֖א דּוּמָ֑ה אֵלַי֙ קֹרֵ֣א מִשֵּׂעִ֔יר שֹׁמֵר֙ מַה־מִּלַּ֔יְלָה שֹׁמֵ֖ר מַה־מִּלֵּֽיל׃
Translated:
The “Dumah” Pronouncement.
A call comes to me from Seir:
“Watchman, what of the night?
Watchman, what of the night?”
Transliteration: masha dumah elay kore misheiyr shomer mah-milayelah shomer mah-mileyl

Hebrew: אָמַ֣ר שֹׁמֵ֔ר אָתָ֥ה בֹ֖קֶר וְגַם־לָ֑יְלָה אִם־תִּבְעָי֥וּן בְּעָ֖יוּ שֻׁ֥בוּ אֵתָֽיוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
The watchman replied,
“Morning came, and so did night.
If you would inquire, inquire.
Come back again.”
Transliteration: amar shomer atah voker vegam-layelah im-tiveayun veayu shuvu etayu {f}

Hebrew: מַשָּׂ֖א בַּעְרָ֑ב בַּיַּ֤עַר בַּעְרַב֙ תָּלִ֔ינוּ אֹרְח֖וֹת דְּדָנִֽים׃
Translated:
The “In the Steppe” Pronouncement.
In the scrub, in the steppe, you will lodge,
O caravans of the Dedanites!
Transliteration: masha vaerav vayaar vaerav taliynu orechvot dedaniym

Hebrew: לִקְרַ֥את צָמֵ֖א הֵתָ֣יוּ מָ֑יִם יֹֽשְׁבֵי֙ אֶ֣רֶץ תֵּימָ֔א בְּלַחְמ֖וֹ קִדְּמ֥וּ נֹדֵֽד׃
Translated:
Meet the thirsty with water,
You who dwell in the land of Tema;
Greet the fugitive with bread.
Transliteration: likerat tsame hetayu mayiim yoshevey erets teyma velachemvo kidemu noded

Hebrew: כִּֽי־מִפְּנֵ֥י חֲרָב֖וֹת נָדָ֑דוּ מִפְּנֵ֣י ׀ חֶ֣רֶב נְטוּשָׁ֗ה וּמִפְּנֵי֙ קֶ֣שֶׁת דְּרוּכָ֔ה וּמִפְּנֵ֖י כֹּ֥בֶד מִלְחָמָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
For they have fled before swords:
Before the whetted sword,
Before the bow that was drawn,
Before the stress of war.
Transliteration: khiy-mifeney charavvot nadadu mifeney cherev netushah umifeney keshet derukhah umifeney khoved milechamah {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹ֛ה אָמַ֥ר אֲדֹנָ֖י אֵלָ֑י בְּע֤וֹד שָׁנָה֙ כִּשְׁנֵ֣י שָׂכִ֔יר וְכָלָ֖ה כׇּל־כְּב֥וֹד קֵדָֽר׃
Translated: For thus my Sovereign has said to me: “In another year, fixed like the years of a hired laborer, all the multitude of Kedar shall vanish;
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar adonay elay vevod shanah khisheney shakhiyr vekhalah khׇl-khevvod kedar

Hebrew: וּשְׁאָ֧ר מִסְפַּר־קֶ֛שֶׁת גִּבּוֹרֵ֥י בְנֵֽי־קֵדָ֖ר יִמְעָ֑טוּ כִּ֛י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל דִּבֵּֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: the remaining bows of Kedar’s warriors shall be few in number; for the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, has spoken.”
Transliteration: ushear misefar-keshet givvorey veney-kedar yimeatu khiy yehovah elohey-yisherael diver {s}

Hebrew: מַשָּׂ֖א גֵּ֣יא חִזָּי֑וֹן מַה־לָּ֣ךְ אֵפ֔וֹא כִּי־עָלִ֥ית כֻּלָּ֖ךְ לַגַּגּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
The “Valley of Vision” Pronouncement.
What can have happened to you
That you have gone, all of you, up on the roofs,
Transliteration: masha gey chizayvon mah-lakhe efvo khiy-aliyt khulakhe lagagvot

Hebrew: תְּשֻׁא֣וֹת ׀ מְלֵאָ֗ה עִ֚יר הֽוֹמִיָּ֔ה קִרְיָ֖ה עַלִּיזָ֑ה חֲלָלַ֙יִךְ֙ לֹ֣א חַלְלֵי־חֶ֔רֶב וְלֹ֖א מֵתֵ֥י מִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
O you who were full of tumult,
You clamorous town,
You city so exultant?
Your slain are not the slain of the sword
Nor the dead of battle.
Transliteration: teshuvot meleah iyr hvomiyah kireyah aliyzah chalalayiikhe lo chaleley-cherev velo metey milechamah

Hebrew: כׇּל־קְצִינַ֥יִךְ נָֽדְדוּ־יַ֖חַד מִקֶּ֣שֶׁת אֻסָּ֑רוּ כׇּל־נִמְצָאַ֙יִךְ֙ אֻסְּר֣וּ יַחְדָּ֔ו מֵרָח֖וֹק בָּרָֽחוּ׃
Translated:
Your officers have all departed,
They fled far away;
Your survivors were all taken captive,
Taken captive without their bows.
Transliteration: khׇl-ketsiynayiikhe nadedu-yachad mikeshet usaru khׇl-nimetsaayiikhe useru yachedav merachvok varachu

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֥ן אָמַ֛רְתִּי שְׁע֥וּ מִנִּ֖י אֲמָרֵ֣ר בַּבֶּ֑כִי אַל־תָּאִ֣יצוּ לְנַֽחֲמֵ֔נִי עַל־שֹׁ֖ד בַּת־עַמִּֽי׃
Translated:
That is why I say, “Let me be,
I will weep bitterly.
Press not to comfort me
For the ruin of my poor people.”
Transliteration: al-khen amaretiy sheu miniy amarer vavekhiy al-taiytsu lenachameniy al-shod vat-amiy

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יוֹם֩ מְהוּמָ֨ה וּמְבוּסָ֜ה וּמְבוּכָ֗ה לַֽאדֹנָ֧י יֱהֹוִ֛ה צְבָא֖וֹת בְּגֵ֣י חִזָּי֑וֹן מְקַרְקַ֥ר קִ֖ר וְשׁ֥וֹעַ אֶל־הָהָֽר׃
Translated:
For my Sovereign GOD of Hosts had a day
Of tumult and din and confusion—
Kir raged in the Valley of Vision,
And Shoa on the hill;
Transliteration: khiy yvom mehumah umevusah umevukhah ladonay yehovih tsevavot vegey chizayvon mekarekar kir veshvoa el-hahar

Hebrew: וְעֵילָם֙ נָשָׂ֣א אַשְׁפָּ֔ה בְּרֶ֥כֶב אָדָ֖ם פָּרָשִׁ֑ים וְקִ֥יר עֵרָ֖ה מָגֵֽן׃
Translated:
While Elam bore the quiver
In troops of mounted men,
And Kir bared the shield—
Transliteration: veeylam nasha ashefah verekhev adam farashiym vekiyr erah magen

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י מִבְחַר־עֲמָקַ֖יִךְ מָ֣לְאוּ רָ֑כֶב וְהַפָּ֣רָשִׁ֔ים שֹׁ֖ת שָׁ֥תוּ הַשָּֽׁעְרָה׃
Translated:
And your choicest lowlands
Were filled with chariots and riders:
They stormed at Judah’s gateway
Transliteration: vayehiy mivechar-amakayiikhe maleu rakhev vehafarashiym shot shatu hashaerah

Hebrew: וַיְגַ֕ל אֵ֖ת מָסַ֣ךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַתַּבֵּט֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא אֶל־נֶ֖שֶׁק בֵּ֥ית הַיָּֽעַר׃
Translated:
And pressed beyond its screen.
You gave thought on that day
To the arms in the Forest House,
Transliteration: vayegal et masakhe yehudah vatavet vayyvom hahu el-neshek veyt hayaar

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת בְּקִיעֵ֧י עִיר־דָּוִ֛ד רְאִיתֶ֖ם כִּי־רָ֑בּוּ וַֽתְּקַבְּצ֔וּ אֶת־מֵ֥י הַבְּרֵכָ֖ה הַתַּחְתּוֹנָֽה׃
Translated:
And you took note of the many breaches
In the City of David.
And you collected the water of the Lower Pool;
Transliteration: veet vekiyey iyr-david reiytem khiy-ravu vatekavetsu et-mey haverekhah hatachetvonah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בָּתֵּ֥י יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם סְפַרְתֶּ֑ם וַתִּתְצוּ֙ הַבָּ֣תִּ֔ים לְבַצֵּ֖ר הַחוֹמָֽה׃
Translated: and you counted the houses of Jerusalem and pulled houses down to fortify the wall;
Transliteration: veet-vatey yerushala͏im sefaretem vatitetsu havatiym levatser hachvomah

Hebrew: וּמִקְוָ֣ה ׀ עֲשִׂיתֶ֗ם בֵּ֚ין הַחֹ֣מֹתַ֔יִם לְמֵ֖י הַבְּרֵכָ֣ה הַיְשָׁנָ֑ה וְלֹ֤א הִבַּטְתֶּם֙ אֶל־עֹשֶׂ֔יהָ וְיֹצְרָ֥הּ מֵרָח֖וֹק לֹ֥א רְאִיתֶֽם׃
Translated:
and you constructed a basin between the two walls for the water of the old pool.
But you gave no thought to the One who planned it,
You took no note of the One who designed it long before.
Transliteration: umikevah ashiytem veyn hachomotayiim lemey haverekhah hayeshanah velo hivatetem el-osheyha veyotserah merachvok lo reiytem

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֗א אֲדֹנָ֧י יֱהֹוִ֛ה צְבָא֖וֹת בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא לִבְכִי֙ וּלְמִסְפֵּ֔ד וּלְקׇרְחָ֖ה וְלַחֲגֹ֥ר שָֽׂק׃
Translated:
My Sovereign GOD of Hosts summoned on that day
To weeping and lamenting,
To tonsuring and girding with sackcloth.
Transliteration: vayikera adonay yehovih tsevavot vayyvom hahu livekhiy ulemisefed ulekׇrechah velachagor shak

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה ׀ שָׂשׂ֣וֹן וְשִׂמְחָ֗ה הָרֹ֤ג ׀ בָּקָר֙ וְשָׁחֹ֣ט צֹ֔אן אָכֹ֥ל בָּשָׂ֖ר וְשָׁת֣וֹת יָ֑יִן אָכ֣וֹל וְשָׁת֔וֹ כִּ֥י מָחָ֖ר נָמֽוּת׃
Translated:
Instead, there was rejoicing and merriment,
Killing of cattle and slaughtering of sheep,
Eating of meat and drinking of wine:
“Eat and drink, for tomorrow we die!”
Transliteration: vehineh shashvon veshimechah harog vakar veshachot tson akhol vashar veshatvot yayiin akhvol veshatvo khiy machar namut

Hebrew: וְנִגְלָ֥ה בְאׇזְנָ֖י יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֑וֹת אִם־יְ֠כֻפַּ֠ר הֶעָוֺ֨ן הַזֶּ֤ה לָכֶם֙ עַד־תְּמֻת֔וּן אָמַ֛ר אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated:
Then GOD of Hosts was revealed to my ears:
“This iniquity shall never be forgiven you
Until you die,” said my Sovereign GOD of Hosts.
Transliteration: venigelah veׇzenay yehovah tsevavot im-yekhufar heavon hazeh lakhem ad-temutun amar adonay yehovih tsevavot {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֛ר אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה צְבָא֑וֹת לֶךְ־בֹּא֙ אֶל־הַסֹּכֵ֣ן הַזֶּ֔ה עַל־שֶׁבְנָ֖א אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: Thus said my Sovereign G<small>OD</small> of Hosts: Go in to see that steward, that Shebna, in charge of the palace:
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih tsevavot lekhe-vo el-hasokhen hazeh al-shevena asher al-havayiit

Hebrew: מַה־לְּךָ֥ פֹה֙ וּמִ֣י לְךָ֣ פֹ֔ה כִּֽי־חָצַ֧בְתָּ לְּךָ֛ פֹּ֖ה קָ֑בֶר חֹצְבִ֤י מָרוֹם֙ קִבְר֔וֹ חֹקְקִ֥י בַסֶּ֖לַע מִשְׁכָּ֥ן לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
What have you here, and whom have you here,
That you have hewn out a tomb for yourself here?—
O you who have hewn your tomb on high;
O you who have hollowed out for yourself an abode in the cliff!
Transliteration: mah-lekha foh umiy lekha foh khiy-chatsaveta lekha foh kaver chotseviy marvom kivervo chokekiy vasela mishekhan lvo

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ מְטַלְטֶלְךָ֔ טַלְטֵלָ֖ה גָּ֑בֶר וְעֹטְךָ֖ עָטֹֽה׃
Translated:
GOD is about to shake you
Severely, fellow, and then wear you like a wrap.
Transliteration: hineh yehovah metaletelekha taletelah gaver veotekha atoh

Hebrew: צָנ֤וֹף יִצְנׇפְךָ֙ צְנֵפָ֔ה כַּדּ֕וּר אֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ רַחֲבַ֣ת יָדָ֑יִם שָׁ֣מָּה תָמ֗וּת וְשָׁ֙מָּה֙ מַרְכְּב֣וֹת כְּבוֹדֶ֔ךָ קְל֖וֹן בֵּ֥ית אֲדֹנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Indeed, [God] will wind you about as a headdress, a turban.
Off to a broad land!
There shall you die, and there shall be the chariots bearing your body,
O shame of your master’s house!
Transliteration: tsanvof yitsenׇfekha tsenefah khadur el-erets rachavat yadayiim shamah tamut veshamah marekhevvot khevvodekha kelvon veyt adoneykha

Hebrew: וַהֲדַפְתִּ֖יךָ מִמַּצָּבֶ֑ךָ וּמִמַּעֲמָֽדְךָ֖ יֶהֶרְסֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
For I will hurl you from your station
And you shall be torn down from your stand.
Transliteration: vahadafetiykha mimatsavekha umimaamadekha yeheresekha

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וְקָרָ֣אתִי לְעַבְדִּ֔י לְאֶלְיָקִ֖ים בֶּן־חִלְקִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: And in that day, I will summon My servant Eliakim son of Hilkiah,
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu vekaratiy leavediy leeleyakiym ven-chilekiyahu

Hebrew: וְהִלְבַּשְׁתִּ֣יו כֻּתׇּנְתֶּ֗ךָ וְאַבְנֵֽטְךָ֙ אֲחַזְּקֶ֔נּוּ וּמֶֽמְשַׁלְתְּךָ֖ אֶתֵּ֣ן בְּיָד֑וֹ וְהָיָ֥ה לְאָ֛ב לְיוֹשֵׁ֥ב יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וּלְבֵ֥ית יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: and I will invest him with your tunic, gird him with your sash, and deliver your authority into his hand; and he shall be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem and the house of Judah.
Transliteration: vehilevashetiyv khutׇnetekha veavenetekha achazekenu umemeshaletekha eten veyadvo vehayah leav leyvoshev yerushala͏im uleveyt yehudah

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֛י מַפְתֵּ֥חַ בֵּית־דָּוִ֖ד עַל־שִׁכְמ֑וֹ וּפָתַח֙ וְאֵ֣ין סֹגֵ֔ר וְסָגַ֖ר וְאֵ֥ין פֹּתֵֽחַ׃
Translated: I will place the keys of David’s palace on his shoulders; and what he unlocks none may shut, and what he locks none may open.
Transliteration: venatatiy mafetecha veyt-david al-shikhemvo ufatach veeyn soger vesagar veeyn fotecha

Hebrew: וּתְקַעְתִּ֥יו יָתֵ֖ד בְּמָק֣וֹם נֶאֱמָ֑ן וְהָיָ֛ה לְכִסֵּ֥א כָב֖וֹד לְבֵ֥ית אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: He shall be a seat of honor to his father’s household. I will fix him as a peg in a firm place,
