Transliteration: utekaetiyv yated vemakvom neeman vehayah lekhise khavvod leveyt aviyv

Hebrew: וְתָל֨וּ עָלָ֜יו כֹּ֣ל ׀ כְּב֣וֹד בֵּית־אָבִ֗יו הַצֶּֽאֱצָאִים֙ וְהַצְּפִע֔וֹת כֹּ֖ל כְּלֵ֣י הַקָּטָ֑ן מִכְּלֵי֙ הָאַגָּנ֔וֹת וְעַ֖ד כׇּל־כְּלֵ֥י הַנְּבָלִֽים׃
Translated: on which all the substance of his father’s household shall be hung: the sprouts and the leaves—all the small vessels, from bowls to all sorts of jars.
Transliteration: vetalu alayv khol khevvod veyt-aviyv hatseetsaiym vehatsefivot khol kheley hakatan mikheley haaganvot vead khׇl-kheley hanevaliym

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא נְאֻם֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת תָּמוּשׁ֙ הַיָּתֵ֔ד הַתְּקוּעָ֖ה בְּמָק֣וֹם נֶאֱמָ֑ן וְנִגְדְּעָ֣ה וְנָפְלָ֗ה וְנִכְרַת֙ הַמַּשָּׂ֣א אֲשֶׁר־עָלֶ֔יהָ כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבֵּֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: In that day—declares G<small>OD</small> of Hosts—the peg fixed in a firm place shall give way: it shall be cut down and shall fall, and the weight it supports shall be destroyed. For it is G<small>OD</small> who has spoken.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu neum yehovah tsevavot tamush hayated hatekuah vemakvom neeman venigedeah venafelah venikherat hamasha asher-aleyha khiy yehovah diver {f}

Hebrew: מַשָּׂ֖א צֹ֑ר הֵילִ֣ילוּ ׀ אֳנִיּ֣וֹת תַּרְשִׁ֗ישׁ כִּֽי־שֻׁדַּ֤ד מִבַּ֙יִת֙ מִבּ֔וֹא מֵאֶ֥רֶץ כִּתִּ֖ים נִגְלָה־לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
The “Tyre” Pronouncement.
Howl, you ships of Tarshish!
For havoc has been wrought, not a house is left;
As they came from the land of Kittim,
This was revealed to them.
Transliteration: masha tsor heyliylu oniyyvot tareshiysh khiy-shudad mivayiit mivvo meerets khitiym nigelah-lamvo

Hebrew: דֹּ֖מּוּ יֹ֣שְׁבֵי אִ֑י סֹחֵ֥ר צִיד֛וֹן עֹבֵ֥ר יָ֖ם מִלְאֽוּךְ׃
Translated:
Moan, you coastland dwellers,
You traders of Sidon,
Once thronged by seafarers,
Transliteration: domu yoshevey iy socher tsiydvon over yam mileukhe

Hebrew: וּבְמַ֤יִם רַבִּים֙ זֶ֣רַע שִׁחֹ֔ר קְצִ֥יר יְא֖וֹר תְּבוּאָתָ֑הּ וַתְּהִ֖י סְחַ֥ר גּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
Over many waters
Your revenue came:
From the trade of nations,
From the grain of Shihor,
The harvest of the Nile.
Transliteration: uvemayiim raviym zera shichor ketsiyr yevor tevuatah vatehiy sechar gvoyim

Hebrew: בּ֣וֹשִׁי צִיד֔וֹן כִּֽי־אָמַ֣ר יָ֔ם מָע֥וֹז הַיָּ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹא־חַ֣לְתִּי וְלֹֽא־יָלַ֗דְתִּי וְלֹ֥א גִדַּ֛לְתִּי בַּחוּרִ֖ים רוֹמַ֥מְתִּי בְתוּלֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Be ashamed, O Sidon!
For the sea—this stronghold of the sea—declares,
“I am as one who has never labored,
Never given birth,
Never raised youths
Or reared maidens!”
Transliteration: vvoshiy tsiydvon khiy-amar yam mavoz hayam lemor lo-chaletiy velo-yaladetiy velo gidaletiy vachuriym rvomametiy vetulvot

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁר־שֵׁ֖מַע לְמִצְרָ֑יִם יָחִ֖ילוּ כְּשֵׁ֥מַע צֹֽר׃
Translated:
When the Egyptians heard it, they quailed
As when they heard about Tyre.
Transliteration: khaasher-shema lemitserayiim yachiylu kheshema tsor

Hebrew: עִבְר֖וּ תַּרְשִׁ֑ישָׁה הֵילִ֖ילוּ יֹ֥שְׁבֵי אִֽי׃
Translated:
Pass on to Tarshish—
Howl, you coastland dwellers!
Transliteration: iveru tareshiyshah heyliylu yoshevey iy

Hebrew: הֲזֹ֥את לָכֶ֖ם עַלִּיזָ֑ה מִֽימֵי־קֶ֤דֶם קַדְמָתָהּ֙ יֹבִל֣וּהָ רַגְלֶ֔יהָ מֵרָח֖וֹק לָגֽוּר׃
Translated:
Was such your merry city
In former times, of yore?
Did her feet carry her off
To sojourn far away?
Transliteration: hazot lakhem aliyzah miymey-kedem kadematah yoviluha rageleyha merachvok lagur

Hebrew: מִ֚י יָעַ֣ץ זֹ֔את עַל־צֹ֖ר הַמַּעֲטִירָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר סֹחֲרֶ֙יהָ֙ שָׂרִ֔ים כִּנְעָנֶ֖יהָ נִכְבַּדֵּי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Who was it that planned this
For crown-wearing Tyre,
Whose merchants were nobles,
Whose traders the world honored?
Transliteration: miy yaats zot al-tsor hamaatiyrah asher sochareyha shariym khineaneyha nikhevadey-arets

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת יְעָצָ֑הּ לְחַלֵּל֙ גְּא֣וֹן כׇּל־צְבִ֔י לְהָקֵ֖ל כׇּל־נִכְבַּדֵּי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
GOD of Hosts planned it—
To defile all glorious beauty,
To shame all the honored of the world.
Transliteration: yehovah tsevavot yeatsah lechalel gevon khׇl-tseviy lehakel khׇl-nikhevadey-arets

Hebrew: עִבְרִ֥י אַרְצֵ֖ךְ כַּיְאֹ֑ר בַּת־תַּרְשִׁ֕ישׁ אֵ֖ין מֵ֥זַח עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
Traverse your land like the Nile,
Fair Tarshish;
This is a harbor no more.
Transliteration: iveriy aretsekhe khayeor vat-tareshiysh eyn mezach vod

Hebrew: יָדוֹ֙ נָטָ֣ה עַל־הַיָּ֔ם הִרְגִּ֖יז מַמְלָכ֑וֹת יְהֹוָה֙ צִוָּ֣ה אֶל־כְּנַ֔עַן לַשְׁמִ֖ד מָעֻזְנֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
GOD poised an arm o’er the sea
And made kingdoms quake—
Decreeing destruction
For Phoenicia’s strongholds,
Transliteration: yadvo natah al-hayam hiregiyz mamelakhvot yehovah tsivah el-khenaan lashemid mauzeneyha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֹא־תוֹסִ֥יפִי ע֖וֹד לַעְל֑וֹז הַֽמְעֻשָּׁקָ֞ה בְּתוּלַ֣ת בַּת־צִיד֗וֹן (כתיים) [כִּתִּים֙] ק֣וּמִי עֲבֹ֔רִי גַּם־שָׁ֖ם לֹא־יָנ֥וּחַֽ לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
And said,
“You shall be exultant no more,
O plundered one, Fair Maiden Sidon.
Up, cross over to Kittim—
Even there you shall have no rest.”
Transliteration: vayomer lo-tvosiyfiy vod laelvoz hameushakah vetulat vat-tsiydvon (khtyym) [khitiym] kumiy avoriy gam-sham lo-yanucha lakhe

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן ׀ אֶ֣רֶץ כַּשְׂדִּ֗ים זֶ֤ה הָעָם֙ לֹ֣א הָיָ֔ה אַשּׁ֖וּר יְסָדָ֣הּ לְצִיִּ֑ים הֵקִ֣ימוּ (בחיניו) [בַחוּנָ֗יו] עֽוֹרְרוּ֙ אַרְמְנוֹתֶ֔יהָ שָׂמָ֖הּ לְמַפֵּלָֽה׃
Translated:
Behold the land of Chaldea—
This is the people that has ceased to be.
Assyria, which founded it for ships,
Which raised its watchtowers,
Erected its ramparts,
Has turned it into a ruin.
Transliteration: hen erets khashediym zeh haam lo hayah ashur yesadah letsiyiym hekiymu (vchynyv) [vachunayv] voreru aremenvoteyha shamah lemafelah

Hebrew: הֵילִ֖ילוּ אֳנִיּ֣וֹת תַּרְשִׁ֑ישׁ כִּ֥י שֻׁדַּ֖ד מָעֻזְּכֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated:
Howl, O ships of Tarshish,
For your stronghold is destroyed!
Transliteration: heyliylu oniyyvot tareshiysh khiy shudad mauzekhen {s}

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא וְנִשְׁכַּ֤חַת צֹר֙ שִׁבְעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה כִּימֵ֖י מֶ֣לֶךְ אֶחָ֑ד מִקֵּ֞ץ שִׁבְעִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לְצֹ֔ר כְּשִׁירַ֖ת הַזּוֹנָֽה׃
Translated: In that day, Tyre shall remain forgotten for seventy years, equaling the lifetime of one king. After a lapse of seventy years, it shall go with Tyre as with the prostitute in the ditty:
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu venishekhachat tsor shiveiym shanah khiymey melekhe echad mikets shiveiym shanah yiheyeh letsor kheshiyrat hazvonah

Hebrew: קְחִ֥י כִנּ֛וֹר סֹ֥בִּי עִ֖יר זוֹנָ֣ה נִשְׁכָּחָ֑ה הֵיטִ֤יבִי נַגֵּן֙ הַרְבִּי־שִׁ֔יר לְמַ֖עַן תִּזָּכֵֽרִי׃
Translated:
Take a lyre, go about the town,
Prostitute long forgotten;
Sweetly play, make much music,
To bring you back to mind.
Transliteration: kechiy khinvor soviy iyr zvonah nishekhachah heytiyviy nagen hareviy-shiyr lemaan tizakheriy

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה מִקֵּ֣ץ ׀ שִׁבְעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֗ה יִפְקֹ֤ד יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־צֹ֔ר וְשָׁבָ֖ה לְאֶתְנַנָּ֑הֿ וְזָ֥נְתָ֛ה אֶת־כׇּל־מַמְלְכ֥וֹת הָאָ֖רֶץ עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: For after a lapse of seventy years, G<small>OD</small> will take note of Tyre, and she shall resume her “fee-taking” and “play the prostitute” with all the kingdoms of the world, on the face of the earth.
Transliteration: vehayah mikets shiveiym shanah yifekod yehovah et-tsor veshavah leetenanahֿ vezanetah et-khׇl-mamelekhvot haarets al-feney haadamah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה סַחְרָ֜הּ וְאֶתְנַנָּ֗הּ קֹ֚דֶשׁ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה לֹ֥א יֵאָצֵ֖ר וְלֹ֣א יֵחָסֵ֑ן כִּ֣י לַיֹּשְׁבִ֞ים לִפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה סַחְרָ֔הּ לֶאֱכֹ֥ל לְשׇׂבְעָ֖ה וְלִמְכַסֶּ֥ה עָתִֽיק׃ {פ}
Translated: But her profits and “hire” shall be consecrated to G<small>OD</small>. They shall not be treasured or stored; rather shall her profits go to those who abide before G<small>OD</small>, that they may eat their fill and clothe themselves elegantly.
Transliteration: vehayah sacherah veetenanah kodesh layhovah lo eiatser velo eichasen khiy layosheviym lifeney yehovah yiheyeh sacherah leekhol leshׇveah velimekhaseh atiyk {f}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה בּוֹקֵ֥ק הָאָ֖רֶץ וּבֽוֹלְקָ֑הּ וְעִוָּ֣ה פָנֶ֔יהָ וְהֵפִ֖יץ יֹשְׁבֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Behold,
GOD will strip the earth bare,
And lay it waste,
And twist its surface,
And scatter its inhabitants.
Transliteration: hineh yehovah vvokek haarets uvvolekah veivah faneyha vehefiyts yosheveyha

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה כָעָם֙ כַּכֹּהֵ֔ן כַּעֶ֙בֶד֙ כַּֽאדֹנָ֔יו כַּשִּׁפְחָ֖ה כַּגְּבִרְתָּ֑הּ כַּקּוֹנֶה֙ כַּמּוֹכֵ֔ר כַּמַּלְוֶה֙ כַּלֹּוֶ֔ה כַּנֹּשֶׁ֕ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר נֹשֶׁ֥א בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Laity and priest shall fare alike,
Slave and master,
Handmaid and mistress,
Buyer and seller,
Lender and borrower,
Creditor and debtor.
Transliteration: vehayah khaam khakhohen khaeved khadonayv khashifechah khageviretah khakvoneh khamvokher khamaleveh khaloveh khanosheh khaasher noshe vvo

Hebrew: הִבּ֧וֹק <small>׀</small> תִּבּ֛וֹק הָאָ֖רֶץ וְהִבּ֣וֹז <small>׀</small> תִּבֹּ֑ז כִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה דִּבֶּ֖ר אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated:
The earth shall be bare, bare;
It shall be plundered, plundered;
For it is GOD who spoke this word.
Transliteration: hivvok <small></small> tivvok haarets vehivvoz <small></small> tivoz khiy yehovah diver et-hadavar hazeh

Hebrew: אָבְלָ֤ה נָֽבְלָה֙ הָאָ֔רֶץ אֻמְלְלָ֥ה נָבְלָ֖ה תֵּבֵ֑ל אֻמְלָ֖לוּ מְר֥וֹם עַם־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
The earth is withered, sear;
The world languishes, it is sear;
The most exalted people of the earth languish.
Transliteration: avelah navelah haarets umelelah navelah tevel umelalu mervom am-haarets

Hebrew: וְהָאָ֥רֶץ חָנְפָ֖ה תַּ֣חַת יֹשְׁבֶ֑יהָ כִּֽי־עָבְר֤וּ תוֹרֹת֙ חָ֣לְפוּ חֹ֔ק הֵפֵ֖רוּ בְּרִ֥ית עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
For the earth was defiled
Under its inhabitants;
Because they transgressed teachings,
Violated laws,
Broke the ancient covenant.
Transliteration: vehaarets chanefah tachat yosheveyha khiy-averu tvorot chalefu chok heferu veriyt volam

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֗ן אָלָה֙ אָ֣כְלָה אֶ֔רֶץ וַֽיֶּאְשְׁמ֖וּ יֹ֣שְׁבֵי בָ֑הּ עַל־כֵּ֗ן חָרוּ֙ יֹ֣שְׁבֵי אֶ֔רֶץ וְנִשְׁאַ֥ר אֱנ֖וֹשׁ מִזְעָֽר׃
Translated:
That is why a curse consumes the earth,
And its inhabitants pay the penalty;
That is why earth’s dwellers have dwindled,
And but few people are left.
Transliteration: al-khen alah akhelah erets vayeeshemu yoshevey vah al-khen charu yoshevey erets venishear envosh mizear

Hebrew: אָבַ֥ל תִּיר֖וֹשׁ אֻמְלְלָה־גָ֑פֶן נֶאֶנְח֖וּ כׇּל־שִׂמְחֵי־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
The new wine fails,
The vine languishes;
And all the merry-hearted sigh.
Transliteration: aval tiyrvosh umelelah-gafen neenechu khׇl-shimechey-lev

Hebrew: שָׁבַת֙ מְשׂ֣וֹשׂ תֻּפִּ֔ים חָדַ֖ל שְׁא֣וֹן עַלִּיזִ֑ים שָׁבַ֖ת מְשׂ֥וֹשׂ כִּנּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Stilled is the merriment of hand-drums,
Ended the clamor of revelers,
Stilled the merriment of lyres.
Transliteration: shavat meshvosh tufiym chadal shevon aliyziym shavat meshvosh khinvor

Hebrew: בַּשִּׁ֖יר לֹ֣א יִשְׁתּוּ־יָ֑יִן יֵמַ֥ר שֵׁכָ֖ר לְשֹׁתָֽיו׃
Translated:
They drink their wine without song;
Liquor tastes bitter to the drinker.
Transliteration: vashiyr lo yishetu-yayiin eimar shekhar leshotayv

Hebrew: נִשְׁבְּרָ֖ה קִרְיַת־תֹּ֑הוּ סֻגַּ֥ר כׇּל־בַּ֖יִת מִבּֽוֹא׃
Translated:
Towns are broken, empty;
Every house is shut, none enter;
Transliteration: nisheverah kireyat-tohu sugar khׇl-vayiit mivvo

Hebrew: צְוָחָ֥ה עַל־הַיַּ֖יִן בַּחוּצ֑וֹת עָֽרְבָה֙ כׇּל־שִׂמְחָ֔ה גָּלָ֖ה מְשׂ֥וֹשׂ הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Even over wine, a cry goes up in the streets:
The sun has set on all joy,
The gladness of the earth is banished.
Transliteration: tsevachah al-hayayiin vachutsvot arevah khׇl-shimechah galah meshvosh haarets

Hebrew: נִשְׁאַ֥ר בָּעִ֖יר שַׁמָּ֑ה וּשְׁאִיָּ֖ה יֻכַּת־שָֽׁעַר׃
Translated:
Desolation is left in the town
And the gate is battered to ruins.
Transliteration: nishear vaiyr shamah usheiyah yukhat-shaar

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֥ה יִֽהְיֶ֛ה בְּקֶ֥רֶב הָאָ֖רֶץ בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעַמִּ֑ים כְּנֹ֣קֶף זַ֔יִת כְּעוֹלֵלֹ֖ת אִם־כָּלָ֥ה בָצִֽיר׃
Translated:
For thus shall it be among the peoples
In the midst of the earth:
As when the olive tree is beaten out,
Like gleanings when the vintage is over.
Transliteration: khiy khoh yiheyeh vekerev haarets vetvokhe haamiym khenokef zayiit khevolelot im-khalah vatsiyr

Hebrew: הֵ֛מָּה יִשְׂא֥וּ קוֹלָ֖ם יָרֹ֑נּוּ בִּגְא֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֔ה צָהֲל֖וּ מִיָּֽם׃
Translated:
These shall lift up their voices,
Exult in GOD’s majesty.
They shall shout from the sea:
Transliteration: hemah yisheu kvolam yaronu vigevon yehovah tsahalu miyam

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֥ן בָּאֻרִ֖ים כַּבְּד֣וּ יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּאִיֵּ֣י הַיָּ֔ם שֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
Therefore, honor GOD with lights
In the coastlands of the sea—
The name of the ETERNAL, the God of Israel.
Transliteration: al-khen vauriym khavedu yehovah veiyey hayam shem yehovah elohey yisherael {s}

Hebrew: מִכְּנַ֨ף הָאָ֜רֶץ זְמִרֹ֤ת שָׁמַ֙עְנוּ֙ צְבִ֣י לַצַּדִּ֔יק וָאֹמַ֛ר רָזִי־לִ֥י רָֽזִי־לִ֖י א֣וֹי לִ֑י בֹּגְדִ֣ים בָּגָ֔דוּ וּבֶ֥גֶד בּוֹגְדִ֖ים בָּגָֽדוּ׃
Translated:
From the end of the earth
We hear singing:
Glory to the righteous!
And I said:
I waste away! I waste away! Woe is me!
The faithless have acted faithlessly;
The faithless have broken faith!
Transliteration: mikhenaf haarets zemirot shamaenu tseviy latsadiyk vaomar raziy-liy raziy-liy voy liy vogediym vagadu uveged vvogediym vagadu

Hebrew: פַּ֥חַד וָפַ֖חַת וָפָ֑ח עָלֶ֖יךָ יוֹשֵׁ֥ב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Terror, and pit, and trap
Upon you who dwell on earth!
Transliteration: fachad vafachat vafach aleykha yvoshev haarets

Hebrew: וְ֠הָיָ֠ה הַנָּ֞ס מִקּ֤וֹל הַפַּ֙חַד֙ יִפֹּ֣ל אֶל־הַפַּ֔חַת וְהָֽעוֹלֶה֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַפַּ֔חַת יִלָּכֵ֖ד בַּפָּ֑ח כִּֽי־אֲרֻבּ֤וֹת מִמָּרוֹם֙ נִפְתָּ֔חוּ וַֽיִּרְעֲשׁ֖וּ מ֥וֹסְדֵי אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Whoever flees at the report of the terror
Shall fall into the pit;
And whoever climbs out of the pit
Shall be caught in the trap.
For sluices are opened on high,
And earth’s foundations tremble.
Transliteration: vehayah hanas mikvol hafachad yifol el-hafachat vehavoleh mitvokhe hafachat yilakhed vafach khiy-aruvvot mimarvom nifetachu vayireashu mvosedey arets

Hebrew: רֹ֥עָה הִֽתְרֹעֲעָ֖ה הָאָ֑רֶץ פּ֤וֹר הִֽתְפּוֹרְרָה֙ אֶ֔רֶץ מ֥וֹט הִֽתְמוֹטְטָ֖ה אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
The earth is breaking, breaking;
The earth is crumbling, crumbling.
The earth is tottering, tottering;
Transliteration: roah hiteroaah haarets fvor hitefvorerah erets mvot hitemvotetah arets

Hebrew: נ֣וֹעַ תָּנ֤וּעַ אֶ֙רֶץ֙ כַּשִּׁכּ֔וֹר וְהִֽתְנוֹדְדָ֖ה כַּמְּלוּנָ֑ה וְכָבַ֤ד עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ פִּשְׁעָ֔הּ וְנָפְלָ֖ה וְלֹא־תֹסִ֥יף קֽוּם׃ {ס}
Translated:
The earth is swaying like a drunkard;
It is rocking to and fro like a hut.
Its iniquity shall weigh it down,
And it shall fall, to rise no more.
Transliteration: nvoa tanua erets khashikhvor vehitenvodedah khamelunah vekhavad aleyha fisheah venafelah velo-tosiyf kum {s}

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא יִפְקֹ֧ד יְהֹוָ֛ה עַל־צְבָ֥א הַמָּר֖וֹם בַּמָּר֑וֹם וְעַל־מַלְכֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָ֖ה עַל־הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated:
In that day, GOD will punish
The host of heaven in heaven
And the kings of the earth on earth.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu yifekod yehovah al-tseva hamarvom vamarvom veal-malekhey haadamah al-haadamah

Hebrew: וְאֻסְּפ֨וּ אֲסֵפָ֤ה אַסִּיר֙ עַל־בּ֔וֹר וְסֻגְּר֖וּ עַל־מַסְגֵּ֑ר וּמֵרֹ֥ב יָמִ֖ים יִפָּקֵֽדוּ׃
Translated:
They shall be gathered in a dungeon
As captives are gathered;
And shall be locked up in a prison.
But after many days they shall be remembered.
Transliteration: veusefu asefah asiyr al-vvor vesugeru al-maseger umerov yamiym yifakedu

Hebrew: וְחָֽפְרָה֙ הַלְּבָנָ֔ה וּבוֹשָׁ֖ה הַחַמָּ֑ה כִּֽי־מָלַ֞ךְ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֗וֹת בְּהַ֤ר צִיּוֹן֙ וּבִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְנֶ֥גֶד זְקֵנָ֖יו כָּבֽוֹד׃ {פ}
Translated:
Then the moon shall be ashamed,
And the sun shall be abashed.
For GOD of Hosts will reign
On Mount Zion and in Jerusalem,
And the Presence will be revealed to God’s elders.
Transliteration: vechaferah halevanah uvvoshah hachamah khiy-malakhe yehovah tsevavot vehar tsiyyvon uviyrushala͏im veneged zekenayv khavvod {f}

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהַי֙ אַתָּ֔ה אֲרֽוֹמִמְךָ֙ אוֹדֶ֣ה שִׁמְךָ֔ כִּ֥י עָשִׂ֖יתָ פֶּ֑לֶא עֵצ֥וֹת מֵרָחֹ֖ק אֱמ֥וּנָה אֹֽמֶן׃
Translated:
O ETERNAL One, You are my God;
I will extol You, I will praise Your name.
For You planned graciousness of old,
Counsels of steadfast faithfulness.
Transliteration: yehovah elohay atah arvomimekha vodeh shimekha khiy ashiyta fele etsvot merachok emunah omen

Hebrew: כִּ֣י שַׂ֤מְתָּ מֵעִיר֙ לַגָּ֔ל קִרְיָ֥ה בְצוּרָ֖ה לְמַפֵּלָ֑ה אַרְמ֤וֹן זָרִים֙ מֵעִ֔יר לְעוֹלָ֖ם לֹ֥א יִבָּנֶֽה׃
Translated:
For You have turned a city into a stone heap,
A walled town into a ruin,
The citadel of strangers into rubble,
Never to be rebuilt.
Transliteration: khiy shameta meiyr lagal kireyah vetsurah lemafelah aremvon zariym meiyr levolam lo yivaneh

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֖ן יְכַבְּד֣וּךָ עַם־עָ֑ז קִרְיַ֛ת גּוֹיִ֥ם עָרִיצִ֖ים יִירָאֽוּךָ׃
Translated:
Therefore a fierce people must honor You,
A city of cruel nations must fear You.
Transliteration: al-khen yekhavedukha am-az kireyat gvoyim ariytsiym yiyraukha

Hebrew: כִּי־הָיִ֨יתָ מָע֥וֹז לַדָּ֛ל מָע֥וֹז לָאֶבְי֖וֹן בַּצַּר־ל֑וֹ מַחְסֶ֤ה מִזֶּ֙רֶם֙ צֵ֣ל מֵחֹ֔רֶב כִּ֛י ר֥וּחַ עָרִיצִ֖ים כְּזֶ֥רֶם קִֽיר׃
Translated:
For You have been a refuge for the pauper,
A shelter for the needy person in distress—
Shelter from rainstorm, shade from heat.
When the fury of tyrants was like a winter rainstorm,
Transliteration: khiy-hayiyta mavoz ladal mavoz laeveyvon vatsar-lvo macheseh mizerem tsel mechorev khiy rucha ariytsiym khezerem kiyr

Hebrew: כְּחֹ֣רֶב בְּצָי֔וֹן שְׁא֥וֹן זָרִ֖ים תַּכְנִ֑יעַ חֹ֚רֶב בְּצֵ֣ל עָ֔ב זְמִ֥יר עָרִיצִ֖ים יַעֲנֶֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
The rage of strangers like heat in the desert,
You subdued the heat with the shade of clouds,
The singing of the tyrants was vanquished.
Transliteration: khechorev vetsayvon shevon zariym takheniya chorev vetsel av zemiyr ariytsiym yaaneh {f}

Hebrew: וְעָשָׂה֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת לְכׇל־הָֽעַמִּים֙ בָּהָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה מִשְׁתֵּ֥ה שְׁמָנִ֖ים מִשְׁתֵּ֣ה שְׁמָרִ֑ים שְׁמָנִים֙ מְמֻ֣חָיִ֔ם שְׁמָרִ֖ים מְזֻקָּקִֽים׃
Translated:
GOD of Hosts will make on this mount
For all the peoples
A banquet of rich viands,
A banquet of choice wines—
Of rich viands seasoned with marrow,
Of choice wines well refined.
Transliteration: veashah yehovah tsevavot lekhׇl-haamiym vahar hazeh misheteh shemaniym misheteh shemariym shemaniym memuchayim shemariym mezukakiym

Hebrew: וּבִלַּע֙ בָּהָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה פְּנֵֽי־הַלּ֥וֹט <small>׀</small> הַלּ֖וֹט עַל־כׇּל־הָעַמִּ֑ים וְהַמַּסֵּכָ֥ה הַנְּסוּכָ֖ה עַל־כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
And on this mount will be destroyed the shroud
That is drawn over the faces of all the peoples,
And the covering that is spread
Over all the nations:
Transliteration: uvila vahar hazeh feney-halvot <small></small> halvot al-khׇl-haamiym vehamasekhah hanesukhah al-khׇl-hagvoyim

Hebrew: בִּלַּ֤ע הַמָּ֙וֶת֙ לָנֶ֔צַח וּמָחָ֨ה אֲדֹנָ֧י יֱהֹוִ֛ה דִּמְעָ֖ה מֵעַ֣ל כׇּל־פָּנִ֑ים וְחֶרְפַּ֣ת עַמּ֗וֹ יָסִיר֙ מֵעַ֣ל כׇּל־הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבֵּֽר׃ {פ}
Translated:
Death will be destroyed forever.
My Sovereign GOD will wipe the tears away
From all faces
And will put an end to the reproach of God’s people
Over all the earth—
For it is GOD who has spoken.
Transliteration: vila hamavet lanetsach umachah adonay yehovih dimeah meal khׇl-faniym vecherefat amvo yasiyr meal khׇl-haarets khiy yehovah diver {f}

Hebrew: וְאָמַר֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא הִנֵּ֨ה אֱלֹהֵ֥ינוּ זֶ֛ה קִוִּ֥ינוּ ל֖וֹ וְיוֹשִׁיעֵ֑נוּ זֶ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ קִוִּ֣ינוּ ל֔וֹ נָגִ֥ילָה וְנִשְׂמְחָ֖ה בִּישׁוּעָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
In that day they shall say:
This is our God;
We trusted in the One who delivered us.
This is GOD, in whom we trusted;
Let us rejoice and exult in God’s deliverance!
Transliteration: veamar vayyvom hahu hineh eloheynu zeh kiviynu lvo veyvoshiyenu zeh yehovah kiviynu lvo nagiylah venishemechah viyshuatvo

Hebrew: כִּי־תָנ֥וּחַ יַד־יְהֹוָ֖ה בָּהָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וְנָד֤וֹשׁ מוֹאָב֙ תַּחְתָּ֔יו כְּהִדּ֥וּשׁ מַתְבֵּ֖ן (במי) [בְּמ֥וֹ] מַדְמֵנָֽה׃
Translated:
For GOD’s hand shall descend
Upon this mount,
And Moab shall be trampled underfoot
As straw is threshed to bits at Madmenah.
Transliteration: khiy-tanucha yad-yehovah vahar hazeh venadvosh mvoav tachetayv khehidush mateven (vmy) [vemvo] mademenah

Hebrew: וּפֵרַ֤שׂ יָדָיו֙ בְּקִרְבּ֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יְפָרֵ֥שׂ הַשֹּׂחֶ֖ה לִשְׂח֑וֹת וְהִשְׁפִּיל֙ גַּאֲוָת֔וֹ עִ֖ם אׇרְבּ֥וֹת יָדָֽיו׃
Translated:
Then [God’s] hands will be spread out in their homeland,
As a swimmer’s hands are spread out to swim,
And their pride will be humbled
Along with the emblems of their power.
Transliteration: uferash yadayv vekirevvo khaasher yefaresh hashocheh lishechvot vehishefiyl gaavatvo im ׇrevvot yadayv

Hebrew: וּמִבְצַ֞ר מִשְׂגַּ֣ב חוֹמֹתֶ֗יךָ הֵשַׁ֥ח הִשְׁפִּ֛יל הִגִּ֥יעַ לָאָ֖רֶץ עַד־עָפָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Yea, the secure fortification of their walls
Will be laid low and humble—
Will be razed to the ground, to the very dust.
Transliteration: umivetsar mishegav chvomoteykha heshach hishefiyl higiya laarets ad-afar {s}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא יוּשַׁ֥ר הַשִּׁיר־הַזֶּ֖ה בְּאֶ֣רֶץ יְהוּדָ֑ה עִ֣יר עׇז־לָ֔נוּ יְשׁוּעָ֥ה יָשִׁ֖ית חוֹמ֥וֹת וָחֵֽל׃
Translated:
In that day, this song shall be sung
In the land of Judah:
Ours is a mighty city;
[God] makes victory our inner and outer wall.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yushar hashiyr-hazeh veerets yehudah iyr ׇz-lanu yeshuah yashiyt chvomvot vachel

Hebrew: פִּתְח֖וּ שְׁעָרִ֑ים וְיָבֹ֥א גוֹי־צַדִּ֖יק שֹׁמֵ֥ר אֱמֻנִֽים׃
Translated:
Open the gates, and let
A righteous nation enter,
[A nation] that keeps faith.
Transliteration: fitechu sheariym veyavo gvoy-tsadiyk shomer emuniym

Hebrew: יֵ֣צֶר סָמ֔וּךְ תִּצֹּ֖ר שָׁל֣וֹם <small>׀</small> שָׁל֑וֹם כִּ֥י בְךָ֖ בָּטֽוּחַ׃
Translated:
The confident mind You guard in safety,
In safety because it trusts in You.
Transliteration: eitser samukhe titsor shalvom <small></small> shalvom khiy vekha vatucha

Hebrew: בִּטְח֥וּ בַיהֹוָ֖ה עֲדֵי־עַ֑ד כִּ֚י בְּיָ֣הּ יְהֹוָ֔ה צ֖וּר עוֹלָמִֽים׃
Translated:
Trust in GOD—for ever and ever,
For in Yah—GOD—you have an everlasting Rock.
Transliteration: vitechu vayhovah adey-ad khiy veyah yehovah tsur volamiym

Hebrew: כִּ֤י הֵשַׁח֙ יֹשְׁבֵ֣י מָר֔וֹם קִרְיָ֖ה נִשְׂגָּבָ֑ה יַשְׁפִּילֶ֤נָּה יַשְׁפִּילָהּ֙ עַד־אֶ֔רֶץ יַגִּיעֶ֖נָּה עַד־עָפָֽר׃
Translated:
For [God] has brought low those who dwelt high up,
Has humbled the secure city,
Humbled it to the ground,
Leveled it with the dust—
Transliteration: khiy heshach yoshevey marvom kireyah nishegavah yashefiylenah yashefiylah ad-erets yagiyenah ad-afar

Hebrew: תִּרְמְסֶ֖נָּה רָ֑גֶל רַגְלֵ֥י עָנִ֖י פַּעֲמֵ֥י דַלִּֽים׃
Translated:
To be trampled underfoot,
By the feet of the needy,
By the soles of the poor.
Transliteration: tiremesenah ragel rageley aniy faamey daliym

Hebrew: אֹ֥רַח לַצַּדִּ֖יק מֵישָׁרִ֑ים יָשָׁ֕ר מַעְגַּ֥ל צַדִּ֖יק תְּפַלֵּֽס׃
Translated:
The path is level for the righteous;
O Just One, You make smooth the course of the righteous.
Transliteration: orach latsadiyk meyshariym yashar maegal tsadiyk tefales

Hebrew: אַ֣ף אֹ֧רַח מִשְׁפָּטֶ֛יךָ יְהֹוָ֖ה קִוִּינ֑וּךָ לְשִׁמְךָ֥ וּלְזִכְרְךָ֖ תַּאֲוַת־נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated:
For Your just ways, O ETERNAL One, we look to You;
We long for the name by which You are called.
Transliteration: af orach mishefateykha yehovah kiviynukha leshimekha ulezikherekha taavat-nafesh

Hebrew: נַפְשִׁ֤י אִוִּיתִ֙ךָ֙ בַּלַּ֔יְלָה אַף־רוּחִ֥י בְקִרְבִּ֖י אֲשַׁחֲרֶ֑ךָּ כִּ֞י כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר מִשְׁפָּטֶ֙יךָ֙ לָאָ֔רֶץ צֶ֥דֶק לָמְד֖וּ יֹשְׁבֵ֥י תֵבֵֽל׃
Translated:
At night I yearn for You with all my being,
I seek You with all the spirit within me.
For when Your judgments are wrought on earth,
The inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.
Transliteration: nafeshiy iviytikha valayelah af-ruchiy vekireviy ashacharekha khiy khaasher mishefateykha laarets tsedek lamedu yoshevey tevel

Hebrew: יֻחַ֤ן רָשָׁע֙ בַּל־לָמַ֣ד צֶ֔דֶק בְּאֶ֥רֶץ נְכֹח֖וֹת יְעַוֵּ֑ל וּבַל־יִרְאֶ֖ה גֵּא֥וּת יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
But the scoundrel, when spared, learns not righteousness;
Doing wrong in a place of integrity—
Ignoring GOD’s majesty.
Transliteration: yuchan rasha val-lamad tsedek veerets nekhochvot yeavel uval-yireeh geut yehovah {f}

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֛ה רָ֥מָה יָדְךָ֖ בַּל־יֶחֱזָי֑וּן יֶחֱז֤וּ וְיֵבֹ֙שׁוּ֙ קִנְאַת־עָ֔ם אַף־אֵ֖שׁ צָרֶ֥יךָ תֹאכְלֵֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
O ETERNAL One!
They see not Your hand exalted.
Let them be shamed as they behold
Your zeal for Your people
And fire consuming Your adversaries.
Transliteration: yehovah ramah yadekha val-yechezayun yechezu veeivoshu kineat-am af-esh tsareykha tokhelem {s}

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֕ה תִּשְׁפֹּ֥ת שָׁל֖וֹם לָ֑נוּ כִּ֛י גַּ֥ם כׇּֽל־מַעֲשֵׂ֖ינוּ פָּעַ֥לְתָּ לָּֽנוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
O ETERNAL One!
May You appoint well-being for us,
Since You have also requited all our misdeeds.
Transliteration: yehovah tishefot shalvom lanu khiy gam khׇl-maasheynu faaleta lanu {s}

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ בְּעָל֥וּנוּ אֲדֹנִ֖ים זוּלָתֶ֑ךָ לְבַד־בְּךָ֖ נַזְכִּ֥יר שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
O ETERNAL One our God!
Rulers other than You possessed us,
But only Your name shall we utter.
Transliteration: yehovah eloheynu vealunu adoniym zulatekha levad-vekha nazekhiyr shemekha

Hebrew: מֵתִים֙ בַּל־יִ֣חְי֔וּ רְפָאִ֖ים בַּל־יָקֻ֑מוּ לָכֵ֤ן פָּקַ֙דְתָּ֙ וַתַּשְׁמִידֵ֔ם וַתְּאַבֵּ֥ד כׇּל־זֵ֖כֶר לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
They are dead, they can never live;
Shades, they can never rise;
Of a truth, You have dealt with them and wiped them out,
Have put an end to all mention of them.
Transliteration: metiym val-yicheyu refaiym val-yakumu lakhen fakadeta vatashemiydem vateaved khׇl-zekher lamvo

Hebrew: יָסַ֤פְתָּ לַגּוֹי֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה יָסַ֥פְתָּ לַגּ֖וֹי נִכְבָּ֑דְתָּ רִחַ֖קְתָּ כׇּל־קַצְוֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
When You added to the nation, O ETERNAL One—
When You added to the nation,
Extending all the boundaries of the land,
You were honored.
Transliteration: yasafeta lagvoy yehovah yasafeta lagvoy nikhevadeta richaketa khׇl-katsevey-arets {f}

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּצַּ֣ר פְּקָד֑וּךָ צָק֣וּן לַ֔חַשׁ מוּסָרְךָ֖ לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
O ETERNAL One! In their distress, they sought You;
Your chastisement reduced them
To anguished whispered prayer.
Transliteration: yehovah vatsar fekadukha tsakun lachash musarekha lamvo

Hebrew: כְּמ֤וֹ הָרָה֙ תַּקְרִ֣יב לָלֶ֔דֶת תָּחִ֥יל תִּזְעַ֖ק בַּחֲבָלֶ֑יהָ כֵּ֛ן הָיִ֥ינוּ מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Like a woman with child
Approaching childbirth,
Writhing and screaming in her pangs,
So are we become because of You, O ETERNAL One.
Transliteration: khemvo harah takeriyv laledet tachiyl tizeak vachavaleyha khen hayiynu mifaneykha yehovah

Hebrew: הָרִ֣ינוּ חַ֔לְנוּ כְּמ֖וֹ יָלַ֣דְנוּ ר֑וּחַ יְשׁוּעֹת֙ בַּל־נַ֣עֲשֶׂה אֶ֔רֶץ וּבַֽל־יִפְּל֖וּ יֹשְׁבֵ֥י תֵבֵֽל׃
Translated:
We were with child, we writhed—
It is as though we had given birth to wind;
We have won no victory on earth;
The inhabitants of the world have not come to life!
Transliteration: hariynu chalenu khemvo yaladenu rucha yeshuot val-naasheh erets uval-yifelu yoshevey tevel

Hebrew: יִֽחְי֣וּ מֵתֶ֔יךָ נְבֵלָתִ֖י יְקוּמ֑וּן הָקִ֨יצוּ וְרַנְּנ֜וּ שֹׁכְנֵ֣י עָפָ֗ר כִּ֣י טַ֤ל אוֹרֹת֙ טַלֶּ֔ךָ וָאָ֖רֶץ רְפָאִ֥ים תַּפִּֽיל׃ {פ}
Translated:
Oh, let Your dead revive!
Let corpses arise!
Awake and shout for joy,
You who dwell in the dust!—
For Your dew is like the dew on fresh growth;
You make the land of the shades come to life.
Transliteration: yicheyu meteykha nevelatiy yekumun hakiytsu veranenu shokheney afar khiy tal vorot talekha vaarets refaiym tafiyl {f}

Hebrew: לֵ֤ךְ עַמִּי֙ בֹּ֣א בַחֲדָרֶ֔יךָ וּֽסְגֹ֥ר (דלתיך) [דְּלָֽתְךָ֖] בַּעֲדֶ֑ךָ חֲבִ֥י כִמְעַט־רֶ֖גַע עַד־(יעבור)־[יַעֲבׇר־]זָֽעַם׃
Translated:
Go, my people, enter your chambers,
And lock your doors behind you.
Hide but a little moment,
Until the indignation passes.
Transliteration: lekhe amiy vo vachadareykha usegor (dltykh) [delatekha] vaadekha chaviy khimeat-rega ad-(yvvr)-[yaavׇr-]zaam

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ יֹצֵ֣א מִמְּקוֹמ֔וֹ לִפְקֹ֛ד עֲוֺ֥ן יֹֽשֵׁב־הָאָ֖רֶץ עָלָ֑יו וְגִלְּתָ֤ה הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֶת־דָּמֶ֔יהָ וְלֹא־תְכַסֶּ֥ה ע֖וֹד עַל־הֲרוּגֶֽיהָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
For lo!
GOD shall come forth from seclusion
To punish the dwellers of the earth
For their iniquity;
And the earth shall disclose its bloodshed
And shall no longer conceal its slain.
Transliteration: khiy-hineh yehovah yotse mimekvomvo lifekod avon yoshev-haarets alayv vegiletah haarets et-dameyha velo-tekhaseh vod al-harugeyha {f}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֡וּא יִפְקֹ֣ד יְהֹוָה֩ בְּחַרְבּ֨וֹ הַקָּשָׁ֜ה וְהַגְּדוֹלָ֣ה וְהַחֲזָקָ֗ה עַ֤ל לִוְיָתָן֙ נָחָ֣שׁ בָּרִ֔חַ וְעַל֙ לִוְיָתָ֔ן נָחָ֖שׁ עֲקַלָּת֑וֹן וְהָרַ֥ג אֶת־הַתַּנִּ֖ין אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּיָּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
In that day GOD will punish
With a great, cruel, mighty sword
Leviathan the Elusive Serpent—
Leviathan the Twisting Serpent;
The Dragon of the sea will be slain.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yifekod yehovah vecharevvo hakashah vehagedvolah vehachazakah al liveyatan nachash varicha veal liveyatan nachash akalatvon veharag et-hataniyn asher vayam {s}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֖וֹם הַה֑וּא כֶּ֥רֶם חֶ֖מֶר עַנּוּ־לָֽהּ׃
Translated:
In that day,
They shall sing of it:
“Vineyard of Delight.”
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu kherem chemer anu-lah

Hebrew: אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ נֹֽצְרָ֔הּ לִרְגָעִ֖ים אַשְׁקֶ֑נָּה פֶּ֚ן יִפְקֹ֣ד עָלֶ֔יהָ לַ֥יְלָה וָי֖וֹם אֶצֳּרֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
I GOD keep watch over it,
I water it every moment;
That no harm may befall it,
I watch it night and day.
Transliteration: aniy yehovah notserah liregaiym ashekenah fen yifekod aleyha layelah vayvom etsorenah

Hebrew: חֵמָ֖ה אֵ֣ין לִ֑י מִֽי־יִתְּנֵ֜נִי שָׁמִ֥יר שַׁ֙יִת֙ בַּמִּלְחָמָ֔ה אֶפְשְׂעָ֥ה בָ֖הּ אֲצִיתֶ֥נָּה יָּֽחַד׃
Translated:
There is no anger in Me:
If it offers Me thorns and thistles,
I will march to battle against it,
And set it all on fire.
Transliteration: chemah eyn liy miy-yiteneniy shamiyr shayiit vamilechamah efesheah vah atsiytenah yachad

Hebrew: א֚וֹ יַחֲזֵ֣ק בְּמָעוּזִּ֔י יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה שָׁל֖וֹם לִ֑י שָׁל֖וֹם יַעֲשֶׂה־לִּֽי׃
Translated:
But if it holds fast to My refuge,
It makes peace with Me;
It makes peace with Me.
Transliteration: vo yachazek vemauziy yaasheh shalvom liy shalvom yaasheh-liy

Hebrew: הַבָּאִים֙ יַשְׁרֵ֣שׁ יַֽעֲקֹ֔ב יָצִ֥יץ וּפָרַ֖ח יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּמָלְא֥וּ פְנֵי־תֵבֵ֖ל תְּנוּבָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
[In days] to come Jacob shall strike root,
Israel shall sprout and blossom,
And the face of the world
Shall be covered with fruit.
Transliteration: havaiym yasheresh yaakov yatsiyts ufarach yisherael umaleu feney-tevel tenuvah {f}

Hebrew: הַכְּמַכַּ֥ת מַכֵּ֖הוּ הִכָּ֑הוּ אִם־כְּהֶ֥רֶג הֲרֻגָ֖יו הֹרָֽג׃
Translated:
Was he beaten as his beater has been?
Did he suffer such slaughter as his slayers?
Transliteration: hakhemakhat makhehu hikhahu im-khehereg harugayv horag

Hebrew: בְּסַאסְּאָ֖ה בְּשַׁלְחָ֣הּ תְּרִיבֶ֑נָּה הָגָ֛ה בְּרוּח֥וֹ הַקָּשָׁ֖ה בְּי֥וֹם קָדִֽים׃
Translated:
Assailing them with fury unchained,
His pitiless blast bore them off
On a day of gale.
Transliteration: vesaseah veshalechah teriyvenah hagah veruchvo hakashah veyvom kadiym

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן בְּזֹאת֙ יְכֻפַּ֣ר עֲוֺֽן־יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְזֶ֕ה כׇּל־פְּרִ֖י הָסִ֣ר חַטָּאת֑וֹ בְּשׂוּמ֣וֹ ׀ כׇּל־אַבְנֵ֣י מִזְבֵּ֗חַ כְּאַבְנֵי־גִר֙ מְנֻפָּצ֔וֹת לֹא־יָקֻ֥מוּ אֲשֵׁרִ֖ים וְחַמָּנִֽים׃
Translated:
Assuredly, by this alone
Shall Jacob’s sin be purged away;
This is the only price
For removing his guilt:
That he make all the altar-stones
Like shattered blocks of chalk—
With no sacred post left standing,
Nor any incense altar.
Transliteration: lakhen vezot yekhufar avon-yaakov vezeh khׇl-feriy hasir chatatvo veshumvo khׇl-aveney mizevecha kheaveney-gir menufatsvot lo-yakumu asheriym vechamaniym

Hebrew: כִּ֣י עִ֤יר בְּצוּרָה֙ בָּדָ֔ד נָוֶ֕ה מְשֻׁלָּ֥ח וְנֶעֱזָ֖ב כַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר שָׁ֣ם יִרְעֶ֥ה עֵ֛גֶל וְשָׁ֥ם יִרְבָּ֖ץ וְכִלָּ֥ה סְעִפֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Thus fortified cities lie desolate,
Homesteads deserted, forsaken like a wilderness;
There calves graze, there they lie down
And consume its boughs.
Transliteration: khiy iyr vetsurah vadad naveh meshulach veneezav khamidevar sham yireeh egel vesham yirevats vekhilah seifeyha

Hebrew: בִּיבֹ֤שׁ קְצִירָהּ֙ תִּשָּׁבַ֔רְנָה נָשִׁ֕ים בָּא֖וֹת מְאִיר֣וֹת אוֹתָ֑הּ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א עַם־בִּינוֹת֙ ה֔וּא עַל־כֵּן֙ לֹא־יְרַחֲמֶ֣נּוּ עֹשֵׂ֔הוּ וְיֹצְר֖וֹ לֹ֥א יְחֻנֶּֽנּוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
When its crown is withered, they break;
Women come and make fires with them.
For they are a people without understanding;
That is why
Their Maker will show them no mercy,
Their Creator will deny them grace.
Transliteration: viyvosh ketsiyrah tishavarenah nashiym vavot meiyrvot votah khiy lo am-viynvot hu al-khen lo-yerachamenu oshehu veyotservo lo yechunenu {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא יַחְבֹּ֧ט יְהֹוָ֛ה מִשִּׁבֹּ֥לֶת הַנָּהָ֖ר עַד־נַ֣חַל מִצְרָ֑יִם וְאַתֶּ֧ם תְּלֻקְּט֛וּ לְאַחַ֥ד אֶחָ֖ד בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: And in that day, G<small>OD</small> will beat out [the peoples like grain] from the channel of the Euphrates to the Wadi of Egypt; and you shall be picked up one by one, O children of Israel!
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu yachevot yehovah mishivolet hanahar ad-nachal mitserayiim veatem teluketu leachad echad veney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יִתָּקַע֮ בְּשׁוֹפָ֣ר גָּדוֹל֒ וּבָ֗אוּ הָאֹֽבְדִים֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אַשּׁ֔וּר וְהַנִּדָּחִ֖ים בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהִשְׁתַּחֲו֧וּ לַיהֹוָ֛ה בְּהַ֥ר הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {פ}
Translated: And in that day, a great ram’s horn shall be sounded; and the strayed who are in the land of Assyria and the expelled who are in the land of Egypt shall come and worship G<small>OD</small> on the holy mount, in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu yitaka veshvofar gadvol uvau haovediym veerets ashur vehanidachiym veerets mitserayiim vehishetachavu layhovah vehar hakodesh viyrushala͏im {f}

Hebrew: ה֗וֹי עֲטֶ֤רֶת גֵּאוּת֙ שִׁכֹּרֵ֣י אֶפְרַ֔יִם וְצִ֥יץ נֹבֵ֖ל צְבִ֣י תִפְאַרְתּ֑וֹ אֲשֶׁ֛ר עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ גֵּֽיא־שְׁמָנִ֖ים הֲל֥וּמֵי יָֽיִן׃
Translated:
Ah, the proud crowns of the drunkards of Ephraim,
Whose glorious beauty is but wilted flowers
On the heads of those bloated with rich food,
Who are overcome by wine!
Transliteration: hvoy ateret geut shikhorey eferayiim vetsiyts novel tseviy tifearetvo asher al-rosh gey-shemaniym halumey yayiin

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה חָזָ֤ק וְאַמִּץ֙ לַֽאדֹנָ֔י כְּזֶ֥רֶם בָּרָ֖ד שַׂ֣עַר קָ֑טֶב כְּ֠זֶ֠רֶם מַ֣יִם כַּבִּירִ֥ים שֹׁטְפִ֛ים הִנִּ֥יחַ לָאָ֖רֶץ בְּיָֽד׃
Translated:
Lo, my Sovereign has something strong and mighty,
Like a storm of hail,
A shower of pestilence.
Something like a storm of massive, torrential rain
Shall be hurled with force to the ground.
Transliteration: hineh chazak veamits ladonay khezerem varad shaar katev khezerem mayiim khaviyriym shotefiym hiniycha laarets veyad

Hebrew: בְּרַגְלַ֖יִם תֵּרָמַ֑סְנָה עֲטֶ֥רֶת גֵּא֖וּת שִׁכּוֹרֵ֥י אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Trampled underfoot shall be
The proud crowns of the drunkards of Ephraim,
Transliteration: veragelayiim teramasenah ateret geut shikhvorey eferayiim

Hebrew: וְֽהָ֨יְתָ֜ה צִיצַ֤ת נֹבֵל֙ צְבִ֣י תִפְאַרְתּ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־רֹ֖אשׁ גֵּ֣יא שְׁמָנִ֑ים כְּבִכּוּרָהּ֙ בְּטֶ֣רֶם קַ֔יִץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִרְאֶ֤ה הָרֹאֶה֙ אוֹתָ֔הּ בְּעוֹדָ֥הּ בְּכַפּ֖וֹ יִבְלָעֶֽנָּה׃ {ס}
Translated:
The wilted flowers—
On the heads of those bloated with rich food—
That are his glorious beauty.
They shall be like an early fig
Before the fruit harvest;
Whoever sees it devours it
While it is still in his hand.
Transliteration: vehayetah tsiytsat novel tseviy tifearetvo asher al-rosh gey shemaniym khevikhurah veterem kayiits asher yireeh haroeh votah vevodah vekhafvo yivelaenah {s}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יִֽהְיֶה֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת לַעֲטֶ֣רֶת צְבִ֔י וְלִצְפִירַ֖ת תִּפְאָרָ֑ה לִשְׁאָ֖ר עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: In that day, G<small>OD</small> of Hosts shall become a crown of beauty and a diadem of glory for the remnant of this people,
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yiheyeh yehovah tsevavot laateret tseviy velitsefiyrat tifearah lishear amvo

Hebrew: וּלְר֖וּחַ מִשְׁפָּ֑ט לַיּוֹשֵׁב֙ עַל־הַמִּשְׁפָּ֔ט וְלִ֨גְבוּרָ֔ה מְשִׁיבֵ֥י מִלְחָמָ֖ה שָֽׁעְרָה׃ {ס}
Translated: and a spirit of judgment for the one who sits in judgment and of valor for those who repel attacks at the gate.
Transliteration: ulerucha mishefat layyvoshev al-hamishefat veligevurah meshiyvey milechamah shaerah {s}

Hebrew: וְגַם־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ בַּיַּ֣יִן שָׁג֔וּ וּבַשֵּׁכָ֖ר תָּע֑וּ כֹּהֵ֣ן וְנָבִיא֩ שָׁג֨וּ בַשֵּׁכָ֜ר נִבְלְע֣וּ מִן־הַיַּ֗יִן תָּעוּ֙ מִן־הַשֵּׁכָ֔ר שָׁגוּ֙ בָּרֹאֶ֔ה פָּק֖וּ פְּלִילִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
But these are also muddled by wine
And dazed by liquor:
Priest and prophet
Are muddled by liquor;
They are confused by wine,
They are dazed by liquor;
They are muddled in their visions,
They stumble in judgment.
Transliteration: vegam-eleh vayayiin shagu uvashekhar tau khohen venaviy shagu vashekhar niveleu min-hayayiin tau min-hashekhar shagu varoeh faku feliyliyah

Hebrew: כִּ֚י כׇּל־שֻׁלְחָנ֔וֹת מָלְא֖וּ קִ֣יא צֹאָ֑ה בְּלִ֖י מָקֽוֹם׃ {פ}
Translated:
Yea, all tables are covered
With vomit and filth,
So that no space is left.
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-shulechanvot maleu kiy tsoah veliy makvom {f}

Hebrew: אֶת־מִי֙ יוֹרֶ֣ה דֵעָ֔ה וְאֶת־מִ֖י יָבִ֣ין שְׁמוּעָ֑ה גְּמוּלֵי֙ מֵחָלָ֔ב עַתִּיקֵ֖י מִשָּׁדָֽיִם׃
Translated:
“To whom would he give instruction?
To whom expound a message?
To those newly weaned from milk,
Just taken away from the breast?
Transliteration: et-miy yvoreh deah veet-miy yaviyn shemuah gemuley mechalav atiykey mishadayiim

Hebrew: כִּ֣י צַ֤ו לָצָו֙ צַ֣ו לָצָ֔ו קַ֥ו לָקָ֖ו קַ֣ו לָקָ֑ו זְעֵ֥יר שָׁ֖ם זְעֵ֥יר שָֽׁם׃
Translated:
That same mutter upon mutter,
Murmur upon murmur,
Now here, now there!”
Transliteration: khiy tsav latsav tsav latsav kav lakav kav lakav zeeyr sham zeeyr sham

Hebrew: כִּ֚י בְּלַעֲגֵ֣י שָׂפָ֔ה וּבְלָשׁ֖וֹן אַחֶ֑רֶת יְדַבֵּ֖ר אֶל־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Truly, as one who speaks to that people in a stammering jargon and an alien tongue
Transliteration: khiy velaagey shafah uvelashvon acheret yedaver el-haam hazeh

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ אָמַ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם זֹ֤את הַמְּנוּחָה֙ הָנִ֣יחוּ לֶעָיֵ֔ף וְזֹ֖את הַמַּרְגֵּעָ֑ה וְלֹ֥א אָב֖וּא שְׁמֽוֹעַ׃
Translated: is he who declares to them, “This is the resting place, let the weary rest; this is the place of repose.” They refuse to listen.
Transliteration: asher amar aleyhem zot hamenuchah haniychu leaeif vezot hamaregeah velo avu shemvoa

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה לָהֶ֜ם דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֗ה צַ֣ו לָצָ֞ו צַ֤ו לָצָו֙ קַ֤ו לָקָו֙ קַ֣ו לָקָ֔ו זְעֵ֥יר שָׁ֖ם זְעֵ֣יר שָׁ֑ם לְמַ֨עַן יֵלְכ֜וּ וְכָשְׁל֤וּ אָחוֹר֙ וְנִשְׁבָּ֔רוּ וְנוֹקְשׁ֖וּ וְנִלְכָּֽדוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
To them the word of GOD is:
“Mutter upon mutter,
Murmur upon murmur,
Now here, now there.”
And so they will march,
But they shall fall backward,
And be injured and snared and captured.
Transliteration: vehayah lahem devar-yehovah tsav latsav tsav latsav kav lakav kav lakav zeeyr sham zeeyr sham lemaan eilekhu vekhashelu achvor venishevaru venvokeshu venilekhadu {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֛ן שִׁמְע֥וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אַנְשֵׁ֣י לָצ֑וֹן מֹֽשְׁלֵי֙ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
Hear now the word of GOD,
You scoffers,
Who govern that people
In Jerusalem!
Transliteration: lakhen shimeu devar-yehovah aneshey latsvon mosheley haam hazeh asher viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אֲמַרְתֶּ֗ם כָּרַ֤תְנֽוּ בְרִית֙ אֶת־מָ֔וֶת וְעִם־שְׁא֖וֹל עָשִׂ֣ינוּ חֹזֶ֑ה (שיט) [שׁ֣וֹט] שׁוֹטֵ֤ף כִּי־[יַֽעֲבֹר֙] (עבר) לֹ֣א יְבוֹאֵ֔נוּ כִּ֣י שַׂ֧מְנוּ כָזָ֛ב מַחְסֵ֖נוּ וּבַשֶּׁ֥קֶר נִסְתָּֽרְנוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
For you have said,
“We have made a covenant with Death,
Concluded a pact with Sheol.
When the sweeping flood passes through,
It shall not reach us;
For we have made falsehood our refuge,
Taken shelter in treachery.”
Transliteration: khiy amaretem kharatenu veriyt et-mavet veim-shevol ashiynu chozeh (shyt) [shvot] shvotef khiy-[yaavor] (vr) lo yevvoenu khiy shamenu khazav machesenu uvasheker nisetarenu {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הִנְנִ֛י יִסַּ֥ד בְּצִיּ֖וֹן אָ֑בֶן אֶ֣בֶן בֹּ֜חַן פִּנַּ֤ת יִקְרַת֙ מוּסָ֣ד מוּסָּ֔ד הַֽמַּאֲמִ֖ין לֹ֥א יָחִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
Thus said the Sovereign GOD:
“Behold, I will found in Zion,
Stone by stone,
A tower of precious cornerstones,
Exceedingly firm;
One who trusts need not fear.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy yisad vetsiyyvon aven even vochan finat yikerat musad musad hamaamiyn lo yachiysh

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י מִשְׁפָּט֙ לְקָ֔ו וּצְדָקָ֖ה לְמִשְׁקָ֑לֶת וְיָעָ֤ה בָרָד֙ מַחְסֵ֣ה כָזָ֔ב וְסֵ֥תֶר מַ֖יִם יִשְׁטֹֽפוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
But I will apply judgment as a measuring line
And retribution as weights;
Hail shall sweep away the refuge of falsehood,
And flood-waters engulf your shelter.
Transliteration: veshametiy mishefat lekav utsedakah lemishekalet veyaah varad macheseh khazav veseter mayiim yishetofu {s}

Hebrew: וְכֻפַּ֤ר בְּרִֽיתְכֶם֙ אֶת־מָ֔וֶת וְחָזוּתְכֶ֥ם אֶת־שְׁא֖וֹל לֹ֣א תָק֑וּם שׁ֤וֹט שׁוֹטֵף֙ כִּ֣י יַֽעֲבֹ֔ר וִהְיִ֥יתֶם ל֖וֹ לְמִרְמָֽס׃
Translated:
Your covenant with Death shall be annulled,
Your pact with Sheol shall not endure;
When the sweeping flood passes through,
You shall be its victims.
Transliteration: vekhufar veriytekhem et-mavet vechazutekhem et-shevol lo takum shvot shvotef khiy yaavor viheyiytem lvo lemiremas

Hebrew: מִדֵּ֤י עׇבְרוֹ֙ יִקַּ֣ח אֶתְכֶ֔ם כִּֽי־בַבֹּ֧קֶר בַּבֹּ֛קֶר יַעֲבֹ֖ר בַּיּ֣וֹם וּבַלָּ֑יְלָה וְהָיָ֥ה רַק־זְוָעָ֖ה הָבִ֥ין שְׁמוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
It shall catch you
Every time it passes through;
It shall pass through every morning,
Every day and every night.
And it shall be sheer horror
To grasp the message.”
Transliteration: midey ׇvervo yikach etekhem khiy-vavoker vavoker yaavor vayyvom uvalayelah vehayah rak-zevaah haviyn shemuah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־קָצַ֥ר הַמַּצָּ֖ע מֵהִשְׂתָּרֵ֑עַ וְהַמַּסֵּכָ֥ה צָ֖רָה כְּהִתְכַּנֵּֽס׃
Translated:
The couch is too short for stretching out,
And the cover too narrow for curling up!
Transliteration: khiy-katsar hamatsa mehishetarea vehamasekhah tsarah khehitekhanes

Hebrew: כִּ֤י כְהַר־פְּרָצִים֙ יָק֣וּם יְהֹוָ֔ה כְּעֵ֖מֶק בְּגִבְע֣וֹן יִרְגָּ֑ז לַעֲשׂ֤וֹת מַעֲשֵׂ֙הוּ֙ זָ֣ר מַעֲשֵׂ֔הוּ וְלַֽעֲבֹד֙ עֲבֹ֣דָת֔וֹ נׇכְרִיָּ֖ה עֲבֹדָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For GOD will arise
As on the hill of Perazim;
[God] will be roused
As in the vale of Gibeon,
To do godly work—
Strange is this work!
And to perform God’s task—
Astounding is this task!
Transliteration: khiy khehar-feratsiym yakum yehovah kheemek vegivevon yiregaz laashvot maashehu zar maashehu velaavod avodatvo nׇkheriyah avodatvo

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ אַל־תִּתְלוֹצָ֔צוּ פֶּֽן־יֶחְזְק֖וּ מֽוֹסְרֵיכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־כָלָ֨ה וְנֶחֱרָצָ֜ה שָׁמַ֗עְתִּי מֵאֵ֨ת אֲדֹנָ֧י יֱהֹוִ֛ה צְבָא֖וֹת עַל־כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Therefore, refrain from mockery,
Lest your bonds be tightened.
For I have heard a decree of destruction
From my Sovereign GOD of Hosts
Against all the land.
Transliteration: veatah al-titelvotsatsu fen-yechezeku mvosereykhem khiy-khalah venecheratsah shamaetiy meet adonay yehovih tsevavot al-khׇl-haarets {f}

Hebrew: הַאֲזִ֥ינוּ וְשִׁמְע֖וּ קוֹלִ֑י הַקְשִׁ֥יבוּ וְשִׁמְע֖וּ אִמְרָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Give diligent ear to my words,
Attend carefully to what I say.
Transliteration: haaziynu veshimeu kvoliy hakeshiyvu veshimeu imeratiy

Hebrew: הֲכֹ֣ל הַיּ֔וֹם יַחֲרֹ֥שׁ הַחֹרֵ֖שׁ לִזְרֹ֑עַ יְפַתַּ֥ח וִֽישַׂדֵּ֖ד אַדְמָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Do those who plow to sow
Plow all the time,
Breaking up and furrowing their land?
Transliteration: hakhol hayyvom yacharosh hachoresh lizeroa yefatach viyshaded adematvo

Hebrew: הֲלוֹא֙ אִם־שִׁוָּ֣ה פָנֶ֔יהָ וְהֵפִ֥יץ קֶ֖צַח וְכַמֹּ֣ן יִזְרֹ֑ק וְשָׂ֨ם חִטָּ֤ה שׂוֹרָה֙ וּשְׂעֹרָ֣ה נִסְמָ֔ן וְכֻסֶּ֖מֶת גְּבֻלָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
When they have smoothed its surface,
Do they not rather broadcast black cumin
And scatter cumin,
Or set wheat in a row,
Barley in a strip,
And emmer in a patch?
Transliteration: halvo im-shivah faneyha vehefiyts ketsach vekhamon yizerok vesham chitah shvorah usheorah niseman vekhusemet gevulatvo

Hebrew: וְיִסְּר֥וֹ לַמִּשְׁפָּ֖ט אֱלֹהָ֥יו יוֹרֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
For they are taught the right manner,
Their God instructs them.
Transliteration: veyiservo lamishefat elohayv yvorenu

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֤א בֶחָרוּץ֙ י֣וּדַשׁ קֶ֔צַח וְאוֹפַ֣ן עֲגָלָ֔ה עַל־כַּמֹּ֖ן יוּסָּ֑ב כִּ֧י בַמַּטֶּ֛ה יֵחָ֥בֶט קֶ֖צַח וְכַמֹּ֥ן בַּשָּֽׁבֶט׃
Translated:
So, too, black cumin is not threshed with a threshing board,
Nor is the wheel of a threshing sledge rolled over cumin;
But black cumin is beaten out with a stick
And cumin with a rod.
Transliteration: khiy lo vecharuts yudash ketsach vevofan agalah al-khamon yusav khiy vamateh eichavet ketsach vekhamon vashavet

Hebrew: לֶ֣חֶם יוּדָ֔ק כִּ֛י לֹ֥א לָנֶ֖צַח אָד֣וֹשׁ יְדוּשֶׁ֑נּוּ וְ֠הָמַ֠ם גִּלְגַּ֧ל עֶגְלָת֛וֹ וּפָרָשָׁ֖יו לֹ֥א יְדֻקֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
It is cereal that is crushed.
For even if it is threshed thoroughly,
And overwhelmed by the wheel of a sledge and horses,
It will not be crushed.
Transliteration: lechem yudak khiy lo lanetsach advosh yedushenu vehamam gilegal egelatvo ufarashayv lo yedukenu

Hebrew: גַּם־זֹ֕את מֵעִ֛ם יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת יָצָ֑אָה הִפְלִ֣א עֵצָ֔ה הִגְדִּ֖יל תּוּשִׁיָּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
That, too, is ordered by GOD of Hosts—
Whose counsel is unfathomable,
And whose wisdom is marvelous.
Transliteration: gam-zot meim yehovah tsevavot yatsaah hifeli etsah higediyl tushiyah {f}

Hebrew: ה֚וֹי אֲרִיאֵ֣ל אֲרִיאֵ֔ל קִרְיַ֖ת חָנָ֣ה דָוִ֑ד סְפ֥וּ שָׁנָ֛ה עַל־שָׁנָ֖ה חַגִּ֥ים יִנְקֹֽפוּ׃
Translated:
“Ah, Ariel, Ariel,
City where David camped!
Add year to year,
Let festivals come in their cycles!
Transliteration: hvoy ariyel ariyel kireyat chanah david sefu shanah al-shanah chagiym yinekofu

Hebrew: וַהֲצִיק֖וֹתִי לַאֲרִיאֵ֑ל וְהָיְתָ֤ה תַֽאֲנִיָּה֙ וַאֲנִיָּ֔ה וְהָ֥יְתָה לִּ֖י כַּאֲרִיאֵֽל׃
Translated:
And I will harass Ariel,
And there shall be sorrow and sighing.
She shall be to Me like Ariel.
Transliteration: vahatsiykvotiy laariyel vehayetah taaniyah vaaniyah vehayetah liy khaariyel

Hebrew: וְחָנִ֥יתִי כַדּ֖וּר עָלָ֑יִךְ וְצַרְתִּ֤י עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ מֻצָּ֔ב וַהֲקִימֹתִ֥י עָלַ֖יִךְ מְצֻרֹֽת׃
Translated:
And I will camp against you round about;
I will lay siege to you with a mound,
And I will set up siegeworks against you.
Transliteration: vechaniytiy khadur alayiikhe vetsaretiy alayiikhe mutsav vahakiymotiy alayiikhe metsurot

Hebrew: וְשָׁפַלְתְּ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ תְּדַבֵּ֔רִי וּמֵעָפָ֖ר תִּשַּׁ֣ח אִמְרָתֵ֑ךְ וְֽ֠הָיָ֠ה כְּא֤וֹב מֵאֶ֙רֶץ֙ קוֹלֵ֔ךְ וּמֵעָפָ֖ר אִמְרָתֵ֥ךְ תְּצַפְצֵֽף׃
Translated:
And you shall speak from lower than the ground,
Your speech shall be humbler than the sod;
Your speech shall sound like a ghost’s from the ground,
Your voice shall chirp from the sod.
Transliteration: veshafalete meerets tedaveriy umeafar tishach imeratekhe vehayah khevov meerets kvolekhe umeafar imeratekhe tetsafetsef

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֛ה כְּאָבָ֥ק דַּ֖ק הֲמ֣וֹן זָרָ֑יִךְ וּכְמֹ֤ץ עֹבֵר֙ הֲמ֣וֹן עָרִיצִ֔ים וְהָיָ֖ה לְפֶ֥תַע פִּתְאֹֽם׃
Translated:
And like fine dust shall be
The multitude of your strangers;
And like flying chaff,
The multitude of tyrants.”
And suddenly, in an instant,
Transliteration: vehayah kheavak dak hamvon zarayiikhe ukhemots over hamvon ariytsiym vehayah lefeta fiteom

Hebrew: מֵעִ֨ם יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ תִּפָּקֵ֔ד בְּרַ֥עַם וּבְרַ֖עַשׁ וְק֣וֹל גָּד֑וֹל סוּפָה֙ וּסְעָרָ֔ה וְלַ֖הַב אֵ֥שׁ אוֹכֵלָֽה׃
Translated:
She shall be remembered of GOD of Hosts
With roaring, and shaking, and deafening noise,
Storm, and tempest, and blaze of consuming fire.
Transliteration: meim yehovah tsevavot tifaked veraam uveraash vekvol gadvol sufah usearah velahav esh vokhelah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כַּֽחֲלוֹם֙ חֲז֣וֹן לַ֔יְלָה הֲמוֹן֙ כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם הַצֹּבְאִ֖ים עַל־אֲרִיאֵ֑ל וְכׇל־צֹבֶ֙יהָ֙ וּמְצֹ֣דָתָ֔הּ וְהַמְּצִיקִ֖ים לָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Then, like a dream, a vision of the night,
Shall be the multitude of nations
That war upon Ariel,
And all her besiegers, and the siegeworks against her,
And those who harass her.
Transliteration: vehayah khachalvom chazvon layelah hamvon khׇl-hagvoyim hatsoveiym al-ariyel vekhׇl-tsoveyha umetsodatah vehametsiykiym lah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֡ה כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ יַחֲלֹ֨ם הָרָעֵ֜ב וְהִנֵּ֣ה אוֹכֵ֗ל וְהֵקִיץ֮ וְרֵיקָ֣ה נַפְשׁוֹ֒ וְכַאֲשֶׁ֨ר יַחֲלֹ֤ם הַצָּמֵא֙ וְהִנֵּ֣ה שֹׁתֶ֔ה וְהֵקִיץ֙ וְהִנֵּ֣ה עָיֵ֔ף וְנַפְשׁ֖וֹ שׁוֹקֵקָ֑ה כֵּ֣ן יִֽהְיֶ֗ה הֲמוֹן֙ כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם הַצֹּבְאִ֖ים עַל־הַ֥ר צִיּֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated:
Like someone hungry who dreams of eating,
But wakes up still hungry;
And like someone thirsty who dreams of drinking,
But wakes faint
And utterly parched—
So shall be all the multitude of nations
That war upon Mount Zion.
Transliteration: vehayah khaasher yachalom haraev vehineh vokhel vehekiyts vereykah nafeshvo vekhaasher yachalom hatsame vehineh shoteh vehekiyts vehineh aeif venafeshvo shvokekah khen yiheyeh hamvon khׇl-hagvoyim hatsoveiym al-har tsiyyvon {f}

Hebrew: הִתְמַהְמְה֣וּ וּתְמָ֔הוּ הִשְׁתַּעַשְׁע֖וּ וָשֹׁ֑עוּ שָׁכְר֣וּ וְלֹא־יַ֔יִן נָע֖וּ וְלֹ֥א שֵׁכָֽר׃
Translated:
Act stupid and be stupefied!
Act blind and be blinded!
(They are drunk, but not from wine,
They stagger, but not from liquor.)
Transliteration: hitemahemehu utemahu hishetaasheu vashou shakheru velo-yayiin nau velo shekhar

Hebrew: כִּֽי־נָסַ֨ךְ עֲלֵיכֶ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ ר֣וּחַ תַּרְדֵּמָ֔ה וַיְעַצֵּ֖ם אֶת־עֵינֵיכֶ֑ם אֶת־הַנְּבִיאִ֛ים וְאֶת־רָאשֵׁיכֶ֥ם הַחֹזִ֖ים כִּסָּֽה׃
Translated:
For GOD has spread over you
A spirit of deep sleep,
And has shut your eyes, the prophets,
And covered your heads, the seers;
Transliteration: khiy-nasakhe aleykhem yehovah rucha taredemah vayeatsem et-eyneykhem et-haneviyiym veet-rasheykhem hachoziym khisah

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֨י לָכֶ֜ם חָז֣וּת הַכֹּ֗ל כְּדִבְרֵי֮ הַסֵּ֣פֶר הֶחָתוּם֒ אֲשֶֽׁר־יִתְּנ֣וּ אֹת֗וֹ אֶל־יוֹדֵ֥עַ (הספר) [סֵ֛פֶר] לֵאמֹ֖ר קְרָ֣א נָא־זֶ֑ה וְאָמַר֙ לֹ֣א אוּכַ֔ל כִּ֥י חָת֖וּם הֽוּא׃
Translated:
So that all prophecy has been to you
Like the words of a sealed document.
If it is handed to one who can read with a request to read it, the response will be, “I can’t, because it is sealed”;
Transliteration: vatehiy lakhem chazut hakhol khediverey hasefer hechatum asher-yitenu otvo el-yvodea (hsfr) [sefer] lemor kera na-zeh veamar lo ukhal khiy chatum hu

Hebrew: וְנִתַּ֣ן הַסֵּ֗פֶר עַל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־יָדַ֥ע סֵ֛פֶר לֵאמֹ֖ר קְרָ֣א נָא־זֶ֑ה וְאָמַ֕ר לֹ֥א יָדַ֖עְתִּי סֵֽפֶר׃ {ס}
Translated: and if the document is handed with the same request to one who cannot read, the response will be, “I can’t read.”
Transliteration: venitan hasefer al asher lo-yada sefer lemor kera na-zeh veamar lo yadaetiy sefer {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲדֹנָ֗י יַ֚עַן כִּ֤י נִגַּשׁ֙ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה בְּפִ֤יו וּבִשְׂפָתָיו֙ כִּבְּד֔וּנִי וְלִבּ֖וֹ רִחַ֣ק מִמֶּ֑נִּי וַתְּהִ֤י יִרְאָתָם֙ אֹתִ֔י מִצְוַ֥ת אֲנָשִׁ֖ים מְלֻמָּדָֽה׃
Translated:
My Sovereign said:
Because that people has approached [Me] with its mouth
And honored Me with its lips,
But has kept its heart far from Me,
And its worship of Me has been
A social obligation, learned by rote—
Transliteration: vayomer adonay yaan khiy nigash haam hazeh vefiyv uvishefatayv khiveduniy velivvo richak mimeniy vatehiy yireatam otiy mitsevat anashiym melumadah

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן הִנְנִ֥י יוֹסִ֛ף לְהַפְלִ֥יא אֶת־הָעָם־הַזֶּ֖ה הַפְלֵ֣א וָפֶ֑לֶא וְאָֽבְדָה֙ חׇכְמַ֣ת חֲכָמָ֔יו וּבִינַ֥ת נְבֹנָ֖יו תִּסְתַּתָּֽר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Truly, I shall further baffle that people
With bafflement upon bafflement;
And the wisdom of its wise shall fail,
And the prudence of its prudent shall vanish.
Transliteration: lakhen hineniy yvosif lehafeliy et-haam-hazeh hafele vafele veavedah chׇkhemat chakhamayv uviynat nevonayv tisetatar {s}

Hebrew: ה֛וֹי הַמַּעֲמִיקִ֥ים מֵיְהֹוָ֖ה לַסְתִּ֣ר עֵצָ֑ה וְהָיָ֤ה בְמַחְשָׁךְ֙ מַֽעֲשֵׂיהֶ֔ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מִ֥י רֹאֵ֖נוּ וּמִ֥י יֹֽדְעֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Ha! Those who would hide their plans
Deep from GOD!
Who do their work in dark places
And say, “Who sees us, who takes note of us?”
Transliteration: hvoy hamaamiykiym meyehovah lasetir etsah vehayah vemacheshakhe maasheyhem vayomeru miy roenu umiy yodeenu

Hebrew: הַ֨פְכְּכֶ֔ם אִם־כְּחֹ֥מֶר הַיֹּצֵ֖ר יֵחָשֵׁ֑ב כִּֽי־יֹאמַ֨ר מַעֲשֶׂ֤ה לְעֹשֵׂ֙הוּ֙ לֹ֣א עָשָׂ֔נִי וְיֵ֛צֶר אָמַ֥ר לְיֹצְר֖וֹ לֹ֥א הֵבִֽין׃
Translated:
How perverse of you!
Should the potter be accounted as the clay?
Should what is made say of its Maker,
“This One did not make me,”
And what is formed say of the One who formed it,
“That One did not understand”?
Transliteration: hafekhekhem im-khechomer hayotser eichashev khiy-yomar maasheh leoshehu lo ashaniy veeitser amar leyotservo lo heviyn

Hebrew: הֲלוֹא־עוֹד֙ מְעַ֣ט מִזְעָ֔ר וְשָׁ֥ב לְבָנ֖וֹן לַכַּרְמֶ֑ל וְהַכַּרְמֶ֖ל לַיַּ֥עַר יֵחָשֵֽׁב׃
Translated:
Surely, in a little while,
Lebanon will be transformed into farmland,
And farmland accounted as mere brush.
Transliteration: halvo-vod meat mizear veshav levanvon lakharemel vehakharemel layaar eichashev

Hebrew: וְשָׁמְע֧וּ בַיּוֹם־הַה֛וּא הַחֵרְשִׁ֖ים דִּבְרֵי־סֵ֑פֶר וּמֵאֹ֣פֶל וּמֵחֹ֔שֶׁךְ עֵינֵ֥י עִוְרִ֖ים תִּרְאֶֽינָה׃
Translated:
In that day, the deaf shall hear even written words,
And the eyes of the blind shall see
Even in darkness and obscurity.
Transliteration: veshameu vayyvom-hahu hachereshiym diverey-sefer umeofel umechoshekhe eyney iveriym tireeynah

Hebrew: וְיָסְפ֧וּ עֲנָוִ֛ים בַּֽיהֹוָ֖ה שִׂמְחָ֑ה וְאֶבְיוֹנֵ֣י אָדָ֔ם בִּקְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יָגִֽילוּ׃
Translated:
Then the humble shall have increasing joy through GOD,
And the neediest of people shall exult
In the Holy One of Israel.
Transliteration: veyasefu anaviym vayhovah shimechah veeveyvoney adam vikedvosh yisherael yagiylu

Hebrew: כִּי־אָפֵ֥ס עָרִ֖יץ וְכָ֣לָה לֵ֑ץ וְנִכְרְת֖וּ כׇּל־שֹׁ֥קְדֵי אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
For the tyrant shall be no more,
The scoffer shall cease to be;
And those diligent for evil shall be wiped out,
Transliteration: khiy-afes ariyts vekhalah lets venikheretu khׇl-shokedey aven

Hebrew: מַחֲטִיאֵ֤י אָדָם֙ בְּדָבָ֔ר וְלַמּוֹכִ֥יחַ בַּשַּׁ֖עַר יְקֹשׁ֑וּן וַיַּטּ֥וּ בַתֹּ֖הוּ צַדִּֽיק׃ {פ}
Translated:
Who cause people to lose their lawsuits,
Laying a snare for the arbiter at the gate,
And wronging by falsehood
One who was in the right.
Transliteration: machatiyey adam vedavar velamvokhiycha vashaar yekoshun vayatu vatohu tsadiyk {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּדָ֖ה אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֑ם לֹֽא־עַתָּ֤ה יֵבוֹשׁ֙ יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְלֹ֥א עַתָּ֖ה פָּנָ֥יו יֶחֱוָֽרוּ׃
Translated:
Assuredly, thus said GOD to the House of Jacob, Who redeemed Abraham:
No more shall Jacob be shamed,
No longer his face grow pale.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah el-veyt yaakov asher fadah et-averaham lo-atah eivvosh yaakov velo atah fanayv yechevaru

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בִ֠רְאֹת֠וֹ יְלָדָ֞יו מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָדַ֛י בְּקִרְבּ֖וֹ יַקְדִּ֣ישֽׁוּ שְׁמִ֑י וְהִקְדִּ֙ישׁוּ֙ אֶת־קְד֣וֹשׁ יַֽעֲקֹ֔ב וְאֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יַעֲרִֽיצוּ׃
Translated:
For when he—that is, his progeny—behold what My hands have wrought in his midst, they will hallow My name.
They will hallow the Holy One of Jacob
And stand in awe of the God of Israel.
Transliteration: khiy vireotvo yeladayv maasheh yaday vekirevvo yakediyshu shemiy vehikediyshu et-kedvosh yaakov veet-elohey yisherael yaariytsu

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֥וּ תֹֽעֵי־ר֖וּחַ בִּינָ֑ה וְרוֹגְנִ֖ים יִלְמְדוּ־לֶֽקַח׃ {ס}
Translated:
And the confused shall acquire insight
And grumblers accept instruction.
Transliteration: veyadeu toey-rucha viynah vervogeniym yilemedu-lekach {s}

Hebrew: ה֣וֹי בָּנִ֤ים סֽוֹרְרִים֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה לַעֲשׂ֤וֹת עֵצָה֙ וְלֹ֣א מִנִּ֔י וְלִנְסֹ֥ךְ מַסֵּכָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א רוּחִ֑י לְמַ֛עַן סְפ֥וֹת חַטָּ֖את עַל־חַטָּֽאת׃
Translated:
Oh, disloyal children!
—declares GOD—
Making plans
Against My wishes,
Weaving schemes
Against My will,
Thereby piling
Guilt on guilt—
Transliteration: hvoy vaniym svoreriym neum-yehovah laashvot etsah velo miniy velinesokhe masekhah velo ruchiy lemaan sefvot chatat al-chatat

Hebrew: הַהֹֽלְכִים֙ לָרֶ֣דֶת מִצְרַ֔יִם וּפִ֖י לֹ֣א שָׁאָ֑לוּ לָעוֹז֙ בְּמָע֣וֹז פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְלַחְס֖וֹת בְּצֵ֥ל מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Who set out to go down to Egypt
Without asking Me,
To seek refuge with Pharaoh,
To seek shelter under the protection of Egypt.
Transliteration: haholekhiym laredet mitserayiim ufiy lo shaalu lavoz vemavoz fareoh velachesvot vetsel mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה לָכֶ֛ם מָע֥וֹז פַּרְעֹ֖ה לְבֹ֑שֶׁת וְהֶחָס֥וּת בְּצֵל־מִצְרַ֖יִם לִכְלִמָּֽה׃
Translated:
The refuge with Pharaoh shall result in your shame;
The shelter under Egypt’s protection, in your chagrin.
Transliteration: vehayah lakhem mavoz fareoh levoshet vehechasut vetsel-mitserayiim likhelimah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הָי֥וּ בְצֹ֖עַן שָׂרָ֑יו וּמַלְאָכָ֖יו חָנֵ֥ס יַגִּֽיעוּ׃
Translated:
Though his officers are present in Zoan,
And his messengers reach as far as Hanes,
Transliteration: khiy-hayu vetsoan sharayv umaleakhayv chanes yagiyu

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ל הֹבִ֔אישׁ עַל־עַ֖ם לֹא־יוֹעִ֣ילוּ לָ֑מוֹ לֹ֤א לְעֵ֙זֶר֙ וְלֹ֣א לְהוֹעִ֔יל כִּ֥י לְבֹ֖שֶׁת וְגַם־לְחֶרְפָּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
They all shall come to shame
Because of a people that does not avail them,
That is of no help or avail,
But [brings] only chagrin and disgrace.
Transliteration: khol hoviysh al-am lo-yvoiylu lamvo lo leezer velo lehvoiyl khiy levoshet vegam-lecherefah {s}

Hebrew: מַשָּׂ֖א בַּהֲמ֣וֹת נֶ֑גֶב בְּאֶ֩רֶץ֩ צָרָ֨ה וְצוּקָ֜ה לָבִ֧יא וָלַ֣יִשׁ מֵהֶ֗ם אֶפְעֶה֙ וְשָׂרָ֣ף מְעוֹפֵ֔ף יִשְׂאוּ֩ עַל־כֶּ֨תֶף עֲיָרִ֜ים חֵילֵהֶ֗ם וְעַל־דַּבֶּ֤שֶׁת גְּמַלִּים֙ אֽוֹצְרֹתָ֔ם עַל־עַ֖ם לֹ֥א יוֹעִֽילוּ׃
Translated:
The “Beasts of the Negeb” Pronouncement.
Through a land of distress and hardship,
Of lion and roaring king-beast,
Of viper and flying seraph,
They convey their wealth on the backs of donkeys,
Their treasures on camels’ humps,
To a people of no avail.
Transliteration: masha vahamvot negev veerets tsarah vetsukah laviy valayiish mehem efeeh vesharaf mevofef yisheu al-khetef ayariym cheylehem veal-daveshet gemaliym votserotam al-am lo yvoiylu

Hebrew: וּמִצְרַ֕יִם הֶ֥בֶל וָרִ֖יק יַעְזֹ֑רוּ לָכֵן֙ קָרָ֣אתִי לָזֹ֔את רַ֥הַב הֵ֖ם שָֽׁבֶת׃
Translated:
For the help of Egypt
Shall be vain and empty.
Truly, I call this,
“They are a threat that has ceased.”
Transliteration: umitserayiim hevel variyk yaezoru lakhen karatiy lazot rahav hem shavet

Hebrew: עַתָּ֗ה בּ֣וֹא כׇתְבָ֥הּ עַל־ל֛וּחַ אִתָּ֖ם וְעַל־סֵ֣פֶר חֻקָּ֑הּ וּתְהִי֙ לְי֣וֹם אַחֲר֔וֹן לָעַ֖ד עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
Now,
Go, write it down on a tablet
And inscribe it in a record,
That it may be with them for future days,
A witness forever.
Transliteration: atah vvo khׇtevah al-lucha itam veal-sefer chukah utehiy leyvom acharvon laad ad-volam

Hebrew: כִּ֣י עַ֤ם מְרִי֙ ה֔וּא בָּנִ֖ים כֶּחָשִׁ֑ים בָּנִ֕ים לֹא־אָב֥וּ שְׁמ֖וֹעַ תּוֹרַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
For it is a rebellious people,
Faithless children,
Children who refused to heed
GOD’s instruction;
Transliteration: khiy am meriy hu vaniym khechashiym vaniym lo-avu shemvoa tvorat yehovah

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָמְר֤וּ לָרֹאִים֙ לֹ֣א תִרְא֔וּ וְלַ֣חֹזִ֔ים לֹ֥א תֶחֱזוּ־לָ֖נוּ נְכֹח֑וֹת דַּבְּרוּ־לָ֣נוּ חֲלָק֔וֹת חֲז֖וּ מַהֲתַלּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Who said to the seers,
“Do not see,”
To the prophets, “Do not prophesy truth to us;
Speak to us falsehoods,
Prophesy delusions.
Transliteration: asher ameru laroiym lo tireu velachoziym lo techezu-lanu nekhochvot daveru-lanu chalakvot chazu mahatalvot

Hebrew: ס֚וּרוּ מִנֵּי־דֶ֔רֶךְ הַטּ֖וּ מִנֵּי־אֹ֑רַח הַשְׁבִּ֥יתוּ מִפָּנֵ֖ינוּ אֶת־קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
Leave the way!
Get off the path!
Let us hear no more
About the Holy One of Israel!”
Transliteration: suru miney-derekhe hatu miney-orach hasheviytu mifaneynu et-kedvosh yisherael {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ קְד֣וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יַ֥עַן מׇאׇסְכֶ֖ם בַּדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַֽתִּבְטְחוּ֙ בְּעֹ֣שֶׁק וְנָל֔וֹז וַתִּֽשָּׁעֲנ֖וּ עָלָֽיו׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
Thus said the Holy One of Israel:
Because you have rejected this word,
And have put your trust and reliance
In that which is fraudulent and tortuous—
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar kedvosh yisherael yaan mׇׇsekhem vadavar hazeh vativetechu veoshek venalvoz vatishaanu alayv

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן יִהְיֶ֤ה לָכֶם֙ הֶעָוֺ֣ן הַזֶּ֔ה כְּפֶ֣רֶץ נֹפֵ֔ל נִבְעֶ֖ה בְּחוֹמָ֣ה נִשְׂגָּבָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־פִּתְאֹ֥ם לְפֶ֖תַע יָב֥וֹא שִׁבְרָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Of a surety,
This iniquity shall work on you
Like a spreading breach that occurs in a lofty wall,
Whose crash comes sudden and swift.
Transliteration: lakhen yiheyeh lakhem heavon hazeh kheferets nofel niveeh vechvomah nishegavah asher-fiteom lefeta yavvo shiverah

Hebrew: וּ֠שְׁבָרָ֠הּ כְּשֵׁ֨בֶר נֵ֧בֶל יוֹצְרִ֛ים כָּת֖וּת לֹ֣א יַחְמֹ֑ל וְלֹֽא־יִמָּצֵ֤א בִמְכִתָּתוֹ֙ חֶ֔רֶשׂ לַחְתּ֥וֹת אֵשׁ֙ מִיָּק֔וּד וְלַחְשֹׂ֥ף מַ֖יִם מִגֶּֽבֶא׃ {ס}
Translated:
It is smashed as one smashes an earthen jug,
Ruthlessly shattered
So that no shard is left in its breakage
To scoop coals from a brazier,
Or ladle water from a puddle.
Transliteration: ushevarah kheshever nevel yvotseriym khatut lo yachemol velo-yimatse vimekhitatvo cheresh lachetvot esh miyakud velacheshof mayiim migeve {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹֽה־אָמַר֩ אֲדֹנָ֨י יֱהֹוִ֜ה קְד֣וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל בְּשׁוּבָ֤ה וָנַ֙חַת֙ תִּוָּ֣שֵׁע֔וּן בְּהַשְׁקֵט֙ וּבְבִטְחָ֔ה תִּֽהְיֶ֖ה גְּבוּרַתְכֶ֑ם וְלֹ֖א אֲבִיתֶֽם׃
Translated:
For thus said my Sovereign GOD,
The Holy One of Israel,
“You shall triumph by stillness and quiet;
Your victory shall come about
Through calm and confidence.”
But you refused.
Transliteration: khiy khoh-amar adonay yehovih kedvosh yisherael veshuvah vanachat tivasheun vehasheket uvevitechah tiheyeh gevuratekhem velo aviytem

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֨אמְר֥וּ לֹא־כִ֛י עַל־ס֥וּס נָנ֖וּס עַל־כֵּ֣ן תְּנוּס֑וּן וְעַל־קַ֣ל נִרְכָּ֔ב עַל־כֵּ֖ן יִקַּ֥לּוּ רֹדְפֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
“No,” you declared.
“We shall flee on steeds”—
Therefore you shall flee!
“We shall ride on swift mounts”—
Therefore your pursuers shall prove swift!
Transliteration: vatomeru lo-khiy al-sus nanus al-khen tenusun veal-kal nirekhav al-khen yikalu rodefeykhem

Hebrew: אֶ֣לֶף אֶחָ֗ד מִפְּנֵי֙ גַּעֲרַ֣ת אֶחָ֔ד מִפְּנֵ֛י גַּעֲרַ֥ת חֲמִשָּׁ֖ה תָּנֻ֑סוּ עַ֣ד אִם־נוֹתַרְתֶּ֗ם כַּתֹּ֙רֶן֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֔ר וְכַנֵּ֖ס עַל־הַגִּבְעָֽה׃
Translated:
One thousand before the shout of one—
You shall flee at the shout of five;
Till what is left of you
Is like a mast on a hilltop,
Like a pole upon a mountain.
Transliteration: elef echad mifeney gaarat echad mifeney gaarat chamishah tanusu ad im-nvotaretem khatoren al-rosh hahar vekhanes al-hagiveah

Hebrew: וְלָכֵ֞ן יְחַכֶּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לַחֲנַנְכֶ֔ם וְלָכֵ֥ן יָר֖וּם לְרַחֶמְכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־אֱלֹהֵ֤י מִשְׁפָּט֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה אַשְׁרֵ֖י כׇּל־ח֥וֹכֵי לֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Truly, GOD is waiting to show you grace,
Truly, to arise and pardon you.
For GOD is a God of justice;
Happy are all who wait, in turn.
Transliteration: velakhen yechakheh yehovah lachananekhem velakhen yarum lerachemekhem khiy-elohey mishefat yehovah asherey khׇl-chvokhey lvo {f}

Hebrew: כִּי־עַ֛ם בְּצִיּ֥וֹן יֵשֵׁ֖ב בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם בָּכ֣וֹ לֹֽא־תִבְכֶּ֗ה חָנ֤וֹן יׇחְנְךָ֙ לְק֣וֹל זַעֲקֶ֔ךָ כְּשׇׁמְעָת֖וֹ עָנָֽךְ׃
Translated: Indeed, O people in Zion, dwellers of Jerusalem, you shall not have cause to weep. Divine favor will be granted at the sound of your cry; upon hearing it, [God] will respond.
Transliteration: khiy-am vetsiyyvon eishev viyrushala͏im vakhvo lo-tivekheh chanvon yׇchenekha lekvol zaakekha kheshׇmeatvo anakhe

Hebrew: וְנָתַ֨ן לָכֶ֧ם אֲדֹנָ֛י לֶ֥חֶם צָ֖ר וּמַ֣יִם לָ֑חַץ וְלֹא־יִכָּנֵ֥ף עוֹד֙ מוֹרֶ֔יךָ וְהָי֥וּ עֵינֶ֖יךָ רֹא֥וֹת אֶת־מוֹרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: My Sovereign will provide for you meager bread and scant water. Then your Guide will no more be ignored, but your eyes will watch your Guide;
Transliteration: venatan lakhem adonay lechem tsar umayiim lachats velo-yikhanef vod mvoreykha vehayu eyneykha rovot et-mvoreykha

Hebrew: וְאׇזְנֶ֙יךָ֙ תִּשְׁמַ֣עְנָה דָבָ֔ר מֵאַחֲרֶ֖יךָ לֵאמֹ֑ר זֶ֤ה הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ לְכ֣וּ ב֔וֹ כִּ֥י תַאֲמִ֖ינוּ וְכִ֥י תַשְׂמְאִֽילוּ׃
Translated: and, whenever you deviate to the right or to the left, your ears will heed the command from behind you: “This is the road; follow it!”
Transliteration: veׇzeneykha tishemaenah davar meachareykha lemor zeh haderekhe lekhu vvo khiy taamiynu vekhiy tashemeiylu

Hebrew: וְטִמֵּאתֶ֗ם אֶת־צִפּוּי֙ פְּסִילֵ֣י כַסְפֶּ֔ךָ וְאֶת־אֲפֻדַּ֖ת מַסֵּכַ֣ת זְהָבֶ֑ךָ תִּזְרֵם֙ כְּמ֣וֹ דָוָ֔ה צֵ֖א תֹּ֥אמַר לֽוֹ׃
Translated: And you will treat as impure the silver overlay of your images and the golden plating of your idols. You will cast them away like a menstruous woman. “Out!” you will call to them.
Transliteration: vetimetem et-tsifuy fesiyley khasefekha veet-afudat masekhat zehavekha tizerem khemvo davah tse tomar lvo

Hebrew: וְנָתַן֩ מְטַ֨ר זַרְעֲךָ֜ אֲשֶׁר־תִּזְרַ֣ע אֶת־הָאֲדָמָ֗ה וְלֶ֙חֶם֙ תְּבוּאַ֣ת הָאֲדָמָ֔ה וְהָיָ֥ה דָשֵׁ֖ן וְשָׁמֵ֑ן יִרְעֶ֥ה מִקְנֶ֛יךָ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא כַּ֥ר נִרְחָֽב׃
Translated: So rain shall be provided for the seed with which you sow the ground, and the bread that the ground brings forth shall be rich and fat. Your livestock, in that day, shall graze in broad pastures;
Transliteration: venatan metar zareakha asher-tizera et-haadamah velechem tevuat haadamah vehayah dashen veshamen yireeh mikeneykha vayyvom hahu khar nirechav

Hebrew: וְהָאֲלָפִ֣ים וְהָעֲיָרִ֗ים עֹֽבְדֵי֙ הָאֲדָמָ֔ה בְּלִ֥יל חָמִ֖יץ יֹאכֵ֑לוּ אֲשֶׁר־זֹרֶ֥ה בָרַ֖חַת וּבַמִּזְרֶֽה׃
Translated: as for the cattle and the donkeys that till the soil, they shall partake of salted fodder that has been winnowed with shovel and fan.
Transliteration: vehaalafiym vehaayariym ovedey haadamah veliyl chamiyts yokhelu asher-zoreh varachat uvamizereh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ עַל־כׇּל־הַ֣ר גָּבֹ֗הַּ וְעַל֙ כׇּל־גִּבְעָ֣ה נִשָּׂאָ֔ה פְּלָגִ֖ים יִבְלֵי־מָ֑יִם בְּיוֹם֙ הֶ֣רֶג רָ֔ב בִּנְפֹ֖ל מִגְדָּלִֽים׃
Translated: And on every high mountain and on every lofty hill, there shall appear brooks and watercourses—on a day of heavy slaughter, when towers topple.
Transliteration: vehayah al-khׇl-har gavoha veal khׇl-giveah nishaah felagiym yiveley-mayiim veyvom hereg rav vinefol migedaliym

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה אוֹר־הַלְּבָנָה֙ כְּא֣וֹר הַחַמָּ֔ה וְא֤וֹר הַֽחַמָּה֙ יִֽהְיֶ֣ה שִׁבְעָתַ֔יִם כְּא֖וֹר שִׁבְעַ֣ת הַיָּמִ֑ים בְּי֗וֹם חֲבֹ֤שׁ יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־שֶׁ֣בֶר עַמּ֔וֹ וּמַ֥חַץ מַכָּת֖וֹ יִרְפָּֽא׃ {פ}
Translated: And the light of the moon shall become like the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall become sevenfold, like the light of the seven days, when G<small>OD</small> binds up the wounds of this people and heals the injuries it has suffered.
Transliteration: vehayah vor-halevanah khevor hachamah vevor hachamah yiheyeh shiveatayiim khevor shiveat hayamiym veyvom chavosh yehovah et-shever amvo umachats makhatvo yirefa {f}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה שֵׁם־יְהֹוָה֙ בָּ֣א מִמֶּרְחָ֔ק בֹּעֵ֣ר אַפּ֔וֹ וְכֹ֖בֶד מַשָּׂאָ֑הֿ שְׂפָתָיו֙ מָ֣לְאוּ זַ֔עַם וּלְשׁוֹנ֖וֹ כְּאֵ֥שׁ אֹכָֽלֶת׃
Translated:
Behold GOD’s eminent might
Comes from afar
In blazing wrath,
With a heavy burden—
With lips full of fury,
With tongue like devouring fire,
Transliteration: hineh shem-yehovah va mimerechak voer afvo vekhoved mashaahֿ shefatayv maleu zaam uleshvonvo kheesh okhalet

Hebrew: וְרוּח֞וֹ כְּנַ֤חַל שׁוֹטֵף֙ עַד־צַוָּ֣אר יֶחֱצֶ֔ה לַהֲנָפָ֥ה גוֹיִ֖ם בְּנָ֣פַת שָׁ֑וְא וְרֶ֣סֶן מַתְעֶ֔ה עַ֖ל לְחָיֵ֥י עַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
And breath like a raging torrent
Reaching halfway up the neck—
To set a misguiding yoke upon nations
And a misleading bridle upon the jaws of peoples.
Transliteration: veruchvo khenachal shvotef ad-tsavar yechetseh lahanafah gvoyim venafat shave veresen mateeh al lechaeiy amiym

Hebrew: הַשִּׁיר֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם כְּלֵ֖יל הִתְקַדֶּשׁ־חָ֑ג וְשִׂמְחַ֣ת לֵבָ֗ב כַּהוֹלֵךְ֙ בֶּחָלִ֔יל לָב֥וֹא בְהַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־צ֥וּר יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
For you, there shall be singing
As on a night when a festival is hallowed;
There shall be rejoicing as when they march
With flute, with hand-drums, and with lyres
To the Rock of Israel on the Mount of GOD.
Transliteration: hashiyr yiheyeh lakhem kheleyl hitekadesh-chag veshimechat levav khahvolekhe vechaliyl lavvo vehar-yehovah el-tsur yisherael

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁמִ֨יעַ יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־ה֣וֹד קוֹל֗וֹ וְנַ֤חַת זְרוֹעוֹ֙ יַרְאֶ֔ה בְּזַ֣עַף אַ֔ף וְלַ֖הַב אֵ֣שׁ אוֹכֵלָ֑ה נֶ֥פֶץ וָזֶ֖רֶם וְאֶ֥בֶן בָּרָֽד׃
Translated:
For GOD will project a majestic voice
And display the sweep of an arm
In raging wrath,
In a devouring blaze of fire,
In tempest, and rainstorm, and hailstones.
Transliteration: vehishemiya yehovah et-hvod kvolvo venachat zervovo yareeh vezaaf af velahav esh vokhelah nefets vazerem veeven varad

Hebrew: כִּֽי־מִקּ֥וֹל יְהֹוָ֖ה יֵחַ֣ת אַשּׁ֑וּר בַּשֵּׁ֖בֶט יַכֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Truly, Assyria, who beats with the rod,
Shall be cowed by GOD’s voice;
Transliteration: khiy-mikvol yehovah eichat ashur vashevet yakheh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כֹּ֚ל מַֽעֲבַר֙ מַטֵּ֣ה מֽוּסָדָ֔הֿ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָנִ֤יחַ יְהֹוָה֙ עָלָ֔יו בְּתֻפִּ֖ים וּבְכִנֹּר֑וֹת וּבְמִלְחֲמ֥וֹת תְּנוּפָ֖ה נִלְחַם־[בָּֽם] (בה)׃
Translated:
And each time the appointed staff passes by,
GOD will bring down [an arm] upon him
And will do battle with him as he waves it.
Transliteration: vehayah khol maavar mateh musadahֿ asher yaniycha yehovah alayv vetufiym uvekhinorvot uvemilechamvot tenufah nilecham-[vam] (vh)

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עָר֤וּךְ מֵֽאֶתְמוּל֙ תׇּפְתֶּ֔ה גַּם־[הִ֛יא] (הוא) לַמֶּ֥לֶךְ הוּכָ֖ן הֶעְמִ֣יק הִרְחִ֑ב מְדֻרָתָ֗הּ אֵ֤שׁ וְעֵצִים֙ הַרְבֵּ֔ה נִשְׁמַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ כְּנַ֣חַל גׇּפְרִ֔ית בֹּעֲרָ֖ה בָּֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
The Topheth has long been ready for him;
He too is destined for Melech—
His firepit has been made both wide and deep,
With plenty of fire and firewood,
And with GOD’s breath
Burning in it like a stream of sulfur.
Transliteration: khiy-arukhe meetemul tׇfeteh gam-[hiy] (hv) lamelekhe hukhan heemiyk hirechiv meduratah esh veetsiym hareveh nishemat yehovah khenachal gׇferiyt voarah vah {f}

Hebrew: ה֣וֹי הַיֹּרְדִ֤ים מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לְעֶזְרָ֔ה עַל־סוּסִ֖ים יִשָּׁעֵ֑נוּ וַיִּבְטְח֨וּ עַל־רֶ֜כֶב כִּ֣י רָ֗ב וְעַ֤ל פָּרָשִׁים֙ כִּֽי־עָצְמ֣וּ מְאֹ֔ד וְלֹ֤א שָׁעוּ֙ עַל־קְד֣וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה לֹ֥א דָרָֽשׁוּ׃
Translated:
Ha!
Those who go down to Egypt for help
And rely upon horses!
They have put their trust in abundance of chariots,
In vast numbers of riders,
And they have not turned to the Holy One of Israel,
They have not sought GOD.
Transliteration: hvoy hayorediym mitserayiim leezerah al-susiym yishaenu vayivetechu al-rekhev khiy rav veal farashiym khiy-atsemu meod velo shau al-kedvosh yisherael veet-yehovah lo darashu

Hebrew: וְגַם־ה֤וּא חָכָם֙ וַיָּ֣בֵא רָ֔ע וְאֶת־דְּבָרָ֖יו לֹ֣א הֵסִ֑יר וְקָם֙ עַל־בֵּ֣ית מְרֵעִ֔ים וְעַל־עֶזְרַ֖ת פֹּ֥עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
But [God] too is wise—
Bringing on misfortune
And not canceling prior pronouncements.
[God] shall rise against the house of evildoers,
And the allies of the workers of iniquity.
Transliteration: vegam-hu chakham vayave ra veet-devarayv lo hesiyr vekam al-veyt mereiym veal-ezerat foaley aven

Hebrew: וּמִצְרַ֤יִם אָדָם֙ וְֽלֹא־אֵ֔ל וְסוּסֵיהֶ֥ם בָּשָׂ֖ר וְלֹא־ר֑וּחַ וַיהֹוָ֞ה יַטֶּ֣ה יָד֗וֹ וְכָשַׁ֤ל עוֹזֵר֙ וְנָפַ֣ל עָזֻ֔ר וְיַחְדָּ֖ו כֻּלָּ֥ם יִכְלָיֽוּן׃ {ס}
Translated:
For the Egyptians are human, not God,
And their horses are flesh, not spirit;
And when GOD stretches out a divine arm,
The helper shall trip
And the helped one shall fall,
And both shall perish together.
Transliteration: umitserayiim adam velo-el vesuseyhem vashar velo-rucha vayhovah yateh yadvo vekhashal vozer venafal azur veyachedav khulam yikhelayun {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֣ה אָֽמַר־יְהֹוָ֣ה <small>׀</small> אֵלַ֡י כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר יֶהְגֶּה֩ הָאַרְיֵ֨ה וְהַכְּפִ֜יר עַל־טַרְפּ֗וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִקָּרֵ֤א עָלָיו֙ מְלֹ֣א רֹעִ֔ים מִקּוֹלָם֙ לֹ֣א יֵחָ֔ת וּמֵהֲמוֹנָ֖ם לֹ֣א יַעֲנֶ֑ה כֵּ֗ן יֵרֵד֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת לִצְבֹּ֥א עַל־הַר־צִיּ֖וֹן וְעַל־גִּבְעָתָֽהּ׃
Translated:
For thus GOD has said to me:
As a lion—a great beast—
Growls over its prey
And, when the shepherds gather
In force against it,
Is not dismayed by their cries
Nor cowed by their noise—
So GOD of Hosts will descend to make war
Against the mount and the hill of Zion.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar-yehovah <small></small> elay khaasher yehegeh haareeih vehakhefiyr al-tarefvo asher yikare alayv melo roiym mikvolam lo eichat umehamvonam lo yaaneh khen eired yehovah tsevavot litsevo al-har-tsiyyvon veal-giveatah

Hebrew: כְּצִפֳּרִ֣ים עָפ֔וֹת כֵּ֗ן יָגֵ֛ן יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם גָּנ֥וֹן וְהִצִּ֖יל פָּסֹ֥חַ וְהִמְלִֽיט׃
Translated: Like the birds that fly, even so will G<small>OD</small> of Hosts shield Jerusalem, shielding and saving, protecting and rescuing.
Transliteration: khetsiforiym afvot khen yagen yehovah tsevavot al-yerushala͏im ganvon vehitsiyl fasocha vehimeliyt

Hebrew: שׁ֗וּבוּ לַאֲשֶׁ֛ר הֶעְמִ֥יקוּ סָרָ֖ה בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Return, O children of Israel, to the One to whom they have been so shamefully false;
Transliteration: shuvu laasher heemiyku sarah veney yisherael

Hebrew: כִּ֚י בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא יִמְאָס֗וּן אִ֚ישׁ אֱלִילֵ֣י כַסְפּ֔וֹ וֶאֱלִילֵ֖י זְהָב֑וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשׂ֥וּ לָכֶ֛ם יְדֵיכֶ֖ם חֵֽטְא׃
Translated: for in that day everyone will reject their idols of silver and idols of gold, which your hands have made for your guilt.
Transliteration: khiy vayyvom hahu yimeasun iysh eliyley khasefvo veeliyley zehavvo asher ashu lakhem yedeykhem chete

Hebrew: וְנָפַ֤ל אַשּׁוּר֙ בְּחֶ֣רֶב לֹא־אִ֔ישׁ וְחֶ֥רֶב לֹא־אָדָ֖ם תֹּאכְלֶ֑נּוּ וְנָ֥ס לוֹ֙ מִפְּנֵי־חֶ֔רֶב וּבַחוּרָ֖יו לָמַ֥ס יִהְיֽוּ׃
Translated:
Then Assyria shall fall,
Not by the sword of mortals;
A sword not of humans shall devour him.
He shall shrivel before the sword,
And his young men pine away.
Transliteration: venafal ashur vecherev lo-iysh vecherev lo-adam tokhelenu venas lvo mifeney-cherev uvachurayv lamas yiheyu

Hebrew: וְסַלְעוֹ֙ מִמָּג֣וֹר יַעֲב֔וֹר וְחַתּ֥וּ מִנֵּ֖ס שָׂרָ֑יו נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁר־א֥וּר לוֹ֙ בְּצִיּ֔וֹן וְתַנּ֥וּר ל֖וֹ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {פ}
Translated:
His rock shall melt with terror,
And his officers shall collapse from weakness—
Declares GOD, who has a fire in Zion,
Who has an oven in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vesalevo mimagvor yaavvor vechatu mines sharayv neum-yehovah asher-ur lvo vetsiyyvon vetanur lvo viyrushala͏im {f}

Hebrew: הֵ֥ן לְצֶ֖דֶק יִמְלׇךְ־מֶ֑לֶךְ וּלְשָׂרִ֖ים לְמִשְׁפָּ֥ט יָשֹֽׂרוּ׃
Translated:
Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness,
And ministers shall govern with justice;
Transliteration: hen letsedek yimelׇkhe-melekhe uleshariym lemishefat yashoru

Hebrew: וְהָיָה־אִ֥ישׁ כְּמַחֲבֵא־ר֖וּחַ וְסֵ֣תֶר זָ֑רֶם כְּפַלְגֵי־מַ֣יִם בְּצָי֔וֹן כְּצֵ֥ל סֶלַע־כָּבֵ֖ד בְּאֶ֥רֶץ עֲיֵפָֽה׃
Translated:
Every one of them shall be
Like a refuge from gales,
A shelter from rainstorms—
Or like brooks of water in a desert,
Like the shade of a massive rock
In a languishing land.
Transliteration: vehayah-iysh khemachave-rucha veseter zarem khefalegey-mayiim vetsayvon khetsel sela-khaved veerets aeifah

Hebrew: וְלֹ֥א תִשְׁעֶ֖ינָה עֵינֵ֣י רֹאִ֑ים וְאׇזְנֵ֥י שֹׁמְעִ֖ים תִּקְשַֽׁבְנָה׃
Translated:
Then the eyes of those who have sight shall not be sealed,
And the ears of those who have hearing shall listen;
Transliteration: velo tisheeynah eyney roiym veׇzeney shomeiym tikeshavenah

Hebrew: וּלְבַ֥ב נִמְהָרִ֖ים יָבִ֣ין לָדָ֑עַת וּלְשׁ֣וֹן עִלְּגִ֔ים תְּמַהֵ֖ר לְדַבֵּ֥ר צָחֽוֹת׃
Translated:
And the minds of the thoughtless shall attend and note,
And the tongues of mumblers shall speak with fluent eloquence.
Transliteration: ulevav nimehariym yaviyn ladaat uleshvon ilegiym temaher ledaver tsachvot

Hebrew: לֹא־יִקָּרֵ֥א ע֛וֹד לְנָבָ֖ל נָדִ֑יב וּלְכִילַ֕י לֹ֥א יֵאָמֵ֖ר שֽׁוֹעַ׃
Translated:
No more shall a villain be called noble,
Nor shall “honorable” be said of a knave.
Transliteration: lo-yikare vod lenaval nadiyv ulekhiylay lo eiamer shvoa

Hebrew: כִּ֤י נָבָל֙ נְבָלָ֣ה יְדַבֵּ֔ר וְלִבּ֖וֹ יַעֲשֶׂה־אָ֑וֶן לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת חֹ֗נֶף וּלְדַבֵּ֤ר אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ תּוֹעָ֔ה לְהָרִיק֙ נֶ֣פֶשׁ רָעֵ֔ב וּמַשְׁקֶ֥ה צָמֵ֖א יַחְסִֽיר׃
Translated:
For the villains speak villainy
And plot treachery;
To act impiously
And to preach disloyalty against GOD;
To leave the hungry unsatisfied
And deprive the thirsty of drink.
Transliteration: khiy naval nevalah yedaver velivvo yaasheh-aven laashvot chonef uledaver el-yehovah tvoah lehariyk nefesh raev umashekeh tsame yachesiyr

Hebrew: וְכֵלַ֖י כֵּלָ֣יו רָעִ֑ים ה֚וּא זִמּ֣וֹת יָעָ֔ץ לְחַבֵּ֤ל (ענוים) [עֲנִיִּים֙] בְּאִמְרֵי־שֶׁ֔קֶר וּבְדַבֵּ֥ר אֶבְי֖וֹן מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
As for the knaves, their tools are knavish.
They forge plots
To destroy the poor with falsehoods
And the needy when they plead their cause.
Transliteration: vekhelay khelayv raiym hu zimvot yaats lechavel (nvym) [aniyiym] veimerey-sheker uvedaver eveyvon mishefat

Hebrew: וְנָדִ֖יב נְדִיב֣וֹת יָעָ֑ץ וְה֖וּא עַל־נְדִיב֥וֹת יָקֽוּם׃ {ס}
Translated:
But the noble have noble intentions
And are constant in noble acts.
Transliteration: venadiyv nediyvvot yaats vehu al-nediyvvot yakum {s}

Hebrew: נָשִׁים֙ שַׁאֲנַנּ֔וֹת קֹ֖מְנָה שְׁמַ֣עְנָה קוֹלִ֑י בָּנוֹת֙ בֹּֽטְח֔וֹת הַאְזֵ֖נָּה אִמְרָתִֽי׃
Translated:
You carefree women,
Attend, hear my words!
You confident ladies,
Give ear to my speech!
Transliteration: nashiym shaananvot komenah shemaenah kvoliy vanvot votechvot haezenah imeratiy

Hebrew: יָמִים֙ עַל־שָׁנָ֔ה תִּרְגַּ֖זְנָה בֹּטְח֑וֹת כִּ֚י כָּלָ֣ה בָצִ֔יר אֹ֖סֶף בְּלִ֥י יָבֽוֹא׃
Translated:
In little more than a year,
You shall be troubled, O confident ones,
When the vintage is over
And no ingathering takes place.
Transliteration: yamiym al-shanah tiregazenah votechvot khiy khalah vatsiyr osef veliy yavvo

Hebrew: חִרְדוּ֙ שַֽׁאֲנַנּ֔וֹת רְגָ֖זָה בֹּטְח֑וֹת פְּשֹׁ֣טָֽה וְעֹ֔רָה וַחֲג֖וֹרָה עַל־חֲלָצָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Tremble, you carefree ones!
Quake, O confident ones!
Strip yourselves naked,
Put the cloth about your loins!
Transliteration: chiredu shaananvot regazah votechvot feshotah veorah vachagvorah al-chalatsayiim

Hebrew: עַל־שָׁדַ֖יִם סֹפְדִ֑ים עַל־שְׂדֵי־חֶ֕מֶד עַל־גֶּ֖פֶן פֹּרִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
Lament upon the breasts,
For the pleasant fields,
For the spreading grapevines,
Transliteration: al-shadayiim sofediym al-shedey-chemed al-gefen foriyah

Hebrew: עַ֚ל אַדְמַ֣ת עַמִּ֔י ק֥וֹץ שָׁמִ֖יר תַּעֲלֶ֑ה כִּ֚י עַל־כׇּל־בָּתֵּ֣י מָשׂ֔וֹשׂ קִרְיָ֖ה עַלִּיזָֽה׃
Translated:
For my people’s soil—
It shall be overgrown with briers and thistles—
Aye, and for all the houses of delight,
For the city of mirth.
Transliteration: al ademat amiy kvots shamiyr taaleh khiy al-khׇl-vatey mashvosh kireyah aliyzah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַרְמ֣וֹן נֻטָּ֔שׁ הֲמ֥וֹן עִ֖יר עֻזָּ֑ב עֹ֣פֶל וָבַ֜חַן הָיָ֨ה בְעַ֤ד מְעָרוֹת֙ עַד־עוֹלָ֔ם מְשׂ֥וֹשׂ פְּרָאִ֖ים מִרְעֵ֥ה עֲדָרִֽים׃
Translated:
For the castle shall be abandoned,
The noisy city forsaken;
Citadel and tower shall become
Bare places forever,
A stamping ground for wild asses,
A pasture for flocks—
Transliteration: khiy-aremvon nutash hamvon iyr uzav ofel vavachan hayah vead mearvot ad-volam meshvosh feraiym mireeh adariym

Hebrew: עַד־יֵ֨עָרֶ֥ה עָלֵ֛ינוּ ר֖וּחַ מִמָּר֑וֹם וְהָיָ֤ה מִדְבָּר֙ לַכַּרְמֶ֔ל (וכרמל) [וְהַכַּרְמֶ֖ל] לַיַּ֥עַר יֵחָשֵֽׁב׃
Translated:
Till a spirit from on high is poured out on us,
And wilderness is transformed into farmland,
While farmland rates as mere brush.
Transliteration: ad-eiareh aleynu rucha mimarvom vehayah midevar lakharemel (vkhrml) [vehakharemel] layaar eichashev

Hebrew: וְשָׁכַ֥ן בַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּצְדָקָ֖ה בַּכַּרְמֶ֥ל תֵּשֵֽׁב׃
Translated:
Then justice shall abide in the wilderness
And righteousness shall dwell on the farmland.
Transliteration: veshakhan vamidevar mishefat utsedakah vakharemel teshev

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֛ה מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה הַצְּדָקָ֖ה שָׁל֑וֹם וַֽעֲבֹדַת֙ הַצְּדָקָ֔ה הַשְׁקֵ֥ט וָבֶ֖טַח עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
For the work of righteousness shall be peace,
And the effect of righteousness, calm and confidence forever.
Transliteration: vehayah maasheh hatsedakah shalvom vaavodat hatsedakah hasheket vavetach ad-volam

Hebrew: וְיָשַׁ֥ב עַמִּ֖י בִּנְוֵ֣ה שָׁל֑וֹם וּֽבְמִשְׁכְּנוֹת֙ מִבְטַחִ֔ים וּבִמְנוּחֹ֖ת שַׁאֲנַנּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Then my people shall dwell in peaceful homes,
In secure dwellings,
In untroubled places of rest.
Transliteration: veyashav amiy vineveh shalvom uvemishekhenvot mivetachiym uvimenuchot shaananvot

Hebrew: וּבָרַ֖ד בְּרֶ֣דֶת הַיָּ֑עַר וּבַשִּׁפְלָ֖ה תִּשְׁפַּ֥ל הָעִֽיר׃
Translated:
And the brush shall sink and vanish,
Even as the city is laid low.
Transliteration: uvarad veredet hayaar uvashifelah tishefal haiyr

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵיכֶ֕ם זֹרְעֵ֖י עַל־כׇּל־מָ֑יִם מְשַׁלְּחֵ֥י רֶגֶל־הַשּׁ֖וֹר וְהַחֲמֽוֹר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Happy shall you be who sow by all waters,
Who send out cattle and donkeys to pasture.
Transliteration: ashereykhem zoreey al-khׇl-mayiim meshalechey regel-hashvor vehachamvor {s}

Hebrew: ה֣וֹי שׁוֹדֵ֗ד וְאַתָּה֙ לֹ֣א שָׁד֔וּד וּבוֹגֵ֖ד וְלֹא־בָ֣גְדוּ ב֑וֹ כַּהֲתִֽמְךָ֤ שׁוֹדֵד֙ תּוּשַּׁ֔ד כַּנְּלֹתְךָ֥ לִבְגֹּ֖ד יִבְגְּדוּ־בָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Ha, you ravager who are not ravaged,
You betrayer who have not been betrayed!
When you have done ravaging, you shall be ravaged;
