When you have finished betraying, you shall be betrayed.
Transliteration: hvoy shvoded veatah lo shadud uvvoged velo-vagedu vvo khahatimekha shvoded tushad khanelotekha livegod yivegedu-vakhe {s}

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה חׇנֵּ֖נוּ לְךָ֣ קִוִּ֑ינוּ הֱיֵ֤ה זְרֹעָם֙ לַבְּקָרִ֔ים אַף־יְשׁוּעָתֵ֖נוּ בְּעֵ֥ת צָרָֽה׃
Translated:
O ETERNAL One, be gracious to us!
It is to You we have looked;
Be their arm every morning,
Also our deliverance in time of stress.
Transliteration: yehovah chׇnenu lekha kiviynu heeih zeroam lavekariym af-yeshuatenu veet tsarah

Hebrew: מִקּ֣וֹל הָמ֔וֹן נָדְד֖וּ עַמִּ֑ים מֵר֣וֹמְמֻתֶ֔ךָ נָפְצ֖וּ גּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
At [Your] roaring, peoples have fled,
Before Your majesty nations have scattered;
Transliteration: mikvol hamvon nadedu amiym mervomemutekha nafetsu gvoyim

Hebrew: וְאֻסַּ֣ף שְׁלַלְכֶ֔ם אֹ֖סֶף הֶחָסִ֑יל כְּמַשַּׁ֥ק גֵּבִ֖ים שֹׁקֵ֥ק בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
And spoil was gathered as locusts are gathered,
It was amassed as grasshoppers are amassed.
Transliteration: veusaf shelalekhem osef hechasiyl khemashak geviym shokek vvo

Hebrew: נִשְׂגָּ֣ב יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י שֹׁכֵ֖ן מָר֑וֹם מִלֵּ֣א צִיּ֔וֹן מִשְׁפָּ֖ט וּצְדָקָֽה׃
Translated:
GOD is exalted,
Dwelling on high—
[Of old] filling Zion
With justice and righteousness.
Transliteration: nishegav yehovah khiy shokhen marvom mile tsiyyvon mishefat utsedakah

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ אֱמוּנַ֣ת עִתֶּ֔יךָ חֹ֥סֶן יְשׁוּעֹ֖ת חׇכְמַ֣ת וָדָ֑עַת יִרְאַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה הִ֥יא אוֹצָרֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Faithfulness to Your charge was [her] wealth,
Wisdom and devotion [her] triumph,
Reverence for GOD—that was her treasure.
Transliteration: vehayah emunat iteykha chosen yeshuot chׇkhemat vadaat yireat yehovah hiy votsarvo {f}

Hebrew: הֵ֚ן אֶרְאֶלָּ֔ם צָעֲק֖וּ חֻ֑צָה מַלְאֲכֵ֣י שָׁל֔וֹם מַ֖ר יִבְכָּיֽוּן׃
Translated:
Hark! The Arielites cry aloud;
Shalom’s messengers weep bitterly.
Transliteration: hen ereelam tsaaku chutsah maleakhey shalvom mar yivekhayun

Hebrew: נָשַׁ֣מּוּ מְסִלּ֔וֹת שָׁבַ֖ת עֹבֵ֣ר אֹ֑רַח הֵפֵ֤ר בְּרִית֙ מָאַ֣ס עָרִ֔ים לֹ֥א חָשַׁ֖ב אֱנֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated:
Highways are desolate,
Wayfarers have ceased.
A covenant has been renounced,
Cities rejected
Mortals despised.
Transliteration: nashamu mesilvot shavat over orach hefer veriyt maas ariym lo chashav envosh

Hebrew: אָבַ֤ל אֻמְלְלָה֙ אָ֔רֶץ הֶחְפִּ֥יר לְבָנ֖וֹן קָמַ֑ל הָיָ֤ה הַשָּׁרוֹן֙ כָּֽעֲרָבָ֔ה וְנֹעֵ֥ר בָּשָׁ֖ן וְכַרְמֶֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
The land is wilted and withered;
Lebanon disgraced and moldering,
Sharon is become like a desert,
And Bashan and Carmel are stripped bare.
Transliteration: aval umelelah arets hechefiyr levanvon kamal hayah hasharvon khaaravah venoer vashan vekharemel {s}

Hebrew: עַתָּ֥ה אָק֖וּם יֹאמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה עַתָּה֙ אֵֽרוֹמָ֔ם עַתָּ֖ה אֶנָּשֵֽׂא׃
Translated:
“Now I will arise,” says GOD,
“Now I will exalt Myself, now raise Myself high.
Transliteration: atah akum yomar yehovah atah ervomam atah enashe

Hebrew: תַּהֲר֥וּ חֲשַׁ֖שׁ תֵּ֣לְדוּ קַ֑שׁ רוּחֲכֶ֕ם אֵ֖שׁ תֹּאכַלְכֶֽם׃
Translated:
You shall conceive hay,
Give birth to straw;
My breath will devour you like fire.
Transliteration: taharu chashash teledu kash ruchakhem esh tokhalekhem

Hebrew: וְהָי֥וּ עַמִּ֖ים מִשְׂרְפ֣וֹת שִׂ֑יד קוֹצִ֥ים כְּסוּחִ֖ים בָּאֵ֥שׁ יִצַּֽתּוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Peoples shall be burnings of lime,
Thorns cut down that are set on fire.
Transliteration: vehayu amiym misherefvot shiyd kvotsiym khesuchiym vaesh yitsatu {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֥וּ רְחוֹקִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֑יתִי וּדְע֥וּ קְרוֹבִ֖ים גְּבֻרָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Hear, you who are far, what I have done;
You who are near, note My might.”
Transliteration: shimeu rechvokiym asher ashiytiy udeu kervoviym gevuratiy

Hebrew: פָּחֲד֤וּ בְצִיּוֹן֙ חַטָּאִ֔ים אָחֲזָ֥ה רְעָדָ֖ה חֲנֵפִ֑ים מִ֣י ׀ יָג֣וּר לָ֗נוּ אֵ֚שׁ אֽוֹכֵלָ֔ה מִֽי־יָג֥וּר לָ֖נוּ מוֹקְדֵ֥י עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
Sinners in Zion are frightened,
The godless are seized with trembling:
“Who of us can dwell with the devouring fire:
Who of us can dwell with the never-dying blaze?”
Transliteration: fachadu vetsiyyvon chataiym achazah readah chanefiym miy yagur lanu esh vokhelah miy-yagur lanu mvokedey volam

Hebrew: הֹלֵ֣ךְ צְדָק֔וֹת וְדֹבֵ֖ר מֵישָׁרִ֑ים מֹאֵ֞ס בְּבֶ֣צַע מַעֲשַׁקּ֗וֹת נֹעֵ֤ר כַּפָּיו֙ מִתְּמֹ֣ךְ בַּשֹּׁ֔חַד אֹטֵ֤ם אׇזְנוֹ֙ מִשְּׁמֹ֣עַ דָּמִ֔ים וְעֹצֵ֥ם עֵינָ֖יו מֵרְא֥וֹת בְּרָֽע׃
Translated:
Whoever walks in righteousness,
Speaks uprightly,
Spurns profit from fraudulent dealings,
Waves away a bribe instead of grasping it,
Stops their ears against listening to infamy,
Shuts their eyes against looking at evil—
Transliteration: holekhe tsedakvot vedover meyshariym moes vevetsa maashakvot noer khafayv mitemokhe vashochad otem ׇzenvo mishemoa damiym veotsem eynayv merevot vera

Hebrew: ה֚וּא מְרוֹמִ֣ים יִשְׁכֹּ֔ן מְצָד֥וֹת סְלָעִ֖ים מִשְׂגַּבּ֑וֹ לַחְמ֣וֹ נִתָּ֔ן מֵימָ֖יו נֶאֱמָנִֽים׃
Translated:
Such a one shall dwell in lofty security,
With inaccessible cliffs for a stronghold,
With food supplied
And drink assured.
Transliteration: hu mervomiym yishekhon metsadvot selaiym mishegavvo lachemvo nitan meymayv neemaniym

Hebrew: מֶ֥לֶךְ בְּיׇפְי֖וֹ תֶּחֱזֶ֣ינָה עֵינֶ֑יךָ תִּרְאֶ֖ינָה אֶ֥רֶץ מַרְחַקִּֽים׃
Translated:
When your eyes behold a king in his beauty,
When they contemplate the land round about,
Transliteration: melekhe veyׇfeyvo techezeynah eyneykha tireeynah erets marechakiym

Hebrew: לִבְּךָ֖ יֶהְגֶּ֣ה אֵימָ֑ה אַיֵּ֤ה סֹפֵר֙ אַיֵּ֣ה שֹׁקֵ֔ל אַיֵּ֖ה סֹפֵ֥ר אֶת־הַמִּגְדָּלִֽים׃
Translated:
Your throat shall murmur in awe,
“Where is one who could count? Where is one who could weigh?
Where is one who could count [all these] towers?”
Transliteration: livekha yehegeh eymah ayeh sofer ayeh shokel ayeh sofer et-hamigedaliym

Hebrew: אֶת־עַ֥ם נוֹעָ֖ז לֹ֣א תִרְאֶ֑ה עַ֣ם עִמְקֵ֤י שָׂפָה֙ מִשְּׁמ֔וֹעַ נִלְעַ֥ג לָשׁ֖וֹן אֵ֥ין בִּינָֽה׃
Translated:
No more shall you see the barbarian folk,
The people of speech too obscure to comprehend,
So stammering of tongue that they are not understood.
Transliteration: et-am nvoaz lo tireeh am imekey shafah mishemvoa nileag lashvon eyn viynah

Hebrew: חֲזֵ֣ה צִיּ֔וֹן קִרְיַ֖ת מוֹעֲדֵ֑נוּ עֵינֶ֩יךָ֩ תִרְאֶ֨ינָה יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם נָוֶ֣ה שַׁאֲנָ֗ן אֹ֤הֶל בַּל־יִצְעָן֙ בַּל־יִסַּ֤ע יְתֵדֹתָיו֙ לָנֶ֔צַח וְכׇל־חֲבָלָ֖יו בַּל־יִנָּתֵֽקוּ׃
Translated:
When you gaze upon Zion, our city of assembly,
Your eyes shall behold Jerusalem
As a secure homestead,
A tent not to be transported,
Whose pegs shall never be pulled up,
And none of whose ropes shall break.
Transliteration: chazeh tsiyyvon kireyat mvoadenu eyneykha tireeynah yerushala͏im naveh shaanan ohel val-yitsean val-yisa yetedotayv lanetsach vekhׇl-chavalayv val-yinateku

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־שָׁ֞ם אַדִּ֤יר יְהֹוָה֙ לָ֔נוּ מְקוֹם־נְהָרִ֥ים יְאֹרִ֖ים רַחֲבֵ֣י יָדָ֑יִם בַּל־תֵּ֤לֶךְ בּוֹ֙ אֳנִי־שַׁ֔יִט וְצִ֥י אַדִּ֖יר לֹ֥א יַעַבְרֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
For there GOD in divine greatness shall be for us
Like a region of rivers, of broad streams,
Where no floating vessels can sail
And no mighty craft can travel—
Their ropes are slack,
They cannot steady the sockets of their masts,
They cannot spread a sail.
Transliteration: khiy im-sham adiyr yehovah lanu mekvom-nehariym yeoriym rachavey yadayiim val-telekhe vvo oniy-shayiit vetsiy adiyr lo yaaverenu

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ שֹׁפְטֵ֔נוּ יְהֹוָ֖ה מְחֹקְקֵ֑נוּ יְהֹוָ֥ה מַלְכֵּ֖נוּ ה֥וּא יוֹשִׁיעֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
For GOD shall be our ruler,
GOD shall be our monarch,
GOD shall be our sovereign
And shall deliver us.
Transliteration: khiy yehovah shofetenu yehovah mechokekenu yehovah malekhenu hu yvoshiyenu

Hebrew: נִטְּשׁ֖וּ חֲבָלָ֑יִךְ בַּל־יְחַזְּק֤וּ כֵן־תׇּרְנָם֙ בַּל־פָּ֣רְשׂוּ נֵ֔ס אָ֣ז חֻלַּ֤ק עַד־שָׁלָל֙ מַרְבֶּ֔ה פִּסְחִ֖ים בָּ֥זְזוּ בַֽז׃
Translated:
Then shall indeed much spoil be divided,
Even the lame shall seize booty.
Transliteration: niteshu chavalayiikhe val-yechazeku khen-tׇrenam val-fareshu nes az chulak ad-shalal mareveh fisechiym vazezu vaz

Hebrew: וּבַל־יֹאמַ֥ר שָׁכֵ֖ן חָלִ֑יתִי הָעָ֛ם הַיֹּשֵׁ֥ב בָּ֖הּ נְשֻׂ֥א עָוֺֽן׃ {ס}
Translated:
And no one who lives there shall say, “I am sick”;
It shall be inhabited by folk whose sin has been forgiven.
Transliteration: uval-yomar shakhen chaliytiy haam hayoshev vah neshu avon {s}

Hebrew: קִרְב֤וּ גוֹיִם֙ לִשְׁמֹ֔עַ וּלְאֻמִּ֖ים הַקְשִׁ֑יבוּ תִּשְׁמַ֤ע הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ וּמְלֹאָ֔הּ תֵּבֵ֖ל וְכׇל־צֶאֱצָאֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Approach, O nations, and listen,
Give heed, O peoples!
Let the earth and those in it hear;
The world, and what it brings forth.
Transliteration: kirevu gvoyim lishemoa uleumiym hakeshiyvu tishema haarets umeloah tevel vekhׇl-tseetsaeyha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י קֶ֤צֶף לַֽיהֹוָה֙ עַל־כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם וְחֵמָ֖ה עַל־כׇּל־צְבָאָ֑ם הֶחֱרִימָ֖ם נְתָנָ֥ם לַטָּֽבַח׃
Translated:
For GOD is angry at all the nations,
Furious at all their host;
They have been doomed, consigned to slaughter.
Transliteration: khiy ketsef layhovah al-khׇl-hagvoyim vechemah al-khׇl-tsevaam hecheriymam netanam latavach

Hebrew: וְחַלְלֵיהֶ֣ם יֻשְׁלָ֔כוּ וּפִגְרֵיהֶ֖ם יַעֲלֶ֣ה בׇאְשָׁ֑ם וְנָמַ֥סּוּ הָרִ֖ים מִדָּמָֽם׃
Translated:
Their slain shall be left lying,
And the stench of their corpses shall mount;
And the hills shall be drenched with their blood,
Transliteration: vechaleleyhem yushelakhu ufigereyhem yaaleh vׇesham venamasu hariym midamam

Hebrew: וְנָמַ֙קּוּ֙ כׇּל־צְבָ֣א הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְנָגֹ֥לּוּ כַסֵּ֖פֶר הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְכׇל־צְבָאָ֣ם יִבּ֔וֹל כִּנְבֹ֤ל עָלֶה֙ מִגֶּ֔פֶן וּכְנֹבֶ֖לֶת מִתְּאֵנָֽה׃
Translated:
All the host of heaven shall molder.
The heavens shall be rolled up like a scroll,
And all their host shall wither
Like a leaf withering on the vine,
Or shriveled fruit on a fig tree.
Transliteration: venamaku khׇl-tseva hashamayiim venagolu khasefer hashamayiim vekhׇl-tsevaam yivvol khinevol aleh migefen ukhenovelet miteenah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־רִוְּתָ֥ה בַשָּׁמַ֖יִם חַרְבִּ֑י הִנֵּה֙ עַל־אֱד֣וֹם תֵּרֵ֔ד וְעַל־עַ֥ם חֶרְמִ֖י לְמִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
For My sword shall be drunk in the sky;
Lo, it shall come down upon Edom,
Upon the people I have doomed,
To wreak judgment.
Transliteration: khiy-rivetah vashamayiim chareviy hineh al-edvom tered veal-am cheremiy lemishefat

Hebrew: חֶ֣רֶב לַיהֹוָ֞ה מָלְאָ֥ה דָם֙ הֻדַּ֣שְׁנָה מֵחֵ֔לֶב מִדַּ֤ם כָּרִים֙ וְעַתּוּדִ֔ים מֵחֵ֖לֶב כִּלְי֣וֹת אֵילִ֑ים כִּ֣י זֶ֤בַח לַֽיהֹוָה֙ בְּבׇצְרָ֔ה וְטֶ֥בַח גָּד֖וֹל בְּאֶ֥רֶץ אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated:
GOD has a sword; it is sated with blood,
It is gorged with fat—
The blood of lambs and he-goats,
The kidney fat of rams.
For GOD holds a sacrifice in Bozrah,
A great slaughter in the land of Edom.
Transliteration: cherev layhovah maleah dam hudashenah mechelev midam khariym veatudiym mechelev khileyvot eyliym khiy zevach layhovah vevׇtserah vetevach gadvol veerets edvom

Hebrew: וְיָרְד֤וּ רְאֵמִים֙ עִמָּ֔ם וּפָרִ֖ים עִם־אַבִּירִ֑ים וְרִוְּתָ֤ה אַרְצָם֙ מִדָּ֔ם וַעֲפָרָ֖ם מֵחֵ֥לֶב יְדֻשָּֽׁן׃
Translated:
Wild oxen shall fall with them,
Young bulls with mighty steers;
And their land shall be drunk with blood,
Their soil shall be saturated with fat.
Transliteration: veyaredu reemiym imam ufariym im-aviyriym verivetah aretsam midam vaafaram mechelev yedushan

Hebrew: כִּ֛י י֥וֹם נָקָ֖ם לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה שְׁנַ֥ת שִׁלּוּמִ֖ים לְרִ֥יב צִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
For it is GOD’s day of retribution,
The year of vindication for Zion’s cause.
Transliteration: khiy yvom nakam layhovah shenat shilumiym leriyv tsiyyvon

Hebrew: וְנֶהֶפְכ֤וּ נְחָלֶ֙יהָ֙ לְזֶ֔פֶת וַעֲפָרָ֖הּ לְגׇפְרִ֑ית וְהָיְתָ֣ה אַרְצָ֔הּ לְזֶ֖פֶת בֹּעֵרָֽה׃
Translated:
Its streams shall be turned to pitch
And its soil to sulfur.
Its land shall become burning pitch,
Transliteration: venehefekhu nechaleyha lezefet vaafarah legׇferiyt vehayetah aretsah lezefet voerah

Hebrew: לַ֤יְלָה וְיוֹמָם֙ לֹ֣א תִכְבֶּ֔ה לְעוֹלָ֖ם יַעֲלֶ֣ה עֲשָׁנָ֑הּ מִדּ֤וֹר לָדוֹר֙ תֶּחֱרָ֔ב לְנֵ֣צַח נְצָחִ֔ים אֵ֥ין עֹבֵ֖ר בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
Night and day it shall never go out;
Its smoke shall rise for all time.
Through the ages it shall lie in ruins;
Through the aeons none shall traverse it.
Transliteration: layelah veyvomam lo tikheveh levolam yaaleh ashanah midvor ladvor techerav lenetsach netsachiym eyn over vah

Hebrew: וִירֵשׁ֙וּהָ֙ קָאַ֣ת וְקִפּ֔וֹד וְיַנְשׁ֥וֹף וְעֹרֵ֖ב יִשְׁכְּנוּ־בָ֑הּ וְנָטָ֥ה עָלֶ֛יהָ קַֽו־תֹֿ֖הוּ וְאַבְנֵי־בֹֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Jackdaws and owls shall possess it;
Great owls and ravens shall dwell there.
[God] shall measure it with a line of chaos
And with weights of emptiness.
Transliteration: viyreshuha kaat vekifvod veyaneshvof veorev yishekhenu-vah venatah aleyha kav-tֿohu veaveney-vohu

Hebrew: חֹרֶ֥יהָ וְאֵֽין־שָׁ֖ם מְלוּכָ֣ה יִקְרָ֑אוּ וְכׇל־שָׂרֶ֖יהָ יִ֥הְיוּ אָֽפֶס׃
Translated:
It shall be called “No kingdom is there,”
Its nobles and all its lords shall be nothing.
Transliteration: choreyha veeyn-sham melukhah yikerau vekhׇl-shareyha yiheyu afes

Hebrew: וְעָלְתָ֤ה אַרְמְנֹתֶ֙יהָ֙ סִירִ֔ים קִמּ֥וֹשׂ וָח֖וֹחַ בְּמִבְצָרֶ֑יהָ וְהָֽיְתָה֙ נְוֵ֣ה תַנִּ֔ים חָצִ֖יר לִבְנ֥וֹת יַעֲנָֽה׃
Translated:
Thorns shall grow up in its palaces,
Nettles and briers in its strongholds.
It shall be a home of jackals,
An abode of ostriches.
Transliteration: vealetah aremenoteyha siyriym kimvosh vachvocha vemivetsareyha vehayetah neveh taniym chatsiyr livenvot yaanah

Hebrew: וּפָגְשׁ֤וּ צִיִּים֙ אֶת־אִיִּ֔ים וְשָׂעִ֖יר עַל־רֵעֵ֣הוּ יִקְרָ֑א אַךְ־שָׁם֙ הִרְגִּ֣יעָה לִּילִ֔ית וּמָצְאָ֥ה לָ֖הּ מָנֽוֹחַ׃
Translated:
Wildcats shall meet hyenas,
Goat-demons shall greet each other;
There too the lilith shall repose
And find herself a resting place.
Transliteration: ufageshu tsiyiym et-iyiym veshaiyr al-reehu yikera akhe-sham hiregiyah liyliyt umatseah lah manvocha

Hebrew: שָׁ֣מָּה קִנְּנָ֤ה קִפּוֹז֙ וַתְּמַלֵּ֔ט וּבָקְעָ֖ה וְדָגְרָ֣ה בְצִלָּ֑הּ אַךְ־שָׁ֛ם נִקְבְּצ֥וּ דַיּ֖וֹת אִשָּׁ֥ה רְעוּתָֽהּ׃
Translated:
There the arrow-snake shall nest and lay eggs,
And shall brood and hatch in its shade.
There too the buzzards shall gather
With one another.
Transliteration: shamah kinenah kifvoz vatemalet uvakeah vedagerah vetsilah akhe-sham nikevetsu dayyvot ishah reutah

Hebrew: דִּרְשׁ֨וּ מֵעַל־סֵ֤פֶר יְהֹוָה֙ וּֽקְרָ֔אוּ אַחַ֤ת מֵהֵ֙נָּה֙ לֹ֣א נֶעְדָּ֔רָה אִשָּׁ֥ה רְעוּתָ֖הּ לֹ֣א פָקָ֑דוּ כִּי־פִי֙ ה֣וּא צִוָּ֔ה וְרוּח֖וֹ ה֥וּא קִבְּצָֽן׃
Translated:
Search and read it in the scroll of GOD:
Not one of these shall be absent,
Not one shall miss its fellow.
For God’s mouth has spoken,
It is God’s spirit that has assembled them—
Transliteration: direshu meal-sefer yehovah ukerau achat mehenah lo needarah ishah reutah lo fakadu khiy-fiy hu tsivah veruchvo hu kivetsan

Hebrew: וְהֽוּא־הִפִּ֤יל לָהֶן֙ גּוֹרָ֔ל וְיָד֛וֹ חִלְּקַ֥תָּה לָהֶ֖ם בַּקָּ֑ו עַד־עוֹלָם֙ יִֽירָשׁ֔וּהָ לְד֥וֹר וָד֖וֹר יִשְׁכְּנוּ־בָֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
The One who apportioned it to them by lot,
Whose hand divided it for them with the line.
They shall possess it for all time,
They shall dwell there through the ages.
Transliteration: vehu-hifiyl lahen gvoral veyadvo chilekatah lahem vakav ad-volam yiyrashuha ledvor vadvor yishekhenu-vah {s}

Hebrew: יְשֻׂשׂ֥וּם מִדְבָּ֖ר וְצִיָּ֑ה וְתָגֵ֧ל עֲרָבָ֛ה וְתִפְרַ֖ח כַּחֲבַצָּֽלֶת׃
Translated:
The arid desert shall be glad,
The wilderness shall rejoice
And shall blossom like a rose.
Transliteration: yeshushum midevar vetsiyah vetagel aravah vetiferach khachavatsalet

Hebrew: פָּרֹ֨חַ תִּפְרַ֜ח וְתָגֵ֗ל אַ֚ף גִּילַ֣ת וְרַנֵּ֔ן כְּב֤וֹד הַלְּבָנוֹן֙ נִתַּן־לָ֔הּ הֲדַ֥ר הַכַּרְמֶ֖ל וְהַשָּׁר֑וֹן הֵ֛מָּה יִרְא֥וּ כְבוֹד־יְהֹוָ֖ה הֲדַ֥ר אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
It shall blossom abundantly,
It shall also exult and shout.
It shall receive the glory of Lebanon,
The splendor of Carmel and Sharon.
They shall behold the glory of GOD,
The splendor of our God.
Transliteration: farocha tiferach vetagel af giylat veranen khevvod halevanvon nitan-lah hadar hakharemel vehasharvon hemah yireu khevvod-yehovah hadar eloheynu {f}

Hebrew: חַזְּק֖וּ יָדַ֣יִם רָפ֑וֹת וּבִרְכַּ֥יִם כֹּשְׁל֖וֹת אַמֵּֽצוּ׃
Translated:
Strengthen the hands that are slack;
Make firm the tottering knees!
Transliteration: chazeku yadayiim rafvot uvirekhayiim khoshelvot ametsu

Hebrew: אִמְרוּ֙ לְנִמְהֲרֵי־לֵ֔ב חִזְק֖וּ אַל־תִּירָ֑אוּ הִנֵּ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ נָקָ֣ם יָב֔וֹא גְּמ֣וּל אֱלֹהִ֔ים ה֥וּא יָב֖וֹא וְיֹשַׁעֲכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Say to the anxious of heart,
“Be strong, fear not;
Behold your God!
Requital is coming,
The recompense of God—
Who is indeed coming to give you triumph.”
Transliteration: imeru lenimeharey-lev chizeku al-tiyrau hineh eloheykhem nakam yavvo gemul Elohim hu yavvo veyoshaakhem

Hebrew: אָ֥ז תִּפָּקַ֖חְנָה עֵינֵ֣י עִוְרִ֑ים וְאׇזְנֵ֥י חֵרְשִׁ֖ים תִּפָּתַֽחְנָה׃
Translated:
Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened,
And the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.
Transliteration: az tifakachenah eyney iveriym veׇzeney chereshiym tifatachenah

Hebrew: אָ֣ז יְדַלֵּ֤ג כָּֽאַיָּל֙ פִּסֵּ֔חַ וְתָרֹ֖ן לְשׁ֣וֹן אִלֵּ֑ם כִּֽי־נִבְקְע֤וּ בַמִּדְבָּר֙ מַ֔יִם וּנְחָלִ֖ים בָּעֲרָבָֽה׃
Translated:
Then the lame shall leap like a deer,
And the tongue of the dumb shall shout aloud;
For waters shall burst forth in the desert,
Streams in the wilderness.
Transliteration: az yedaleg khaayal fisecha vetaron leshvon ilem khiy-nivekeu vamidevar mayiim unechaliym vaaravah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה הַשָּׁרָב֙ לַאֲגַ֔ם וְצִמָּא֖וֹן לְמַבּ֣וּעֵי מָ֑יִם בִּנְוֵ֤ה תַנִּים֙ רִבְצָ֔הּ חָצִ֖יר לְקָנֶ֥ה וָגֹֽמֶא׃
Translated:
Torrid earth shall become a pool;
Parched land, fountains of water;
The home of jackals, a pasture;
The abode [of ostriches], reeds and rushes.
Transliteration: vehayah hasharav laagam vetsimavon lemavuey mayiim vineveh taniym rivetsah chatsiyr lekaneh vagome

Hebrew: וְהָיָה־שָׁ֞ם מַסְל֣וּל וָדֶ֗רֶךְ וְדֶ֤רֶךְ הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ יִקָּ֣רֵא לָ֔הּ לֹא־יַעַבְרֶ֥נּוּ טָמֵ֖א וְהוּא־לָ֑מוֹ הֹלֵ֥ךְ דֶּ֛רֶךְ וֶאֱוִילִ֖ים לֹ֥א יִתְעֽוּ׃
Translated:
And a highway shall appear there,
Which shall be called the Sacred Way.
No one impure shall pass along it,
But it shall be for them.
No traveler, not even fools, shall go astray.
Transliteration: vehayah-sham maselul vaderekhe vederekhe hakodesh yikare lah lo-yaaverenu tame vehu-lamvo holekhe derekhe veeviyliym lo yiteu

Hebrew: לֹא־יִהְיֶ֨ה שָׁ֜ם אַרְיֵ֗ה וּפְרִ֤יץ חַיּוֹת֙ בַּֽל־יַעֲלֶ֔נָּה לֹ֥א תִמָּצֵ֖א שָׁ֑ם וְהָלְכ֖וּ גְּאוּלִֽים׃
Translated:
No lion shall be there,
No ferocious beast shall set foot on it—
These shall not be found there.
But the redeemed shall walk it;
Transliteration: lo-yiheyeh sham areeih uferiyts chayyvot val-yaalenah lo timatse sham vehalekhu geuliym

Hebrew: וּפְדוּיֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֜ה יְשֻׁב֗וּן וּבָ֤אוּ צִיּוֹן֙ בְּרִנָּ֔ה וְשִׂמְחַ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם עַל־רֹאשָׁ֑ם שָׂשׂ֤וֹן וְשִׂמְחָה֙ יַשִּׂ֔יגוּ וְנָ֖סוּ יָג֥וֹן וַאֲנָחָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
And GOD’s ransomed shall return,
And come with shouting to Zion,
Crowned with joy everlasting.
They shall attain joy and gladness,
While sorrow and sighing flee.
Transliteration: ufedueiy yehovah yeshuvun uvau tsiyyvon verinah veshimechat volam al-rosham shashvon veshimechah yashiygu venasu yagvon vaanachah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י בְּאַרְבַּע֩ עֶשְׂרֵ֨ה שָׁנָ֜ה לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ חִזְקִיָּ֗הוּ עָלָ֞ה סַנְחֵרִ֤יב מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁוּר֙ עַ֣ל כׇּל־עָרֵ֧י יְהוּדָ֛ה הַבְּצֻר֖וֹת וַֽיִּתְפְּשֵֽׂם׃
Translated: In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah, King Sennacherib of Assyria marched against all the fortified towns of Judah and seized them.
Transliteration: vayehiy veareva eshereh shanah lamelekhe chizekiyahu alah sanecheriyv melekhe-ashur al khׇl-arey yehudah havetsurvot vayitefeshem

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֣וּר ׀ אֶת־רַבְשָׁקֵ֨ה מִלָּכִ֧ישׁ יְרוּשָׁלַ֛͏ְמָה אֶל־הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ בְּחֵ֣יל כָּבֵ֑ד וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֗ד בִּתְעָלַת֙ הַבְּרֵכָ֣ה הָעֶלְיוֹנָ֔ה בִּמְסִלַּ֖ת שְׂדֵ֥ה כוֹבֵֽס׃
Translated: From Lachish, the king of Assyria sent the Rabshakeh, with a large force, to King Hezekiah in Jerusalem. [The Rabshakeh] took up a position near the conduit of the Upper Pool, by the road of the Fuller’s Field;
Transliteration: vayishelach melekhe-ashur et-raveshakeh milakhiysh yerushala͏emah el-hamelekhe chizekiyahu vecheyl khaved vayaamod vitealat haverekhah haeleyvonah vimesilat shedeh khvoves

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א אֵלָ֛יו אֶלְיָקִ֥ים בֶּן־חִלְקִיָּ֖הוּ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַבָּ֑יִת וְשֶׁבְנָא֙ הַסֹּפֵ֔ר וְיוֹאָ֥ח בֶּן־אָסָ֖ף הַמַּזְכִּֽיר׃
Translated: and Eliakim son of Hilkiah who was in charge of the palace, Shebna the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder went out to him.
Transliteration: vayetse elayv eleyakiym ven-chilekiyahu asher al-havayiit veshevena hasofer veyvoach ven-asaf hamazekhiyr

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם֙ רַבְשָׁקֵ֔ה אִמְרוּ־נָ֖א אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֑הוּ כֹּֽה־אָמַ֞ר הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ הַגָּדוֹל֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר מָ֧ה הַבִּטָּח֛וֹן הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּטָֽחְתָּ׃
Translated: The Rabshakeh said to them, “You tell Hezekiah: Thus said the Great King, the king of Assyria: What makes you so confident?
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem raveshakeh imeru-na el-chizekiyahu khoh-amar hamelekhe hagadvol melekhe ashur mah havitachvon hazeh asher vatacheta

Hebrew: אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ אַךְ־דְּבַר־שְׂפָתַ֔יִם עֵצָ֥ה וּגְבוּרָ֖ה לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה עַתָּה֙ עַל־מִ֣י בָטַ֔חְתָּ כִּ֥י מָרַ֖דְתָּ בִּֽי׃
Translated: I suppose mere talk makes counsel and valor for war! Look, on whom are you relying, that you have rebelled against me?
Transliteration: amaretiy akhe-devar-shefatayiim etsah ugevurah lamilechamah atah al-miy vatacheta khiy maradeta viy

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה בָטַ֡חְתָּ עַל־מִשְׁעֶ֩נֶת֩ הַקָּנֶ֨ה הָרָצ֤וּץ הַזֶּה֙ עַל־מִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִסָּמֵ֥ךְ אִישׁ֙ עָלָ֔יו וּבָ֥א בְכַפּ֖וֹ וּנְקָבָ֑הּ כֵּ֚ן פַּרְעֹ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֔יִם לְכׇֽל־הַבֹּטְחִ֖ים עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: You are relying on Egypt, that splintered reed of a staff, which enters and punctures the palm of anyone who leans on it. That’s what Pharaoh king of Egypt is like to all who rely on him.
Transliteration: hineh vatacheta al-misheenet hakaneh haratsuts hazeh al-mitserayiim asher yisamekhe iysh alayv uva vekhafvo unekavah khen fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim lekhׇl-havotechiym alayv

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־תֹאמַ֣ר אֵלַ֔י אֶל־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ בָּטָ֑חְנוּ הֲלוֹא־ה֗וּא אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵסִ֤יר חִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ אֶת־בָּמֹתָ֣יו וְאֶת־מִזְבְּחֹתָ֔יו וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לִיהוּדָה֙ וְלִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לִפְנֵ֛י הַמִּזְבֵּ֥חַ הַזֶּ֖ה תִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֽוּ׃
Translated: And if you tell me that you are relying on the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, this is the very one whose shrines and altars Hezekiah did away with, telling Judah and Jerusalem, ‘You must worship only at this altar!’
Transliteration: vekhiy-tomar elay el-yehovah eloheynu vatachenu halvo-hu asher hesiyr chizekiyahu et-vamotayv veet-mizevechotayv vayomer liyhudah veliyrushala͏im lifeney hamizevecha hazeh tishetachavu

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ הִתְעָ֣רֶב נָ֔א אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֖י הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֑וּר וְאֶתְּנָ֤ה לְךָ֙ אַלְפַּ֣יִם סוּסִ֔ים אִם־תּוּכַ֕ל לָ֥תֶת לְךָ֖ רֹכְבִ֥ים עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Come now, make this wager with my master, the king of Assyria: I’ll give you two thousand horses, if you can produce riders to mount them.
Transliteration: veatah hitearev na et-adoniy hamelekhe ashur veetenah lekha alefayiim susiym im-tukhal latet lekha rokheviym aleyhem

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣יךְ תָּשִׁ֗יב אֵ֠ת פְּנֵ֨י פַחַ֥ת אַחַ֛ד עַבְדֵ֥י אֲדֹנִ֖י הַקְּטַנִּ֑ים וַתִּבְטַ֤ח לְךָ֙ עַל־מִצְרַ֔יִם לְרֶ֖כֶב וּלְפָרָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: So how could you refuse anything, even to the deputy of one of my master’s lesser servants, relying on Egypt for chariots and riders?
Transliteration: veeykhe tashiyv et feney fachat achad avedey adoniy haketaniym vativetach lekha al-mitserayiim lerekhev ulefarashiym

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ הֲמִבַּלְעֲדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה עָלִ֛יתִי עַל־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּ֖את לְהַשְׁחִיתָ֑הּ יְהֹוָה֙ אָמַ֣ר אֵלַ֔י עֲלֵ֛ה אֶל־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּ֖את וְהַשְׁחִיתָֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: And do you think I have marched against this land to destroy it without G<small>OD</small>? It was G<small>OD</small> who told me: Go up against that land and destroy it.”
Transliteration: veatah hamivaleadey yehovah aliytiy al-haarets hazot lehashechiytah yehovah amar elay aleh el-haarets hazot vehashechiytah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶלְיָקִים֩ וְשֶׁבְנָ֨א וְיוֹאָ֜ח אֶל־רַבְשָׁקֵ֗ה דַּבֶּר־נָ֤א אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲרָמִ֔ית כִּ֥י שֹׁמְעִ֖ים אֲנָ֑חְנוּ וְאַל־תְּדַבֵּ֤ר אֵלֵ֙ינוּ֙ יְהוּדִ֔ית בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַחוֹמָֽה׃
Translated: Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah replied to the Rabshakeh, “Please, speak to your servants in Aramaic, since we understand it; do not speak to us in Judean in the hearing of the people on the wall.”
Transliteration: vayomer eleyakiym veshevena veyvoach el-raveshakeh daver-na el-avadeykha aramiyt khiy shomeiym anachenu veal-tedaver eleynu yehudiyt veׇzeney haam asher al-hachvomah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר רַבְשָׁקֵ֗ה הַאֶ֨ל אֲדֹנֶ֤יךָ וְאֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ שְׁלָחַ֣נִי אֲדֹנִ֔י לְדַבֵּ֖ר אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה הֲלֹ֣א עַל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים הַיֹּֽשְׁבִים֙ עַל־הַ֣חוֹמָ֔ה לֶאֱכֹ֣ל אֶת־[צוֹאָתָ֗ם] (חראיהם) וְלִשְׁתּ֛וֹת אֶת־[מֵימֵ֥י רַגְלֵיהֶ֖ם] (שיניהם) עִמָּכֶֽם׃
Translated: But the Rabshakeh replied, “Was it to your master and to you that my master sent me to speak those words? It was precisely to the men who are sitting on the wall—who will have to eat their dung and drink their urine with you.”
Transliteration: vayomer raveshakeh hael adoneykha veeleykha shelachaniy adoniy ledaver et-hadevariym haeleh halo al-haanashiym hayosheviym al-hachvomah leekhol et-[tsvoatam] (chryhm) velishetvot et-[meymey rageleyhem] (shynyhm) imakhem

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲמֹד֙ רַבְשָׁקֵ֔ה וַיִּקְרָ֥א בְקוֹל־גָּד֖וֹל יְהוּדִ֑ית וַיֹּ֕אמֶר שִׁמְע֗וּ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֛י הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ הַגָּד֖וֹל מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: And the Rabshakeh stood and called out in a loud voice in Judean:
Transliteration: vayaamod raveshakeh vayikera vekvol-gadvol yehudiyt vayomer shimeu et-diverey hamelekhe hagadvol melekhe ashur

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אַל־יַשִּׁ֥א לָכֶ֖ם חִזְקִיָּ֑הוּ כִּ֥י לֹֽא־יוּכַ֖ל לְהַצִּ֥יל אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: “Hear the words of the Great King, the king of Assyria! Thus said the king: Don’t let Hezekiah deceive you, for he will not be able to save you.
Transliteration: khoh amar hamelekhe al-yashi lakhem chizekiyahu khiy lo-yukhal lehatsiyl etekhem

Hebrew: וְאַל־יַבְטַ֨ח אֶתְכֶ֤ם חִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה לֵאמֹ֔ר הַצֵּ֥ל יַצִּילֵ֖נוּ יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹ֤א תִנָּתֵן֙ הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את בְּיַ֖ד מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: Don’t let Hezekiah make you rely on G<small>OD</small>, saying, ‘G<small>OD</small> will surely save us; this city will not fall into the hands of Assyria!’
Transliteration: veal-yavetach etekhem chizekiyahu el-yehovah lemor hatsel yatsiylenu yehovah lo tinaten haiyr hazot veyad melekhe ashur

Hebrew:
אַֽל־תִּשְׁמְע֖וּ אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֑הוּ {פ}
כִּי֩ כֹ֨ה אָמַ֜ר הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֗וּר עֲשֽׂוּ־אִתִּ֤י בְרָכָה֙ וּצְא֣וּ אֵלַ֔י וְאִכְל֤וּ אִישׁ־גַּפְנוֹ֙ וְאִ֣ישׁ תְּאֵנָת֔וֹ וּשְׁת֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ מֵי־בוֹרֽוֹ׃
Translated: Don’t listen to Hezekiah. For thus said the king of Assyria: Make your peace with me and come out to me, so that you may all eat from your vines and your fig trees and drink water from your cisterns,
Transliteration:
al-tishemeu el-chizekiyahu {f}
khiy khoh amar hamelekhe ashur ashu-itiy verakhah utseu elay veikhelu iysh-gafenvo veiysh teenatvo ushetu iysh mey-vvorvo

Hebrew: עַד־בֹּאִ֕י וְלָקַחְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּאַרְצְכֶ֑ם אֶ֤רֶץ דָּגָן֙ וְתִיר֔וֹשׁ אֶ֥רֶץ לֶ֖חֶם וּכְרָמִֽים׃
Translated: until I come and take you away to a land like your own, a land of bread and wine, of grain [fields] and vineyards.
Transliteration: ad-voiy velakachetiy etekhem el-erets khearetsekhem erets dagan vetiyrvosh erets lechem ukheramiym

Hebrew: פֶּן־יַסִּ֨ית אֶתְכֶ֤ם חִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יְהֹוָ֖ה יַצִּילֵ֑נוּ הַהִצִּ֜ילוּ אֱלֹהֵ֤י הַגּוֹיִם֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־אַרְצ֔וֹ מִיַּ֖ד מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: Beware of letting Hezekiah mislead you by saying, ‘G<small>OD</small> will save us.’ Did any of the gods of the other nations save their land from the king of Assyria?
Transliteration: fen-yasiyt etekhem chizekiyahu lemor yehovah yatsiylenu hahitsiylu elohey hagvoyim iysh et-aretsvo miyad melekhe ashur

Hebrew: אַיֵּ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י חֲמָת֙ וְאַרְפָּ֔ד אַיֵּ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י סְפַרְוָ֑יִם וְכִֽי־הִצִּ֥ילוּ אֶת־שֹׁמְר֖וֹן מִיָּדִֽי׃
Translated: Where were the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where were the gods of Sepharvaim? And did they save Samaria from me?
Transliteration: ayeh elohey chamat vearefad ayeh elohey sefarevayiim vekhiy-hitsiylu et-shomervon miyadiy

Hebrew: מִ֗י בְּכׇל־אֱלֹהֵ֤י הָאֲרָצוֹת֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁר־הִצִּ֥ילוּ אֶת־אַרְצָ֖ם מִיָּדִ֑י כִּֽי־יַצִּ֧יל יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם מִיָּדִֽי׃
Translated: Which among all the gods of those countries saved their countries from me, that G<small>OD</small> should save Jerusalem from me?”
Transliteration: miy vekhׇl-elohey haaratsvot haeleh asher-hitsiylu et-aretsam miyadiy khiy-yatsiyl yehovah et-yerushala͏im miyadiy

Hebrew: וַֽיַּחֲרִ֔ישׁוּ וְלֹא־עָנ֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ דָּבָ֑ר כִּֽי־מִצְוַ֨ת הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ הִ֛יא לֵאמֹ֖ר לֹ֥א תַעֲנֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: But they were silent and did not answer him with a single word; for the king’s order was: “Do not answer him.”
Transliteration: vayachariyshu velo-anu otvo davar khiy-mitsevat hamelekhe hiy lemor lo taanuhu

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א אֶלְיָקִ֣ים בֶּן־חִלְקִיָּ֣הוּ אֲשֶׁר־עַל־הַ֠בַּ֠יִת וְשֶׁבְנָ֨א הַסֹּפֵ֜ר וְיוֹאָ֨ח בֶּן־אָסָ֧ף הַמַּזְכִּ֛יר אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ קְרוּעֵ֣י בְגָדִ֑ים וַיַּגִּ֣ידוּ ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת דִּבְרֵ֥י רַבְשָׁקֵֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And so Eliakim son of Hilkiah who was in charge of the palace, Shebna the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder came to Hezekiah with their clothes rent, and they reported to him what the Rabshakeh had said.
Transliteration: vayavo eleyakiym ven-chilekiyahu asher-al-havayiit veshevena hasofer veyvoach ven-asaf hamazekhiyr el-chizekiyahu keruey vegadiym vayagiydu lvo et diverey raveshakeh {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֗י כִּשְׁמֹ֙עַ֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ חִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ וַיִּקְרַ֖ע אֶת־בְּגָדָ֑יו וַיִּתְכַּ֣ס בַּשָּׂ֔ק וַיָּבֹ֖א בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When King Hezekiah heard this, he rent his clothes and covered himself with sackcloth and went into the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa hamelekhe chizekiyahu vayikera et-vegadayv vayitekhas vashak vayavo veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּשְׁלַ֠ח אֶת־אֶלְיָקִ֨ים אֲשֶׁר־עַל־הַבַּ֜יִת וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שֶׁבְנָ֣א הַסּוֹפֵ֗ר וְאֵת֙ זִקְנֵ֣י הַכֹּהֲנִ֔ים מִתְכַּסִּ֖ים בַּשַּׂקִּ֑ים אֶל־יְשַׁעְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־אָמ֖וֹץ הַנָּבִֽיא׃
Translated: He also sent Eliakim, who was in charge of the palace, Shebna, the scribe, and the senior priests, covered with sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.
Transliteration: vayishelach et-eleyakiym asher-al-havayiit veet shevena hasvofer veet zikeney hakhohaniym mitekhasiym vashakiym el-yeshaeyahu ven-amvots hanaviy

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר חִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ יוֹם־צָרָ֧ה וְתוֹכֵחָ֛ה וּנְאָצָ֖ה הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֣י בָ֤אוּ בָנִים֙ עַד־מַשְׁבֵּ֔ר וְכֹ֥חַ אַ֖יִן לְלֵדָֽה׃
Translated: They said to him, “Thus said Hezekiah: This day is a day of distress, of chastisement, and of disgrace. The babes have reached the birthstool, but the strength to give birth is lacking.
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv khoh amar chizekiyahu yvom-tsarah vetvokhechah uneatsah hayyvom hazeh khiy vau vaniym ad-mashever vekhocha ayiin leledah

Hebrew: אוּלַ֡י יִשְׁמַע֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ אֵ֣ת ׀ דִּבְרֵ֣י רַבְשָׁקֵ֗ה אֲשֶׁר֩ שְׁלָח֨וֹ מֶלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֤וּר ׀ אֲדֹנָיו֙ לְחָרֵף֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים חַ֔י וְהוֹכִ֙יחַ֙ בַּדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמַ֖ע יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְנָשָׂ֣אתָ תְפִלָּ֔ה בְּעַ֥ד הַשְּׁאֵרִ֖ית הַנִּמְצָאָֽה׃
Translated: Perhaps the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God will take note of the words of the Rabshakeh, whom his master the king of Assyria has sent to blaspheme the living God, and will mete out judgment for the words that the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God has heard—if you will offer up prayer for the surviving remnant.”
Transliteration: ulay yishema yehovah eloheykha et diverey raveshakeh asher shelachvo melekhe-ashur adonayv lecharef Elohim chay vehvokhiycha vadevariym asher shama yehovah eloheykha venashata tefilah vead hasheeriyt hanimetsaah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ עַבְדֵ֛י הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ אֶֽל־יְשַׁעְיָֽהוּ׃
Translated: When King Hezekiah’s ministers came to Isaiah,
Transliteration: vayavou avedey hamelekhe chizekiyahu el-yeshaeyahu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם֙ יְשַֽׁעְיָ֔הוּ כֹּ֥ה תֹאמְר֖וּן אֶל־אֲדֹנֵיכֶ֑ם כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אַל־תִּירָא֙ מִפְּנֵ֤י הַדְּבָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁמַ֔עְתָּ אֲשֶׁ֧ר גִּדְּפ֛וּ נַעֲרֵ֥י מֶלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֖וּר אוֹתִֽי׃
Translated: Isaiah said to them, “Tell your master as follows: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Do not be frightened by the words of blasphemy against Me that you have heard from the minions of the king of Assyria.
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem yeshaeyahu khoh tomerun el-adoneykhem khoh amar yehovah al-tiyra mifeney hadevariym asher shamaeta asher gidefu naarey melekhe-ashur votiy

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֨י נוֹתֵ֥ן בּוֹ֙ ר֔וּחַ וְשָׁמַ֥ע שְׁמוּעָ֖ה וְשָׁ֣ב אֶל־אַרְצ֑וֹ וְהִפַּלְתִּ֥יו בַּחֶ֖רֶב בְּאַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: I will delude him: He will hear a rumor and return to his land, and I will make him fall by the sword in his land.”
Transliteration: hineniy nvoten vvo rucha veshama shemuah veshav el-aretsvo vehifaletiyv vacherev vearetsvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙שׇׁב֙ רַבְשָׁקֵ֔ה וַיִּמְצָא֙ אֶת־מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר נִלְחָ֖ם עַל־לִבְנָ֑ה כִּ֣י שָׁמַ֔ע כִּ֥י נָסַ֖ע מִלָּכִֽישׁ׃
Translated: The Rabshakeh, meanwhile, heard that [the king] had left Lachish; he turned back and found the king of Assyria attacking Libnah.
Transliteration: vayashׇv raveshakeh vayimetsa et-melekhe ashur nilecham al-livenah khiy shama khiy nasa milakhiysh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֗ע עַל־תִּרְהָ֤קָה מֶֽלֶךְ־כּוּשׁ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יָצָ֖א לְהִלָּחֵ֣ם אִתָּ֑ךְ וַיִּשְׁמַע֙ וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח מַלְאָכִ֔ים אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: But [the king of Assyria] learned that King Tirhakah of Cush had come out to fight him; and when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,
Transliteration: vayishema al-tirehakah melekhe-khush lemor yatsa lehilachem itakhe vayishema vayishelach maleakhiym el-chizekiyahu lemor

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה תֹאמְר֗וּן אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֤הוּ מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַל־יַשִּׁאֲךָ֣ אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֛ה בּוֹטֵ֥חַ בּ֖וֹ לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹ֤א תִנָּתֵן֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם בְּיַ֖ד מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: “Tell this to King Hezekiah of Judah: Do not let your God, on whom you are relying, mislead you into thinking that Jerusalem will not be delivered into the hands of the king of Assyria.
Transliteration: khoh tomerun el-chizekiyahu melekhe-yehudah lemor al-yashiakha eloheykha asher atah vvotecha vvo lemor lo tinaten yerushala͏im veyad melekhe ashur

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ אַתָּ֣ה שָׁמַ֗עְתָּ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשׂ֜וּ מַלְכֵ֥י אַשּׁ֛וּר לְכׇל־הָאֲרָצ֖וֹת לְהַחֲרִימָ֑ם וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּנָּצֵֽל׃
Translated: You yourself have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all the lands, how they have annihilated them; and can you escape?
Transliteration: hineh atah shamaeta asher ashu malekhey ashur lekhׇl-haaratsvot lehachariymam veatah tinatsel

Hebrew: הַהִצִּ֨ילוּ אוֹתָ֜ם אֱלֹהֵ֤י הַגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִשְׁחִ֣יתוּ אֲבוֹתַ֔י אֶת־גּוֹזָ֖ן וְאֶת־חָרָ֑ן וְרֶ֥צֶף וּבְנֵי־עֶ֖דֶן אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּתְלַשָּֽׂר׃
Translated: Were the nations that my predecessors destroyed—Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the Bethedenites in Telassar—saved by their gods?
Transliteration: hahitsiylu votam elohey hagvoyim asher hishechiytu avvotay et-gvozan veet-charan veretsef uveney-eden asher vitelashar

Hebrew: אַיֵּ֤ה מֶֽלֶךְ־חֲמָת֙ וּמֶ֣לֶךְ אַרְפָּ֔ד וּמֶ֖לֶךְ לָעִ֣יר סְפַרְוָ֑יִם הֵנַ֖ע וְעִוָּֽה׃
Translated: Where is the king of Hamath? and the king of Arpad? and the kings of Lair, Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah?”
Transliteration: ayeh melekhe-chamat umelekhe arefad umelekhe laiyr sefarevayiim hena veivah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח חִזְקִיָּ֧הוּ אֶת־הַסְּפָרִ֛ים מִיַּ֥ד הַמַּלְאָכִ֖ים וַיִּקְרָאֵ֑הוּ וַיַּ֙עַל֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּפְרְשֵׂ֥הוּ חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Hezekiah received the letter from the messengers and read it. Hezekiah then went up to the House of G<small>OD</small> and spread it out before G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayikach chizekiyahu et-hasefariym miyad hamaleakhiym vayikeraehu vayaal veyt yehovah vayifereshehu chizekiyahu lifeney yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפַּלֵּל֙ חִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And Hezekiah prayed to G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: vayitefalel chizekiyahu el-yehovah lemor

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ יֹשֵׁ֣ב הַכְּרֻבִ֔ים אַתָּה־ה֤וּא הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ לְבַדְּךָ֔ לְכֹ֖ל מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הָאָ֑רֶץ אַתָּ֣ה עָשִׂ֔יתָ אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וְאֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: “O G<small>OD</small> of Hosts—God of Israel—Enthroned on the Cherubim! You alone are God of all the kingdoms of the earth. You made the heavens and the earth.
Transliteration: yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael yoshev hakheruviym atah-hu haElohim levadekha lekhol mamelekhvot haarets atah ashiyta et-hashamayiim veet-haarets

Hebrew: הַטֵּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֤ה <small>׀</small> אׇזְנְךָ֙ וּֽשְׁמָ֔ע פְּקַ֧ח יְהֹוָ֛ה עֵינֶ֖ךָ וּרְאֵ֑ה וּשְׁמַ֗ע אֵ֚ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י סַנְחֵרִ֔יב אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁלַ֔ח לְחָרֵ֖ף אֱלֹהִ֥ים חָֽי׃
Translated: O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, incline Your ear and hear, open Your eye and see. Hear all the words that Sennacherib has sent to blaspheme the living God!
Transliteration: hateh yehovah <small></small> ׇzenekha ushema fekach yehovah eynekha ureeh ushema et khׇl-diverey sanecheriyv asher shalach lecharef Elohim chay

Hebrew: אׇמְנָ֖ם יְהֹוָ֑ה הֶחֱרִ֜יבוּ מַלְכֵ֥י אַשּׁ֛וּר אֶת־כׇּל־הָאֲרָצ֖וֹת וְאֶת־אַרְצָֽם׃
Translated: True, O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, the kings of Assyria have annihilated all the nations and their lands
Transliteration: ׇmenam yehovah hecheriyvu malekhey ashur et-khׇl-haaratsvot veet-aretsam

Hebrew: וְנָתֹ֥ן אֶת־אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֖ם בָּאֵ֑שׁ כִּי֩ לֹ֨א אֱלֹהִ֜ים הֵ֗מָּה כִּ֣י אִם־מַעֲשֵׂ֧ה יְדֵֽי־אָדָ֛ם עֵ֥ץ וָאֶ֖בֶן וַֽיְאַבְּדֽוּם׃
Translated: and have committed their gods to the flames and have destroyed them; for they are not gods, but the handiwork of mere mortals, wood and stone.
Transliteration: venaton et-eloheyhem vaesh khiy lo Elohim hemah khiy im-maasheh yedey-adam ets vaeven vayeavedum

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ הוֹשִׁיעֵ֖נוּ מִיָּד֑וֹ וְיֵֽדְעוּ֙ כׇּל־מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לְבַדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: But now, O E<small>TERNAL</small> One our God, deliver us from his hands, and let all the kingdoms of the earth know that You, O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, alone [are God].”
Transliteration: veatah yehovah eloheynu hvoshiyenu miyadvo veeideu khׇl-mamelekhvot haarets khiy-atah yehovah levadekha

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ יְשַֽׁעְיָ֣הוּ בֶן־אָמ֔וֹץ אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁר֙ הִתְפַּלַּ֣לְתָּ אֵלַ֔י אֶל־סַנְחֵרִ֖יב מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent this message to Hezekiah: “Thus said G<small>OD</small>, the God of Israel, to whom you have prayed, concerning King Sennacherib of Assyria—
Transliteration: vayishelach yeshaeyahu ven-amvots el-chizekiyahu lemor khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael asher hitefalaleta elay el-sanecheriyv melekhe ashur

Hebrew: זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה עָלָ֑יו בָּזָ֨ה לְךָ֜ לָעֲגָ֣ה לְךָ֗ בְּתוּלַת֙ בַּת־צִיּ֔וֹן אַחֲרֶ֙יךָ֙ רֹ֣אשׁ הֵנִ֔יעָה בַּ֖ת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
this is the word that GOD has spoken concerning him:
Fair Maiden Zion despises you,
She mocks at you;
Fair Jerusalem shakes
Her head at you.
Transliteration: zeh hadavar asher-diver yehovah alayv vazah lekha laagah lekha vetulat vat-tsiyyvon achareykha rosh heniyah vat yerushala͏im

Hebrew: אֶת־מִ֤י חֵרַ֙פְתָּ֙ וְגִדַּ֔פְתָּ וְעַל־מִ֖י הֲרִימ֣וֹתָה קּ֑וֹל וַתִּשָּׂ֥א מָר֛וֹם עֵינֶ֖יךָ אֶל־קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Whom have you blasphemed and reviled?
Against whom made loud your voice
And haughtily raised your eyes?
Against the Holy One of Israel!
Transliteration: et-miy cherafeta vegidafeta veal-miy hariymvotah kvol vatisha marvom eyneykha el-kedvosh yisherael

Hebrew: בְּיַ֣ד עֲבָדֶ֘יךָ֮ חֵרַ֣פְתָּ <small>׀</small> אֲדֹנָי֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר בְּרֹ֥ב רִכְבִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י עָלִ֛יתִי מְר֥וֹם הָרִ֖ים יַרְכְּתֵ֣י לְבָנ֑וֹן וְאֶכְרֹ֞ת קוֹמַ֤ת אֲרָזָיו֙ מִבְחַ֣ר בְּרֹשָׁ֔יו וְאָבוֹא֙ מְר֣וֹם קִצּ֔וֹ יַ֖עַר כַּרְמִלּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Through your servants you have blasphemed the Sovereign.
Because you thought,
‘Thanks to my vast chariotry,
It is I who have climbed the highest mountains,
To the remotest parts of the Lebanon,
And have cut down its loftiest cedars,
Its choicest cypresses,
And have reached its highest peak,
Its densest forest.
Transliteration: veyad avadeykha cherafeta <small></small> adonay vatomer verov rikheviy aniy aliytiy mervom hariym yarekhetey levanvon veekherot kvomat arazayv mivechar veroshayv veavvo mervom kitsvo yaar kharemilvo

Hebrew: אֲנִ֥י קַ֖רְתִּי וְשָׁתִ֣יתִי מָ֑יִם וְאַחְרִב֙ בְּכַף־פְּעָמַ֔י כֹּ֖ל יְאֹרֵ֥י מָצֽוֹר׃
Translated:
It is I who have drawn
And drunk water.
I have dried up with the soles of my feet
All the streams of Egypt.’
Transliteration: aniy karetiy veshatiytiy mayiim veacheriv vekhaf-feamay khol yeorey matsvor

Hebrew: הֲלֽוֹא־שָׁמַ֤עְתָּ לְמֵֽרָחוֹק֙ אוֹתָ֣הּ עָשִׂ֔יתִי מִ֥ימֵי קֶ֖דֶם וִיצַרְתִּ֑יהָ עַתָּ֣ה הֲבֵאתִ֔יהָ וּתְהִ֗י לְהַשְׁא֛וֹת גַּלִּ֥ים נִצִּ֖ים עָרִ֥ים בְּצֻרֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Have you not heard? Of old
I planned that very thing,
I designed it long ago,
And now have fulfilled it.
And it has come to pass,
Laying fortified towns waste in desolate heaps.
Transliteration: halvo-shamaeta lemerachvok votah ashiytiy miymey kedem viytsaretiyha atah havetiyha utehiy lehashevot galiym nitsiym ariym vetsurvot

Hebrew: וְיֹֽשְׁבֵיהֶן֙ קִצְרֵי־יָ֔ד חַ֖תּוּ וָבֹ֑שׁוּ הָי֞וּ עֵ֤שֶׂב שָׂדֶה֙ וִ֣ירַק דֶּ֔שֶׁא חֲצִ֣יר גַּגּ֔וֹת וּשְׁדֵמָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י קָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Their inhabitants are helpless,
Dismayed and shamed.
They were but grass of the field
And green herbage,
Grass of the roofs that is blasted
Before the east wind.
Transliteration: veyosheveyhen kitserey-yad chatu vavoshu hayu eshev shadeh viyrak deshe chatsiyr gagvot ushedemah lifeney kamah

Hebrew: וְשִׁבְתְּךָ֛ וְצֵאתְךָ֥ וּבוֹאֲךָ֖ יָדָ֑עְתִּי וְאֵ֖ת הִֽתְרַגֶּזְךָ֥ אֵלָֽי׃
Translated:
I know your stayings
And your goings and comings,
And how you have raged against Me,
Transliteration: veshivetekha vetsetekha uvvoakha yadaetiy veet hiteragezekha elay

Hebrew: יַ֚עַן הִתְרַגֶּזְךָ֣ אֵלַ֔י וְשַׁאֲנַנְךָ֖ עָלָ֣ה בְאׇזְנָ֑י וְשַׂמְתִּ֨י חַחִ֜י בְּאַפֶּ֗ךָ וּמִתְגִּי֙ בִּשְׂפָתֶ֔יךָ וַהֲשִׁ֣יבֹתִ֔יךָ בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥אתָ בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
Because you have raged against Me,
And your tumult has reached My ears,
I will place My hook in your nose
And My bit between your jaws;
And I will make you go back by the road
By which you came.
Transliteration: yaan hiteragezekha elay veshaananekha alah veׇzenay veshametiy chachiy veafekha umitegiy vishefateykha vahashiyvotiykha vaderekhe asher-vata vah

Hebrew: וְזֶה־לְּךָ֣ הָא֔וֹת אָכ֤וֹל הַשָּׁנָה֙ סָפִ֔יחַ וּבַשָּׁנָ֥ה הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית שָׁחִ֑יס וּבַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֗ית זִרְע֧וּ וְקִצְר֛וּ וְנִטְע֥וּ כְרָמִ֖ים (ואכול) [וְאִכְל֥וּ] פִרְיָֽם׃
Translated: “And this is the sign for you: This year you eat what grows of itself, and the next year what springs from that, and in the third year sow and reap and plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
Transliteration: vezeh-lekha havot akhvol hashanah safiycha uvashanah hasheniyt shachiys uvashanah hasheliyshiyt zireu vekitseru veniteu kheramiym (vkhvl) [veikhelu] fireyam

Hebrew: וְיָ֨סְפָ֜ה פְּלֵיטַ֧ת בֵּית־יְהוּדָ֛ה הַנִּשְׁאָרָ֖ה שֹׁ֣רֶשׁ לְמָ֑טָּה וְעָשָׂ֥ה פְרִ֖י לְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: And the survivors of the House of Judah that have escaped shall renew its trunk below and produce boughs above.
Transliteration: veyasefah feleytat veyt-yehudah hanishearah shoresh lematah veashah feriy lemaelah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ תֵּצֵ֣א שְׁאֵרִ֔ית וּפְלֵיטָ֖ה מֵהַ֣ר צִיּ֑וֹן קִנְאַ֛ת יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת תַּעֲשֶׂה־זֹּֽאת׃ {ס}
Translated:
For a remnant shall come forth from Jerusalem,
Survivors from Mount Zion.
The zeal of GOD of Hosts
Shall bring this to pass.
Transliteration: khiy miyrushala͏im tetse sheeriyt ufeleytah mehar tsiyyvon kineat yehovah tsevavot taasheh-zot {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר לֹ֤א יָבוֹא֙ אֶל־הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את וְלֹא־יוֹרֶ֥ה שָׁ֖ם חֵ֑ץ וְלֹֽא־יְקַדְּמֶ֣נָּה מָגֵ֔ן וְלֹֽא־יִשְׁפֹּ֥ךְ עָלֶ֖יהָ סֹלְלָֽה׃
Translated:
“Assuredly, thus said GOD concerning the king of Assyria:
He shall not enter this city;
He shall not shoot an arrow at it,
Or advance upon it with a shield,
Or pile up a siege mound against it.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah el-melekhe ashur lo yavvo el-haiyr hazot velo-yvoreh sham chets velo-yekademenah magen velo-yishefokhe aleyha solelah

Hebrew: בַּדֶּ֥רֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֖א בָּ֣הּ יָשׁ֑וּב וְאֶל־הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֛את לֹ֥א יָב֖וֹא נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
He shall go back
By the way he came,
He shall not enter this city
—declares GOD;
Transliteration: vaderekhe asher-va vah yashuv veel-haiyr hazot lo yavvo neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וְגַנּוֹתִ֛י עַל־הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֖את לְהֽוֹשִׁיעָ֑הּ לְמַֽעֲנִ֔י וּלְמַ֖עַן דָּוִ֥ד עַבְדִּֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
I will protect and save this city for My sake
And for the sake of My servant David.”
Transliteration: veganvotiy al-haiyr hazot lehvoshiyah lemaaniy ulemaan david avediy {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֣א ׀ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיַּכֶּה֙ בְּמַחֲנֵ֣ה אַשּׁ֔וּר מֵאָ֛ה וּשְׁמֹנִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּׁ֖ה אָ֑לֶף וַיַּשְׁכִּ֣ימוּ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וְהִנֵּ֥ה כֻלָּ֖ם פְּגָרִ֥ים מֵתִֽים׃
Translated: [That night] an angel of G<small>OD</small> went out and struck down one hundred and eighty-five thousand in the Assyrian camp, and the following morning they were all dead corpses.
Transliteration: vayetse maleakhe yehovah vayakheh vemachaneh ashur meah ushemoniym vachamishah alef vayashekhiymu vavoker vehineh khulam fegariym metiym

Hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֣ע וַיֵּ֔לֶךְ וַיָּ֖שׇׁב סַנְחֵרִ֣יב מֶלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֑וּר וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בְּנִֽינְוֵֽה׃
Translated: So King Sennacherib of Assyria broke camp and retreated, and stayed in Nineveh.
Transliteration: vayisa vayelekhe vayashׇv sanecheriyv melekhe-ashur vayeshev veniyneveh

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ ה֨וּא מִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֜ה בֵּ֣ית ׀ נִסְרֹ֣ךְ אֱלֹהָ֗יו וְֽאַדְרַמֶּ֨לֶךְ וְשַׂרְאֶ֤צֶר בָּנָיו֙ הִכֻּ֣הוּ בַחֶ֔רֶב וְהֵ֥מָּה נִמְלְט֖וּ אֶ֣רֶץ אֲרָרָ֑ט וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אֵסַר־חַדֹּ֥ן בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: While he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch, he was struck down with the sword by his sons Adrammelech and Sarezer. They fled to the land of Ararat, and his son Esarhaddon succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayehiy hu mishetachaveh veyt niserokhe elohayv veaderamelekhe veshareetser vanayv hikhuhu vacherev vehemah nimeletu erets ararat vayimelokhe esar-chadon venvo tachetayv {s}

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם חָלָ֥ה חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ לָמ֑וּת וַיָּב֣וֹא אֵ֠לָ֠יו יְשַֽׁעְיָ֨הוּ בֶן־אָמ֜וֹץ הַנָּבִ֗יא וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ צַ֣ו לְבֵיתֶ֔ךָ כִּ֛י מֵ֥ת אַתָּ֖ה וְלֹ֥א תִֽחְיֶֽה׃
Translated: In those days Hezekiah fell dangerously ill. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz came and said to him, “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Set your affairs in order, for you are going to die; you will not get well.”
Transliteration: vayamiym hahem chalah chizekiyahu lamut vayavvo elayv yeshaeyahu ven-amvots hanaviy vayomer elayv khoh-amar yehovah tsav leveytekha khiy met atah velo ticheyeh

Hebrew: וַיַּסֵּ֧ב חִזְקִיָּ֛הוּ פָּנָ֖יו אֶל־הַקִּ֑יר וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֖ל אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Thereupon Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayasev chizekiyahu fanayv el-hakiyr vayitefalel el-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֗ר אָנָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ זְכׇר־נָ֞א אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁ֧ר הִתְהַלַּ֣כְתִּי לְפָנֶ֗יךָ בֶּֽאֱמֶת֙ וּבְלֵ֣ב שָׁלֵ֔ם וְהַטּ֥וֹב בְּעֵינֶ֖יךָ עָשִׂ֑יתִי וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ בְּכִ֥י גָדֽוֹל׃ {ס}
Translated: “Please, O E<small>TERNAL</small> One,” he said, “remember how I have walked before You sincerely and wholeheartedly, and have done what is pleasing to You.” And Hezekiah wept profusely.
Transliteration: vayomar anah yehovah zekhׇr-na et asher hitehalakhetiy lefaneykha veemet uvelev shalem vehatvov veeyneykha ashiytiy vayevekhe chizekiyahu vekhiy gadvol {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶֽל־יְשַֽׁעְיָ֖הוּ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then the word of G<small>OD</small> came to Isaiah:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yeshaeyahu lemor

Hebrew: הָל֞וֹךְ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֗הוּ כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵי֙ דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֔יךָ שָׁמַ֙עְתִּי֙ אֶת־תְּפִלָּתֶ֔ךָ רָאִ֖יתִי אֶת־דִּמְעָתֶ֑ךָ הִנְנִי֙ יוֹסִ֣ף עַל־יָמֶ֔יךָ חֲמֵ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: “Go and tell Hezekiah: Thus said G<small>OD</small>, the God of your forefather David: I have heard your prayer, I have seen your tears. I hereby add fifteen years to your life.
Transliteration: halvokhe veamareta el-chizekiyahu khoh-amar yehovah elohey david aviykha shamaetiy et-tefilatekha raiytiy et-dimeatekha hineniy yvosif al-yameykha chamesh eshereh shanah

Hebrew: וּמִכַּ֤ף מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁוּר֙ אַצִּ֣ילְךָ֔ וְאֵ֖ת הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֑את וְגַנּוֹתִ֖י עַל־הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: I will also rescue you and this city from the hands of the king of Assyria. I will protect this city.
Transliteration: umikhaf melekhe-ashur atsiylekha veet haiyr hazot veganvotiy al-haiyr hazot

Hebrew: וְזֶה־לְּךָ֥ הָא֖וֹת מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר֙ יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽר׃
Translated: And this is the sign for you from G<small>OD</small> that G<small>OD</small> will do the thing that was promised:
Transliteration: vezeh-lekha havot meet yehovah asher yaasheh yehovah et-hadavar hazeh asher diver

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֣י מֵשִׁ֣יב אֶת־צֵ֣ל הַֽמַּעֲל֡וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָרְדָה֩ בְמַעֲל֨וֹת אָחָ֥ז בַּשֶּׁ֛מֶשׁ אֲחֹרַנִּ֖ית עֶ֣שֶׂר מַעֲל֑וֹת וַתָּ֤שׇׁב הַשֶּׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ עֶ֣שֶׂר מַעֲל֔וֹת בַּֽמַּעֲל֖וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָרָֽדָה׃ {ס}
Translated: I am going to make the shadow on the steps, which has descended on the dial of Ahaz because of the sun, recede ten steps.” And the sun[’s shadow] receded ten steps, the same steps as it had descended.
Transliteration: hineniy meshiyv et-tsel hamaalvot asher yaredah vemaalvot achaz vashemesh achoraniyt esher maalvot vatashׇv hashemesh esher maalvot vamaalvot asher yaradah {s}

Hebrew: מִכְתָּ֖ב לְחִזְקִיָּ֣הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֑ה בַּחֲלֹת֕וֹ וַיְחִ֖י מֵחׇלְיֽוֹ׃
Translated: A poem by King Hezekiah of Judah when he recovered from the illness he had suffered:
Transliteration: mikhetav lechizekiyahu melekhe-yehudah vachalotvo vayechiy mechׇleyvo

Hebrew: אֲנִ֣י אָמַ֗רְתִּי בִּדְמִ֥י יָמַ֛י אֵלֵ֖כָה בְּשַׁעֲרֵ֣י שְׁא֑וֹל פֻּקַּ֖דְתִּי יֶ֥תֶר שְׁנוֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
I had thought:
I must depart in the middle of my days;
I have been consigned to the gates of Sheol
For the rest of my years.
Transliteration: aniy amaretiy videmiy yamay elekhah veshaarey shevol fukadetiy yeter shenvotay

Hebrew: אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ לֹא־אֶרְאֶ֣ה יָ֔הּ יָ֖הּ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ הַחַיִּ֑ים לֹא־אַבִּ֥יט אָדָ֛ם ע֖וֹד עִם־י֥וֹשְׁבֵי חָֽדֶל׃
Translated:
I thought, I shall never see Yah,
Yah in the land of the living,
Or ever behold humans again
Among those who inhabit the earth.
Transliteration: amaretiy lo-ereeh yah yah veerets hachayiym lo-aviyt adam vod im-yvoshevey chadel

Hebrew: דּוֹרִ֗י נִסַּ֧ע וְנִגְלָ֛ה מִנִּ֖י כְּאֹ֣הֶל רֹעִ֑י קִפַּ֨דְתִּי כָאֹרֵ֤ג חַיַּי֙ מִדַּלָּ֣ה יְבַצְּעֵ֔נִי מִיּ֥וֹם עַד־לַ֖יְלָה תַּשְׁלִימֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
My dwelling is pulled up and removed from me
Like a tent of shepherds;
My life is rolled up like a web
And cut from the thrum.
Only from daybreak to nightfall
Was I kept whole,
Transliteration: dvoriy nisa venigelah miniy kheohel roiy kifadetiy khaoreg chayay midalah yevatseeniy miyyvom ad-layelah tasheliymeniy

Hebrew: שִׁוִּ֤יתִי עַד־בֹּ֙קֶר֙ כָּאֲרִ֔י כֵּ֥ן יְשַׁבֵּ֖ר כׇּל־עַצְמוֹתָ֑י מִיּ֥וֹם עַד־לַ֖יְלָה תַּשְׁלִימֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Then it was as though a lion
Were breaking all my bones;
I cried out until morning.
(Only from daybreak to nightfall
Was I kept whole.)
Transliteration: shiviytiy ad-voker khaariy khen yeshaver khׇl-atsemvotay miyyvom ad-layelah tasheliymeniy

Hebrew: כְּס֤וּס עָגוּר֙ כֵּ֣ן אֲצַפְצֵ֔ף אֶהְגֶּ֖ה כַּיּוֹנָ֑ה דַּלּ֤וּ עֵינַי֙ לַמָּר֔וֹם אֲדֹנָ֖י עָֽשְׁקָה־לִּ֥י עׇרְבֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
I piped like a swift or a swallow,
I moaned like a dove,
As my eyes, all worn, looked to heaven:
“My Sovereign, I am in straits;
Be my surety!”
Transliteration: khesus agur khen atsafetsef ehegeh khayyvonah dalu eynay lamarvom adonay ashekah-liy ׇreveniy

Hebrew: מָֽה־אֲדַבֵּ֥ר וְאָֽמַר־לִ֖י וְה֣וּא עָשָׂ֑ה אֶדַּדֶּ֥ה כׇל־שְׁנוֹתַ֖י עַל־מַ֥ר נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
What can I say? It had been promised me,
By the One who has wrought it.
All my sleep had fled
Because of the bitterness of my soul.
Transliteration: mah-adaver veamar-liy vehu ashah edadeh khׇl-shenvotay al-mar nafeshiy

Hebrew: אֲדֹנָ֖י עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם יִֽחְי֑וּ וּלְכׇל־בָּהֶן֙ חַיֵּ֣י רוּחִ֔י וְתַחֲלִימֵ֖נִי וְהַחֲיֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
My Sovereign, for all that and despite it
My life-breath is revived;
You have restored me to health and revived me.
Transliteration: adonay aleyhem yicheyu ulekhׇl-vahen chayey ruchiy vetachaliymeniy vehachaeiniy

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה לְשָׁל֖וֹם מַר־לִ֣י מָ֑ר וְאַתָּ֞ה חָשַׁ֤קְתָּ נַפְשִׁי֙ מִשַּׁ֣חַת בְּלִ֔י כִּ֥י הִשְׁלַ֛כְתָּ אַחֲרֵ֥י גֵוְךָ֖ כׇּל־חֲטָאָֽי׃
Translated:
Truly, it was for my own good
That I had such great bitterness:
You saved my life
From the pit of destruction,
For You have cast behind Your back
All my offenses.
Transliteration: hineh leshalvom mar-liy mar veatah chashaketa nafeshiy mishachat veliy khiy hishelakheta acharey gevekha khׇl-chataay

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֥א שְׁא֛וֹל תּוֹדֶ֖ךָּ מָ֣וֶת יְהַלְלֶ֑ךָּ לֹא־יְשַׂבְּר֥וּ יוֹרְדֵי־ב֖וֹר אֶל־אֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
For it is not Sheol that praises You,
Not [the Land of] Death that extols You;
Nor do they who descend into the Pit
Hope for Your grace.
Transliteration: khiy lo shevol tvodekha mavet yehalelekha lo-yeshaveru yvoredey-vvor el-amitekha

Hebrew: חַ֥י חַ֛י ה֥וּא יוֹדֶ֖ךָ כָּמ֣וֹנִי הַיּ֑וֹם אָ֣ב לְבָנִ֔ים יוֹדִ֖יעַ אֶל־אֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
The living, only the living
Can give thanks to You
As I do this day;
Fathers relate to children
Your acts of grace:
Transliteration: chay chay hu yvodekha khamvoniy hayyvom av levaniym yvodiya el-amitekha

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֖ה לְהוֹשִׁיעֵ֑נִי וּנְגִנוֹתַ֧י נְנַגֵּ֛ן כׇּל־יְמֵ֥י חַיֵּ֖ינוּ עַל־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
“[It has pleased] GOD to deliver us,
That is why we offer up music
All the days of our lives
At the House of GOD.”
Transliteration: yehovah lehvoshiyeniy uneginvotay nenagen khׇl-yemey chayeynu al-veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְשַֽׁעְיָ֔הוּ יִשְׂא֖וּ דְּבֶ֣לֶת תְּאֵנִ֑ים וְיִמְרְח֥וּ עַֽל־הַשְּׁחִ֖ין וְיֶֽחִי׃
Translated: When Isaiah said, “Let them take a cake of figs and apply it to the rash, and he will recover,”
Transliteration: vayomer yeshaeyahu yisheu develet teeniym veyimerechu al-hashechiyn veyechiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ מָ֣ה א֑וֹת כִּ֥י אֶעֱלֶ֖ה בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Hezekiah asked, “What will be the sign that I shall go up to the House of G<small>OD</small>?”
Transliteration: vayomer chizekiyahu mah vot khiy eeleh veyt yehovah {s}

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֡יא שָׁלַ֡ח מְרֹדַ֣ךְ בַּ֠לְאֲדָ֠ן בֶּֽן־בַּלְאֲדָ֧ן מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֛ל סְפָרִ֥ים וּמִנְחָ֖ה אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֑הוּ וַיִּשְׁמַ֕ע כִּ֥י חָלָ֖ה וַֽיֶּחֱזָֽק׃
Translated: At that time, Merodach-baladan son of Baladan, the king of Babylon, sent [envoys with] a letter and a gift to Hezekiah, for he had heard about his illness and recovery.
Transliteration: vaet hahiy shalach merodakhe valeadan ven-valeadan melekhe-vavel sefariym uminechah el-chizekiyahu vayishema khiy chalah vayechezak

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂמַ֣ח עֲלֵיהֶם֮ חִזְקִיָּ֒הוּ֒ וַיַּרְאֵ֣ם אֶת־בֵּ֣ית נְכֹתֹ֡ה אֶת־הַכֶּסֶף֩ וְאֶת־הַזָּהָ֨ב וְאֶת־הַבְּשָׂמִ֜ים וְאֵ֣ת ׀ הַשֶּׁ֣מֶן הַטּ֗וֹב וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִמְצָ֖א בְּאֹצְרֹתָ֑יו לֹא־הָיָ֣ה דָבָ֗ר אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹֽא־הֶרְאָ֧ם חִזְקִיָּ֛הוּ בְּבֵית֖וֹ וּבְכׇל־מֶמְשַׁלְתּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: Hezekiah was pleased by their coming, and he showed them his treasure house—the silver, the gold, the spices, and the fragrant oil—and all his armory, and everything that was to be found in his storehouses. There was nothing in his palace or in all his realm that Hezekiah did not show them.
Transliteration: vayishemach aleyhem chizekiyahu vayareem et-veyt nekhotoh et-hakhesef veet-hazahav veet-haveshamiym veet hashemen hatvov veet khׇl-veyt khelayv veet khׇl-asher nimetsa veotserotayv lo-hayah davar asher lo-heream chizekiyahu veveytvo uvekhׇl-memeshaletvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ יְשַֽׁעְיָ֣הוּ הַנָּבִ֔יא אֶל־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ חִזְקִיָּ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו מָ֥ה אָמְר֣וּ ׀ הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה וּמֵאַ֙יִן֙ יָבֹ֣אוּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ חִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ מֵאֶ֧רֶץ רְחוֹקָ֛ה בָּ֥אוּ אֵלַ֖י מִבָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: Then the prophet Isaiah came to King Hezekiah. “What,” he demanded of him, “did those men say to you? Where have they come to you from?” “They have come to me,” replied Hezekiah, “from a far country, from Babylon.”
Transliteration: vayavo yeshaeyahu hanaviy el-hamelekhe chizekiyahu vayomer elayv mah ameru haanashiym haeleh umeayiin yavou eleykha vayomer chizekiyahu meerets rechvokah vau elay mivavel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מָ֥ה רָא֖וּ בְּבֵיתֶ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר חִזְקִיָּ֗הוּ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֤ר בְּבֵיתִי֙ רָא֔וּ לֹא־הָיָ֥ה דָבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־הִרְאִיתִ֖ים בְּאוֹצְרֹתָֽי׃
Translated: Next he asked, “What have they seen in your palace?” And Hezekiah replied, “They have seen everything there is in my palace. There was nothing in my storehouses that I did not show them.”
Transliteration: vayomer mah rau veveytekha vayomer chizekiyahu et khׇl-asher veveytiy rau lo-hayah davar asher lo-hireiytiym vevotserotay

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְשַֽׁעְיָ֖הוּ אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֑הוּ שְׁמַ֖ע דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃
Translated: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of G<small>OD</small> of Hosts:
Transliteration: vayomer yeshaeyahu el-chizekiyahu shema devar-yehovah tsevavot

Hebrew: הִנֵּה֮ יָמִ֣ים בָּאִים֒ וְנִשָּׂ֣א ׀ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּבֵיתֶ֗ךָ וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר אָצְר֧וּ אֲבֹתֶ֛יךָ עַד־הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה בָּבֶ֑ל לֹֽא־יִוָּתֵ֥ר דָּבָ֖ר אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: A time is coming when everything in your palace, which your ancestors have stored up to this day, will be carried off to Babylon; nothing will be left behind, said G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: hineh yamiym vaiym venisha khׇl-asher veveytekha vaasher atseru avoteykha ad-hayyvom hazeh vavel lo-yivater davar amar yehovah

Hebrew: וּמִבָּנֶ֜יךָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יֵצְא֧וּ מִמְּךָ֛ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תּוֹלִ֖יד יִקָּ֑חוּ וְהָיוּ֙ סָרִיסִ֔ים בְּהֵיכַ֖ל מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: And some of your sons, your own issue, whom you will have fathered, will be taken to serve as eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.”
Transliteration: umivaneykha asher eitseu mimekha asher tvoliyd yikachu vehayu sariysiym veheykhal melekhe vavel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר חִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ אֶֽל־יְשַׁעְיָ֔הוּ ט֥וֹב דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבַּ֑רְתָּ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֥י יִהְיֶ֛ה שָׁל֥וֹם וֶאֱמֶ֖ת בְּיָמָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: Hezekiah declared to Isaiah, “The word of G<small>OD</small> that you have spoken is good.” For he thought, “It means that safety is assured for my time.”
Transliteration: vayomer chizekiyahu el-yeshaeyahu tvov devar-yehovah asher divareta vayomer khiy yiheyeh shalvom veemet veyamay {f}

Hebrew: נַחֲמ֥וּ נַחֲמ֖וּ עַמִּ֑י יֹאמַ֖ר אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Comfort, oh comfort My people,
Says your God.
Transliteration: nachamu nachamu amiy yomar eloheykhem

Hebrew: דַּבְּר֞וּ עַל־לֵ֤ב יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ וְקִרְא֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יהָ כִּ֤י מָֽלְאָה֙ צְבָאָ֔הּ כִּ֥י נִרְצָ֖ה עֲוֺנָ֑הּ כִּ֤י לָֽקְחָה֙ מִיַּ֣ד יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּפְלַ֖יִם בְּכׇל־חַטֹּאתֶֽיהָ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Speak tenderly to Jerusalem,
And declare to her
That her term of service is over,
That her iniquity is expiated;
For she has received at GOD’s hand
Double for all her sins.
Transliteration: daveru al-lev yerushala͏im vekireu eleyha khiy maleah tsevaah khiy niretsah avonah khiy lakechah miyad yehovah khifelayiim vekhׇl-chatoteyha {s}

Hebrew: ק֣וֹל קוֹרֵ֔א בַּמִּדְבָּ֕ר פַּנּ֖וּ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה יַשְּׁרוּ֙ בָּעֲרָבָ֔ה מְסִלָּ֖ה לֵאלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
A voice rings out:
“Clear in the desert
A road for GOD!
Level in the wilderness
A highway for our God!
Transliteration: kvol kvore vamidevar fanu derekhe yehovah yasheru vaaravah mesilah leloheynu

Hebrew: כׇּל־גֶּיא֙ יִנָּשֵׂ֔א וְכׇל־הַ֥ר וְגִבְעָ֖ה יִשְׁפָּ֑לוּ וְהָיָ֤ה הֶֽעָקֹב֙ לְמִישׁ֔וֹר וְהָרְכָסִ֖ים לְבִקְעָֽה׃
Translated:
Let every valley be raised,
Every hill and mount made low.
Let the rugged ground become level
And the ridges become a plain.
Transliteration: khׇl-gey yinashe vekhׇl-har vegiveah yishefalu vehayah heakov lemiyshvor veharekhasiym levikeah

Hebrew: וְנִגְלָ֖ה כְּב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֑ה וְרָא֤וּ כׇל־בָּשָׂר֙ יַחְדָּ֔ו כִּ֛י פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבֵּֽר׃ {פ}
Translated:
The Presence of GOD shall appear,
And all flesh, as one, shall behold—
For GOD has spoken.”
Transliteration: venigelah khevvod yehovah verau khׇl-vashar yachedav khiy fiy yehovah diver {f}

Hebrew: ק֚וֹל אֹמֵ֣ר קְרָ֔א וְאָמַ֖ר מָ֣ה אֶקְרָ֑א כׇּל־הַבָּשָׂ֣ר חָצִ֔יר וְכׇל־חַסְדּ֖וֹ כְּצִ֥יץ הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated:
A voice rings out: “Proclaim!”
Another asks, “What shall I proclaim?”
“All flesh is grass,
All its goodness like flowers of the field:
Transliteration: kvol omer kera veamar mah ekera khׇl-havashar chatsiyr vekhׇl-chasedvo khetsiyts hashadeh

Hebrew: יָבֵ֤שׁ חָצִיר֙ נָ֣בֵֽל־צִ֔יץ כִּ֛י ר֥וּחַ יְהֹוָ֖ה נָ֣שְׁבָה בּ֑וֹ אָכֵ֥ן חָצִ֖יר הָעָֽם׃
Translated:
Grass withers, flowers fade
When GOD’s breath blows on them.
Indeed, people are but grass:
Transliteration: yavesh chatsiyr navel-tsiyts khiy rucha yehovah nashevah vvo akhen chatsiyr haam

Hebrew: יָבֵ֥שׁ חָצִ֖יר נָ֣בֵֽל צִ֑יץ וּדְבַר־אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ יָק֥וּם לְעוֹלָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Grass withers, flowers fade—
But the word of our God is always fulfilled!”
Transliteration: yavesh chatsiyr navel tsiyts udevar-eloheynu yakum levolam {s}

Hebrew: עַ֣ל הַר־גָּבֹ֤הַּ עֲלִי־לָךְ֙ מְבַשֶּׂ֣רֶת צִיּ֔וֹן הָרִ֤ימִי בַכֹּ֙חַ֙ קוֹלֵ֔ךְ מְבַשֶּׂ֖רֶת יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם הָרִ֙ימִי֙ אַל־תִּירָ֔אִי אִמְרִי֙ לְעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה הִנֵּ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Ascend a lofty mountain,
O herald of joy to Zion;
Raise your voice with power,
O herald of joy to Jerusalem—
Raise it, have no fear;
Announce to the cities of Judah:
Behold your God!
Transliteration: al har-gavoha aliy-lakhe mevasheret tsiyyvon hariymiy vakhocha kvolekhe mevasheret yerushala͏im hariymiy al-tiyraiy imeriy learey yehudah hineh eloheykhem

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ בְּחָזָ֣ק יָב֔וֹא וּזְרֹע֖וֹ מֹ֣שְׁלָה ל֑וֹ הִנֵּ֤ה שְׂכָרוֹ֙ אִתּ֔וֹ וּפְעֻלָּת֖וֹ לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated:
Behold, my Sovereign GOD comes in might—
Whose arm wins triumph;
See, [God] has brought along the reward,
The recompense is in view.
Transliteration: hineh adonay yehovih vechazak yavvo uzerovo moshelah lvo hineh shekharvo itvo ufeulatvo lefanayv

Hebrew: כְּרֹעֶה֙ עֶדְר֣וֹ יִרְעֶ֔ה בִּזְרֹעוֹ֙ יְקַבֵּ֣ץ טְלָאִ֔ים וּבְחֵיק֖וֹ יִשָּׂ֑א עָל֖וֹת יְנַהֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
Like a shepherd who pastures the flock,
[God] gathers up the lambs
And carries them in the divine bosom,
While gently driving the mother sheep.
Transliteration: kheroeh edervo yireeh vizerovo yekavets telaiym uvecheykvo yisha alvot yenahel {s}

Hebrew: מִי־מָדַ֨ד בְּשׇׁעֳל֜וֹ מַ֗יִם וְשָׁמַ֙יִם֙ בַּזֶּ֣רֶת תִּכֵּ֔ן וְכָ֥ל בַּשָּׁלִ֖שׁ עֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֑רֶץ וְשָׁקַ֤ל בַּפֶּ֙לֶס֙ הָרִ֔ים וּגְבָע֖וֹת בְּמֹאזְנָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Who measured the waters with a hand’s hollow,
And gauged the skies with a span,
And meted earth’s dust with a measure,
And weighed the mountains with a scale
And the hills with a balance?
Transliteration: miy-madad veshׇolvo mayiim veshamayiim vazeret tikhen vekhal vashalish afar haarets veshakal vafeles hariym ugevavot vemozenayiim

Hebrew: מִֽי־תִכֵּ֥ן אֶת־ר֖וּחַ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאִ֖ישׁ עֲצָת֥וֹ יוֹדִיעֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Who has plumbed the mind of GOD?
Can anyone disclose God’s plan?
Transliteration: miy-tikhen et-rucha yehovah veiysh atsatvo yvodiyenu

Hebrew: אֶת־מִ֤י נוֹעָץ֙ וַיְבִינֵ֔הוּ וַֽיְלַמְּדֵ֖הוּ בְּאֹ֣רַח מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וַיְלַמְּדֵ֣הוּ דַ֔עַת וְדֶ֥רֶךְ תְּבוּנ֖וֹת יוֹדִיעֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Whom did [God] consult, and who bestowed understanding,
Providing guidance in the way of right?
Who guided [God] in knowledge
And made known the path of wisdom?
Transliteration: et-miy nvoats vayeviynehu vayelamedehu veorach mishefat vayelamedehu daat vederekhe tevunvot yvodiyenu

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן גּוֹיִם֙ כְּמַ֣ר מִדְּלִ֔י וּכְשַׁ֥חַק מֹאזְנַ֖יִם נֶחְשָׁ֑בוּ הֵ֥ן אִיִּ֖ים כַּדַּ֥ק יִטּֽוֹל׃
Translated:
The nations are but a drop in a bucket,
Reckoned as dust on a balance;
The very coastlands are lifted like motes.
Transliteration: hen gvoyim khemar mideliy ukheshachak mozenayiim necheshavu hen iyiym khadak yitvol

Hebrew: וּלְבָנ֕וֹן אֵ֥ין דֵּ֖י בָּעֵ֑ר וְחַ֨יָּת֔וֹ אֵ֥ין דֵּ֖י עוֹלָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Lebanon is not fuel enough,
Nor its beasts enough for sacrifice.
Transliteration: ulevanvon eyn dey vaer vechayatvo eyn dey volah {f}

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֖ם כְּאַ֣יִן נֶגְדּ֑וֹ מֵאֶ֥פֶס וָתֹ֖הוּ נֶחְשְׁבוּ־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
All nations are as naught in God’s sight,
Who accounts them as less than nothing.
Transliteration: khׇl-hagvoyim kheayiin negedvo meefes vatohu necheshevu-lvo

Hebrew: וְאֶל־מִ֖י תְּדַמְּי֣וּן אֵ֑ל וּמַה־דְּמ֖וּת תַּ֥עַרְכוּ לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
To whom, then, can you liken God,
With what form can you make comparison?
Transliteration: veel-miy tedameyun el umah-demut taarekhu lvo

Hebrew: הַפֶּ֙סֶל֙ נָסַ֣ךְ חָרָ֔שׁ וְצֹרֵ֖ף בַּזָּהָ֣ב יְרַקְּעֶ֑נּוּ וּרְתֻק֥וֹת כֶּ֖סֶף צוֹרֵֽף׃
Translated:
The idol? A woodworker shaped it,
And a smith overlaid it with gold,
Forging links of silver.
Transliteration: hafesel nasakhe charash vetsoref vazahav yerakeenu uretukvot khesef tsvoref

Hebrew: הַֽמְסֻכָּ֣ן תְּרוּמָ֔ה עֵ֥ץ לֹא־יִרְקַ֖ב יִבְחָ֑ר חָרָ֤שׁ חָכָם֙ יְבַקֶּשׁ־ל֔וֹ לְהָכִ֥ין פֶּ֖סֶל לֹ֥א יִמּֽוֹט׃ {ס}
Translated:
As a gift, someone chooses the mulberry—
A wood that does not rot—
Then seeks a skillful woodworker
To make a firm idol,
That will not topple.
Transliteration: hamesukhan terumah ets lo-yirekav yivechar charash chakham yevakesh-lvo lehakhiyn fesel lo yimvot {s}

Hebrew: הֲל֤וֹא תֵֽדְעוּ֙ הֲל֣וֹא תִשְׁמָ֔עוּ הֲל֛וֹא הֻגַּ֥ד מֵרֹ֖אשׁ לָכֶ֑ם הֲלוֹא֙ הֲבִ֣ינוֹתֶ֔ם מוֹסְד֖וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Do you not know?
Have you not heard?
Have you not been told
From the very first?
Have you not discerned
How the earth was founded?
Transliteration: halvo tedeu halvo tishemau halvo hugad merosh lakhem halvo haviynvotem mvosedvot haarets

Hebrew: הַיֹּשֵׁב֙ עַל־ח֣וּג הָאָ֔רֶץ וְיֹשְׁבֶ֖יהָ כַּחֲגָבִ֑ים הַנּוֹטֶ֤ה כַדֹּק֙ שָׁמַ֔יִם וַיִּמְתָּחֵ֥ם כָּאֹ֖הֶל לָשָֽׁבֶת׃
Translated:
It is [God] who is enthroned above the vault of the earth,
So that its inhabitants seem as grasshoppers;
Who spread out the skies like gauze,
Stretched them out like a tent to dwell in—
Transliteration: hayoshev al-chug haarets veyosheveyha khachagaviym hanvoteh khadok shamayiim vayimetachem khaohel lashavet

Hebrew: הַנּוֹתֵ֥ן רוֹזְנִ֖ים לְאָ֑יִן שֹׁ֥פְטֵי אֶ֖רֶץ כַּתֹּ֥הוּ עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated:
Bringing potentates to naught,
Making rulers of the earth as nothing.
Transliteration: hanvoten rvozeniym leayiin shofetey erets khatohu ashah

Hebrew: אַ֣ף בַּל־נִטָּ֗עוּ אַ֚ף בַּל־זֹרָ֔עוּ אַ֛ף בַּל־שֹׁרֵ֥שׁ בָּאָ֖רֶץ גִּזְעָ֑ם וְגַם־נָשַׁ֤ף בָּהֶם֙ וַיִּבָ֔שׁוּ וּסְעָרָ֖ה כַּקַּ֥שׁ תִּשָּׂאֵֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Hardly are they planted,
Hardly are they sown,
Hardly has their stem
Taken root in earth,
When [God] blows upon them and they dry up,
And the storm bears them off like straw.
Transliteration: af val-nitau af val-zorau af val-shoresh vaarets gizeam vegam-nashaf vahem vayivashu usearah khakash tishaem {s}

Hebrew: וְאֶל־מִ֥י תְדַמְּי֖וּנִי וְאֶשְׁוֶ֑ה יֹאמַ֖ר קָדֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated:
To whom, then, can you liken Me,
To whom can I be compared?
—says the Holy One.
Transliteration: veel-miy tedameyuniy veesheveh yomar kadvosh

Hebrew: שְׂאוּ־מָר֨וֹם עֵינֵיכֶ֤ם וּרְאוּ֙ מִֽי־בָרָ֣א אֵ֔לֶּה הַמּוֹצִ֥יא בְמִסְפָּ֖ר צְבָאָ֑ם לְכֻלָּם֙ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יִקְרָ֔א מֵרֹ֤ב אוֹנִים֙ וְאַמִּ֣יץ כֹּ֔חַ אִ֖ישׁ לֹ֥א נֶעְדָּֽר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Lift high your eyes and see:
Who created these?
The One who sends out their host by count,
Who calls them each by name:
Given such great might and vast power,
Not a single one fails to appear.
Transliteration: sheu-marvom eyneykhem ureu miy-vara eleh hamvotsiy vemisefar tsevaam lekhulam veshem yikera merov voniym veamiyts khocha iysh lo needar {s}

Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה תֹאמַר֙ יַעֲקֹ֔ב וּתְדַבֵּ֖ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל נִסְתְּרָ֤ה דַרְכִּי֙ מֵיְהֹוָ֔ה וּמֵאֱלֹהַ֖י מִשְׁפָּטִ֥י יַעֲבֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Why do you say, O Jacob,
Why declare, O Israel,
“My way is hid from GOD,
My cause is ignored by my God”?
Transliteration: lamah tomar yaakov utedaver yisherael niseterah darekhiy meyehovah umeelohay mishefatiy yaavvor

Hebrew: הֲל֨וֹא יָדַ֜עְתָּ אִם־לֹ֣א שָׁמַ֗עְתָּ אֱלֹהֵ֨י עוֹלָ֤ם <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָה֙ בּוֹרֵא֙ קְצ֣וֹת הָאָ֔רֶץ לֹ֥א יִיעַ֖ף וְלֹ֣א יִיגָ֑ע אֵ֥ין חֵ֖קֶר לִתְבוּנָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Do you not know?
Have you not heard?
The ETERNAL is God from of old,
Creator of the earth from end to end,
Who never grows faint or weary,
Whose wisdom cannot be fathomed—
Transliteration: halvo yadaeta im-lo shamaeta elohey volam <small></small> yehovah vvore ketsvot haarets lo yiyaf velo yiyga eyn cheker litevunatvo

Hebrew: נֹתֵ֥ן לַיָּעֵ֖ף כֹּ֑חַ וּלְאֵ֥ין אוֹנִ֖ים עׇצְמָ֥ה יַרְבֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Who gives strength to the weary,
Fresh vigor to the spent.
Transliteration: noten layaef khocha uleeyn voniym ׇtsemah yareveh

Hebrew: וְיִעֲפ֥וּ נְעָרִ֖ים וְיִגָ֑עוּ וּבַחוּרִ֖ים כָּשׁ֥וֹל יִכָּשֵֽׁלוּ׃
Translated:
Youths may grow faint and weary,
And young men stumble and fall;
Transliteration: veyiafu neariym veyigau uvachuriym khashvol yikhashelu

Hebrew: וְקוֹיֵ֤ יְהֹוָה֙ יַחֲלִ֣יפוּ כֹ֔חַ יַעֲל֥וּ אֵ֖בֶר כַּנְּשָׁרִ֑ים יָר֙וּצוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א יִיגָ֔עוּ יֵלְכ֖וּ וְלֹ֥א יִיעָֽפוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
But they who trust in GOD shall renew their strength
As eagles grow new plumes:
They shall run and not grow weary,
They shall march and not grow faint.
Transliteration: vekvoei yehovah yachaliyfu khocha yaalu ever khaneshariym yarutsu velo yiygau eilekhu velo yiyafu {s}

Hebrew: הַחֲרִ֤ישׁוּ אֵלַי֙ אִיִּ֔ים וּלְאֻמִּ֖ים יַחֲלִ֣יפוּ כֹ֑חַ יִגְּשׁוּ֙ אָ֣ז יְדַבֵּ֔רוּ יַחְדָּ֖ו לַמִּשְׁפָּ֥ט נִקְרָֽבָה׃
Translated:
Stand silent before Me, coastlands,
And let nations renew their strength.
Let them approach to state their case;
Let us come forward together for argument.
Transliteration: hachariyshu elay iyiym uleumiym yachaliyfu khocha yigeshu az yedaveru yachedav lamishefat nikeravah

Hebrew: מִ֤י הֵעִיר֙ מִמִּזְרָ֔ח צֶ֖דֶק יִקְרָאֵ֣הוּ לְרַגְל֑וֹ יִתֵּ֨ן לְפָנָ֤יו גּוֹיִם֙ וּמְלָכִ֣ים יַ֔רְדְּ יִתֵּ֤ן כֶּֽעָפָר֙ חַרְבּ֔וֹ כְּקַ֥שׁ נִדָּ֖ף קַשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who has roused a victor from the East,
Summoned him to God’s service?
Has delivered up nations to him,
And trodden sovereigns down?
Has rendered their swords like dust,
Their bows like wind-blown straw?
Transliteration: miy heiyr mimizerach tsedek yikeraehu leragelvo yiten lefanayv gvoyim umelakhiym yarede yiten kheafar charevvo khekash nidaf kashetvo

Hebrew: יִרְדְּפֵ֖ם יַעֲב֣וֹר שָׁל֑וֹם אֹ֥רַח בְּרַגְלָ֖יו לֹ֥א יָבֽוֹא׃
Translated:
He pursues them, he goes on unscathed;
No shackle is placed on his feet.
Transliteration: yiredefem yaavvor shalvom orach veragelayv lo yavvo

Hebrew: מִֽי־פָעַ֣ל וְעָשָׂ֔ה קֹרֵ֥א הַדֹּר֖וֹת מֵרֹ֑אשׁ אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ רִאשׁ֔וֹן וְאֶת־אַחֲרֹנִ֖ים אֲנִי־הֽוּא׃
Translated:
Who has wrought and achieved this?
The One who announced the generations from the start—
I, GOD, who was first
And will be with the last as well.
Transliteration: miy-faal veashah kore hadorvot merosh aniy yehovah rishvon veet-acharoniym aniy-hu

Hebrew: רָא֤וּ אִיִּים֙ וְיִרָ֔אוּ קְצ֥וֹת הָאָ֖רֶץ יֶחֱרָ֑דוּ קָרְב֖וּ וַיֶּאֱתָיֽוּן׃
Translated:
The coastlands look on in fear,
The ends of earth tremble.
The craftsmen draw near and come;
Transliteration: rau iyiym veyirau ketsvot haarets yecheradu karevu vayeetayun

Hebrew: אִ֥ישׁ אֶת־רֵעֵ֖הוּ יַעְזֹ֑רוּ וּלְאָחִ֖יו יֹאמַ֥ר חֲזָֽק׃
Translated:
Each one helps the other,
Saying to his fellow, “Take courage!”
Transliteration: iysh et-reehu yaezoru uleachiyv yomar chazak

Hebrew: וַיְחַזֵּ֤ק חָרָשׁ֙ אֶת־צֹרֵ֔ף מַחֲלִ֥יק פַּטִּ֖ישׁ אֶת־ה֣וֹלֶם פָּ֑עַם אֹמֵ֤ר לַדֶּ֙בֶק֙ ט֣וֹב ה֔וּא וַיְחַזְּקֵ֥הוּ בְמַסְמְרִ֖ים לֹ֥א יִמּֽוֹט׃ {ס}
Translated:
The woodworker encourages the smith;
He who flattens with the hammer
[Encourages] him who pounds the anvil.
He says of the riveting, “It is good!”
And he fixes it with nails,
That it may not topple.
Transliteration: vayechazek charash et-tsoref machaliyk fatiysh et-hvolem faam omer ladevek tvov hu vayechazekehu vemasemeriym lo yimvot {s}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּה֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל עַבְדִּ֔י יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּחַרְתִּ֑יךָ זֶ֖רַע אַבְרָהָ֥ם אֹהֲבִֽי׃
Translated:
But you, Israel, My servant,
Jacob, whom I have chosen,
Seed of Abraham My friend—
Transliteration: veatah yisherael avediy yaakov asher vecharetiykha zera averaham ohaviy

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֶחֱזַקְתִּ֙יךָ֙ מִקְצ֣וֹת הָאָ֔רֶץ וּמֵאֲצִילֶ֖יהָ קְרָאתִ֑יךָ וָאֹ֤מַר לְךָ֙ עַבְדִּי־אַ֔תָּה בְּחַרְתִּ֖יךָ וְלֹ֥א מְאַסְתִּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You whom I drew from the ends of the earth
And called from its far corners,
To whom I said: You are My servant;
I chose you, I have not rejected you—
Transliteration: asher hechezaketiykha miketsvot haarets umeatsiyleyha keratiykha vaomar lekha avediy-atah vecharetiykha velo measetiykha

Hebrew: אַל־תִּירָא֙ כִּ֣י עִמְּךָ־אָ֔נִי אַל־תִּשְׁתָּ֖ע כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ אִמַּצְתִּ֙יךָ֙ אַף־עֲזַרְתִּ֔יךָ אַף־תְּמַכְתִּ֖יךָ בִּימִ֥ין צִדְקִֽי׃
Translated:
Fear not, for I am with you,
Be not frightened, for I am your God;
I strengthen you and I help you,
I uphold you with My victorious right hand.
Transliteration: al-tiyra khiy imekha-aniy al-tisheta khiy-aniy eloheykha imatsetiykha af-azaretiykha af-temakhetiykha viymiyn tsidekiy

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן יֵבֹ֙שׁוּ֙ וְיִכָּ֣לְמ֔וּ כֹּ֖ל הַנֶּחֱרִ֣ים בָּ֑ךְ יִהְי֥וּ כְאַ֛יִן וְיֹאבְד֖וּ אַנְשֵׁ֥י רִיבֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Shamed and chagrined shall be
All who contend with you;
They who strive with you
Shall become as naught and shall perish.
Transliteration: hen eivoshu veyikhalemu khol hanecheriym vakhe yiheyu kheayiin veyovedu aneshey riyvekha

Hebrew: תְּבַקְשֵׁם֙ וְלֹ֣א תִמְצָאֵ֔ם אַנְשֵׁ֖י מַצֻּתֶ֑ךָ יִהְי֥וּ כְאַ֛יִן וּכְאֶ֖פֶס אַנְשֵׁ֥י מִלְחַמְתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
You may seek, but shall not find
Those who struggle with you;
Less than nothing shall be
The men who battle against you.
Transliteration: tevakeshem velo timetsaem aneshey matsutekha yiheyu kheayiin ukheefes aneshey milechametekha

Hebrew: כִּ֗י אֲנִ֛י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ מַחֲזִ֣יק יְמִינֶ֑ךָ הָאֹמֵ֥ר לְךָ֛ אַל־תִּירָ֖א אֲנִ֥י עֲזַרְתִּֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated:
For I the ETERNAL One am your God,
Who grasped your right hand,
Who say to you: Have no fear;
I will be your help.
Transliteration: khiy aniy yehovah eloheykha machaziyk yemiynekha haomer lekha al-tiyra aniy azaretiykha {s}

Hebrew: אַל־תִּֽירְאִי֙ תּוֹלַ֣עַת יַעֲקֹ֔ב מְתֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲנִ֤י עֲזַרְתִּיךְ֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְגֹאֲלֵ֖ךְ קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Fear not, O worm Jacob,
O men of Israel:
I will help you
—declares GOD—
I your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
Transliteration: al-tiyreiy tvolaat yaakov metey yisherael aniy azaretiykhe neum-yehovah vegoalekhe kedvosh yisherael

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה שַׂמְתִּ֗יךְ לְמוֹרַג֙ חָר֣וּץ חָדָ֔שׁ בַּ֖עַל פִּיפִיּ֑וֹת תָּד֤וּשׁ הָרִים֙ וְתָדֹ֔ק וּגְבָע֖וֹת כַּמֹּ֥ץ תָּשִֽׂים׃
Translated:
I will make of you a threshing board,
A new thresher, with many spikes;
You shall thresh mountains to dust,
And make hills like chaff.
Transliteration: hineh shametiykhe lemvorag charuts chadash vaal fiyfiyyvot tadush hariym vetadok ugevavot khamots tashiym

Hebrew: תִּזְרֵם֙ וְר֣וּחַ תִּשָּׂאֵ֔ם וּסְעָרָ֖ה תָּפִ֣יץ אוֹתָ֑ם וְאַתָּה֙ תָּגִ֣יל בַּֽיהֹוָ֔ה בִּקְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תִּתְהַלָּֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
You shall winnow them
And the wind shall carry them off;
The whirlwind shall scatter them.
But you shall rejoice in GOD,
And glory in the Holy One of Israel.
Transliteration: tizerem verucha tishaem usearah tafiyts votam veatah tagiyl vayhovah vikedvosh yisherael titehalal {s}

Hebrew: הָעֲנִיִּ֨ים וְהָאֶבְיוֹנִ֜ים מְבַקְשִׁ֥ים מַ֙יִם֙ וָאַ֔יִן לְשׁוֹנָ֖ם בַּצָּמָ֣א נָשָׁ֑תָּה אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אֶעֱנֵ֔ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹ֥א אֶעֶזְבֵֽם׃
Translated:
The poor and the needy
Seek water, and there is none;
Their tongue is parched with thirst.
I GOD will respond to them.
I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.
Transliteration: haaniyiym vehaeveyvoniym mevakeshiym mayiim vaayiin leshvonam vatsama nashatah aniy yehovah eenem elohey yisherael lo eezevem

Hebrew: אֶפְתַּ֤ח עַל־שְׁפָיִים֙ נְהָר֔וֹת וּבְת֥וֹךְ בְּקָע֖וֹת מַעְיָנ֑וֹת אָשִׂ֤ים מִדְבָּר֙ לַאֲגַם־מַ֔יִם וְאֶ֥רֶץ צִיָּ֖ה לְמוֹצָ֥אֵי מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
I will open up streams on the bare hills
And fountains amid the valleys;
I will turn the desert into ponds,
The arid land into springs of water.
Transliteration: efetach al-shefayiym neharvot uvetvokhe vekavot maeyanvot ashiym midevar laagam-mayiim veerets tsiyah lemvotsaey mayiim

Hebrew: אֶתֵּ֤ן בַּמִּדְבָּר֙ אֶ֣רֶז שִׁטָּ֔ה וַהֲדַ֖ס וְעֵ֣ץ שָׁ֑מֶן אָשִׂ֣ים בָּעֲרָבָ֗ה בְּר֛וֹשׁ תִּדְהָ֥ר וּתְאַשּׁ֖וּר יַחְדָּֽו׃
Translated:
I will plant cedars in the wilderness,
Acacias and myrtles and oleasters;
I will set cypresses in the desert,
Box trees and elms as well—
Transliteration: eten vamidevar erez shitah vahadas veets shamen ashiym vaaravah vervosh tidehar uteashur yachedav

Hebrew: לְמַ֧עַן יִרְא֣וּ וְיֵדְע֗וּ וְיָשִׂ֤ימוּ וְיַשְׂכִּ֙ילוּ֙ יַחְדָּ֔ו כִּ֥י יַד־יְהֹוָ֖ה עָ֣שְׂתָה זֹּ֑את וּקְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּרָאָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
That all may see and know,
Consider and comprehend
That GOD’s hand has done this,
That the Holy One of Israel has wrought it.
Transliteration: lemaan yireu veeideu veyashiymu veyashekhiylu yachedav khiy yad-yehovah ashetah zot ukedvosh yisherael veraah {f}

Hebrew: קָרְב֥וּ רִֽיבְכֶ֖ם יֹאמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה הַגִּ֙ישׁוּ֙ עֲצֻמ֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם יֹאמַ֖ר מֶ֥לֶךְ יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
Submit your case, says GOD;
Offer your pleas, says the King of Jacob.
Transliteration: karevu riyvekhem yomar yehovah hagiyshu atsumvoteykhem yomar melekhe yaakov

Hebrew: יַגִּ֙ישׁוּ֙ וְיַגִּ֣ידוּ לָ֔נוּ אֵ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּקְרֶ֑ינָה הָרִאשֹׁנ֣וֹת ׀ מָ֣ה הֵ֗נָּה הַגִּ֜ידוּ וְנָשִׂ֤ימָה לִבֵּ֙נוּ֙ וְנֵדְעָ֣ה אַחֲרִיתָ֔ן א֥וֹ הַבָּא֖וֹת הַשְׁמִיעֻֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Let them approach and tell us what will happen.
Tell us what has occurred,
And we will take note of it;
Or announce to us what will occur,
That we may know the outcome.
Transliteration: yagiyshu veyagiydu lanu et asher tikereynah harishonvot mah henah hagiydu venashiymah livenu venedeah achariytan vo havavot hashemiyunu

Hebrew: הַגִּ֙ידוּ֙ הָאֹתִיּ֣וֹת לְאָח֔וֹר וְנֵ֣דְעָ֔ה כִּ֥י אֱלֹהִ֖ים אַתֶּ֑ם אַף־תֵּיטִ֣יבוּ וְתָרֵ֔עוּ וְנִשְׁתָּ֖עָה (ונרא) [וְנִרְאֶ֥ה] יַחְדָּֽו׃
Translated:
Foretell what is yet to happen,
That we may know that you are gods!
Do anything, good or bad,
That we may be awed and see.
Transliteration: hagiydu haotiyyvot leachvor venedeah khiy Elohim atem af-teytiyvu vetareu venishetaah (vnr) [venireeh] yachedav

Hebrew: הֵן־אַתֶּ֣ם מֵאַ֔יִן וּפׇעׇלְכֶ֖ם מֵאָ֑פַע תּוֹעֵבָ֖ה יִבְחַ֥ר בָּכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
Why, you are less than nothing,
Your effect is less than nullity;
One who chooses you is an abomination.
Transliteration: hen-atem meayiin ufׇׇlekhem meafa tvoevah yivechar vakhem {f}

Hebrew: הַעִיר֤וֹתִי מִצָּפוֹן֙ וַיַּ֔את מִמִּזְרַח־שֶׁ֖מֶשׁ יִקְרָ֣א בִשְׁמִ֑י וְיָבֹ֤א סְגָנִים֙ כְּמוֹ־חֹ֔מֶר וּכְמ֥וֹ יוֹצֵ֖ר יִרְמׇס־טִֽיט׃
Translated:
I have roused him from the north, and he has come,
From the sunrise, one who invokes My name;
And he has trampled rulers like mud,
Like a potter treading clay.
Transliteration: haiyrvotiy mitsafvon vayat mimizerach-shemesh yikera vishemiy veyavo seganiym khemvo-chomer ukhemvo yvotser yiremׇs-tiyt

Hebrew: מִֽי־הִגִּ֤יד מֵרֹאשׁ֙ וְנֵדָ֔עָה וּמִלְּפָנִ֖ים וְנֹאמַ֣ר צַדִּ֑יק אַ֣ף אֵין־מַגִּ֗יד אַ֚ף אֵ֣ין מַשְׁמִ֔יעַ אַ֥ף אֵין־שֹׁמֵ֖עַ אִמְרֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Who foretold this from the start, that we may note it;
From aforetime, that we might say, “You are right”?
Not one foretold, not one announced;
No one has heard your utterance!
Transliteration: miy-higiyd merosh venedaah umilefaniym venomar tsadiyk af eyn-magiyd af eyn mashemiya af eyn-shomea imereykhem

Hebrew: רִאשׁ֥וֹן לְצִיּ֖וֹן הִנֵּ֣ה הִנָּ֑ם וְלִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם מְבַשֵּׂ֥ר אֶתֵּֽן׃
Translated:
The things once predicted to Zion—
Behold, here they are!
