And again I send a herald to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: rishvon letsiyyvon hineh hinam veliyrushala͏im mevasher eten

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙רֶא֙ וְאֵ֣ין אִ֔ישׁ וּמֵאֵ֖לֶּה וְאֵ֣ין יוֹעֵ֑ץ וְאֶשְׁאָלֵ֖ם וְיָשִׁ֥יבוּ דָבָֽר׃
Translated:
But I look and there is no one;
Not one of them can predict
Or can respond when I question them.
Transliteration: veere veeyn iysh umeeleh veeyn yvoets veeshealem veyashiyvu davar

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן כֻּלָּ֔ם אָ֥וֶן אֶ֖פֶס מַעֲשֵׂיהֶ֑ם ר֥וּחַ וָתֹ֖הוּ נִסְכֵּיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
See, they are all nothingness,
Their works are nullity,
Their statues are naught and nil.
Transliteration: hen khulam aven efes maasheyhem rucha vatohu nisekheyhem {f}

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן עַבְדִּי֙ אֶתְמׇךְ־בּ֔וֹ בְּחִירִ֖י רָצְתָ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֑י נָתַ֤תִּי רוּחִי֙ עָלָ֔יו מִשְׁפָּ֖ט לַגּוֹיִ֥ם יוֹצִֽיא׃
Translated:
This is My servant, whom I uphold,
My chosen one, in whom I delight.
I have put My spirit upon him,
He shall teach the true way to the nations.
Transliteration: hen avediy etemׇkhe-vvo vechiyriy ratsetah nafeshiy natatiy ruchiy alayv mishefat lagvoyim yvotsiy

Hebrew: לֹ֥א יִצְעַ֖ק וְלֹ֣א יִשָּׂ֑א וְלֹא־יַשְׁמִ֥יעַ בַּח֖וּץ קוֹלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He shall not cry out or shout aloud,
Or make his voice heard in the streets.
Transliteration: lo yitseak velo yisha velo-yashemiya vachuts kvolvo

Hebrew: קָנֶ֤ה רָצוּץ֙ לֹ֣א יִשְׁבּ֔וֹר וּפִשְׁתָּ֥ה כֵהָ֖ה לֹ֣א יְכַבֶּ֑נָּה לֶאֱמֶ֖ת יוֹצִ֥יא מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
He shall not break even a bruised reed,
Or snuff out even a dim wick.
He shall bring forth the true way.
Transliteration: kaneh ratsuts lo yishevvor ufishetah khehah lo yekhavenah leemet yvotsiy mishefat

Hebrew: לֹ֤א יִכְהֶה֙ וְלֹ֣א יָר֔וּץ עַד־יָשִׂ֥ים בָּאָ֖רֶץ מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּלְתוֹרָת֖וֹ אִיִּ֥ים יְיַחֵֽלוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
He shall not grow dim or be bruised
Till he has established the true way on earth;
And the coastlands shall await his teaching.
Transliteration: lo yikheheh velo yaruts ad-yashiym vaarets mishefat uletvoratvo iyiym yeyachelu {f}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר הָאֵ֣ל <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֗ה בּוֹרֵ֤א הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ וְנ֣וֹטֵיהֶ֔ם רֹקַ֥ע הָאָ֖רֶץ וְצֶאֱצָאֶ֑יהָ נֹתֵ֤ן נְשָׁמָה֙ לָעָ֣ם עָלֶ֔יהָ וְר֖וּחַ לַהֹלְכִ֥ים בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
Thus said the ETERNAL God,
Who created the heavens and stretched them out,
Who spread out the earth and what it brings forth,
Who gave breath to the people upon it
And life to those who walk thereon:
Transliteration: khoh-amar hael <small></small> yehovah vvore hashamayiim venvoteyhem roka haarets vetseetsaeyha noten neshamah laam aleyha verucha laholekhiym vah

Hebrew: אֲנִ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה קְרָאתִ֥יךָֽ בְצֶ֖דֶק וְאַחְזֵ֣ק בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וְאֶצׇּרְךָ֗ וְאֶתֶּנְךָ֛ לִבְרִ֥ית עָ֖ם לְא֥וֹר גּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
I GOD, in My grace, have summoned you,
And I have grasped you by the hand.
I created you, and appointed you
A covenant people, a light of nations—
Transliteration: aniy yehovah keratiykha vetsedek veachezek veyadekha veetsׇrekha veetenekha liveriyt am levor gvoyim

Hebrew: לִפְקֹ֖חַ עֵינַ֣יִם עִוְר֑וֹת לְהוֹצִ֤יא מִמַּסְגֵּר֙ אַסִּ֔יר מִבֵּ֥ית כֶּ֖לֶא יֹ֥שְׁבֵי חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
Translated:
Opening eyes deprived of light,
Rescuing prisoners from confinement,
From the dungeon those who sit in darkness.
Transliteration: lifekocha eynayiim ivervot lehvotsiy mimaseger asiyr miveyt khele yoshevey choshekhe

Hebrew: אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה ה֣וּא שְׁמִ֑י וּכְבוֹדִי֙ לְאַחֵ֣ר לֹֽא־אֶתֵּ֔ן וּתְהִלָּתִ֖י לַפְּסִילִֽים׃
Translated:
I am GOD, that is My name;
I will not yield My glory to another,
Nor My renown to idols.
Transliteration: aniy yehovah hu shemiy ukhevvodiy leacher lo-eten utehilatiy lafesiyliym

Hebrew: הָרִאשֹׁנ֖וֹת הִנֵּה־בָ֑אוּ וַֽחֲדָשׁוֹת֙ אֲנִ֣י מַגִּ֔יד בְּטֶ֥רֶם תִּצְמַ֖חְנָה אַשְׁמִ֥יעַ אֶתְכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
See, the things once predicted have come,
And now I foretell new things,
Announce to you ere they sprout up.
Transliteration: harishonvot hineh-vau vachadashvot aniy magiyd veterem titsemachenah ashemiya etekhem {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֤ירוּ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ שִׁ֣יר חָדָ֔שׁ תְּהִלָּת֖וֹ מִקְצֵ֣ה הָאָ֑רֶץ יוֹרְדֵ֤י הַיָּם֙ וּמְלֹא֔וֹ אִיִּ֖ים וְיֹשְׁבֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Sing to GOD a new song,
Praise from the ends of the earth—
You who sail the sea and you creatures in it,
You coastlands and their inhabitants!
Transliteration: shiyru layhovah shiyr chadash tehilatvo miketseh haarets yvoredey hayam umelovo iyiym veyosheveyhem

Hebrew: יִשְׂא֤וּ מִדְבָּר֙ וְעָרָ֔יו חֲצֵרִ֖ים תֵּשֵׁ֣ב קֵדָ֑ר יָרֹ֙נּוּ֙ יֹ֣שְׁבֵי סֶ֔לַע מֵרֹ֥אשׁ הָרִ֖ים יִצְוָֽחוּ׃
Translated:
Let the desert and its towns cry aloud,
The villages where Kedar dwells;
Let Sela’s inhabitants shout,
Call out from the peaks of the mountains.
Transliteration: yisheu midevar vearayv chatseriym teshev kedar yaronu yoshevey sela merosh hariym yitsevachu

Hebrew: יָשִׂ֥ימוּ לַיהֹוָ֖ה כָּב֑וֹד וּתְהִלָּת֖וֹ בָּאִיִּ֥ים יַגִּֽידוּ׃
Translated:
Let them do honor to GOD,
And tell God’s glory in the coastlands.
Transliteration: yashiymu layhovah khavvod utehilatvo vaiyiym yagiydu

Hebrew: יְהֹוָה֙ כַּגִּבּ֣וֹר יֵצֵ֔א כְּאִ֥ישׁ מִלְחָמ֖וֹת יָעִ֣יר קִנְאָ֑ה יָרִ֙יעַ֙ אַף־יַצְרִ֔יחַ עַל־אֹיְבָ֖יו יִתְגַּבָּֽר׃ {ס}
Translated:
GOD goes forth like a warrior,
Whipping up rage like a fighter—
Yelling, roaring aloud,
Then charging upon the enemy.
Transliteration: yehovah khagivvor eitse kheiysh milechamvot yaiyr kineah yariya af-yatseriycha al-oyevayv yitegavar {s}

Hebrew: הֶחֱשֵׁ֙יתִי֙ מֵֽעוֹלָ֔ם אַחֲרִ֖ישׁ אֶתְאַפָּ֑ק כַּיּוֹלֵדָ֣ה אֶפְעֶ֔ה אֶשֹּׁ֥ם וְאֶשְׁאַ֖ף יָֽחַד׃
Translated:
“I have kept silent far too long,
Kept still and restrained Myself;
Now I will scream like a woman in labor,
I will pant and I will gasp.
Transliteration: hechesheytiy mevolam achariysh eteafak khayyvoledah efeeh eshom veesheaf yachad

Hebrew: אַחֲרִ֤יב הָרִים֙ וּגְבָע֔וֹת וְכׇל־עֶשְׂבָּ֖ם אוֹבִ֑ישׁ וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י נְהָרוֹת֙ לָאִיִּ֔ים וַאֲגַמִּ֖ים אוֹבִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
Hills and heights will I scorch,
Cause all their green to wither;
I will turn rivers into isles,
And dry the marshes up.
Transliteration: achariyv hariym ugevavot vekhׇl-eshevam voviysh veshametiy neharvot laiyiym vaagamiym voviysh

Hebrew: וְהוֹלַכְתִּ֣י עִוְרִ֗ים בְּדֶ֙רֶךְ֙ לֹ֣א יָדָ֔עוּ בִּנְתִיב֥וֹת לֹא־יָדְע֖וּ אַדְרִיכֵ֑ם אָשִׂים֩ מַחְשָׁ֨ךְ לִפְנֵיהֶ֜ם לָא֗וֹר וּמַֽעֲקַשִּׁים֙ לְמִישׁ֔וֹר אֵ֚לֶּה הַדְּבָרִ֔ים עֲשִׂיתִ֖ם וְלֹ֥א עֲזַבְתִּֽים׃
Translated:
I will lead the blind
By a road they did not know,
And I will make them walk
By paths they never knew.
I will turn darkness before them to light,
Rough places into level ground.
These are the promises—
I will keep them without fail.
Transliteration: vehvolakhetiy iveriym vederekhe lo yadau vinetiyvvot lo-yadeu aderiykhem ashiym macheshakhe lifeneyhem lavor umaakashiym lemiyshvor eleh hadevariym ashiytim velo azavetiym

Hebrew: נָסֹ֤גוּ אָחוֹר֙ יֵבֹ֣שׁוּ בֹ֔שֶׁת הַבֹּטְחִ֖ים בַּפָּ֑סֶל הָאֹמְרִ֥ים לְמַסֵּכָ֖ה אַתֶּ֥ם אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Driven back and utterly shamed
Shall be those who trust in an image,
Those who say to idols,
‘You are our gods!’”
Transliteration: nasogu achvor eivoshu voshet havotechiym vafasel haomeriym lemasekhah atem eloheynu {f}

Hebrew: הַחֵרְשִׁ֖ים שְׁמָ֑עוּ וְהַעִוְרִ֖ים הַבִּ֥יטוּ לִרְאֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Listen, you who are deaf;
You blind ones, look up and see!
Transliteration: hachereshiym shemau vehaiveriym haviytu lirevot

Hebrew: מִ֤י עִוֵּר֙ כִּ֣י אִם־עַבְדִּ֔י וְחֵרֵ֖שׁ כְּמַלְאָכִ֣י אֶשְׁלָ֑ח מִ֤י עִוֵּר֙ כִּמְשֻׁלָּ֔ם וְעִוֵּ֖ר כְּעֶ֥בֶד יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Who is so blind as My servant,
So deaf as the messenger I send?
Who is so blind as the chosen one,
So blind as GOD’s servant?
Transliteration: miy iver khiy im-avediy vecheresh khemaleakhiy eshelach miy iver khimeshulam veiver kheeved yehovah

Hebrew: (ראית) [רָא֥וֹת] רַבּ֖וֹת וְלֹ֣א תִשְׁמֹ֑ר פָּק֥וֹחַ אׇזְנַ֖יִם וְלֹ֥א יִשְׁמָֽע׃
Translated:
Seeing many things, he gives no heed;
With ears open, he hears nothing.
Transliteration: (ryt) [ravot] ravvot velo tishemor fakvocha ׇzenayiim velo yishema

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה חָפֵ֖ץ לְמַ֣עַן צִדְק֑וֹ יַגְדִּ֥יל תּוֹרָ֖ה וְיַאְדִּֽיר׃
Translated:
GOD desires his vindication,
That he may magnify and glorify the Teaching.
Transliteration: yehovah chafets lemaan tsidekvo yagediyl tvorah veyaediyr

Hebrew: וְהוּא֮ עַם־בָּז֣וּז וְשָׁסוּי֒ הָפֵ֤חַ בַּחוּרִים֙ כֻּלָּ֔ם וּבְבָתֵּ֥י כְלָאִ֖ים הׇחְבָּ֑אוּ הָי֤וּ לָבַז֙ וְאֵ֣ין מַצִּ֔יל מְשִׁסָּ֖ה וְאֵין־אֹמֵ֥ר הָשַֽׁב׃
Translated:
Yet it is a people plundered and despoiled:
All of them are trapped in holes,
Imprisoned in dungeons.
They are given over to plunder, with none to rescue them;
To despoilment, with none to say “Give back!”
Transliteration: vehu am-vazuz veshasuy hafecha vachuriym khulam uvevatey khelaiym hׇchevau hayu lavaz veeyn matsiyl meshisah veeyn-omer hashav

Hebrew: מִ֥י בָכֶ֖ם יַאֲזִ֣ין זֹ֑את יַקְשִׁ֥ב וְיִשְׁמַ֖ע לְאָחֽוֹר׃
Translated:
If only you would listen to this,
Attend and give heed from now on!
Transliteration: miy vakhem yaaziyn zot yakeshiv veyishema leachvor

Hebrew: מִֽי־נָתַ֨ן (למשוסה) [לִמְשִׁסָּ֧ה] יַעֲקֹ֛ב וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל לְבֹזְזִ֖ים הֲל֣וֹא יְהֹוָ֑ה ז֚וּ חָטָ֣אנוּ ל֔וֹ וְלֹֽא־אָב֤וּ בִדְרָכָיו֙ הָל֔וֹךְ וְלֹ֥א שָׁמְע֖וּ בְּתוֹרָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who was it gave Jacob over to despoilment
And Israel to plunderers?
Surely, GOD—against whom they sinned,
In whose ways they would not walk,
And whose Teaching they would not obey—
Transliteration: miy-natan (lmshvsh) [limeshisah] yaakov veyisherael levozeziym halvo yehovah zu chatanu lvo velo-avu viderakhayv halvokhe velo shameu vetvoratvo

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֤ךְ עָלָיו֙ חֵמָ֣ה אַפּ֔וֹ וֶעֱז֖וּז מִלְחָמָ֑ה וַתְּלַהֲטֵ֤הוּ מִסָּבִיב֙ וְלֹ֣א יָדָ֔ע וַתִּבְעַר־בּ֖וֹ וְלֹא־יָשִׂ֥ים עַל־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
Who poured out wrath,
Anger, and the fury of war upon them.
It blazed upon them all about, but they heeded not;
It burned among them, but they gave it no thought.
Transliteration: vayishefokhe alayv chemah afvo veezuz milechamah vatelahatehu misaviyv velo yada vativear-vvo velo-yashiym al-lev

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֞ה כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ בֹּרַאֲךָ֣ יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְיֹצֶרְךָ֖ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אַל־תִּירָא֙ כִּ֣י גְאַלְתִּ֔יךָ קָרָ֥אתִי בְשִׁמְךָ֖ לִי־אָֽתָּה׃
Translated:
But now thus said GOD—
Who created you, O Jacob,
Who formed you, O Israel:
Fear not, for I will redeem you;
I have singled you out by name,
You are Mine.
Transliteration: veatah khoh-amar yehovah voraakha yaakov veyotserekha yisherael al-tiyra khiy gealetiykha karatiy veshimekha liy-atah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תַעֲבֹ֤ר בַּמַּ֙יִם֙ אִתְּךָ־אָ֔נִי וּבַנְּהָר֖וֹת לֹ֣א יִשְׁטְפ֑וּךָ כִּֽי־תֵלֵ֤ךְ בְּמוֹ־אֵשׁ֙ לֹ֣א תִכָּוֶ֔ה וְלֶהָבָ֖ה לֹ֥א תִבְעַר־בָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
When you pass through water,
I will be with you;
Through streams,
They shall not overwhelm you.
When you walk through fire,
You shall not be scorched;
Through flame,
It shall not burn you.
Transliteration: khiy-taavor vamayiim itekha-aniy uvaneharvot lo yishetefukha khiy-telekhe vemvo-esh lo tikhaveh velehavah lo tivear-vakhe

Hebrew: כִּ֗י אֲנִי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מוֹשִׁיעֶ֑ךָ נָתַ֤תִּי כׇפְרְךָ֙ מִצְרַ֔יִם כּ֥וּשׁ וּסְבָ֖א תַּחְתֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
For I the ETERNAL am your God,
The Holy One of Israel, your Savior.
I give Egypt as a ransom for you,
Cush and Saba in exchange for you.
Transliteration: khiy aniy yehovah eloheykha kedvosh yisherael mvoshiyekha natatiy khׇferekha mitserayiim khush useva tacheteykha

Hebrew: מֵאֲשֶׁ֨ר יָקַ֧רְתָּ בְעֵינַ֛י נִכְבַּ֖דְתָּ וַאֲנִ֣י אֲהַבְתִּ֑יךָ וְאֶתֵּ֤ן אָדָם֙ תַּחְתֶּ֔יךָ וּלְאֻמִּ֖ים תַּ֥חַת נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated:
Because you are precious to Me,
And honored, and I love you,
I give people in exchange for you
And nations in your stead.
Transliteration: measher yakareta veeynay nikhevadeta vaaniy ahavetiykha veeten adam tacheteykha uleumiym tachat nafeshekha

Hebrew: אַל־תִּירָ֖א כִּ֣י אִתְּךָ־אָ֑נִי מִמִּזְרָח֙ אָבִ֣יא זַרְעֶ֔ךָ וּמִֽמַּעֲרָ֖ב אֲקַבְּצֶֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Fear not, for I am with you:
I will bring your folk from the East,
Will gather you out of the West;
Transliteration: al-tiyra khiy itekha-aniy mimizerach aviy zareekha umimaarav akavetsekha

Hebrew: אֹמַ֤ר לַצָּפוֹן֙ תֵּ֔נִי וּלְתֵימָ֖ן אַל־תִּכְלָ֑אִי הָבִ֤יאִי בָנַי֙ מֵרָח֔וֹק וּבְנוֹתַ֖י מִקְצֵ֥ה הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
I will say to the North, “Give back!”
And to the South, “Do not withhold!
Bring My sons from afar,
And My daughters from the end of the earth—
Transliteration: omar latsafvon teniy uleteyman al-tikhelaiy haviyiy vanay merachvok uvenvotay miketseh haarets

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ל הַנִּקְרָ֣א בִשְׁמִ֔י וְלִכְבוֹדִ֖י בְּרָאתִ֑יו יְצַרְתִּ֖יו אַף־עֲשִׂיתִֽיו׃
Translated:
All who are linked to My name,
Whom I have created,
Formed, and made for My glory—
Transliteration: khol hanikera vishemiy velikhevvodiy veratiyv yetsaretiyv af-ashiytiyv

Hebrew: הוֹצִ֥יא עַם־עִוֵּ֖ר וְעֵינַ֣יִם יֵ֑שׁ וְחֵרְשִׁ֖ים וְאׇזְנַ֥יִם לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
Setting free that people,
Blind though it has eyes
And deaf though it has ears.”
Transliteration: hvotsiy am-iver veeynayiim eish vechereshiym veׇzenayiim lamvo

Hebrew: כׇּֽל־הַגּוֹיִ֞ם נִקְבְּצ֣וּ יַחְדָּ֗ו וְיֵאָֽסְפוּ֙ לְאֻמִּ֔ים מִ֤י בָהֶם֙ יַגִּ֣יד זֹ֔את וְרִאשֹׁנ֖וֹת יַשְׁמִיעֻ֑נוּ יִתְּנ֤וּ עֵֽדֵיהֶם֙ וְיִצְדָּ֔קוּ וְיִשְׁמְע֖וּ וְיֹאמְר֥וּ אֱמֶֽת׃
Translated:
All the nations assemble as one,
The peoples gather.
Who among them declared this,
Foretold to us the things that have happened?
Let them produce their witnesses and be vindicated,
That people, hearing them, may say, “It is true!”
Transliteration: khׇl-hagvoyim nikevetsu yachedav veeiasefu leumiym miy vahem yagiyd zot verishonvot yashemiyunu yitenu edeyhem veyitsedaku veyishemeu veyomeru emet

Hebrew: אַתֶּ֤ם עֵדַי֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְעַבְדִּ֖י אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּחָ֑רְתִּי לְמַ֣עַן תֵּ֠דְע֠וּ וְתַאֲמִ֨ינוּ לִ֤י וְתָבִ֙ינוּ֙ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י ה֔וּא לְפָנַי֙ לֹא־נ֣וֹצַר אֵ֔ל וְאַחֲרַ֖י לֹ֥א יִהְיֶֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
My witnesses are you
—declares GOD—
My servant, whom I have chosen.
To the end that you may take thought,
And believe in Me,
And understand that I am the One:
Before Me no god was formed,
And after Me none shall exist—
Transliteration: atem eday neum-yehovah veavediy asher vacharetiy lemaan tedeu vetaamiynu liy vetaviynu khiy-aniy hu lefanay lo-nvotsar el veacharay lo yiheyeh {s}

Hebrew: אָנֹכִ֥י אָנֹכִ֖י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאֵ֥ין מִבַּלְעָדַ֖י מוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated:
None but me, GOD;
Beside Me, none can grant triumph.
Transliteration: anokhiy anokhiy yehovah veeyn mivaleaday mvoshiya

Hebrew: אָנֹכִ֞י הִגַּ֤דְתִּי וְהוֹשַׁ֙עְתִּי֙ וְהִשְׁמַ֔עְתִּי וְאֵ֥ין בָּכֶ֖ם זָ֑ר וְאַתֶּ֥ם עֵדַ֛י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַאֲנִי־אֵֽל׃
Translated:
I alone foretold the triumph
And I brought it to pass;
I announced it,
And no strange god was among you.
So you are My witnesses
—declares GOD—
And I am God.
Transliteration: anokhiy higadetiy vehvoshaetiy vehishemaetiy veeyn vakhem zar veatem eday neum-yehovah vaaniy-el

Hebrew: גַּם־מִיּוֹם֙ אֲנִ֣י ה֔וּא וְאֵ֥ין מִיָּדִ֖י מַצִּ֑יל אֶפְעַ֖ל וּמִ֥י יְשִׁיבֶֽנָּה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Ever since day was, I am the One;
None can deliver from My hand.
When I act, who can reverse it?
Transliteration: gam-miyyvom aniy hu veeyn miyadiy matsiyl efeal umiy yeshiyvenah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה גֹּאַלְכֶ֖ם קְד֣וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לְמַעַנְכֶ֞ם שִׁלַּ֣חְתִּי בָבֶ֗לָה וְהוֹרַדְתִּ֤י בָֽרִיחִים֙ כֻּלָּ֔ם וְכַשְׂדִּ֖ים בָּאֳנִיּ֥וֹת רִנָּתָֽם׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD,
Your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel:
For your sake I send to Babylon;
I will bring down all [her] bars,
And the Chaldeans shall raise their voice in lamentation.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah goalekhem kedvosh yisherael lemaanekhem shilachetiy vavelah vehvoradetiy variychiym khulam vekhashediym vaoniyyvot rinatam

Hebrew: אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה קְדֽוֹשְׁכֶ֑ם בּוֹרֵ֥א יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מַלְכְּכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
I am your Holy One, GOD,
Your Sovereign, the Creator of Israel.
Transliteration: aniy yehovah kedvoshekhem vvore yisherael malekhekhem {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הַנּוֹתֵ֥ן בַּיָּ֖ם דָּ֑רֶךְ וּבְמַ֥יִם עַזִּ֖ים נְתִיבָֽה׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD,
Who made a road through the sea
And a path through mighty waters,
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah hanvoten vayam darekhe uvemayiim aziym netiyvah

Hebrew: הַמּוֹצִ֥יא רֶכֶב־וָס֖וּס חַ֣יִל וְעִזּ֑וּז יַחְדָּ֤ו יִשְׁכְּבוּ֙ בַּל־יָק֔וּמוּ דָּעֲכ֖וּ כַּפִּשְׁתָּ֥ה כָבֽוּ׃
Translated:
Who destroyed chariots and horses,
And all the mighty host—
They lay down to rise no more,
They were extinguished, quenched like a wick:
Transliteration: hamvotsiy rekhev-vasus chayiil veizuz yachedav yishekhevu val-yakumu daakhu khafishetah khavu

Hebrew: אַֽל־תִּזְכְּר֖וּ רִאשֹׁנ֑וֹת וְקַדְמֹנִיּ֖וֹת אַל־תִּתְבֹּנָֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Do not recall what happened of old,
Or ponder what happened of yore!
Transliteration: al-tizekheru rishonvot vekademoniyyvot al-titevonanu

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֨י עֹשֶׂ֤ה חֲדָשָׁה֙ עַתָּ֣ה תִצְמָ֔ח הֲל֖וֹא תֵּדָע֑וּהָ אַ֣ף אָשִׂ֤ים בַּמִּדְבָּר֙ דֶּ֔רֶךְ בִּישִׁמ֖וֹן נְהָרֽוֹת׃
Translated:
I am about to do something new;
Even now it shall come to pass,
Suddenly you shall perceive it:
I will make a road through the wilderness
And rivers in the desert.
Transliteration: hineniy osheh chadashah atah titsemach halvo tedauha af ashiym vamidevar derekhe viyshimvon neharvot

Hebrew: תְּכַבְּדֵ֙נִי֙ חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה תַּנִּ֖ים וּבְנ֣וֹת יַעֲנָ֑ה כִּֽי־נָתַ֨תִּי בַמִּדְבָּ֜ר מַ֗יִם נְהָרוֹת֙ בִּֽישִׁימֹ֔ן לְהַשְׁק֖וֹת עַמִּ֥י בְחִירִֽי׃
Translated:
The wild beasts shall honor Me,
Jackals and ostriches,
For I provide water in the wilderness,
Rivers in the desert,
To give drink to My chosen people,
Transliteration: tekhavedeniy chayat hashadeh taniym uvenvot yaanah khiy-natatiy vamidevar mayiim neharvot viyshiymon lehashekvot amiy vechiyriy

Hebrew: עַם־זוּ֙ יָצַ֣רְתִּי לִ֔י תְּהִלָּתִ֖י יְסַפֵּֽרוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
The people I formed for Myself
That they might declare My praise.
Transliteration: am-zu yatsaretiy liy tehilatiy yesaferu {s}

Hebrew: וְלֹא־אֹתִ֥י קָרָ֖אתָ יַעֲקֹ֑ב כִּֽי־יָגַ֥עְתָּ בִּ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
But you have not worshiped Me, O Jacob,
That you should be weary of Me, O Israel.
Transliteration: velo-otiy karata yaakov khiy-yagaeta viy yisherael

Hebrew: לֹֽא־הֵבֵ֤יאתָ לִּי֙ שֵׂ֣ה עֹלֹתֶ֔יךָ וּזְבָחֶ֖יךָ לֹ֣א כִבַּדְתָּ֑נִי לֹ֤א הֶעֱבַדְתִּ֙יךָ֙ בְּמִנְחָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א הוֹגַעְתִּ֖יךָ בִּלְבוֹנָֽה׃
Translated:
You have not brought Me your sheep for burnt offerings,
Nor honored Me with your sacrifices.
I have not burdened you with grain offerings,
Nor wearied you about frankincense.
Transliteration: lo-heveyta liy sheh oloteykha uzevacheykha lo khivadetaniy lo heevadetiykha veminechah velo hvogaetiykha vilevvonah

Hebrew: לֹא־קָנִ֨יתָ לִּ֤י בַכֶּ֙סֶף֙ קָנֶ֔ה וְחֵ֥לֶב זְבָחֶ֖יךָ לֹ֣א הִרְוִיתָ֑נִי אַ֗ךְ הֶעֱבַדְתַּ֙נִי֙ בְּחַטֹּאותֶ֔יךָ הוֹגַעְתַּ֖נִי בַּעֲוֺנֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You have not bought Me fragrant reed with money,
Nor sated Me with the fat of your sacrifices.
Instead, you have burdened Me with your sins,
You have wearied Me with your iniquities.
Transliteration: lo-kaniyta liy vakhesef kaneh vechelev zevacheykha lo hireviytaniy akhe heevadetaniy vechatovteykha hvogaetaniy vaavonoteykha

Hebrew: אָנֹכִ֨י אָנֹכִ֥י ה֛וּא מֹחֶ֥ה פְשָׁעֶ֖יךָ לְמַעֲנִ֑י וְחַטֹּאתֶ֖יךָ לֹ֥א אֶזְכֹּֽר׃
Translated:
It is I, I who—for My own sake—
Wipe your transgressions away
And remember your sins no more.
Transliteration: anokhiy anokhiy hu mocheh feshaeykha lemaaniy vechatoteykha lo ezekhor

Hebrew: הַזְכִּירֵ֕נִי נִשָּׁפְטָ֖ה יָ֑חַד סַפֵּ֥ר אַתָּ֖ה לְמַ֥עַן תִּצְדָּֽק׃
Translated:
Help me remember!
Let us join in argument,
Tell your version,
That you may be vindicated.
Transliteration: hazekhiyreniy nishafetah yachad safer atah lemaan titsedak

Hebrew: אָבִ֥יךָ הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן חָטָ֑א וּמְלִיצֶ֖יךָ פָּ֥שְׁעוּ בִֽי׃
Translated:
Your earliest ancestor sinned,
And your spokesmen transgressed against Me.
Transliteration: aviykha harishvon chata umeliytseykha fasheu viy

Hebrew: וַאֲחַלֵּ֖ל שָׂ֣רֵי קֹ֑דֶשׁ וְאֶתְּנָ֤ה לַחֵ֙רֶם֙ יַֽעֲקֹ֔ב וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְגִדּוּפִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
So I profaned the holy princes;
I abandoned Jacob to proscription
And Israel to mockery.
Transliteration: vaachalel sharey kodesh veetenah lacherem yaakov veyisherael legidufiym {f}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֥ה שְׁמַ֖ע יַעֲקֹ֣ב עַבְדִּ֑י וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בָּחַ֥רְתִּי בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
But hear, now, O Jacob My servant,
Israel whom I have chosen!
Transliteration: veatah shema yaakov avediy veyisherael vacharetiy vvo

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֥ה עֹשֶׂ֛ךָ וְיֹצֶרְךָ֥ מִבֶּ֖טֶן יַעְזְרֶ֑ךָּ אַל־תִּירָא֙ עַבְדִּ֣י יַעֲקֹ֔ב וִישֻׁר֖וּן בָּחַ֥רְתִּי בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD, your Maker,
Your Creator who has helped you since birth:
Fear not, My servant Jacob,
Jeshurun whom I have chosen,
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah oshekha veyotserekha miveten yaezerekha al-tiyra avediy yaakov viyshurun vacharetiy vvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֶצׇּק־מַ֙יִם֙ עַל־צָמֵ֔א וְנֹזְלִ֖ים עַל־יַבָּשָׁ֑ה אֶצֹּ֤ק רוּחִי֙ עַל־זַרְעֶ֔ךָ וּבִרְכָתִ֖י עַל־צֶאֱצָאֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Even as I pour water on thirsty soil,
And rain upon dry ground,
So will I pour My spirit on your offspring,
My blessing upon your posterity.
Transliteration: khiy etsׇk-mayiim al-tsame venozeliym al-yavashah etsok ruchiy al-zareekha uvirekhatiy al-tseetsaeykha

Hebrew: וְצָמְח֖וּ בְּבֵ֣ין חָצִ֑יר כַּעֲרָבִ֖ים עַל־יִבְלֵי־מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
And they shall sprout like grass,
Like willows by watercourses.
Transliteration: vetsamechu veveyn chatsiyr khaaraviym al-yiveley-mayiim

Hebrew: זֶ֤ה יֹאמַר֙ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אָ֔נִי וְזֶ֖ה יִקְרָ֣א בְשֵֽׁם־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְזֶ֗ה יִכְתֹּ֤ב יָדוֹ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וּבְשֵׁ֥ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יְכַנֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
One shall say, “I am GOD’s,”
Another shall use the name of “Jacob,”
Another shall mark his arm “of GOD”
And adopt the name of “Israel.”
Transliteration: zeh yomar layhovah aniy vezeh yikera veshem-yaakov vezeh yikhetov yadvo layhovah uveshem yisherael yekhaneh {f}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֧ה מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל וְגֹאֲל֖וֹ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֑וֹת אֲנִ֤י רִאשׁוֹן֙ וַאֲנִ֣י אַחֲר֔וֹן וּמִבַּלְעָדַ֖י אֵ֥ין אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD, the Sovereign of Israel,
Their Redeemer, GOD of Hosts:
I am the first and I am the last,
And there is no god but Me.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah melekhe-yisherael vegoalvo yehovah tsevavot aniy rishvon vaaniy acharvon umivaleaday eyn Elohim

Hebrew: וּמִי־כָמ֣וֹנִי יִקְרָ֗א וְיַגִּידֶ֤הָ וְיַעְרְכֶ֙הָ֙ לִ֔י מִשּׂוּמִ֖י עַם־עוֹלָ֑ם וְאֹתִיּ֛וֹת וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּבֹ֖אנָה יַגִּ֥ידוּ לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
Who like Me can announce,
Can foretell it—and match Me thereby?
Even as I told the future to an ancient people,
So let anyone foretell coming events to them.
Transliteration: umiy-khamvoniy yikera veyagiydeha veyaerekheha liy mishumiy am-volam veotiyyvot vaasher tavonah yagiydu lamvo

Hebrew: אַֽל־תִּפְחֲדוּ֙ וְאַל־תִּרְה֔וּ הֲלֹ֥א מֵאָ֛ז הִשְׁמַעְתִּ֥יךָ וְהִגַּ֖דְתִּי וְאַתֶּ֣ם עֵדָ֑י הֲיֵ֤שׁ אֱל֙וֹהַּ֙ מִבַּלְעָדַ֔י וְאֵ֥ין צ֖וּר בַּל־יָדָֽעְתִּי׃
Translated:
Do not be frightened, do not be shaken!
Have I not from of old predicted to you?
I foretold, and you are My witnesses.
Is there any god, then, but Me?
“There is no other rock; I know none!”
Transliteration: al-tifechadu veal-tirehu halo meaz hishemaetiykha vehigadetiy veatem eday haeish elvoha mivaleaday veeyn tsur val-yadaetiy

Hebrew: יֹצְרֵי־פֶ֤סֶל כֻּלָּם֙ תֹּ֔הוּ וַחֲמוּדֵיהֶ֖ם בַּל־יוֹעִ֑ילוּ וְעֵדֵיהֶ֣ם הֵ֗ׄמָּׄהׄ בַּל־יִרְא֛וּ וּבַל־יֵדְע֖וּ לְמַ֥עַן יֵבֹֽשׁוּ׃
Translated:
The makers of idols
All work to no purpose;
And the things they treasure
Can do no good,
As they themselves can testify.
They neither look nor think,
And so they shall be shamed.
Transliteration: yotserey-fesel khulam tohu vachamudeyhem val-yvoiylu veedeyhem hemah val-yireu uval-eideu lemaan eivoshu

Hebrew: מִֽי־יָצַ֥ר אֵ֖ל וּפֶ֣סֶל נָסָ֑ךְ לְבִלְתִּ֖י הוֹעִֽיל׃
Translated:
Who would fashion a god
Or cast a statue
That can do no good?
Transliteration: miy-yatsar el ufesel nasakhe leviletiy hvoiyl

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן כׇּל־חֲבֵרָיו֙ יֵבֹ֔שׁוּ וְחָרָשִׁ֥ים הֵ֖מָּה מֵאָדָ֑ם יִֽתְקַבְּצ֤וּ כֻלָּם֙ יַעֲמֹ֔דוּ יִפְחֲד֖וּ יֵבֹ֥שׁוּ יָֽחַד׃
Translated:
Lo, all its adherents shall be shamed;
They are craftsmen, are merely human.
Let them all assemble and stand up!
They shall be cowed, and they shall be shamed.
Transliteration: hen khׇl-chaverayv eivoshu vecharashiym hemah meadam yitekavetsu khulam yaamodu yifechadu eivoshu yachad

Hebrew: חָרַ֤שׁ בַּרְזֶל֙ מַֽעֲצָ֔ד וּפָעַל֙ בַּפֶּחָ֔ם וּבַמַּקָּב֖וֹת יִצְּרֵ֑הוּ וַיִּפְעָלֵ֙הוּ֙ בִּזְר֣וֹעַ כֹּח֔וֹ גַּם־רָעֵב֙ וְאֵ֣ין כֹּ֔חַ לֹא־שָׁ֥תָה מַ֖יִם וַיִּיעָֽף׃
Translated:
The craftsman in iron, with his tools,
Works it over charcoal
And fashions it by hammering,
Working with the strength of his arm.
Should he go hungry, his strength would ebb;
Should he drink no water, he would grow faint.
Transliteration: charash varezel maatsad ufaal vafecham uvamakavvot yitserehu vayifealehu vizervoa khochvo gam-raev veeyn khocha lo-shatah mayiim vayiyaf

Hebrew: חָרַ֣שׁ עֵצִים֮ נָ֣טָה קָו֒ יְתָאֲרֵ֣הוּ בַשֶּׂ֔רֶד יַעֲשֵׂ֙הוּ֙ בַּמַּקְצֻע֔וֹת וּבַמְּחוּגָ֖ה יְתׇאֳרֵ֑הוּ וַֽיַּעֲשֵׂ֙הוּ֙ כְּתַבְנִ֣ית אִ֔ישׁ כְּתִפְאֶ֥רֶת אָדָ֖ם לָשֶׁ֥בֶת בָּֽיִת׃
Translated:
The craftsman in wood measures with a line
And marks out a shape with a stylus;
He forms it with scraping tools,
Marking it out with a compass.
He gives it the form of a person—
Human beauty, to dwell in a shrine.
Transliteration: charash etsiym natah kav yetaarehu vashered yaashehu vamaketsuvot uvamechugah yetׇorehu vayaashehu khetaveniyt iysh khetifeeret adam lashevet vayiit

Hebrew: לִכְרׇת־ל֣וֹ אֲרָזִ֔ים וַיִּקַּ֤ח תִּרְזָה֙ וְאַלּ֔וֹן וַיְאַמֶּץ־ל֖וֹ בַּעֲצֵי־יָ֑עַר נָטַ֥ע אֹ֖רֶ<small>ן</small> וְגֶ֥שֶׁם יְגַדֵּֽל׃
Translated:
For his use he cuts down cedars;
He chooses plane trees and oaks.
He sets aside trees of the forest;
Or plants firs, and the rain makes them grow.
Transliteration: likherׇt-lvo araziym vayikach tirezah vealvon vayeamets-lvo vaatsey-yaar nata ore<small>n</small> vegeshem yegadel

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה לְאָדָם֙ לְבָעֵ֔ר וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֵהֶם֙ וַיָּ֔חׇם אַף־יַשִּׂ֖יק וְאָ֣פָה לָ֑חֶם אַף־יִפְעַל־אֵל֙ וַיִּשְׁתָּ֔חוּ עָשָׂ֥הוּ פֶ֖סֶל וַיִּסְגׇּד־לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
All this serves a mortal for fuel:
He takes some to warm himself,
And he builds a fire and bakes bread.
He also makes a god of it and worships it,
Fashions an idol and bows down to it!
Transliteration: vehayah leadam levaer vayikach mehem vayachׇm af-yashiyk veafah lachem af-yifeal-el vayishetachu ashahu fesel vayisegׇd-lamvo

Hebrew: חֶצְיוֹ֙ שָׂרַ֣ף בְּמוֹ־אֵ֔שׁ עַל־חֶצְיוֹ֙ בָּשָׂ֣ר יֹאכֵ֔ל יִצְלֶ֥ה צָלִ֖י וְיִשְׂבָּ֑ע אַף־יָחֹם֙ וְיֹאמַ֣ר הֶאָ֔ח חַמּוֹתִ֖י רָאִ֥יתִי אֽוּר׃
Translated:
Part of it he burns in a fire:
On that part he roasts meat,
He eats the roast and is sated;
He also warms himself and cries, “Ah,
I am warm! I can feel the heat!”
Transliteration: chetseyvo sharaf vemvo-esh al-chetseyvo vashar yokhel yitseleh tsaliy veyisheva af-yachom veyomar heach chamvotiy raiytiy ur

Hebrew: וּשְׁאֵ֣רִית֔וֹ לְאֵ֥ל עָשָׂ֖ה לְפִסְל֑וֹ (יסגוד) [יִסְגׇּד־]ל֤וֹ וְיִשְׁתַּ֙חוּ֙ וְיִתְפַּלֵּ֣ל אֵלָ֔יו וְיֹאמַר֙ הַצִּילֵ֔נִי כִּ֥י אֵלִ֖י אָֽתָּה׃
Translated:
Of the rest he makes a god—his own carving!
He bows down to it, worships it;
He prays to it and cries,
“Save me, for you are my god!”
Transliteration: usheeriytvo leel ashah lefiselvo (ysgvd) [yisegׇd-]lvo veyishetachu veyitefalel elayv veyomar hatsiyleniy khiy eliy atah

Hebrew: לֹ֥א יָדְע֖וּ וְלֹ֣א יָבִ֑ינוּ כִּ֣י טַ֤ח מֵֽרְאוֹת֙ עֵינֵיהֶ֔ם מֵהַשְׂכִּ֖יל לִבֹּתָֽם׃
Translated:
They have no wit or judgment:
Their eyes are besmeared, and they see not;
Their minds, and they cannot think.
Transliteration: lo yadeu velo yaviynu khiy tach merevot eyneyhem mehashekhiyl livotam

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יָשִׁ֣יב אֶל־לִבּ֗וֹ וְלֹ֨א דַ֥עַת וְלֹֽא־תְבוּנָה֮ לֵאמֹר֒ חֶצְי֞וֹ שָׂרַ֣פְתִּי בְמוֹ־אֵ֗שׁ וְ֠אַ֠ף אָפִ֤יתִי עַל־גֶּחָלָיו֙ לֶ֔חֶם אֶצְלֶ֥ה בָשָׂ֖ר וְאֹכֵ֑ל וְיִתְרוֹ֙ לְתוֹעֵבָ֣ה אֶעֱשֶׂ֔ה לְב֥וּל עֵ֖ץ אֶסְגּֽוֹד׃
Translated:
They do not give thought,
They lack the wit and judgment to say:
“Part of it I burned in a fire;
I also baked bread on the coals,
I roasted meat and ate it—
Should I make the rest an abhorrence?
Should I bow to a block of wood?”
Transliteration: velo-yashiyv el-livvo velo daat velo-tevunah lemor chetseyvo sharafetiy vemvo-esh veaf afiytiy al-gechalayv lechem etseleh vashar veokhel veyitervo letvoevah eesheh levul ets esegvod

Hebrew: רֹעֶ֣ה אֵ֔פֶר לֵ֥ב הוּתַ֖ל הִטָּ֑הוּ וְלֹא־יַצִּ֤יל אֶת־נַפְשׁוֹ֙ וְלֹ֣א יֹאמַ֔ר הֲל֥וֹא שֶׁ֖קֶר בִּימִינִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
He pursues ashes!
A deluded mind has led him astray,
And he cannot save himself;
He never says to himself,
“The thing in my hand is a fraud!”
Transliteration: roeh efer lev hutal hitahu velo-yatsiyl et-nafeshvo velo yomar halvo sheker viymiyniy {s}

Hebrew: זְכׇר־אֵ֣לֶּה יַֽעֲקֹ֔ב וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כִּ֣י עַבְדִּי־אָ֑תָּה יְצַרְתִּ֤יךָ עֶֽבֶד־לִי֙ אַ֔תָּה יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹ֥א תִנָּשֵֽׁנִי׃
Translated:
Remember these things, O Jacob
For you, O Israel, are My servant:
I fashioned you, you are My servant—
O Israel, never forget Me.
Transliteration: zekhׇr-eleh yaakov veyisherael khiy avediy-atah yetsaretiykha eved-liy atah yisherael lo tinasheniy

Hebrew: מָחִ֤יתִי כָעָב֙ פְּשָׁעֶ֔יךָ וְכֶעָנָ֖ן חַטֹּאותֶ֑יךָ שׁוּבָ֥ה אֵלַ֖י כִּ֥י גְאַלְתִּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I wipe away your sins like a cloud,
Your transgressions like mist—
Come back to Me, for I redeem you.
Transliteration: machiytiy khaav feshaeykha vekheanan chatovteykha shuvah elay khiy gealetiykha

Hebrew: רׇנּ֨וּ שָׁמַ֜יִם כִּֽי־עָשָׂ֣ה יְהֹוָ֗ה הָרִ֙יעוּ֙ תַּחְתִּיּ֣וֹת אָ֔רֶץ פִּצְח֤וּ הָרִים֙ רִנָּ֔ה יַ֖עַר וְכׇל־עֵ֣ץ בּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־גָאַ֤ל יְהֹוָה֙ יַעֲקֹ֔ב וּבְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יִתְפָּאָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Shout, O heavens, for GOD has acted;
Shout aloud, O depths of the earth!
Shout for joy, O mountains,
O forests with all your trees!
For GOD has redeemed Jacob,
Has gained glory through Israel.
Transliteration: rׇnu shamayiim khiy-ashah yehovah hariyu tachetiyyvot arets fitsechu hariym rinah yaar vekhׇl-ets vvo khiy-gaal yehovah yaakov uveyisherael yitefaar {s}

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ גֹּאֲלֶ֔ךָ וְיֹצֶרְךָ֖ מִבָּ֑טֶן אָנֹכִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ עֹ֣שֶׂה כֹּ֔ל נֹטֶ֤ה שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ לְבַדִּ֔י רֹקַ֥ע הָאָ֖רֶץ (מי אתי) [מֵאִתִּֽי]׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD, your Redeemer,
Who formed you in the womb:
It is I, GOD, who made everything,
Who alone stretched out the heavens
And unaided spread out the earth;
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah goalekha veyotserekha mivaten anokhiy yehovah osheh khol noteh shamayiim levadiy roka haarets (my ty) [meitiy]

Hebrew: מֵפֵר֙ אֹת֣וֹת בַּדִּ֔ים וְקֹסְמִ֖ים יְהוֹלֵ֑ל מֵשִׁ֧יב חֲכָמִ֛ים אָח֖וֹר וְדַעְתָּ֥ם יְסַכֵּֽל׃
Translated:
Who annul the omens of diviners,
And make fools of the augurs;
Who turn sages back
And make nonsense of their knowledge;
Transliteration: mefer otvot vadiym vekosemiym yehvolel meshiyv chakhamiym achvor vedaetam yesakhel

Hebrew: מֵקִים֙ דְּבַ֣ר עַבְדּ֔וֹ וַעֲצַ֥ת מַלְאָכָ֖יו יַשְׁלִ֑ים הָאֹמֵ֨ר לִירוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם תּוּשָׁ֗ב וּלְעָרֵ֤י יְהוּדָה֙ תִּבָּנֶ֔ינָה וְחׇרְבוֹתֶ֖יהָ אֲקוֹמֵֽם׃
Translated:
But confirm the word of My servant
And fulfill the prediction of My messengers.
It is I who say of Jerusalem, “It shall be inhabited,”
And of the towns of Judah, “They shall be rebuilt;
And I will restore their ruined places.”
Transliteration: mekiym devar avedvo vaatsat maleakhayv yasheliym haomer liyrushala͏im tushav ulearey yehudah tivaneynah vechׇrevvoteyha akvomem

Hebrew: הָאֹמֵ֥ר לַצּוּלָ֖ה חֳרָ֑בִי וְנַהֲרֹתַ֖יִךְ אוֹבִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
[I,] who said to the deep, “Be dry;
I will dry up your floods,”
Transliteration: haomer latsulah choraviy venaharotayiikhe voviysh

Hebrew: הָאֹמֵ֤ר לְכ֙וֹרֶשׁ֙ רֹעִ֔י וְכׇל־חֶפְצִ֖י יַשְׁלִ֑ם וְלֵאמֹ֤ר לִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ תִּבָּנֶ֔ה וְהֵיכָ֖ל תִּוָּסֵֽד׃ {פ}
Translated:
Am the same who says of Cyrus, “He is My shepherd;
He shall fulfill all My purposes!
He shall say of Jerusalem, ‘She shall be rebuilt,’
And to the temple: ‘You shall be founded again.’”
Transliteration: haomer lekhvoresh roiy vekhׇl-chefetsiy yashelim velemor liyrushala͏im tivaneh veheykhal tivased {f}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָה֮ לִמְשִׁיחוֹ֮ לְכ֣וֹרֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־הֶחֱזַ֣קְתִּי בִימִינ֗וֹ לְרַד־לְפָנָיו֙ גּוֹיִ֔ם וּמׇתְנֵ֥י מְלָכִ֖ים אֲפַתֵּ֑חַ לִפְתֹּ֤חַ לְפָנָיו֙ דְּלָתַ֔יִם וּשְׁעָרִ֖ים לֹ֥א יִסָּגֵֽרוּ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD to Cyrus, the anointed one—
Having grasped his right hand,
Treading down nations before him,
Ungirding the loins of kings,
Opening doors before him
And letting no gate stay shut:
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah limeshiychvo lekhvoresh asher-hechezaketiy viymiynvo lerad-lefanayv gvoyim umׇteney melakhiym afatecha lifetocha lefanayv delatayiim usheariym lo yisageru

Hebrew: אֲנִי֙ לְפָנֶ֣יךָ אֵלֵ֔ךְ וַהֲדוּרִ֖ים (אושר) [אֲיַשֵּׁ֑ר] דַּלְת֤וֹת נְחוּשָׁה֙ אֲשַׁבֵּ֔ר וּבְרִיחֵ֥י בַרְזֶ֖ל אֲגַדֵּֽעַ׃
Translated:
I will march before you
And level the hills that loom up;
I will shatter doors of bronze
And cut down iron bars.
Transliteration: aniy lefaneykha elekhe vahaduriym (vshr) [ayasher] daletvot nechushah ashaver uveriychey varezel agadea

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י לְךָ֙ אוֹצְר֣וֹת חֹ֔שֶׁךְ וּמַטְמֻנֵ֖י מִסְתָּרִ֑ים לְמַ֣עַן תֵּדַ֗ע כִּֽי־אֲנִ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה הַקּוֹרֵ֥א בְשִׁמְךָ֖ אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
I will give you treasures concealed in the dark
And secret hoards—
So that you may know that it is I the ETERNAL One,
The God of Israel, who call you by name.
Transliteration: venatatiy lekha votservot choshekhe umatemuney misetariym lemaan teda khiy-aniy yehovah hakvore veshimekha elohey yisherael

Hebrew: לְמַ֙עַן֙ עַבְדִּ֣י יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּחִירִ֑י וָאֶקְרָ֤א לְךָ֙ בִּשְׁמֶ֔ךָ אֲכַנְּךָ֖ וְלֹ֥א יְדַעְתָּֽנִי׃
Translated:
For the sake of My servant Jacob,
Israel My chosen one,
I call you by name,
I hail you by title, though you have not known Me.
Transliteration: lemaan avediy yaakov veyisherael vechiyriy vaekera lekha vishemekha akhanekha velo yedaetaniy

Hebrew: אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ וְאֵ֣ין ע֔וֹד זוּלָתִ֖י אֵ֣ין אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֲאַזֶּרְךָ֖ וְלֹ֥א יְדַעְתָּֽנִי׃
Translated:
I am GOD and there is none else;
Beside Me, there is no god.
I engird you, though you have not known Me,
Transliteration: aniy yehovah veeyn vod zulatiy eyn Elohim aazerekha velo yedaetaniy

Hebrew: לְמַ֣עַן יֵדְע֗וּ מִמִּזְרַח־שֶׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ וּמִמַּ֣עֲרָבָ֔הֿ כִּי־אֶ֖פֶס בִּלְעָדָ֑י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה וְאֵ֥ין עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
So that they may know, from east to west,
That there is none but Me.
I am GOD and there is none else,
Transliteration: lemaan eideu mimizerach-shemesh umimaaravahֿ khiy-efes vileaday aniy yehovah veeyn vod

Hebrew: יוֹצֵ֥ר אוֹר֙ וּבוֹרֵ֣א חֹ֔שֶׁךְ עֹשֶׂ֥ה שָׁל֖וֹם וּב֣וֹרֵא רָ֑ע אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה עֹשֶׂ֥ה כׇל־אֵֽלֶּה׃ {פ}
Translated:
I form light and create darkness,
I make weal and create woe—
I GOD do all these things.
Transliteration: yvotser vor uvvore choshekhe osheh shalvom uvvore ra aniy yehovah osheh khׇl-eleh {f}

Hebrew: הַרְעִ֤יפוּ שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ מִמַּ֔עַל וּשְׁחָקִ֖ים יִזְּלוּ־צֶ֑דֶק תִּפְתַּח־אֶ֣רֶץ וְיִפְרוּ־יֶ֗שַׁע וּצְדָקָ֤ה תַצְמִ֙יחַ֙ יַ֔חַד אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּרָאתִֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated:
Pour down, O skies, from above!
Let the heavens rain down victory!
Let the earth open up and triumph sprout,
Yes, let vindication spring up:
I GOD have created it.
Transliteration: hareiyfu shamayiim mimaal ushechakiym yizelu-tsedek tifetach-erets veyiferu-yesha utsedakah tatsemiycha yachad aniy yehovah veratiyv {s}

Hebrew: ה֗וֹי רָ֚ב אֶת־יֹ֣צְר֔וֹ חֶ֖רֶשׂ אֶת־חַרְשֵׂ֣י אֲדָמָ֑ה הֲיֹאמַ֨ר חֹ֤מֶר לְיֹֽצְרוֹ֙ מַֽה־תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה וּפׇעׇלְךָ֖ אֵין־יָדַ֥יִם לֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Shame on anyone who argues with their Maker,
Though naught but a potsherd of earth!
Shall the clay say to the potter, “What are you doing?
Your work has no handles”?
Transliteration: hvoy rav et-yotservo cheresh et-chareshey adamah hayomar chomer leyotservo mah-taasheh ufׇׇlekha eyn-yadayiim lvo {s}

Hebrew: ה֛וֹי אֹמֵ֥ר לְאָ֖ב מַה־תּוֹלִ֑יד וּלְאִשָּׁ֖ה מַה־תְּחִילִֽין׃ {ס}
Translated:
Shame on anyone who asks a father, “What are you begetting?”
Or a woman, “What are you bearing?”
Transliteration: hvoy omer leav mah-tvoliyd uleishah mah-techiyliyn {s}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְיֹצְר֑וֹ הָאֹתִיּ֣וֹת שְׁאָל֔וּנִי עַל־בָּנַ֛י וְעַל־פֹּ֥עַל יָדַ֖י תְּצַוֻּֽנִי׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD,
Israel’s Holy One and Maker:
Will you question Me on the destiny of My children,
Will you instruct Me about the work of My hands?
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah kedvosh yisherael veyotservo haotiyyvot shealuniy al-vanay veal-foal yaday tetsavuniy

Hebrew: אָֽנֹכִי֙ עָשִׂ֣יתִי אֶ֔רֶץ וְאָדָ֖ם עָלֶ֣יהָ בָרָ֑אתִי אֲנִ֗י יָדַי֙ נָט֣וּ שָׁמַ֔יִם וְכׇל־צְבָאָ֖ם צִוֵּֽיתִי׃
Translated:
It was I who made the earth
And created humankind upon it;
My own hands stretched out the heavens,
And I marshaled all their host.
Transliteration: anokhiy ashiytiy erets veadam aleyha varatiy aniy yaday natu shamayiim vekhׇl-tsevaam tsiveytiy

Hebrew: אָֽנֹכִי֙ הַעִירֹתִ֣הֽוּ בְצֶ֔דֶק וְכׇל־דְּרָכָ֖יו אֲיַשֵּׁ֑ר הֽוּא־יִבְנֶ֤ה עִירִי֙ וְגָלוּתִ֣י יְשַׁלֵּ֔חַ לֹ֤א בִמְחִיר֙ וְלֹ֣א בְשֹׁ֔חַד אָמַ֖ר יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated:
It was I who roused him for victory
And who level all roads for him.
He shall rebuild My city
And let My exiled people go
Without price and without payment
—said GOD of Hosts.
Transliteration: anokhiy haiyrotihu vetsedek vekhׇl-derakhayv ayasher hu-yiveneh iyriy vegalutiy yeshalecha lo vimechiyr velo veshochad amar yehovah tsevavot {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה יְגִ֨יעַ מִצְרַ֥יִם וּֽסְחַר־כּוּשׁ֮ וּסְבָאִים֮ אַנְשֵׁ֣י מִדָּה֒ עָלַ֤יִךְ יַעֲבֹ֙רוּ֙ וְלָ֣ךְ יִֽהְי֔וּ אַחֲרַ֣יִךְ יֵלֵ֔כוּ בַּזִּקִּ֖ים יַעֲבֹ֑רוּ וְאֵלַ֤יִךְ יִֽשְׁתַּחֲווּ֙ אֵלַ֣יִךְ יִתְפַּלָּ֔לוּ אַ֣ךְ בָּ֥ךְ אֵ֛ל וְאֵ֥ין ע֖וֹד אֶ֥פֶס אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
Egypt’s wealth and Cush’s gains
And Sabaites, long of limb,
Shall pass over to you and be yours,
Pass over and follow you in fetters,
Bow low to you
And reverently address you:
“Only among you is God,
There is no other god at all!
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah yegiya mitserayiim usechar-khush usevaiym aneshey midah alayiikhe yaavoru velakhe yiheyu acharayiikhe eilekhu vazikiym yaavoru veelayiikhe yishetachavu elayiikhe yitefalalu akhe vakhe el veeyn vod efes Elohim

Hebrew: אָכֵ֕ן אַתָּ֖ה אֵ֣ל מִסְתַּתֵּ֑ר אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated:
You are indeed a God who hides in concealment,
O God of Israel, who brings victory!
Transliteration: akhen atah el misetater elohey yisherael mvoshiya

Hebrew: בּ֥וֹשׁוּ וְגַֽם־נִכְלְמ֖וּ כֻּלָּ֑ם יַחְדָּו֙ הָלְכ֣וּ בַכְּלִמָּ֔ה חָרָשֵׁ֖י צִירִֽים׃
Translated:
Those who fabricate idols—
All are shamed and disgraced;
They slink away in disgrace together.
Transliteration: vvoshu vegam-nikhelemu khulam yachedav halekhu vakhelimah charashey tsiyriym

Hebrew: יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ נוֹשַׁ֣ע בַּֽיהֹוָ֔ה תְּשׁוּעַ֖ת עוֹלָמִ֑ים לֹא־תֵבֹ֥שׁוּ וְלֹא־תִכָּלְמ֖וּ עַד־ע֥וֹלְמֵי עַֽד׃ {פ}
Translated:
But Israel has won through GOD
Triumph everlasting.
You shall not be shamed or disgraced
In all the ages to come!”
Transliteration: yisherael nvosha vayhovah teshuat volamiym lo-tevoshu velo-tikhalemu ad-volemey ad {f}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֣ה אָֽמַר־יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה בּוֹרֵ֨א הַשָּׁמַ֜יִם ה֣וּא הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים יֹצֵ֨ר הָאָ֤רֶץ וְעֹשָׂהּ֙ ה֣וּא כֽוֹנְנָ֔הּ לֹא־תֹ֥הוּ בְרָאָ֖הּ לָשֶׁ֣בֶת יְצָרָ֑הּ אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה וְאֵ֥ין עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
For thus said GOD,
The Creator of heaven who alone is God,
Who formed the earth and made it,
Who alone established it—
Who did not create it a waste,
But formed it for habitation:
I am GOD, and there is none else.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar-yehovah vvore hashamayiim hu haElohim yotser haarets veoshah hu khvonenah lo-tohu veraah lashevet yetsarah aniy yehovah veeyn vod

Hebrew: לֹ֧א בַסֵּ֣תֶר דִּבַּ֗רְתִּי בִּמְקוֹם֙ אֶ֣רֶץ חֹ֔שֶׁךְ לֹ֥א אָמַ֛רְתִּי לְזֶ֥רַע יַעֲקֹ֖ב תֹּ֣הוּ בַקְּשׁ֑וּנִי אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ דֹּבֵ֣ר צֶ֔דֶק מַגִּ֖יד מֵישָׁרִֽים׃
Translated:
I did not speak in secret,
At a site in a land of darkness;
I did not say to the stock of Jacob,
“Seek Me out in a wasteland”—
I GOD, who foretell reliably,
Who announce what is true.
Transliteration: lo vaseter divaretiy vimekvom erets choshekhe lo amaretiy lezera yaakov tohu vakeshuniy aniy yehovah dover tsedek magiyd meyshariym

Hebrew: הִקָּבְצ֥וּ וָבֹ֛אוּ הִֽתְנַגְּשׁ֥וּ יַחְדָּ֖ו פְּלִיטֵ֣י הַגּוֹיִ֑ם לֹ֣א יָדְע֗וּ הַנֹּֽשְׂאִים֙ אֶת־עֵ֣ץ פִּסְלָ֔ם וּמִֽתְפַּלְלִ֔ים אֶל־אֵ֖ל לֹ֥א יוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated:
Come, gather together,
Draw nigh, you remnants of the nations!
No foreknowledge had they who carry their wooden images
And pray to a god who cannot give success.
Transliteration: hikavetsu vavou hitenageshu yachedav feliytey hagvoyim lo yadeu hanosheiym et-ets fiselam umitefaleliym el-el lo yvoshiya

Hebrew: הַגִּ֣ידוּ וְהַגִּ֔ישׁוּ אַ֥ף יִֽוָּעֲצ֖וּ יַחְדָּ֑ו מִ֣י הִשְׁמִ֩יעַ֩ זֹ֨את מִקֶּ֜דֶם מֵאָ֣ז הִגִּידָ֗הּ הֲל֨וֹא אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ וְאֵֽין־ע֤וֹד אֱלֹהִים֙ מִבַּלְעָדַ֔י אֵל־צַדִּ֣יק וּמוֹשִׁ֔יעַ אַ֖יִן זוּלָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Speak up, compare testimony—
Let them even take counsel together!
Who announced this aforetime,
Foretold it of old?
Was it not I the ETERNAL One?
Then there is no god beside Me,
No God exists beside Me
Who foretells truly and grants success.
Transliteration: hagiydu vehagiyshu af yivaatsu yachedav miy hishemiya zot mikedem meaz higiydah halvo aniy yehovah veeyn-vod Elohim mivaleaday el-tsadiyk umvoshiya ayiin zulatiy

Hebrew: פְּנוּ־אֵלַ֥י וְהִוָּשְׁע֖וּ כׇּל־אַפְסֵי־אָ֑רֶץ כִּ֥י אֲנִי־אֵ֖ל וְאֵ֥ין עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
Turn to Me and gain success,
All the ends of earth!
For I am God, and there is none else.
Transliteration: fenu-elay vehivasheu khׇl-afesey-arets khiy aniy-el veeyn vod

Hebrew: בִּ֣י נִשְׁבַּ֔עְתִּי יָצָ֨א מִפִּ֧י צְדָקָ֛ה דָּבָ֖ר וְלֹ֣א יָשׁ֑וּב כִּי־לִי֙ תִּכְרַ֣ע כׇּל־בֶּ֔רֶךְ תִּשָּׁבַ֖ע כׇּל־לָשֽׁוֹן׃
Translated:
By Myself have I sworn,
From My mouth has issued truth,
A word that shall not turn back:
To Me every knee shall bend,
Every tongue swear loyalty.
Transliteration: viy nishevaetiy yatsa mifiy tsedakah davar velo yashuv khiy-liy tikhera khׇl-verekhe tishava khׇl-lashvon

Hebrew: אַ֧ךְ בַּיהֹוָ֛ה לִ֥י אָמַ֖ר צְדָק֣וֹת וָעֹ֑ז עָדָיו֙ יָב֣וֹא וְיֵבֹ֔שׁוּ כֹּ֖ל הַנֶּחֱרִ֥ים בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
They shall say: “Only through GOD
Can I find victory and might.
When people trust in [God],
All their adversaries are put to shame.
Transliteration: akhe vayhovah liy amar tsedakvot vaoz adayv yavvo veeivoshu khol hanecheriym vvo

Hebrew: בַּיהֹוָ֛ה יִצְדְּק֥וּ וְיִֽתְהַלְל֖וּ כׇּל־זֶ֥רַע יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
It is through GOD that all the offspring of Israel
Have vindication and glory.”
Transliteration: vayhovah yitsedeku veyitehalelu khׇl-zera yisherael

Hebrew: כָּרַ֥ע בֵּל֙ קֹרֵ֣ס נְב֔וֹ הָיוּ֙ עֲצַבֵּיהֶ֔ם לַחַיָּ֖ה וְלַבְּהֵמָ֑ה נְשֻׂאֹתֵיכֶ֣ם עֲמוּס֔וֹת מַשָּׂ֖א לַעֲיֵפָֽה׃
Translated:
Bel is bowed, Nebo is cowering,
Their images are a burden for beasts and cattle;
The things you would carry [in procession]
Are now piled as a burden
On tired [beasts].
Transliteration: khara vel kores nevvo hayu atsaveyhem lachayah velavehemah neshuoteykhem amusvot masha laaeifah

Hebrew: קָרְס֤וּ כָֽרְעוּ֙ יַחְדָּ֔ו לֹ֥א יָכְל֖וּ מַלֵּ֣ט מַשָּׂ֑א וְנַפְשָׁ֖ם בַּשְּׁבִ֥י הָלָֽכָה׃ {פ}
Translated:
They cowered, they bowed as well,
They could not rescue the burden,
And they themselves went into captivity.
Transliteration: karesu khareu yachedav lo yakhelu malet masha venafesham vasheviy halakhah {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֤וּ אֵלַי֙ בֵּ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְכׇל־שְׁאֵרִ֖ית בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הַֽעֲמֻסִים֙ מִנִּי־בֶ֔טֶן הַנְּשֻׂאִ֖ים מִנִּי־רָֽחַם׃
Translated:
Listen to Me, O House of Jacob,
All that are left of the House of Israel,
Who have been carried since birth,
Supported since leaving the womb:
Transliteration: shimeu elay veyt yaakov vekhׇl-sheeriyt veyt yisherael haamusiym miniy-veten haneshuiym miniy-racham

Hebrew: וְעַד־זִקְנָה֙ אֲנִ֣י ה֔וּא וְעַד־שֵׂיבָ֖ה אֲנִ֣י אֶסְבֹּ֑ל אֲנִ֤י עָשִׂ֙יתִי֙ וַאֲנִ֣י אֶשָּׂ֔א וַאֲנִ֥י אֶסְבֹּ֖ל וַאֲמַלֵּֽט׃ {ס}
Translated:
Till you grow old, I will still be the same;
When you turn gray, it is I who will carry;
I was the Maker, and I will be the Bearer;
And I will carry and rescue [you].
Transliteration: vead-zikenah aniy hu vead-sheyvah aniy esevol aniy ashiytiy vaaniy esha vaaniy esevol vaamalet {s}

Hebrew: לְמִ֥י תְדַמְּי֖וּנִי וְתַשְׁו֑וּ וְתַמְשִׁל֖וּנִי וְנִדְמֶֽה׃
Translated:
To whom can you compare Me
Or declare Me similar?
To whom can you liken Me,
So that we seem comparable?
Transliteration: lemiy tedameyuniy vetashevu vetameshiluniy venidemeh

Hebrew: הַזָּלִ֤ים זָהָב֙ מִכִּ֔יס וְכֶ֖סֶף בַּקָּנֶ֣ה יִשְׁקֹ֑לוּ יִשְׂכְּר֤וּ צוֹרֵף֙ וְיַעֲשֵׂ֣הוּ אֵ֔ל יִסְגְּד֖וּ אַף־יִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֽוּ׃
Translated:
Those who squander gold from the purse
And weigh out silver on the balance,
They hire a metal worker to make it into a god,
To which they bow down and prostrate themselves.
Transliteration: hazaliym zahav mikhiys vekhesef vakaneh yishekolu yishekheru tsvoref veyaashehu el yisegedu af-yishetachavu

Hebrew: יִ֠שָּׂאֻ֠הוּ עַל־כָּתֵ֨ף יִסְבְּלֻ֜הוּ וְיַנִּיחֻ֤הוּ תַחְתָּיו֙ וְיַֽעֲמֹ֔ד מִמְּקוֹמ֖וֹ לֹ֣א יָמִ֑ישׁ אַף־יִצְעַ֤ק אֵלָיו֙ וְלֹ֣א יַעֲנֶ֔ה מִצָּרָת֖וֹ לֹ֥א יוֹשִׁיעֶֽנּוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
They must carry it on their backs and transport it;
When they put it down, it stands,
It does not budge from its place.
If they cry out to it, it does not answer;
It cannot save them from their distress.
Transliteration: yishauhu al-khatef yiseveluhu veyaniychuhu tachetayv veyaamod mimekvomvo lo yamiysh af-yitseak elayv velo yaaneh mitsaratvo lo yvoshiyenu {s}

Hebrew: זִכְרוּ־זֹ֖את וְהִתְאֹשָׁ֑שׁוּ הָשִׁ֥יבוּ פוֹשְׁעִ֖ים עַל־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
Keep this in mind, and stand firm!
Take this to heart, you sinners!
Transliteration: zikheru-zot vehiteoshashu hashiyvu fvosheiym al-lev

Hebrew: זִכְר֥וּ רִאשֹׁנ֖וֹת מֵעוֹלָ֑ם כִּ֣י אָנֹכִ֥י אֵל֙ וְאֵ֣ין ע֔וֹד אֱלֹהִ֖ים וְאֶ֥פֶס כָּמֽוֹנִי׃
Translated:
Bear in mind what happened of old;
For I am God, and there is none else,
I am divine, and there is none like Me.
Transliteration: zikheru rishonvot mevolam khiy anokhiy el veeyn vod Elohim veefes khamvoniy

Hebrew: מַגִּ֤יד מֵֽרֵאשִׁית֙ אַחֲרִ֔ית וּמִקֶּ֖דֶם אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־נַֽעֲשׂ֑וּ אֹמֵר֙ עֲצָתִ֣י תָק֔וּם וְכׇל־חֶפְצִ֖י אֶעֱשֶֽׂה׃
Translated:
I foretell the end from the beginning,
And from the start, things that had not occurred.
I say: My plan shall be fulfilled;
I will do all I have purposed.
Transliteration: magiyd mereshiyt achariyt umikedem asher lo-naashu omer atsatiy takum vekhׇl-chefetsiy eesheh

Hebrew: קֹרֵ֤א מִמִּזְרָח֙ עַ֔יִט מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מֶרְחָ֖ק אִ֣ישׁ (עצתו) [עֲצָתִ֑י] אַף־דִּבַּ֙רְתִּי֙ אַף־אֲבִיאֶ֔נָּה יָצַ֖רְתִּי אַף־אֶעֱשֶֽׂנָּה׃ {ס}
Translated:
I summoned that swooping bird from the East;
From a distant land, the man for My purpose.
I have spoken, so I will bring it to pass;
I have designed it, so I will complete it.
Transliteration: kore mimizerach ayiit meerets merechak iysh (tstv) [atsatiy] af-divaretiy af-aviyenah yatsaretiy af-eeshenah {s}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֥וּ אֵלַ֖י אַבִּ֣ירֵי לֵ֑ב הָרְחוֹקִ֖ים מִצְּדָקָֽה׃
Translated:
Listen to Me, you stubborn of heart,
Who are far from victory:
Transliteration: shimeu elay aviyrey lev harechvokiym mitsedakah

Hebrew: קֵרַ֤בְתִּי צִדְקָתִי֙ לֹ֣א תִרְחָ֔ק וּתְשׁוּעָתִ֖י לֹ֣א תְאַחֵ֑ר וְנָתַתִּ֤י בְצִיּוֹן֙ תְּשׁוּעָ֔ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תִּפְאַרְתִּֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
I am bringing My victory close;
It shall not be far,
And My triumph shall not be delayed.
I will grant triumph in Zion
To Israel, in whom I glory.
Transliteration: keravetiy tsidekatiy lo tirechak uteshuatiy lo teacher venatatiy vetsiyyvon teshuah leyisherael tifearetiy {s}

Hebrew: רְדִ֣י ׀ וּשְׁבִ֣י עַל־עָפָ֗ר בְּתוּלַת֙ בַּת־בָּבֶ֔ל שְׁבִי־לָאָ֥רֶץ אֵין־כִּסֵּ֖א בַּת־כַּשְׂדִּ֑ים כִּ֣י לֹ֤א תוֹסִ֙יפִי֙ יִקְרְאוּ־לָ֔ךְ רַכָּ֖ה וַעֲנֻגָּֽה׃
Translated:
Get down, sit in the dust,
Fair Maiden Babylon;
Sit, dethroned, on the ground,
O Fair Chaldea;
Nevermore shall they call you
The tender and dainty one.
Transliteration: rediy usheviy al-afar vetulat vat-vavel sheviy-laarets eyn-khise vat-khashediym khiy lo tvosiyfiy yikereu-lakhe rakhah vaanugah

Hebrew: קְחִ֥י רֵחַ֖יִם וְטַ֣חֲנִי קָ֑מַח גַּלִּ֨י צַמָּתֵ֧ךְ חֶשְׂפִּי־שֹׁ֛בֶל גַּלִּי־שׁ֖וֹק עִבְרִ֥י נְהָרֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Grasp the hand mill and grind meal.
Remove your veil,
Strip off your train, bare your leg,
Wade through the rivers.
Transliteration: kechiy rechayiim vetachaniy kamach galiy tsamatekhe cheshefiy-shovel galiy-shvok iveriy neharvot

Hebrew: תִּגָּל֙ עֶרְוָתֵ֔ךְ גַּ֥ם תֵּרָאֶ֖ה חֶרְפָּתֵ֑ךְ נָקָ֣ם אֶקָּ֔ח וְלֹ֥א אֶפְגַּ֖ע אָדָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
Your nakedness shall be uncovered,
And your shame shall be exposed.
I will take vengeance,
And let no one intercede.
Transliteration: tigal erevatekhe gam teraeh cherefatekhe nakam ekach velo efega adam {f}

Hebrew: גֹּאֲלֵ֕נוּ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁמ֑וֹ קְד֖וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Our Redeemer—whose name is GOD of Hosts—
Is the Holy One of Israel.
Transliteration: goalenu yehovah tsevavot shemvo kedvosh yisherael

Hebrew: שְׁבִ֥י דוּמָ֛ם וּבֹ֥אִי בַחֹ֖שֶׁךְ בַּת־כַּשְׂדִּ֑ים כִּ֣י לֹ֤א תוֹסִ֙יפִי֙ יִקְרְאוּ־לָ֔ךְ גְּבֶ֖רֶת מַמְלָכֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Sit silent; retire into darkness,
O Fair Chaldea;
Nevermore shall they call you
Mistress of Kingdoms.
Transliteration: sheviy dumam uvoiy vachoshekhe vat-khashediym khiy lo tvosiyfiy yikereu-lakhe geveret mamelakhvot

Hebrew: קָצַ֣פְתִּי עַל־עַמִּ֗י חִלַּ֙לְתִּי֙ נַחֲלָתִ֔י וָאֶתְּנֵ֖ם בְּיָדֵ֑ךְ לֹא־שַׂ֤מְתְּ לָהֶם֙ רַחֲמִ֔ים עַל־זָקֵ֕ן הִכְבַּ֥דְתְּ עֻלֵּ֖ךְ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
I was angry at My people,
I defiled My heritage;
I put them into your hands,
But you showed them no mercy.
Even upon the aged you made
Your yoke exceedingly heavy.
Transliteration: katsafetiy al-amiy chilaletiy nachalatiy vaetenem veyadekhe lo-shamete lahem rachamiym al-zaken hikhevadete ulekhe meod

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמְרִ֔י לְעוֹלָ֖ם אֶהְיֶ֣ה גְבָ֑רֶת עַ֣ד לֹא־שַׂ֥מְתְּ אֵ֙לֶּה֙ עַל־לִבֵּ֔ךְ לֹ֥א זָכַ֖רְתְּ אַחֲרִיתָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
You thought, “I shall always be
The mistress still.”
You did not take these things to heart,
You gave no thought to the end of it.
Transliteration: vatomeriy levolam eheyeh gevaret ad lo-shamete eleh al-livekhe lo zakharete achariytah {f}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֞ה שִׁמְעִי־זֹ֤את עֲדִינָה֙ הַיּוֹשֶׁ֣בֶת לָבֶ֔טַח הָאֹֽמְרָה֙ בִּלְבָבָ֔הּ אֲנִ֖י וְאַפְסִ֣י ע֑וֹד לֹ֤א אֵשֵׁב֙ אַלְמָנָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א אֵדַ֖ע שְׁכֽוֹל׃
Translated:
And now hear this, O pampered one—
Who dwell in security,
Who think to yourself,
“I am, and there is none but me;
I shall not become a widow
Or know loss of children”—
Transliteration: veatah shimeiy-zot adiynah hayyvoshevet lavetach haomerah vilevavah aniy veafesiy vod lo eshev alemanah velo eda shekhvol

Hebrew: וְתָבֹ֩אנָה֩ לָּ֨ךְ שְׁתֵּי־אֵ֥לֶּה רֶ֛גַע בְּי֥וֹם אֶחָ֖ד שְׁכ֣וֹל וְאַלְמֹ֑ן כְּתֻמָּם֙ בָּ֣אוּ עָלַ֔יִךְ בְּרֹ֣ב כְּשָׁפַ֔יִךְ בְּעׇצְמַ֥ת חֲבָרַ֖יִךְ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
These two things shall come upon you,
Suddenly, in one day:
Loss of children and widowhood
Shall come upon you in full measure,
Despite your many enchantments
And all your countless spells.
Transliteration: vetavonah lakhe shetey-eleh rega veyvom echad shekhvol vealemon khetumam vau alayiikhe verov kheshafayiikhe veׇtsemat chavarayiikhe meod

Hebrew: וַתִּבְטְחִ֣י בְרָעָתֵ֗ךְ אָמַרְתְּ֙ אֵ֣ין רֹאָ֔נִי חׇכְמָתֵ֥ךְ וְדַעְתֵּ֖ךְ הִ֣יא שׁוֹבְבָ֑תֶךְ וַתֹּאמְרִ֣י בְלִבֵּ֔ךְ אֲנִ֖י וְאַפְסִ֥י עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
You were secure in your wickedness;
You thought, “No one can see me.”
It was your skill and your science
That led you astray.
And you thought to yourself,
“I am, and there is none but me.”
Transliteration: vativetechiy veraatekhe amarete eyn roaniy chׇkhematekhe vedaetekhe hiy shvovevatekhe vatomeriy velivekhe aniy veafesiy vod

Hebrew: וּבָ֧א עָלַ֣יִךְ רָעָ֗ה לֹ֤א תֵֽדְעִי֙ שַׁחְרָ֔הּ וְתִפֹּ֤ל עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ הֹוָ֔ה לֹ֥א תוּכְלִ֖י כַּפְּרָ֑הּ וְתָבֹ֨א עָלַ֧יִךְ פִּתְאֹ֛ם שֹׁאָ֖ה לֹ֥א תֵדָֽעִי׃
Translated:
Evil is coming upon you
That you will not know how to charm away;
Disaster is falling upon you
That you will not be able to appease;
Coming upon you suddenly
Is ruin of which you know nothing.
Transliteration: uva alayiikhe raah lo tedeiy shacherah vetifol alayiikhe hovah lo tukheliy khaferah vetavo alayiikhe fiteom shoah lo tedaiy

Hebrew: עִמְדִי־נָ֤א בַחֲבָרַ֙יִךְ֙ וּבְרֹ֣ב כְּשָׁפַ֔יִךְ בַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יָגַ֖עַתְּ מִנְּעוּרָ֑יִךְ אוּלַ֛י תּוּכְלִ֥י הוֹעִ֖יל אוּלַ֥י תַּעֲרֽוֹצִי׃
Translated:
Stand up, with your spells and your many enchantments
On which you labored since youth!
Perhaps you’ll be able to profit,
Perhaps you will find strength.
Transliteration: imediy-na vachavarayiikhe uverov kheshafayiikhe vaasher yagaate mineurayiikhe ulay tukheliy hvoiyl ulay taarvotsiy

Hebrew: נִלְאֵ֖ית בְּרֹ֣ב עֲצָתָ֑יִךְ יַעַמְדוּ־נָ֨א וְיוֹשִׁיעֻ֜ךְ (הברו) [הֹבְרֵ֣י] שָׁמַ֗יִם הַחֹזִים֙ בַּכּ֣וֹכָבִ֔ים מֽוֹדִעִים֙ לֶחֳדָשִׁ֔ים מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר יָבֹ֖אוּ עָלָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
You are helpless, despite all your art.
Let them stand up and help you now,
The scanners of heaven, the star-gazers,
Who announce, month by month,
Whatever will come upon you.
Transliteration: nileeyt verov atsatayiikhe yaamedu-na veyvoshiyukhe (hvrv) [hoverey] shamayiim hachoziym vakhvokhaviym mvodiiym lechodashiym measher yavou alayiikhe

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה הָי֤וּ כְקַשׁ֙ אֵ֣שׁ שְׂרָפָ֔תַם לֹא־יַצִּ֥ילוּ אֶת־נַפְשָׁ֖ם מִיַּ֣ד לֶהָבָ֑ה אֵין־גַּחֶ֣לֶת לַחְמָ֔ם א֖וּר לָשֶׁ֥בֶת נֶגְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
See, they are become like straw,
Fire consumes them;
They cannot save themselves
From the power of the flame;
This is no coal for warming oneself,
No fire to sit by!
Transliteration: hineh hayu khekash esh sherafatam lo-yatsiylu et-nafesham miyad lehavah eyn-gachelet lachemam ur lashevet negedvo

Hebrew: כֵּ֥ן הָיוּ־לָ֖ךְ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָגָ֑עַתְּ סֹחֲרַ֣יִךְ מִנְּעוּרַ֗יִךְ אִ֤ישׁ לְעֶבְרוֹ֙ תָּע֔וּ אֵ֖ין מוֹשִׁיעֵֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
This is what they have profited you—
The traders you dealt with since youth—
They have all wandered off on separate paths,
There is none to save you.
Transliteration: khen hayu-lakhe asher yagaate socharayiikhe mineurayiikhe iysh leevervo tau eyn mvoshiyekhe {s}

Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ־זֹ֣את בֵּֽית־יַעֲקֹ֗ב הַנִּקְרָאִים֙ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּמִמֵּ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה יָצָ֑אוּ הַֽנִּשְׁבָּעִ֣ים ׀ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֗ה וּבֵאלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ יַזְכִּ֔ירוּ לֹ֥א בֶאֱמֶ֖ת וְלֹ֥א בִצְדָקָֽה׃
Translated:
Listen to this, O House of Jacob,
Who bear the name Israel
And have issued from the waters of Judah,
Who swear by the name of GOD
And invoke the God of Israel—
Though not in truth and sincerity—
Transliteration: shimeu-zot veyt-yaakov hanikeraiym veshem yisherael umimey yehudah yatsau hanishevaiym veshem yehovah uvelohey yisherael yazekhiyru lo veemet velo vitsedakah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־מֵעִ֤יר הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ נִקְרָ֔אוּ וְעַל־אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נִסְמָ֑כוּ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁמֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
For you are called after the Holy City
And you do lean on the God of Israel,
Whose name is GOD of Hosts:
Transliteration: khiy-meiyr hakodesh nikerau veal-elohey yisherael nisemakhu yehovah tsevavot shemvo {s}

Hebrew: הָרִֽאשֹׁנוֹת֙ מֵאָ֣ז הִגַּ֔דְתִּי וּמִפִּ֥י יָצְא֖וּ וְאַשְׁמִיעֵ֑ם פִּתְאֹ֥ם עָשִׂ֖יתִי וַתָּבֹֽאנָה׃
Translated:
Long ago, I foretold things that happened,
From My mouth they issued, and I announced them;
Suddenly I acted, and they came to pass.
Transliteration: harishonvot meaz higadetiy umifiy yatseu veashemiyem fiteom ashiytiy vatavonah

Hebrew: מִדַּעְתִּ֕י כִּ֥י קָשֶׁ֖ה אָ֑תָּה וְגִ֤יד בַּרְזֶל֙ עׇרְפֶּ֔ךָ וּמִצְחֲךָ֖ נְחוּשָֽׁה׃
Translated:
Because I know how stubborn you are
(Your neck is like an iron sinew
And your forehead bronze),
Transliteration: midaetiy khiy kasheh atah vegiyd varezel ׇrefekha umitsechakha nechushah

Hebrew: וָאַגִּ֤יד לְךָ֙ מֵאָ֔ז בְּטֶ֥רֶם תָּב֖וֹא הִשְׁמַעְתִּ֑יךָ פֶּן־תֹּאמַר֙ עׇצְבִּ֣י עָשָׂ֔ם וּפִסְלִ֥י וְנִסְכִּ֖י צִוָּֽם׃
Translated:
Therefore I told you long beforehand,
Announced things to you ere they happened—
That you might not say, “My idol caused them,
My carved and molten images ordained them.”
Transliteration: vaagiyd lekha meaz veterem tavvo hishemaetiykha fen-tomar ׇtseviy asham ufiseliy venisekhiy tsivam

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֤עְתָּֽ חֲזֵה֙ כֻּלָּ֔הּ וְאַתֶּ֖ם הֲל֣וֹא תַגִּ֑ידוּ הִשְׁמַעְתִּ֤יךָ חֲדָשׁוֹת֙ מֵעַ֔תָּה וּנְצֻר֖וֹת וְלֹ֥א יְדַעְתָּֽם׃
Translated:
You have heard all this; look, must you not acknowledge it?
As of now, I announce to you new things,
Well-guarded secrets you did not know.
Transliteration: shamaeta chazeh khulah veatem halvo tagiydu hishemaetiykha chadashvot meatah unetsurvot velo yedaetam

Hebrew: עַתָּ֤ה נִבְרְאוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א מֵאָ֔ז וְלִפְנֵי־י֖וֹם וְלֹ֣א שְׁמַעְתָּ֑ם פֶּן־תֹּאמַ֖ר הִנֵּ֥ה יְדַעְתִּֽין׃
Translated:
Only now are they created, and not of old;
Before today you had not heard them;
You cannot say, “I knew them already.”
Transliteration: atah nivereu velo meaz velifeney-yvom velo shemaetam fen-tomar hineh yedaetiyn

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם לֹֽא־שָׁמַ֗עְתָּ גַּ֚ם לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתָּ גַּ֕ם מֵאָ֖ז לֹא־פִתְּחָ֣ה אׇזְנֶ֑ךָ כִּ֤י יָדַ֙עְתִּי֙ בָּג֣וֹד תִּבְגּ֔וֹד וּפֹשֵׁ֥עַ מִבֶּ֖טֶן קֹ֥רָא לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
You had never heard, you had never known,
Your ears were not opened of old.
Though I know that you are treacherous,
That you were called a rebel from birth,
Transliteration: gam lo-shamaeta gam lo yadaeta gam meaz lo-fitechah ׇzenekha khiy yadaetiy vagvod tivegvod ufoshea miveten kora lakhe

Hebrew: לְמַ֤עַן שְׁמִי֙ אַאֲרִ֣יךְ אַפִּ֔י וּתְהִלָּתִ֖י אֶחֱטׇם־לָ֑ךְ לְבִלְתִּ֖י הַכְרִיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
For the sake of My name I control My wrath;
To My own glory, I am patient with you,
And I will not destroy you.
Transliteration: lemaan shemiy aariykhe afiy utehilatiy echetׇm-lakhe leviletiy hakheriytekha

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה צְרַפְתִּ֖יךָ וְלֹ֣א בְכָ֑סֶף בְּחַרְתִּ֖יךָ בְּכ֥וּר עֹֽנִי׃
Translated:
See, I refine you, but not as silver;
I test you in the furnace of affliction.
Transliteration: hineh tserafetiykha velo vekhasef vecharetiykha vekhur oniy

Hebrew: לְמַעֲנִ֧י לְמַעֲנִ֛י אֶעֱשֶׂ֖ה כִּ֣י אֵ֣יךְ יֵחָ֑ל וּכְבוֹדִ֖י לְאַחֵ֥ר לֹא־אֶתֵּֽן׃ {פ}
Translated:
For My sake, My own sake, do I act—
Lest [My name] be dishonored!
I will not give My glory to another.
Transliteration: lemaaniy lemaaniy eesheh khiy eykhe eichal ukhevvodiy leacher lo-eten {f}

Hebrew: שְׁמַ֤ע אֵלַי֙ יַֽעֲקֹ֔ב וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מְקֹרָאִ֑י אֲנִי־הוּא֙ אֲנִ֣י רִאשׁ֔וֹן אַ֖ף אֲנִ֥י אַחֲרֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Listen to Me, O Jacob,
Israel, whom I have called:
I am the One—I am the first,
And I am the last as well.
Transliteration: shema elay yaakov veyisherael mekoraiy aniy-hu aniy rishvon af aniy acharvon

Hebrew: אַף־יָדִי֙ יָ֣סְדָה אֶ֔רֶץ וִימִינִ֖י טִפְּחָ֣ה שָׁמָ֑יִם קֹרֵ֥א אֲנִ֛י אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם יַעַמְד֥וּ יַחְדָּֽו׃
Translated:
My own hand founded the earth,
My right hand spread out the skies.
I call unto them, let them stand up.
Transliteration: af-yadiy yasedah erets viymiyniy tifechah shamayiim kore aniy aleyhem yaamedu yachedav

Hebrew: הִקָּבְצ֤וּ כֻלְּכֶם֙ וּֽשְׁמָ֔עוּ מִ֥י בָהֶ֖ם הִגִּ֣יד אֶת־אֵ֑לֶּה יְהֹוָ֣ה אֲהֵב֔וֹ יַעֲשֶׂ֤ה חֶפְצוֹ֙ בְּבָבֶ֔ל וּזְרֹע֖וֹ כַּשְׂדִּֽים׃
Translated:
Assemble, all of you, and listen!
Who among you foretold these things:
“He whom GOD loves
Shall work the divine will against Babylon,
And, with divine might, against Chaldea”?
Transliteration: hikavetsu khulekhem ushemau miy vahem higiyd et-eleh yehovah ahevvo yaasheh chefetsvo vevavel uzerovo khashediym

Hebrew: אֲנִ֥י אֲנִ֛י דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי אַף־קְרָאתִ֑יו הֲבִאֹתִ֖יו וְהִצְלִ֥יחַ דַּרְכּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
I, I predicted, and I called him;
I have brought him and he shall succeed in his mission.
Transliteration: aniy aniy divaretiy af-keratiyv haviotiyv vehitseliycha darekhvo

Hebrew: קִרְב֧וּ אֵלַ֣י שִׁמְעוּ־זֹ֗את לֹ֤א מֵרֹאשׁ֙ בַּסֵּ֣תֶר דִּבַּ֔רְתִּי מֵעֵ֥ת הֱיוֹתָ֖הּ שָׁ֣ם אָ֑נִי וְעַתָּ֗ה אֲדֹנָ֧י יֱהֹוִ֛ה שְׁלָחַ֖נִי וְרוּחֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Draw near to Me and hear this:
From the beginning, I did not speak in secret;
From the time anything existed, I was there.
“And now the Sovereign GOD has sent me, endowed with divine spirit.”
Transliteration: kirevu elay shimeu-zot lo merosh vaseter divaretiy meet heyvotah sham aniy veatah adonay yehovih shelachaniy veruchvo {f}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה גֹּאַלְךָ֖ קְד֣וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲנִ֨י יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ מְלַמֶּדְךָ֣ לְהוֹעִ֔יל מַדְרִֽיכְךָ֖ בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ תֵּלֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD your Redeemer,
The Holy One of Israel:
I the ETERNAL One am your God,
Instructing you for your own benefit.
Guiding you in the way you should go.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah goalekha kedvosh yisherael aniy yehovah eloheykha melamedekha lehvoiyl maderiykhekha vederekhe telekhe

Hebrew: ל֥וּא הִקְשַׁ֖בְתָּ לְמִצְוֺתָ֑י וַיְהִ֤י כַנָּהָר֙ שְׁלוֹמֶ֔ךָ וְצִדְקָתְךָ֖ כְּגַלֵּ֥י הַיָּֽם׃
Translated:
If only you would heed My commands!
Then your prosperity would be like a river,
Your triumph like the waves of the sea.
Transliteration: lu hikeshaveta lemitsevotay vayehiy khanahar shelvomekha vetsidekatekha khegaley hayam

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י כַחוֹל֙ זַרְעֶ֔ךָ וְצֶאֱצָאֵ֥י מֵעֶ֖יךָ כִּמְעֹתָ֑יו לֹא־יִכָּרֵ֧ת וְֽלֹא־יִשָּׁמֵ֛ד שְׁמ֖וֹ מִלְּפָנָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Your offspring would be as many as the sand,
Their issue as many as its grains.
Their name would never be cut off
Or obliterated from before Me.
Transliteration: vayehiy khachvol zareekha vetseetsaey meeykha khimeotayv lo-yikharet velo-yishamed shemvo milefanay {s}

Hebrew: צְא֣וּ מִבָּבֶל֮ בִּרְח֣וּ מִכַּשְׂדִּים֒ בְּק֣וֹל רִנָּ֗ה הַגִּ֤ידוּ הַשְׁמִ֙יעוּ֙ זֹ֔את הוֹצִיא֖וּהָ עַד־קְצֵ֣ה הָאָ֑רֶץ אִמְר֕וּ גָּאַ֥ל יְהֹוָ֖ה עַבְדּ֥וֹ יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
Go forth from Babylon,
Flee from Chaldea!
Declare this with loud shouting,
Announce this,
Bring out the word to the ends of the earth!
Say: “ GOD has redeemed
Jacob—God’s servant!”
Transliteration: tseu mivavel virechu mikhashediym vekvol rinah hagiydu hashemiyu zot hvotsiyuha ad-ketseh haarets imeru gaal yehovah avedvo yaakov

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א צָמְא֗וּ בׇּֽחֳרָבוֹת֙ הוֹלִיכָ֔ם מַ֥יִם מִצּ֖וּר הִזִּ֣יל לָ֑מוֹ וַיִּ֨בְקַע־צ֔וּר וַיָּזֻ֖בוּ מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
They have known no thirst,
Though they were led through parched places;
[God] made water flow for them from the rock,
Cleaving the rock so that water gushed forth.
Transliteration: velo tsameu vׇchoravvot hvoliykham mayiim mitsur hiziyl lamvo vayiveka-tsur vayazuvu mayiim

Hebrew: אֵ֣ין שָׁל֔וֹם אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה לָרְשָׁעִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: There is no safety—said GOD—for the wicked.
Transliteration: eyn shalvom amar yehovah lareshaiym {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֤וּ אִיִּים֙ אֵלַ֔י וְהַקְשִׁ֥יבוּ לְאֻמִּ֖ים מֵרָח֑וֹק יְהֹוָה֙ מִבֶּ֣טֶן קְרָאָ֔נִי מִמְּעֵ֥י אִמִּ֖י הִזְכִּ֥יר שְׁמִֽי׃
Translated:
Listen, O coastlands, to me,
And give heed, O nations afar:
GOD appointed me before I was born,
Naming me while I was in my mother’s womb.
Transliteration: shimeu iyiym elay vehakeshiyvu leumiym merachvok yehovah miveten keraaniy mimeey imiy hizekhiyr shemiy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שֶׂם פִּי֙ כְּחֶ֣רֶב חַדָּ֔ה בְּצֵ֥ל יָד֖וֹ הֶחְבִּיאָ֑נִי וַיְשִׂימֵ֙נִי֙ לְחֵ֣ץ בָּר֔וּר בְּאַשְׁפָּת֖וֹ הִסְתִּירָֽנִי׃
Translated:
My mouth was made to be like a sharpened blade,
While I was hidden in the shadow of a divine hand,
So that I was like a polished arrow—
Concealed in God’s quiver.
Transliteration: vayashem fiy khecherev chadah vetsel yadvo hecheviyaniy vayeshiymeniy lechets varur veashefatvo hisetiyraniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לִ֖י עַבְדִּי־אָ֑תָּה יִשְׂרָאֵ֕ל אֲשֶׁר־בְּךָ֖ אֶתְפָּאָֽר׃
Translated:
And [God] said to me, “You are My servant,
Israel in whom I glory.”
Transliteration: vayomer liy avediy-atah yisherael asher-vekha etefaar

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ לְרִ֣יק יָגַ֔עְתִּי לְתֹ֥הוּ וְהֶ֖בֶל כֹּחִ֣י כִלֵּ֑יתִי אָכֵן֙ מִשְׁפָּטִ֣י אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה וּפְעֻלָּתִ֖י אֶת־אֱלֹהָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
I thought, “I have labored in vain,
I have spent my strength for empty breath.”
But my case rested with GOD,
My recompense was in the hands of my God.
Transliteration: vaaniy amaretiy leriyk yagaetiy letohu vehevel khochiy khileytiy akhen mishefatiy et-yehovah ufeulatiy et-elohay {s}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה יֽוֹצְרִ֤י מִבֶּ֙טֶן֙ לְעֶ֣בֶד ל֔וֹ לְשׁוֹבֵ֤ב יַֽעֲקֹב֙ אֵלָ֔יו וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל (לא) [ל֣וֹ] יֵאָסֵ֑ף וְאֶכָּבֵד֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וֵאלֹהַ֖י הָיָ֥ה עֻזִּֽי׃
Translated:
And now GOD has resolved—
The One who formed me in the womb to be of service—
To bring back Jacob
And restore Israel.
And I have been honored in the sight of GOD,
My God has been my strength.
Transliteration: veatah amar yehovah yvotseriy miveten leeved lvo leshvovev yaakov elayv veyisherael (l) [lvo] eiasef veekhaved veeyney yehovah velohay hayah uziy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר נָקֵ֨ל מִֽהְיוֹתְךָ֥ לִי֙ עֶ֔בֶד לְהָקִים֙ אֶת־שִׁבְטֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֔ב (ונצירי) [וּנְצוּרֵ֥י] יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְהָשִׁ֑יב וּנְתַתִּ֙יךָ֙ לְא֣וֹר גּוֹיִ֔ם לִהְי֥וֹת יְשׁוּעָתִ֖י עַד־קְצֵ֥ה הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated:
And [God] has said:
“It is too little that you should be My servant
In that I raise up the tribes of Jacob
And restore the survivors of Israel:
I will also make you a light of nations,
That My salvation may reach the ends of the earth.”
Transliteration: vayomer nakel miheyvotekha liy eved lehakiym et-shivetey yaakov (vntsyry) [unetsurey] yisherael lehashiyv unetatiykha levor gvoyim liheyvot yeshuatiy ad-ketseh haarets {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה אָֽמַר־יְהֹוָה֩ גֹּאֵ֨ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל קְדוֹשׁ֗וֹ לִבְזֹה־נֶ֜פֶשׁ לִמְתָ֤עֵֽב גּוֹי֙ לְעֶ֣בֶד מֹשְׁלִ֔ים מְלָכִים֙ יִרְא֣וּ וָקָ֔מוּ שָׂרִ֖ים וְיִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֑וּ לְמַ֤עַן יְהֹוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נֶאֱמָ֔ן קְדֹ֥שׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַיִּבְחָרֶֽךָּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Thus said GOD,
The Redeemer of Israel, his Holy One,
To the despised one,
To the abhorred nations,
To the slave of rulers:
Kings shall see and stand up;
Nobles, and they shall prostrate themselves—
To the honor of GOD, who is faithful,
To the Holy One of Israel who chose you.
Transliteration: khoh amar-yehovah goel yisherael kedvoshvo livezoh-nefesh limetaev gvoy leeved mosheliym melakhiym yireu vakamu shariym veyishetachavu lemaan yehovah asher neeman kedosh yisherael vayivecharekha {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה בְּעֵ֤ת רָצוֹן֙ עֲנִיתִ֔יךָ וּבְי֥וֹם יְשׁוּעָ֖ה עֲזַרְתִּ֑יךָ וְאֶצׇּרְךָ֗ וְאֶתֶּנְךָ֙ לִבְרִ֣ית עָ֔ם לְהָקִ֣ים אֶ֔רֶץ לְהַנְחִ֖יל נְחָל֥וֹת שֹׁמֵמֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
In an hour of favor I answer you,
And on a day of salvation I help you—
I created you and appointed you a covenant people—
Restoring the land,
Allotting anew the desolate holdings,
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah veet ratsvon aniytiykha uveyvom yeshuah azaretiykha veetsׇrekha veetenekha liveriyt am lehakiym erets lehanechiyl nechalvot shomemvot

Hebrew: לֵאמֹ֤ר לַֽאֲסוּרִים֙ צֵ֔אוּ לַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּחֹ֖שֶׁךְ הִגָּל֑וּ עַל־דְּרָכִ֣ים יִרְע֔וּ וּבְכׇל־שְׁפָיִ֖ים מַרְעִיתָֽם׃
Translated:
Saying to the prisoners, “Go free,”
To those who are in darkness, “Show yourselves.”
They shall pasture along the roads,
On every bare height shall be their pasture.
Transliteration: lemor laasuriym tseu laasher vachoshekhe higalu al-derakhiym yireu uvekhׇl-shefayiym mareiytam

Hebrew: לֹ֤א יִרְעָ֙בוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א יִצְמָ֔אוּ וְלֹא־יַכֵּ֥ם שָׁרָ֖ב וָשָׁ֑מֶשׁ כִּֽי־מְרַחֲמָ֣ם יְנַהֲגֵ֔ם וְעַל־מַבּ֥וּעֵי מַ֖יִם יְנַהֲלֵֽם׃
Translated:
They shall not hunger or thirst,
Hot wind and sun shall not strike them;
For the One who loves them will lead them
And will guide them to springs of water.
Transliteration: lo yireavu velo yitsemau velo-yakhem sharav vashamesh khiy-merachamam yenahagem veal-mavuey mayiim yenahalem

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֥י כׇל־הָרַ֖י לַדָּ֑רֶךְ וּמְסִלֹּתַ֖י יְרֻמֽוּן׃
Translated:
I will make all My mountains a road,
And My highways shall be built up.
Transliteration: veshametiy khׇl-haray ladarekhe umesilotay yerumun

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־אֵ֕לֶּה מֵרָח֖וֹק יָבֹ֑אוּ וְהִֽנֵּה־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ מִצָּפ֣וֹן וּמִיָּ֔ם וְאֵ֖לֶּה מֵאֶ֥רֶץ סִינִֽים׃
Translated:
Look! These are coming from afar,
These from the north and the west,
And these from the land of Sinim.
Transliteration: hineh-eleh merachvok yavou vehineh-eleh mitsafvon umiyam veeleh meerets siyniym

Hebrew: רׇנּ֤וּ שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ וְגִ֣ילִי אָ֔רֶץ (יפצחו) [וּפִצְח֥וּ] הָרִ֖ים רִנָּ֑ה כִּֽי־נִחַ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ עַמּ֔וֹ וַעֲנִיָּ֖יו יְרַחֵֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Shout, O heavens, and rejoice, O earth!
Break into shouting, O hills!
For GOD has comforted this people,
And has taken back its afflicted ones in love.
Transliteration: rׇnu shamayiim vegiyliy arets (yftschv) [ufitsechu] hariym rinah khiy-nicham yehovah amvo vaaniyayv yerachem {s}

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֥אמֶר צִיּ֖וֹן עֲזָבַ֣נִי יְהֹוָ֑ה וַאדֹנָ֖י שְׁכֵחָֽנִי׃
Translated:
Zion says,
“ GOD has forsaken me,
My Sovereign has forgotten me.”
Transliteration: vatomer tsiyyvon azavaniy yehovah vadonay shekhechaniy

Hebrew: הֲתִשְׁכַּ֤ח אִשָּׁה֙ עוּלָ֔הּ מֵרַחֵ֖ם בֶּן־בִּטְנָ֑הּ גַּם־אֵ֣לֶּה תִשְׁכַּ֔חְנָה וְאָנֹכִ֖י לֹ֥א אֶשְׁכָּחֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Can a woman forget her baby,
Or disown the child of her womb?
Though she might forget,
I never could forget you.
Transliteration: hatishekhach ishah ulah merachem ven-vitenah gam-eleh tishekhachenah veanokhiy lo eshekhachekhe

Hebrew: הֵ֥ן עַל־כַּפַּ֖יִם חַקֹּתִ֑יךְ חוֹמֹתַ֥יִךְ נֶגְדִּ֖י תָּמִֽיד׃
Translated:
See, I have engraved you
On the palms of My hands,
Your walls are ever before Me.
Transliteration: hen al-khafayiim chakotiykhe chvomotayiikhe negediy tamiyd

Hebrew: מִהֲר֖וּ בָּנָ֑יִךְ מְהָֽרְסַ֥יִךְ וּמַחֲרִיבַ֖יִךְ מִמֵּ֥ךְ יֵצֵֽאוּ׃
Translated:
Swiftly your children are coming;
Those who ravaged and ruined you shall leave you.
Transliteration: miharu vanayiikhe meharesayiikhe umachariyvayiikhe mimekhe eitseu

Hebrew: שְׂאִֽי־סָבִ֤יב עֵינַ֙יִךְ֙ וּרְאִ֔י כֻּלָּ֖ם נִקְבְּצ֣וּ בָֽאוּ־לָ֑ךְ חַי־אָ֣נִי נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֗ה כִּ֤י כֻלָּם֙ כָּעֲדִ֣י תִלְבָּ֔שִׁי וּֽתְקַשְּׁרִ֖ים כַּכַּלָּֽה׃
Translated:
Look up all around you and see:
They are all assembled, are come to you!
As I live
—declares GOD—
You shall don them all like jewels,
Deck yourself with them like a bride.
Transliteration: sheiy-saviyv eynayiikhe ureiy khulam nikevetsu vau-lakhe chay-aniy neum-yehovah khiy khulam khaadiy tilevashiy utekasheriym khakhalah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י חׇרְבֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ וְשֹׁ֣מְמֹתַ֔יִךְ וְאֶ֖רֶץ הֲרִסֻתֵ֑ךְ כִּ֤י עַתָּה֙ תֵּצְרִ֣י מִיּוֹשֵׁ֔ב וְרָחֲק֖וּ מְבַלְּעָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
As for your ruins and desolate places
And your land laid waste—
You shall soon be crowded with settlers,
While destroyers stay far from you.
Transliteration: khiy chׇrevotayiikhe veshomemotayiikhe veerets harisutekhe khiy atah tetseriy miyyvoshev verachaku mevaleayiikhe

Hebrew: ע֚וֹד יֹאמְר֣וּ בְאׇזְנַ֔יִךְ בְּנֵ֖י שִׁכֻּלָ֑יִךְ צַר־לִ֥י הַמָּק֖וֹם גְּשָׁה־לִּ֥י וְאֵשֵֽׁבָה׃
Translated:
The children you thought you had lost
Shall yet say in your hearing,
“The place is too crowded for me;
Make room for me to settle.”
Transliteration: vod yomeru veׇzenayiikhe veney shikhulayiikhe tsar-liy hamakvom geshah-liy veeshevah

Hebrew: וְאָמַ֣רְתְּ בִּלְבָבֵ֗ךְ מִ֤י יָֽלַד־לִי֙ אֶת־אֵ֔לֶּה וַאֲנִ֥י שְׁכוּלָ֖ה וְגַלְמוּדָ֑ה גֹּלָ֣ה ׀ וְסוּרָ֗ה וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ מִ֣י גִדֵּ֔ל הֵ֤ן אֲנִי֙ נִשְׁאַ֣רְתִּי לְבַדִּ֔י אֵ֖לֶּה אֵיפֹ֥ה הֵֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
And you will say to yourself,
“Who bore these for me
When I was bereaved and barren,
Exiled and disdained—
By whom, then, were these reared?
I was left all alone—
And where have these been?”
Transliteration: veamarete vilevavekhe miy yalad-liy et-eleh vaaniy shekhulah vegalemudah golah vesurah veeleh miy gidel hen aniy nishearetiy levadiy eleh eyfoh hem {f}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה הִנֵּ֨ה אֶשָּׂ֤א אֶל־גּוֹיִם֙ יָדִ֔י וְאֶל־עַמִּ֖ים אָרִ֣ים נִסִּ֑י וְהֵבִ֤יאוּ בָנַ֙יִךְ֙ בְּחֹ֔צֶן וּבְנֹתַ֖יִךְ עַל־כָּתֵ֥ף תִּנָּשֶֽׂאנָה׃
Translated:
Thus said my Sovereign GOD:
I will raise My hand to nations
And lift up My ensign to peoples;
And they shall bring your sons in their bosoms,
And carry your daughters on their backs.
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineh esha el-gvoyim yadiy veel-amiym ariym nisiy veheviyu vanayiikhe vechotsen uvenotayiikhe al-khatef tinashenah

Hebrew: וְהָי֨וּ מְלָכִ֜ים אֹמְנַ֗יִךְ וְשָׂרֽוֹתֵיהֶם֙ מֵינִ֣יקֹתַ֔יִךְ אַפַּ֗יִם אֶ֚רֶץ יִשְׁתַּ֣חֲווּ לָ֔ךְ וַעֲפַ֥ר רַגְלַ֖יִךְ יְלַחֵ֑כוּ וְיָדַ֙עַתְּ֙ כִּי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יֵבֹ֖שׁוּ קֹוָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Kings shall tend your children,
Their queens shall serve you as nurses.
They shall bow to you, face to the ground,
And lick the dust of your feet.
And you shall know that I am GOD—
Those who trust in Me shall not be shamed.
Transliteration: vehayu melakhiym omenayiikhe vesharvoteyhem meyniykotayiikhe afayiim erets yishetachavu lakhe vaafar ragelayiikhe yelachekhu veyadaate khiy-aniy yehovah asher lo-eivoshu kovay {s}

Hebrew: הֲיֻקַּ֥ח מִגִּבּ֖וֹר מַלְק֑וֹחַ וְאִם־שְׁבִ֥י צַדִּ֖יק יִמָּלֵֽט׃ {ס}
Translated:
Can spoil be taken from a warrior,
Or captives retrieved from a victor?
Transliteration: hayukach migivvor malekvocha veim-sheviy tsadiyk yimalet {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה גַּם־שְׁבִ֤י גִבּוֹר֙ יֻקָּ֔ח וּמַלְק֥וֹחַ עָרִ֖יץ יִמָּלֵ֑ט וְאֶת־יְרִיבֵךְ֙ אָנֹכִ֣י אָרִ֔יב וְאֶת־בָּנַ֖יִךְ אָנֹכִ֥י אוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated:
Yet thus said GOD:
Captives shall be taken from a warrior
And spoil shall be retrieved from a tyrant;
For I will contend with your adversaries,
And I will deliver your children.
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah gam-sheviy givvor yukach umalekvocha ariyts yimalet veet-yeriyvekhe anokhiy ariyv veet-vanayiikhe anokhiy voshiya

Hebrew: וְהַאֲכַלְתִּ֤י אֶת־מוֹנַ֙יִךְ֙ אֶת־בְּשָׂרָ֔ם וְכֶעָסִ֖יס דָּמָ֣ם יִשְׁכָּר֑וּן וְיָדְע֣וּ כׇל־בָּשָׂ֗ר כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ מֽוֹשִׁיעֵ֔ךְ וְגֹאֲלֵ֖ךְ אֲבִ֥יר יַעֲקֹֽב׃ {ס}
Translated:
I will make your oppressors eat their own flesh,
They shall be drunk with their own blood as with wine.
And all humankind shall know
That I GOD am your Savior,
The Mighty One of Jacob, your Redeemer.
Transliteration: vehaakhaletiy et-mvonayiikhe et-vesharam vekheasiys damam yishekharun veyadeu khׇl-vashar khiy aniy yehovah mvoshiyekhe vegoalekhe aviyr yaakov {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֵ֣י זֶ֠ה סֵ֣פֶר כְּרִית֤וּת אִמְּכֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שִׁלַּחְתִּ֔יהָ א֚וֹ מִ֣י מִנּוֹשַׁ֔י אֲשֶׁר־מָכַ֥רְתִּי אֶתְכֶ֖ם ל֑וֹ הֵ֤ן בַּעֲוֺנֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ נִמְכַּרְתֶּ֔ם וּבְפִשְׁעֵיכֶ֖ם שֻׁלְּחָ֥ה אִמְּכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
Where is the bill of divorce
Of your mother whom I dismissed?
And which of My creditors was it
To whom I sold you off?
You were only sold off for your sins,
And your mother dismissed for your crimes.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah ey zeh sefer kheriytut imekhem asher shilachetiyha vo miy minvoshay asher-makharetiy etekhem lvo hen vaavonoteykhem nimekharetem uvefisheeykhem shulechah imekhem

Hebrew: מַדּ֨וּעַ בָּ֜אתִי וְאֵ֣ין אִ֗ישׁ קָרָ֘אתִי֮ וְאֵ֣ין עוֹנֶה֒ הֲקָצ֨וֹר קָצְרָ֤ה יָדִי֙ מִפְּד֔וּת וְאִם־אֵֽין־בִּ֥י כֹ֖חַ לְהַצִּ֑יל הֵ֣ן בְּגַעֲרָתִ֞י אַחֲרִ֣יב יָ֗ם אָשִׂ֤ים נְהָרוֹת֙ מִדְבָּ֔ר תִּבְאַ֤שׁ דְּגָתָם֙ מֵאֵ֣ין מַ֔יִם וְתָמֹ֖ת בַּצָּמָֽא׃
Translated:
Why, when I came, was no one there,
Why, when I called, would none respond?
Is my arm, then, too short to rescue,
Have I not the power to save?
With a mere rebuke I dry up the sea,
And turn rivers into desert.
Their fish stink from lack of water;
They lie dead of thirst.
Transliteration: madua vatiy veeyn iysh karatiy veeyn voneh hakatsvor katserah yadiy mifedut veim-eyn-viy khocha lehatsiyl hen vegaaratiy achariyv yam ashiym neharvot midevar tiveash degatam meeyn mayiim vetamot vatsama

Hebrew: אַלְבִּ֥ישׁ שָׁמַ֖יִם קַדְר֑וּת וְשַׂ֖ק אָשִׂ֥ים כְּסוּתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
I clothe the skies in blackness
And make their raiment sackcloth.
Transliteration: aleviysh shamayiim kaderut veshak ashiym khesutam {f}

Hebrew: אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה נָ֤תַן לִי֙ לְשׁ֣וֹן לִמּוּדִ֔ים לָדַ֛עַת לָע֥וּת אֶת־יָעֵ֖ף דָּבָ֑ר יָעִ֣יר ׀ בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֗קֶר יָעִ֥יר לִי֙ אֹ֔זֶן לִשְׁמֹ֖עַ כַּלִּמּוּדִֽים׃
Translated:
My Sovereign GOD gave me a skilled tongue,
To know how to speak timely words to the weary.
Morning by morning, [God] rouses me,
Rousing my ear
To give heed like disciples.
Transliteration: adonay yehovih natan liy leshvon limudiym ladaat laut et-yaef davar yaiyr vavoker vavoker yaiyr liy ozen lishemoa khalimudiym

Hebrew: אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ פָּתַֽח־לִ֣י אֹ֔זֶן וְאָנֹכִ֖י לֹ֣א מָרִ֑יתִי אָח֖וֹר לֹ֥א נְסוּגֹֽתִי׃
Translated:
My Sovereign GOD opened my ears,
And I did not disobey,
I did not run away.
Transliteration: adonay yehovih fatach-liy ozen veanokhiy lo mariytiy achvor lo nesugotiy

Hebrew: גֵּוִי֙ נָתַ֣תִּי לְמַכִּ֔ים וּלְחָיַ֖י לְמֹֽרְטִ֑ים פָּנַי֙ לֹ֣א הִסְתַּ֔רְתִּי מִכְּלִמּ֖וֹת וָרֹֽק׃
Translated:
I offered my back to the floggers,
And my cheeks to those who tore out my hair.
I did not hide my face
From insult and spittle.
Transliteration: geviy natatiy lemakhiym ulechayay lemoretiym fanay lo hisetaretiy mikhelimvot varok

Hebrew: וַאדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ יַֽעֲזׇר־לִ֔י עַל־כֵּ֖ן לֹ֣א נִכְלָ֑מְתִּי עַל־כֵּ֞ן שַׂ֤מְתִּי פָנַי֙ כַּחַלָּמִ֔ישׁ וָאֵדַ֖ע כִּי־לֹ֥א אֵבֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated:
But my Sovereign GOD will help me—
Therefore I feel no disgrace;
Therefore I have set my face like flint,
And I know I shall not be shamed.
Transliteration: vadonay yehovih yaazׇr-liy al-khen lo nikhelametiy al-khen shametiy fanay khachalamiysh vaeda khiy-lo evvosh

Hebrew: קָרוֹב֙ מַצְדִּיקִ֔י מִֽי־יָרִ֥יב אִתִּ֖י נַ֣עַמְדָה יָּ֑חַד מִי־בַ֥עַל מִשְׁפָּטִ֖י יִגַּ֥שׁ אֵלָֽי׃
Translated:
My Vindicator is at hand—
Who dares contend with me?
Let us stand up together!
Who would be my opponent?
Let them approach me!
Transliteration: karvov matsediykiy miy-yariyv itiy naamedah yachad miy-vaal mishefatiy yigash elay

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ יַעֲזׇר־לִ֔י מִי־ה֖וּא יַרְשִׁיעֵ֑נִי הֵ֤ן כֻּלָּם֙ כַּבֶּ֣גֶד יִבְל֔וּ עָ֖שׁ יֹאכְלֵֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Lo, my Sovereign GOD will help me—
Who can get a verdict against me?
They shall all wear out like a garment,
The moth shall consume them.
Transliteration: hen adonay yehovih yaazׇr-liy miy-hu yareshiyeniy hen khulam khaveged yivelu ash yokhelem {s}

Hebrew: מִ֤י בָכֶם֙ יְרֵ֣א יְהֹוָ֔ה שֹׁמֵ֖עַ בְּק֣וֹל עַבְדּ֑וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ הָלַ֣ךְ חֲשֵׁכִ֗ים וְאֵ֥ין נֹ֙גַהּ֙ ל֔וֹ יִבְטַח֙ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה וְיִשָּׁעֵ֖ן בֵּאלֹהָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated:
Who among you reveres GOD
And heeds the voice of the appointed servant?—
Though walking in darkness
And having no light,
Let them trust in the name of GOD
And rely upon his God.
Transliteration: miy vakhem yere yehovah shomea vekvol avedvo asher halakhe chashekhiym veeyn nogah lvo yivetach veshem yehovah veyishaen velohayv {s}

Hebrew: הֵ֧ן כֻּלְּכֶ֛ם קֹ֥דְחֵי אֵ֖שׁ מְאַזְּרֵ֣י זִיק֑וֹת לְכ֣וּ ׀ בְּא֣וּר אֶשְׁכֶ֗ם וּבְזִיקוֹת֙ בִּֽעַרְתֶּ֔ם מִיָּדִי֙ הָיְתָה־זֹּ֣את לָכֶ֔ם לְמַעֲצֵבָ֖ה תִּשְׁכָּבֽוּן׃ {ס}
Translated:
But you are all kindlers of fire,
Girding on firebrands.
Walk by the blaze of your fire,
By the brands that you have lit!
This has come to you from My hand:
You shall lie down in pain.
Transliteration: hen khulekhem kodechey esh meazerey ziykvot lekhu veur eshekhem uveziykvot viaretem miyadiy hayetah-zot lakhem lemaatsevah tishekhavun {s}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֥וּ אֵלַ֛י רֹ֥דְפֵי צֶ֖דֶק מְבַקְשֵׁ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה הַבִּ֙יטוּ֙ אֶל־צ֣וּר חֻצַּבְתֶּ֔ם וְאֶל־מַקֶּ֥בֶת בּ֖וֹר נֻקַּרְתֶּֽם׃
Translated:
Listen to Me, you who pursue justice,
You who seek GOD:
Look to the rock you were hewn from,
To the quarry you were dug from.
Transliteration: shimeu elay rodefey tsedek mevakeshey yehovah haviytu el-tsur chutsavetem veel-makevet vvor nukaretem

Hebrew: הַבִּ֙יטוּ֙ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֣ם אֲבִיכֶ֔ם וְאֶל־שָׂרָ֖ה תְּחוֹלֶלְכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־אֶחָ֣ד קְרָאתִ֔יו וַאֲבָרְכֵ֖הוּ וְאַרְבֵּֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Look back to Abraham your father
And to Sarah who brought you forth.
For he was only one when I called him,
But I blessed him and made him many.
Transliteration: haviytu el-averaham aviykhem veel-sharah techvolelekhem khiy-echad keratiyv vaavarekhehu vearevehu

Hebrew: כִּי־נִחַ֨ם יְהֹוָ֜ה צִיּ֗וֹן נִחַם֙ כׇּל־חׇרְבֹתֶ֔יהָ וַיָּ֤שֶׂם מִדְבָּרָהּ֙ כְּעֵ֔דֶן וְעַרְבָתָ֖הּ כְּגַן־יְהֹוָ֑ה שָׂשׂ֤וֹן וְשִׂמְחָה֙ יִמָּ֣צֵא בָ֔הּ תּוֹדָ֖ה וְק֥וֹל זִמְרָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Truly GOD has comforted Zion,
Comforted all her ruins—
Made her wilderness like Eden,
Her desert like the Garden of GOD.
Gladness and joy shall abide there,
Thanksgiving and the sound of music.
Transliteration: khiy-nicham yehovah tsiyyvon nicham khׇl-chׇrevoteyha vayashem midevarah kheeden vearevatah khegan-yehovah shashvon veshimechah yimatse vah tvodah vekvol zimerah {s}

Hebrew: הַקְשִׁ֤יבוּ אֵלַי֙ עַמִּ֔י וּלְאוּמִּ֖י אֵלַ֣י הַאֲזִ֑ינוּ כִּ֤י תוֹרָה֙ מֵאִתִּ֣י תֵצֵ֔א וּמִ֨שְׁפָּטִ֔י לְא֥וֹר עַמִּ֖ים אַרְגִּֽיעַ׃
Translated:
Hearken to Me, My people,
And give ear to Me, O My nation,
For teaching shall go forth from Me,
My way for the light of peoples.
In a moment I will bring it:
