Transliteration: hakeshiyvu elay amiy uleumiy elay haaziynu khiy tvorah meitiy tetse umishefatiy levor amiym aregiya

Hebrew: קָר֤וֹב צִדְקִי֙ יָצָ֣א יִשְׁעִ֔י וּזְרֹעַ֖י עַמִּ֣ים יִשְׁפֹּ֑טוּ אֵלַי֙ אִיִּ֣ים יְקַוּ֔וּ וְאֶל־זְרֹעִ֖י יְיַחֵלֽוּן׃
Translated:
The triumph I grant is near,
The success I give has gone forth.
My arms shall provide for the peoples;
The coastlands shall trust in Me,
They shall look to My arm.
Transliteration: karvov tsidekiy yatsa yisheiy uzeroay amiym yishefotu elay iyiym yekauu veel-zeroiy yeyachelun

Hebrew: שְׂאוּ֩ לַשָּׁמַ֨יִם עֵינֵיכֶ֜ם וְֽהַבִּ֧יטוּ אֶל־הָאָ֣רֶץ מִתַּ֗חַת כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֜יִם כֶּעָשָׁ֤ן נִמְלָ֙חוּ֙ וְהָאָ֙רֶץ֙ כַּבֶּ֣גֶד תִּבְלֶ֔ה וְיֹשְׁבֶ֖יהָ כְּמוֹ־כֵ֣ן יְמוּת֑וּן וִישֽׁוּעָתִי֙ לְעוֹלָ֣ם תִּֽהְיֶ֔ה וְצִדְקָתִ֖י לֹ֥א תֵחָֽת׃ {פ}
Translated:
Raise your eyes to the heavens,
And look upon the earth beneath:
Though the heavens should melt away like smoke,
And the earth wear out like a garment,
And its inhabitants die out as well,
My victory shall stand forever,
My triumph shall remain unbroken.
Transliteration: sheu lashamayiim eyneykhem vehaviytu el-haarets mitachat khiy-shamayiim kheashan nimelachu vehaarets khaveged tiveleh veyosheveyha khemvo-khen yemutun viyshuatiy levolam tiheyeh vetsidekatiy lo techat {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֤וּ אֵלַי֙ יֹ֣דְעֵי צֶ֔דֶק עַ֖ם תּוֹרָתִ֣י בְלִבָּ֑ם אַל־תִּֽירְאוּ֙ חֶרְפַּ֣ת אֱנ֔וֹשׁ וּמִגִּדֻּפֹתָ֖ם אַל־תֵּחָֽתּוּ׃
Translated:
Listen to Me, you who care for the right,
O people who lay My instruction to heart!
Fear not mortals’ insults,
And be not dismayed at their jeers;
Transliteration: shimeu elay yodeey tsedek am tvoratiy velivam al-tiyreu cherefat envosh umigidufotam al-techatu

Hebrew: כִּ֤י כַבֶּ֙גֶד֙ יֹאכְלֵ֣ם עָ֔שׁ וְכַצֶּ֖מֶר יֹאכְלֵ֣ם סָ֑ס וְצִדְקָתִי֙ לְעוֹלָ֣ם תִּֽהְיֶ֔ה וִישׁוּעָתִ֖י לְד֥וֹר דּוֹרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
For the moth shall eat them up like a garment,
The worm shall eat them up like wool.
But My triumph shall endure forever,
My salvation through all the ages.
Transliteration: khiy khaveged yokhelem ash vekhatsemer yokhelem sas vetsidekatiy levolam tiheyeh viyshuatiy ledvor dvoriym {s}

Hebrew: עוּרִ֨י עוּרִ֤י לִבְשִׁי־עֹז֙ זְר֣וֹעַ יְהֹוָ֔ה ע֚וּרִי כִּ֣ימֵי קֶ֔דֶם דֹּר֖וֹת עוֹלָמִ֑ים הֲל֥וֹא אַתְּ־הִ֛יא הַמַּחְצֶ֥בֶת רַ֖הַב מְחוֹלֶ֥לֶת תַּנִּֽין׃
Translated:
Awake, awake, clothe yourself with splendor.
O arm of the ETERNAL One!
Awake as in days of old,
As in former ages!
It was you that hacked Rahab in pieces,
That pierced the Dragon.
Transliteration: uriy uriy liveshiy-oz zervoa yehovah uriy khiymey kedem dorvot volamiym halvo ate-hiy hamachetsevet rahav mechvolelet taniyn

Hebrew: הֲל֤וֹא אַתְּ־הִיא֙ הַמַּחֲרֶ֣בֶת יָ֔ם מֵ֖י תְּה֣וֹם רַבָּ֑ה הַשָּׂ֙מָה֙ מַֽעֲמַקֵּי־יָ֔ם דֶּ֖רֶךְ לַעֲבֹ֥ר גְּאוּלִֽים׃
Translated:
It was you that dried up the Sea,
The waters of the great deep;
That made the abysses of the Sea
A road the redeemed might walk.
Transliteration: halvo ate-hiy hamacharevet yam mey tehvom ravah hashamah maamakey-yam derekhe laavor geuliym

Hebrew: וּפְדוּיֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֜ה יְשׁוּב֗וּן וּבָ֤אוּ צִיּוֹן֙ בְּרִנָּ֔ה וְשִׂמְחַ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם עַל־רֹאשָׁ֑ם שָׂשׂ֤וֹן וְשִׂמְחָה֙ יַשִּׂיג֔וּן נָ֖סוּ יָג֥וֹן וַאֲנָחָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
So let GOD’s ransomed return,
And come with shouting to Zion,
Crowned with joy everlasting.
Let them attain joy and gladness,
While sorrow and sighing flee.
Transliteration: ufedueiy yehovah yeshuvun uvau tsiyyvon verinah veshimechat volam al-rosham shashvon veshimechah yashiygun nasu yagvon vaanachah {s}

Hebrew: אָנֹכִ֧י אָנֹכִ֛י ה֖וּא מְנַחֶמְכֶ֑ם מִי־אַ֤תְּ וַתִּֽירְאִי֙ מֵאֱנ֣וֹשׁ יָמ֔וּת וּמִבֶּן־אָדָ֖ם חָצִ֥יר יִנָּתֵֽן׃
Translated:
I, I am the One who comforts you!
What ails you that you fear
Man who must die,
Mortals who fare like grass?
Transliteration: anokhiy anokhiy hu menachemekhem miy-ate vatiyreiy meenvosh yamut umiven-adam chatsiyr yinaten

Hebrew: וַתִּשְׁכַּ֞ח יְהֹוָ֣ה עֹשֶׂ֗ךָ נוֹטֶ֣ה שָׁמַ֘יִם֮ וְיֹסֵ֣ד אָ֒רֶץ֒ וַתְּפַחֵ֨ד תָּמִ֜יד כׇּל־הַיּ֗וֹם מִפְּנֵי֙ חֲמַ֣ת הַמֵּצִ֔יק כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר כּוֹנֵ֖ן לְהַשְׁחִ֑ית וְאַיֵּ֖ה חֲמַ֥ת הַמֵּצִֽיק׃
Translated:
You have forgotten GOD your Maker,
Who stretched out the skies and made firm the earth!
And you live all day in constant dread
Because of the rage of an oppressor
Who is aiming to cut [you] down.
Yet of what account is the rage of an oppressor?
Transliteration: vatishekhach yehovah oshekha nvoteh shamayiim veyosed arets vatefached tamiyd khׇl-hayyvom mifeney chamat hametsiyk khaasher khvonen lehashechiyt veayeh chamat hametsiyk

Hebrew: מִהַ֥ר צֹעֶ֖ה לְהִפָּתֵ֑חַ וְלֹא־יָמ֣וּת לַשַּׁ֔חַת וְלֹ֥א יֶחְסַ֖ר לַחְמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Quickly the crouching one is freed;
He is not cut down and slain,
And he shall not want for food.
Transliteration: mihar tsoeh lehifatecha velo-yamut lashachat velo yechesar lachemvo

Hebrew: וְאָֽנֹכִי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ רֹגַ֣ע הַיָּ֔ם וַיֶּהֱמ֖וּ גַּלָּ֑יו יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For I the ETERNAL your God—
Who stirs up the sea into roaring waves,
Whose name is GOD of Hosts—
Transliteration: veanokhiy yehovah eloheykha roga hayam vayehemu galayv yehovah tsevavot shemvo

Hebrew: וָאָשִׂ֤ם דְּבָרַי֙ בְּפִ֔יךָ וּבְצֵ֥ל יָדִ֖י כִּסִּיתִ֑יךָ לִנְטֹ֤עַ שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ וְלִיסֹ֣ד אָ֔רֶץ וְלֵאמֹ֥ר לְצִיּ֖וֹן עַמִּי־אָֽתָּה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Have put My words in your mouth
And sheltered you with My hand;
I, who planted the skies and made firm the earth,
Have said to Zion: You are My people!
Transliteration: vaashim devaray vefiykha uvetsel yadiy khisiytiykha linetoa shamayiim veliysod arets velemor letsiyyvon amiy-atah {s}

Hebrew: הִתְעוֹרְרִ֣י הִֽתְעוֹרְרִ֗י ק֚וּמִי יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁתִ֛ית מִיַּ֥ד יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־כּ֣וֹס חֲמָת֑וֹ אֶת־קֻבַּ֜עַת כּ֧וֹס הַתַּרְעֵלָ֛ה שָׁתִ֖ית מָצִֽית׃
Translated:
Rouse, rouse yourself!
Arise, O Jerusalem,
You who from GOD’s hand
Have drunk God’s wrath-filled cup,
You who have drained to the dregs
The bowl, the cup of reeling!
Transliteration: hitevoreriy hitevoreriy kumiy yerushala͏im asher shatiyt miyad yehovah et-khvos chamatvo et-kuvaat khvos hatareelah shatiyt matsiyt

Hebrew: אֵין־מְנַהֵ֣ל לָ֔הּ מִכׇּל־בָּנִ֖ים יָלָ֑דָה וְאֵ֤ין מַחֲזִיק֙ בְּיָדָ֔הּ מִכׇּל־בָּנִ֖ים גִּדֵּֽלָה׃
Translated:
She has none to guide her
Of all the children she bore;
None takes her by the hand,
Of all the children she reared.
Transliteration: eyn-menahel lah mikhׇl-vaniym yaladah veeyn machaziyk veyadah mikhׇl-vaniym gidelah

Hebrew: שְׁתַּ֤יִם הֵ֙נָּה֙ קֹרְאֹתַ֔יִךְ מִ֖י יָנ֣וּד לָ֑ךְ הַשֹּׁ֧ד וְהַשֶּׁ֛בֶר וְהָרָעָ֥ב וְהַחֶ֖רֶב מִ֥י אֲנַחֲמֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
These two things have befallen you:
Wrack and ruin—who can console you?
Famine and sword—how shall I comfort you?
Transliteration: shetayiim henah koreotayiikhe miy yanud lakhe hashod vehashever veharaav vehacherev miy anachamekhe

Hebrew: בָּנַ֜יִךְ עֻלְּפ֥וּ שָׁכְב֛וּ בְּרֹ֥אשׁ כׇּל־חוּצ֖וֹת כְּת֣וֹא מִכְמָ֑ר הַֽמְלֵאִ֥ים חֲמַת־יְהֹוָ֖ה גַּעֲרַ֥ת אֱלֹהָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
Your sons lie in a swoon
At the corner of every street—
Like an antelope caught in a net—
Drunk with the wrath of GOD,
With the rebuke of your God.
Transliteration: vanayiikhe ulefu shakhevu verosh khׇl-chutsvot khetvo mikhemar hameleiym chamat-yehovah gaarat elohayiikhe

Hebrew: לָכֵ֛ן שִׁמְעִי־נָ֥א זֹ֖את עֲנִיָּ֑ה וּשְׁכֻרַ֖ת וְלֹ֥א מִיָּֽיִן׃ {פ}
Translated:
Therefore,
Listen to this, unhappy one,
Who are drunk, but not with wine!
Transliteration: lakhen shimeiy-na zot aniyah ushekhurat velo miyayiin {f}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר אֲדֹנַ֣יִךְ יְהֹוָ֗ה וֵאלֹהַ֙יִךְ֙ יָרִ֣יב עַמּ֔וֹ הִנֵּ֥ה לָקַ֛חְתִּי מִיָּדֵ֖ךְ אֶת־כּ֣וֹס הַתַּרְעֵלָ֑ה אֶת־קֻבַּ֙עַת֙ כּ֣וֹס חֲמָתִ֔י לֹא־תוֹסִ֥יפִי לִשְׁתּוֹתָ֖הּ עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD, your Sovereign,
Your God who champions this people:
Herewith I take from your hand
The cup of reeling,
The bowl, the cup of My wrath;
You shall never drink it again.
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonayiikhe yehovah velohayiikhe yariyv amvo hineh lakachetiy miyadekhe et-khvos hatareelah et-kuvaat khvos chamatiy lo-tvosiyfiy lishetvotah vod

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֙יהָ֙ בְּיַד־מוֹגַ֔יִךְ אֲשֶׁר־אָמְר֥וּ לְנַפְשֵׁ֖ךְ שְׁחִ֣י וְנַעֲבֹ֑רָה וַתָּשִׂ֤ימִי כָאָ֙רֶץ֙ גֵּוֵ֔ךְ וְכַח֖וּץ לַעֹבְרִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will put it in the hands of your tormentors,
Who have commanded you,
“Get down, that we may walk over you”—
So that you made your back like the ground,
Like a street for passersby.
Transliteration: veshametiyha veyad-mvogayiikhe asher-ameru lenafeshekhe shechiy venaavorah vatashiymiy khaarets gevekhe vekhachuts laoveriym {f}

Hebrew: עוּרִ֥י עוּרִ֛י לִבְשִׁ֥י עֻזֵּ֖ךְ צִיּ֑וֹן לִבְשִׁ֣י ׀ בִּגְדֵ֣י תִפְאַרְתֵּ֗ךְ יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ עִ֣יר הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ כִּ֣י לֹ֥א יוֹסִ֛יף יָבֹא־בָ֥ךְ ע֖וֹד עָרֵ֥ל וְטָמֵֽא׃
Translated:
Awake, awake, O Zion!
Clothe yourself in splendor;
Put on your robes of majesty,
Jerusalem, holy city!
For the uncircumcised and the impure
Shall never enter you again.
Transliteration: uriy uriy liveshiy uzekhe tsiyyvon liveshiy vigedey tifearetekhe yerushala͏im iyr hakodesh khiy lo yvosiyf yavo-vakhe vod arel vetame

Hebrew: הִתְנַעֲרִ֧י מֵעָפָ֛ר ק֥וּמִי שְּׁבִ֖י יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם (התפתחו) [הִֽתְפַּתְּחִי֙] מוֹסְרֵ֣י צַוָּארֵ֔ךְ שְׁבִיָּ֖ה בַּת־צִיּֽוֹן׃ {ס}
Translated:
Arise, shake off the dust,
Sit [on your throne], Jerusalem!
Loose the bonds from your neck,
O captive one, Fair Zion!
Transliteration: hitenaariy meafar kumiy sheviy yerushala͏im (htftchv) [hitefatechiy] mvoserey tsavarekhe sheviyah vat-tsiyyvon {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹה֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה חִנָּ֖ם נִמְכַּרְתֶּ֑ם וְלֹ֥א בְכֶ֖סֶף תִּגָּאֵֽלוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
For thus said GOD:
You were sold for no price,
And shall be redeemed without money.
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah chinam nimekharetem velo vekhesef tigaelu {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה מִצְרַ֛יִם יָֽרַד־עַמִּ֥י בָרִֽאשֹׁנָ֖ה לָג֣וּר שָׁ֑ם וְאַשּׁ֖וּר בְּאֶ֥פֶס עֲשָׁקֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For thus said my Sovereign GOD:
Of old, My people went down
To Egypt to sojourn there;
But Assyria has robbed them,
Giving nothing in return.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar adonay yehovih mitserayiim yarad-amiy varishonah lagur sham veashur veefes ashakvo

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֤ה מַה־לִּי־פֹה֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּֽי־לֻקַּ֥ח עַמִּ֖י חִנָּ֑ם מֹשְׁלָ֤ו יְהֵילִ֙ילוּ֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְתָמִ֥יד כׇּל־הַיּ֖וֹם שְׁמִ֥י מִנֹּאָֽץ׃
Translated:
What therefore do I gain here?
—declares GOD—
For My people has been carried off for nothing,
Their mockers howl
—declares GOD—
And constantly, unceasingly,
My name is reviled.
Transliteration: veatah mah-liy-foh neum-yehovah khiy-lukach amiy chinam moshelav yeheyliylu neum-yehovah vetamiyd khׇl-hayyvom shemiy minoats

Hebrew: לָכֵ֛ן יֵדַ֥ע עַמִּ֖י שְׁמִ֑י לָכֵן֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא כִּֽי־אֲנִי־ה֥וּא הַֽמְדַבֵּ֖ר הִנֵּֽנִי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Assuredly, My people shall learn My name,
Assuredly [they shall learn] on that day
That I, the One who promised,
Am now at hand.
Transliteration: lakhen eida amiy shemiy lakhen vayyvom hahu khiy-aniy-hu hamedaver hineniy {s}

Hebrew: מַה־נָּאו֨וּ עַל־הֶהָרִ֜ים רַגְלֵ֣י מְבַשֵּׂ֗ר מַשְׁמִ֧יעַ שָׁל֛וֹם מְבַשֵּׂ֥ר ט֖וֹב מַשְׁמִ֣יעַ יְשׁוּעָ֑ה אֹמֵ֥ר לְצִיּ֖וֹן מָלַ֥ךְ אֱלֹהָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
How welcome on the mountain
Are the footsteps of the herald
Announcing happiness,
Heralding good fortune,
Announcing victory,
Telling Zion, “Your God reigns!”
Transliteration: mah-navu al-hehariym rageley mevasher mashemiya shalvom mevasher tvov mashemiya yeshuah omer letsiyyvon malakhe elohayiikhe

Hebrew: ק֥וֹל צֹפַ֛יִךְ נָ֥שְׂאוּ ק֖וֹל יַחְדָּ֣ו יְרַנֵּ֑נוּ כִּ֣י עַ֤יִן בְּעַ֙יִן֙ יִרְא֔וּ בְּשׁ֥וּב יְהֹוָ֖ה צִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Hark!
Your lookouts raise their voices,
As one they shout for joy;
For every eye shall behold
GOD ’s return to Zion.
Transliteration: kvol tsofayiikhe nasheu kvol yachedav yeranenu khiy ayiin veayiin yireu veshuv yehovah tsiyyvon

Hebrew: פִּצְח֤וּ רַנְּנוּ֙ יַחְדָּ֔ו חׇרְב֖וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם כִּֽי־נִחַ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ עַמּ֔וֹ גָּאַ֖ל יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
Raise a shout together,
O ruins of Jerusalem!
For GOD will comfort this people,
Will redeem Jerusalem.
Transliteration: fitsechu ranenu yachedav chׇrevvot yerushala͏im khiy-nicham yehovah amvo gaal yerushala͏im

Hebrew: חָשַׂ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־זְר֣וֹעַ קׇדְשׁ֔וֹ לְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם וְרָאוּ֙ כׇּל־אַפְסֵי־אָ֔רֶץ אֵ֖ת יְשׁוּעַ֥ת אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
GOD will bare a holy arm
In the sight of all the nations,
And the very ends of earth shall see
The victory of our God.
Transliteration: chashaf yehovah et-zervoa kׇdeshvo leeyney khׇl-hagvoyim verau khׇl-afesey-arets et yeshuat eloheynu {s}

Hebrew: ס֤וּרוּ ס֙וּרוּ֙ צְא֣וּ מִשָּׁ֔ם טָמֵ֖א אַל־תִּגָּ֑עוּ צְא֣וּ מִתּוֹכָ֔הּ הִבָּ֕רוּ נֹשְׂאֵ֖י כְּלֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Turn, turn away, touch naught impure
As you depart from there;
Keep pure, as you go forth from there,
You who bear the vessels of GOD!
Transliteration: suru suru tseu misham tame al-tigau tseu mitvokhah hivaru nosheey kheley yehovah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֤א בְחִפָּזוֹן֙ תֵּצֵ֔אוּ וּבִמְנוּסָ֖ה לֹ֣א תֵלֵכ֑וּן כִּֽי־הֹלֵ֤ךְ לִפְנֵיכֶם֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וּמְאַסִּפְכֶ֖ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
For you will not depart in haste,
Nor will you leave in flight;
For GOD is marching before you,
The God of Israel is your rear guard.
Transliteration: khiy lo vechifazvon tetseu uvimenusah lo telekhun khiy-holekhe lifeneykhem yehovah umeasifekhem elohey yisherael {s}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה יַשְׂכִּ֖יל עַבְדִּ֑י יָר֧וּם וְנִשָּׂ֛א וְגָבַ֖הּ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
“Indeed, My servant shall prosper,
Be exalted and raised to great heights.
Transliteration: hineh yashekhiyl avediy yarum venisha vegavah meod

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר שָׁמְמ֤וּ עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ רַבִּ֔ים כֵּן־מִשְׁחַ֥ת מֵאִ֖ישׁ מַרְאֵ֑הוּ וְתֹאֲר֖וֹ מִבְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Just as the many were appalled at him—
So marred was his appearance, unlike that of a person,
His form, beyond human semblance—
Transliteration: khaasher shamemu aleykha raviym khen-mishechat meiysh mareehu vetoarvo miveney adam

Hebrew: כֵּ֤ן יַזֶּה֙ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֔ים עָלָ֛יו יִקְפְּצ֥וּ מְלָכִ֖ים פִּיהֶ֑ם כִּ֠י אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־סֻפַּ֤ר לָהֶם֙ רָא֔וּ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־שָׁמְע֖וּ הִתְבּוֹנָֽנוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Just so he shall startle many nations.
Kings shall be silenced because of him,
For they shall see what has not been told them,
Shall behold what they never have heard.”
Transliteration: khen yazeh gvoyim raviym alayv yikefetsu melakhiym fiyhem khiy asher lo-sufar lahem rau vaasher lo-shameu hitevvonanu {s}

Hebrew: מִ֥י הֶאֱמִ֖ין לִשְׁמֻעָתֵ֑נוּ וּזְר֥וֹעַ יְהֹוָ֖ה עַל־מִ֥י נִגְלָֽתָה׃
Translated:
“Who can believe what we have heard?
Upon whom has the arm of GOD been revealed?
Transliteration: miy heemiyn lishemuatenu uzervoa yehovah al-miy nigelatah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַל כַּיּוֹנֵ֜ק לְפָנָ֗יו וְכַשֹּׁ֙רֶשׁ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ צִיָּ֔ה לֹא־תֹ֥אַר ל֖וֹ וְלֹ֣א הָדָ֑ר וְנִרְאֵ֥הוּ וְלֹֽא־מַרְאֶ֖ה וְנֶחְמְדֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
For he has grown, by God’s favor, like a tree crown,
Like a tree trunk out of arid ground.
He had no form or beauty, that we should look at him:
No charm, that we should find him pleasing.
Transliteration: vayaal khayyvonek lefanayv vekhashoresh meerets tsiyah lo-toar lvo velo hadar venireehu velo-mareeh venechemedehu

Hebrew: נִבְזֶה֙ וַחֲדַ֣ל אִישִׁ֔ים אִ֥ישׁ מַכְאֹב֖וֹת וִיד֣וּעַ חֹ֑לִי וּכְמַסְתֵּ֤ר פָּנִים֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ נִבְזֶ֖ה וְלֹ֥א חֲשַׁבְנֻֽהוּ׃
Translated:
He was despised, shunned by others,
A man of suffering, familiar with disease.
As one who hid his face from us,
He was despised, we held him of no account.
Transliteration: nivezeh vachadal iyshiym iysh makheovvot viydua choliy ukhemaseter faniym mimenu nivezeh velo chashavenuhu

Hebrew: אָכֵ֤ן חֳלָיֵ֙נוּ֙ ה֣וּא נָשָׂ֔א וּמַכְאֹבֵ֖ינוּ סְבָלָ֑ם וַאֲנַ֣חְנוּ חֲשַׁבְנֻ֔הוּ נָג֛וּעַ מֻכֵּ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים וּמְעֻנֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Yet it was our sickness that he was bearing,
Our suffering that he endured.
We accounted him plagued,
Smitten and afflicted by God;
Transliteration: akhen cholaeinu hu nasha umakheoveynu sevalam vaanachenu chashavenuhu nagua mukheh Elohim umeuneh

Hebrew: וְהוּא֙ מְחֹלָ֣ל מִפְּשָׁעֵ֔נוּ מְדֻכָּ֖א מֵעֲוֺנֹתֵ֑ינוּ מוּסַ֤ר שְׁלוֹמֵ֙נוּ֙ עָלָ֔יו וּבַחֲבֻרָת֖וֹ נִרְפָּא־לָֽנוּ׃
Translated:
But he was wounded because of our sins,
Crushed because of our iniquities.
He bore the chastisement that made us whole,
And by his bruises we were healed.
Transliteration: vehu mecholal mifeshaenu medukha meavonoteynu musar shelvomenu alayv uvachavuratvo nirefa-lanu

Hebrew: כֻּלָּ֙נוּ֙ כַּצֹּ֣אן תָּעִ֔ינוּ אִ֥ישׁ לְדַרְכּ֖וֹ פָּנִ֑ינוּ וַיהֹוָה֙ הִפְגִּ֣יעַ בּ֔וֹ אֵ֖ת עֲוֺ֥ן כֻּלָּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
We all went astray like sheep,
Each of us going our own way;
And GOD visited upon him
The guilt of all of us.”
Transliteration: khulanu khatson taiynu iysh ledarekhvo faniynu vayhovah hifegiya vvo et avon khulanu

Hebrew: נִגַּ֨שׂ וְה֣וּא נַעֲנֶה֮ וְלֹ֣א יִפְתַּח־פִּיו֒ כַּשֶּׂה֙ לַטֶּ֣בַח יוּבָ֔ל וּכְרָחֵ֕ל לִפְנֵ֥י גֹזְזֶ֖יהָ נֶאֱלָ֑מָה וְלֹ֥א יִפְתַּ֖ח פִּֽיו׃
Translated:
He was maltreated, yet he was submissive,
He did not open his mouth;
Like a sheep being led to slaughter,
Like a ewe, dumb before those who shear her,
He did not open his mouth.
Transliteration: nigash vehu naaneh velo yifetach-fiyv khasheh latevach yuval ukherachel lifeney gozezeyha neelamah velo yifetach fiyv

Hebrew: מֵעֹ֤צֶר וּמִמִּשְׁפָּט֙ לֻקָּ֔ח וְאֶת־דּוֹר֖וֹ מִ֣י יְשׂוֹחֵ֑חַ כִּ֤י נִגְזַר֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ חַיִּ֔ים מִפֶּ֥שַׁע עַמִּ֖י נֶ֥גַע לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
By oppressive judgment he was taken away,
Who could describe his abode?
For he was cut off from the land of the living
Through the sin of my people, who deserved the punishment.
Transliteration: meotser umimishefat lukach veet-dvorvo miy yeshvochecha khiy nigezar meerets chayiym mifesha amiy nega lamvo

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן אֶת־רְשָׁעִים֙ קִבְר֔וֹ וְאֶת־עָשִׁ֖יר בְּמֹתָ֑יו עַ֚ל לֹא־חָמָ֣ס עָשָׂ֔ה וְלֹ֥א מִרְמָ֖ה בְּפִֽיו׃
Translated:
And his grave was set among the wicked,
And with the rich, in his death—
Though he had done no injustice
And had spoken no falsehood.
Transliteration: vayiten et-reshaiym kivervo veet-ashiyr vemotayv al lo-chamas ashah velo miremah vefiyv

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֞ה חָפֵ֤ץ דַּכְּאוֹ֙ הֶחֱלִ֔י אִם־תָּשִׂ֤ים אָשָׁם֙ נַפְשׁ֔וֹ יִרְאֶ֥ה זֶ֖רַע יַאֲרִ֣יךְ יָמִ֑ים וְחֵ֥פֶץ יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיָד֥וֹ יִצְלָֽח׃
Translated:
But GOD chose to crush him by disease,
That, if he made himself an offering for guilt,
He might see offspring and have long life,
And that through him GOD’s purpose might prosper.
Transliteration: vayhovah chafets dakhevo hecheliy im-tashiym asham nafeshvo yireeh zera yaariykhe yamiym vechefets yehovah veyadvo yitselach

Hebrew: מֵעֲמַ֤ל נַפְשׁוֹ֙ יִרְאֶ֣ה יִשְׂבָּ֔ע בְּדַעְתּ֗וֹ יַצְדִּ֥יק צַדִּ֛יק עַבְדִּ֖י לָרַבִּ֑ים וַעֲוֺנֹתָ֖ם ה֥וּא יִסְבֹּֽל׃
Translated:
Out of his anguish he shall see it;
He shall enjoy it to the full through his devotion.
“My righteous servant makes the many righteous,
It is their punishment that he bears;
Transliteration: meamal nafeshvo yireeh yisheva vedaetvo yatsediyk tsadiyk avediy laraviym vaavonotam hu yisevol

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן אֲחַלֶּק־ל֣וֹ בָרַבִּ֗ים וְאֶת־עֲצוּמִים֮ יְחַלֵּ֣ק שָׁלָל֒ תַּ֗חַת אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶעֱרָ֤ה לַמָּ֙וֶת֙ נַפְשׁ֔וֹ וְאֶת־פֹּשְׁעִ֖ים נִמְנָ֑ה וְהוּא֙ חֵטְא־רַבִּ֣ים נָשָׂ֔א וְלַפֹּשְׁעִ֖ים יַפְגִּֽיעַ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Assuredly, I will give him the many as his portion,
He shall receive the multitude as his spoil.
For he exposed himself to death
And was numbered among the sinners,
Whereas he bore the guilt of the many
And made intercession for sinners.”
Transliteration: lakhen achalek-lvo varaviym veet-atsumiym yechalek shalal tachat asher heerah lamavet nafeshvo veet-fosheiym nimenah vehu chete-raviym nasha velafosheiym yafegiya {f}

Hebrew: רׇנִּ֥י עֲקָרָ֖ה לֹ֣א יָלָ֑דָה פִּצְחִ֨י רִנָּ֤ה וְצַֽהֲלִי֙ לֹא־חָ֔לָה כִּֽי־רַבִּ֧ים בְּֽנֵי־שׁוֹמֵמָ֛ה מִבְּנֵ֥י בְעוּלָ֖ה אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Shout, O infertile one,
You who bore no child!
Shout aloud for joy,
You who did not travail!
For the children of the wife forlorn
Shall outnumber those of the espoused
—said GOD.
Transliteration: rׇniy akarah lo yaladah fitsechiy rinah vetsahaliy lo-chalah khiy-raviym veney-shvomemah miveney veulah amar yehovah

Hebrew: הַרְחִ֣יבִי ׀ מְק֣וֹם אׇהֳלֵ֗ךְ וִירִיע֧וֹת מִשְׁכְּנוֹתַ֛יִךְ יַטּ֖וּ אַל־תַּחְשֹׂ֑כִי הַאֲרִ֙יכִי֙ מֵיתָרַ֔יִךְ וִיתֵדֹתַ֖יִךְ חַזֵּֽקִי׃
Translated:
Enlarge the site of your tent,
Extend the size of your dwelling,
Do not stint!
Lengthen the ropes, and drive the pegs firm.
Transliteration: harechiyviy mekvom ׇholekhe viyriyvot mishekhenvotayiikhe yatu al-tacheshokhiy haariykhiy meytarayiikhe viytedotayiikhe chazekiy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹ֖אול תִּפְרֹ֑צִי וְזַרְעֵךְ֙ גּוֹיִ֣ם יִירָ֔שׁ וְעָרִ֥ים נְשַׁמּ֖וֹת יוֹשִֽׁיבוּ׃
Translated:
For you shall spread out to the right and the left;
Your offspring shall dispossess nations
And shall people the desolate towns.
Transliteration: khiy-yamiyn ushemovl tiferotsiy vezareekhe gvoyim yiyrash veariym neshamvot yvoshiyvu

Hebrew: אַל־תִּֽירְאִי֙ כִּֽי־לֹ֣א תֵב֔וֹשִׁי וְאַל־תִּכָּלְמִ֖י כִּ֣י לֹ֣א תַחְפִּ֑ירִי כִּ֣י בֹ֤שֶׁת עֲלוּמַ֙יִךְ֙ תִּשְׁכָּ֔חִי וְחֶרְפַּ֥ת אַלְמְנוּתַ֖יִךְ לֹ֥א תִזְכְּרִי־עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
Fear not, you shall not be shamed;
Do not cringe, you shall not be disgraced.
For you shall forget
The reproach of your youth,
And remember no more
The shame of your widowhood.
Transliteration: al-tiyreiy khiy-lo tevvoshiy veal-tikhalemiy khiy lo tachefiyriy khiy voshet alumayiikhe tishekhachiy vecherefat alemenutayiikhe lo tizekheriy-vod

Hebrew: כִּ֤י בֹעֲלַ֙יִךְ֙ עֹשַׂ֔יִךְ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁמ֑וֹ וְגֹֽאֲלֵךְ֙ קְד֣וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֱלֹהֵ֥י כׇל־הָאָ֖רֶץ יִקָּרֵֽא׃
Translated:
For the One who made you—whose name is “ GOD of Hosts”—
Will espouse you.
The Holy One of Israel—who is called “God of all the Earth”—
Will redeem you.
Transliteration: khiy voalayiikhe oshayiikhe yehovah tsevavot shemvo vegoalekhe kedvosh yisherael elohey khׇl-haarets yikare

Hebrew: כִּֽי־כְאִשָּׁ֧ה עֲזוּבָ֛ה וַעֲצ֥וּבַת ר֖וּחַ קְרָאָ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאֵ֧שֶׁת נְעוּרִ֛ים כִּ֥י תִמָּאֵ֖ס אָמַ֥ר אֱלֹהָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
GOD has called you back
As a wife forlorn and forsaken.
Can one cast off the wife of his youth?
—said your God.
Transliteration: khiy-kheishah azuvah vaatsuvat rucha keraakhe yehovah veeshet neuriym khiy timaes amar elohayiikhe

Hebrew: בְּרֶ֥גַע קָטֹ֖ן עֲזַבְתִּ֑יךְ וּבְרַחֲמִ֥ים גְּדֹלִ֖ים אֲקַבְּצֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
For a little while I forsook you,
But with vast love I will bring you back.
Transliteration: verega katon azavetiykhe uverachamiym gedoliym akavetsekhe

Hebrew: בְּשֶׁ֣צֶף קֶ֗צֶף הִסְתַּ֨רְתִּי פָנַ֥י רֶ֙גַע֙ מִמֵּ֔ךְ וּבְחֶ֥סֶד עוֹלָ֖ם רִחַמְתִּ֑יךְ אָמַ֥ר גֹּאֲלֵ֖ךְ יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
In slight anger, for a moment,
I hid My face from you;
But with kindness everlasting
I will take you back in love
—said GOD your Redeemer.
Transliteration: veshetsef ketsef hisetaretiy fanay rega mimekhe uvechesed volam richametiykhe amar goalekhe yehovah {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־מֵ֥י נֹ֙חַ֙ זֹ֣את לִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִשְׁבַּ֗עְתִּי מֵעֲבֹ֥ר מֵי־נֹ֛חַ ע֖וֹד עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ כֵּ֥ן נִשְׁבַּ֛עְתִּי מִקְּצֹ֥ף עָלַ֖יִךְ וּמִגְּעׇר־בָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
For this to Me is like the waters of Noah:
As I swore that the waters of Noah
Nevermore would flood the earth,
So I swear that I will not
Be angry with you or rebuke you.
Transliteration: khiy-mey nocha zot liy asher nishevaetiy meavor mey-nocha vod al-haarets khen nishevaetiy miketsof alayiikhe umigeׇr-vakhe

Hebrew: כִּ֤י הֶהָרִים֙ יָמ֔וּשׁוּ וְהַגְּבָע֖וֹת תְּמוּטֶ֑ינָה וְחַסְדִּ֞י מֵאִתֵּ֣ךְ לֹא־יָמ֗וּשׁ וּבְרִ֤ית שְׁלוֹמִי֙ לֹ֣א תָמ֔וּט אָמַ֥ר מְרַחֲמֵ֖ךְ יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
For the mountains may move
And the hills be shaken,
But my loyalty shall never move from you,
Nor My covenant of friendship be shaken
—said GOD, who takes you back in love.
Transliteration: khiy hehariym yamushu vehagevavot temuteynah vechasediy meitekhe lo-yamush uveriyt shelvomiy lo tamut amar merachamekhe yehovah {s}

Hebrew: עֲנִיָּ֥ה סֹעֲרָ֖ה לֹ֣א נֻחָ֑מָה הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י מַרְבִּ֤יץ בַּפּוּךְ֙ אֲבָנַ֔יִךְ וִֽיסַדְתִּ֖יךְ בַּסַּפִּירִֽים׃
Translated:
Unhappy, storm-tossed one, uncomforted!
I will lay carbuncles as your building stones
And make your foundations of sapphires.
Transliteration: aniyah soarah lo nuchamah hineh anokhiy mareviyts vafukhe avanayiikhe viysadetiykhe vasafiyriym

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י כַּֽדְכֹד֙ שִׁמְשֹׁתַ֔יִךְ וּשְׁעָרַ֖יִךְ לְאַבְנֵ֣י אֶקְדָּ֑ח וְכׇל־גְּבוּלֵ֖ךְ לְאַבְנֵי־חֵֽפֶץ׃
Translated:
I will make your battlements of rubies,
Your gates of precious stones,
The whole encircling wall of gems.
Transliteration: veshametiy khadekhod shimeshotayiikhe ushearayiikhe leaveney ekedach vekhׇl-gevulekhe leaveney-chefets

Hebrew: וְכׇל־בָּנַ֖יִךְ לִמּוּדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְרַ֖ב שְׁל֥וֹם בָּנָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
And all your children shall be disciples of GOD,
And great shall be the happiness of your children;
Transliteration: vekhׇl-vanayiikhe limudey yehovah verav shelvom vanayiikhe

Hebrew: בִּצְדָקָ֖ה תִּכּוֹנָ֑נִי רַחֲקִ֤י מֵעֹ֙שֶׁק֙ כִּי־לֹ֣א תִירָ֔אִי וּמִ֨מְּחִתָּ֔ה כִּ֥י לֹֽא־תִקְרַ֖ב אֵלָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
You shall be established through righteousness.
You shall be safe from oppression,
And shall have no fear;
From ruin, and it shall not come near you.
Transliteration: vitsedakah tikhvonaniy rachakiy meoshek khiy-lo tiyraiy umimechitah khiy lo-tikerav elayiikhe

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן גּ֥וֹר יָג֛וּר אֶ֖פֶס מֵאוֹתִ֑י מִי־גָ֥ר אִתָּ֖ךְ עָלַ֥יִךְ יִפּֽוֹל׃
Translated:
Surely no harm can be done
Without My consent:
Whoever would harm you
Shall fall because of you.
Transliteration: hen gvor yagur efes mevotiy miy-gar itakhe alayiikhe yifvol

Hebrew: (הן) [הִנֵּ֤ה] אָנֹכִי֙ בָּרָ֣אתִי חָרָ֔שׁ נֹפֵ֙חַ֙ בְּאֵ֣שׁ פֶּחָ֔ם וּמוֹצִ֥יא כְלִ֖י לְמַעֲשֵׂ֑הוּ וְאָנֹכִ֛י בָּרָ֥אתִי מַשְׁחִ֖ית לְחַבֵּֽל׃
Translated:
It is I who created the smith
To fan the charcoal fire
And produce tools for each purpose;
So it is I who create
The instruments of havoc.
Transliteration: (hn) [hineh] anokhiy varatiy charash nofecha veesh fecham umvotsiy kheliy lemaashehu veanokhiy varatiy mashechiyt lechavel

Hebrew: כׇּל־כְּלִ֞י יוּצַ֤ר עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ לֹ֣א יִצְלָ֔ח וְכׇל־לָשׁ֛וֹן תָּקוּם־אִתָּ֥ךְ לַמִּשְׁפָּ֖ט תַּרְשִׁ֑יעִי זֹ֡את נַחֲלַת֩ עַבְדֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֧ה וְצִדְקָתָ֛ם מֵאִתִּ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
No weapon formed against you
Shall succeed,
And every tongue that contends with you at law
You shall defeat.
Such is the lot of GOD’s servants,
Such their triumph through Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: khׇl-kheliy yutsar alayiikhe lo yitselach vekhׇl-lashvon takum-itakhe lamishefat tareshiyiy zot nachalat avedey yehovah vetsidekatam meitiy neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: ה֤וֹי כׇּל־צָמֵא֙ לְכ֣וּ לַמַּ֔יִם וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵֽין־ל֖וֹ כָּ֑סֶף לְכ֤וּ שִׁבְרוּ֙ וֶאֱכֹ֔לוּ וּלְכ֣וּ שִׁבְר֗וּ בְּלוֹא־כֶ֛סֶף וּבְל֥וֹא מְחִ֖יר יַ֥יִן וְחָלָֽב׃
Translated:
Ho, all who are thirsty,
Come for water,
Even if you have no money;
Come, buy food and eat:
Buy food without money,
Wine and milk without cost.
Transliteration: hvoy khׇl-tsame lekhu lamayiim vaasher eyn-lvo khasef lekhu shiveru veekholu ulekhu shiveru velvo-khesef uvelvo mechiyr yayiin vechalav

Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה תִשְׁקְלוּ־כֶ֙סֶף֙ בְּלוֹא־לֶ֔חֶם וִיגִיעֲכֶ֖ם בְּל֣וֹא לְשׇׂבְעָ֑ה שִׁמְע֨וּ שָׁמ֤וֹעַ אֵלַי֙ וְאִכְלוּ־ט֔וֹב וְתִתְעַנַּ֥ג בַּדֶּ֖שֶׁן נַפְשְׁכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Why do you spend money for what is not bread,
Your earnings for what does not satisfy?
Give heed to Me,
And you shall eat choice food
And enjoy the richest viands.
Transliteration: lamah tishekelu-khesef velvo-lechem viygiyakhem velvo leshׇveah shimeu shamvoa elay veikhelu-tvov vetiteanag vadeshen nafeshekhem

Hebrew: הַטּ֤וּ אׇזְנְכֶם֙ וּלְכ֣וּ אֵלַ֔י שִׁמְע֖וּ וּתְחִ֣י נַפְשְׁכֶ֑ם וְאֶכְרְתָ֤ה לָכֶם֙ בְּרִ֣ית עוֹלָ֔ם חַֽסְדֵ֥י דָוִ֖ד הַנֶּאֱמָנִֽים׃
Translated:
Incline your ear and come to Me;
Hearken, and you shall be revived.
And I will make with you an everlasting covenant,
The enduring loyalty promised to David.
Transliteration: hatu ׇzenekhem ulekhu elay shimeu utechiy nafeshekhem veekheretah lakhem veriyt volam chasedey david haneemaniym

Hebrew: הֵ֛ן עֵ֥ד לְאוּמִּ֖ים נְתַתִּ֑יו נָגִ֥יד וּמְצַוֵּ֖ה לְאֻמִּֽים׃
Translated:
As I made him a leader of peoples,
A prince and commander of peoples,
Transliteration: hen ed leumiym netatiyv nagiyd umetsaveh leumiym

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן גּ֤וֹי לֹֽא־תֵדַע֙ תִּקְרָ֔א וְג֥וֹי לֹֽא־יְדָע֖וּךָ אֵלֶ֣יךָ יָר֑וּצוּ לְמַ֙עַן֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְלִקְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כִּ֥י פֵאֲרָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
So you shall summon a nation you did not know,
And a nation that did not know you
Shall come running to you—
For the sake of the ETERNAL your God,
The Holy One of Israel who has glorified you.
Transliteration: hen gvoy lo-teda tikera vegvoy lo-yedaukha eleykha yarutsu lemaan yehovah eloheykha velikedvosh yisherael khiy fearakhe {s}

Hebrew: דִּרְשׁ֥וּ יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּהִמָּֽצְא֑וֹ קְרָאֻ֖הוּ בִּֽהְיוֹת֥וֹ קָרֽוֹב׃
Translated:
Seek GOD while you can,
Call out while [God] is near.
Transliteration: direshu yehovah vehimatsevo kerauhu viheyvotvo karvov

Hebrew: יַעֲזֹ֤ב רָשָׁע֙ דַּרְכּ֔וֹ וְאִ֥ישׁ אָ֖וֶן מַחְשְׁבֹתָ֑יו וְיָשֹׁ֤ב אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ וִֽירַחֲמֵ֔הוּ וְאֶל־אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ כִּֽי־יַרְבֶּ֥ה לִסְלֽוֹחַ׃
Translated:
Let the wicked give up their ways,
The sinful, their plans;
Let each one turn back to GOD
So as to be pardoned;
To our God,
Who freely forgives.
Transliteration: yaazov rasha darekhvo veiysh aven macheshevotayv veyashov el-yehovah viyrachamehu veel-eloheynu khiy-yareveh liselvocha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֤א מַחְשְׁבוֹתַי֙ מַחְשְׁב֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א דַרְכֵיכֶ֖ם דְּרָכָ֑י נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
For My plans are not your plans,
Nor are My ways your ways
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: khiy lo macheshevvotay macheshevvoteykhem velo darekheykhem derakhay neum yehovah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־גָבְה֥וּ שָׁמַ֖יִם מֵאָ֑רֶץ כֵּ֣ן גָּבְה֤וּ דְרָכַי֙ מִדַּרְכֵיכֶ֔ם וּמַחְשְׁבֹתַ֖י מִמַּחְשְׁבֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
But as the heavens are high above the earth,
So are My ways high above your ways
And My plans above your plans.
Transliteration: khiy-gavehu shamayiim mearets khen gavehu derakhay midarekheykhem umacheshevotay mimacheshevoteykhem

Hebrew: כִּ֡י כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵרֵד֩ הַגֶּ֨שֶׁם וְהַשֶּׁ֜לֶג מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם וְשָׁ֙מָּה֙ לֹ֣א יָשׁ֔וּב כִּ֚י אִם־הִרְוָ֣ה אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְהוֹלִידָ֖הּ וְהִצְמִיחָ֑הּ וְנָ֤תַן זֶ֙רַע֙ לַזֹּרֵ֔עַ וְלֶ֖חֶם לָאֹכֵֽל׃
Translated:
For as the rain or snow drops from heaven
And returns not there,
But soaks the earth
And makes it bring forth vegetation,
Yielding seed for sowing and bread for eating,
Transliteration: khiy khaasher eired hageshem vehasheleg min-hashamayiim veshamah lo yashuv khiy im-hirevah et-haarets vehvoliydah vehitsemiychah venatan zera lazorea velechem laokhel

Hebrew: כֵּ֣ן יִהְיֶ֤ה דְבָרִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵצֵ֣א מִפִּ֔י לֹא־יָשׁ֥וּב אֵלַ֖י רֵיקָ֑ם כִּ֤י אִם־עָשָׂה֙ אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָפַ֔צְתִּי וְהִצְלִ֖יחַ אֲשֶׁ֥ר שְׁלַחְתִּֽיו׃
Translated:
So is the word that issues from My mouth:
It does not come back to Me unfulfilled,
But performs what I purpose,
Achieves what I sent it to do.
Transliteration: khen yiheyeh devariy asher eitse mifiy lo-yashuv elay reykam khiy im-ashah et-asher chafatsetiy vehitseliycha asher shelachetiyv

Hebrew: כִּֽי־בְשִׂמְחָ֣ה תֵצֵ֔אוּ וּבְשָׁל֖וֹם תּוּבָל֑וּן הֶהָרִ֣ים וְהַגְּבָע֗וֹת יִפְצְח֤וּ לִפְנֵיכֶם֙ רִנָּ֔ה וְכׇל־עֲצֵ֥י הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה יִמְחֲאוּ־כָֽף׃
Translated:
Yea, you shall leave in joy and be led home secure.
Before you, mount and hill shall shout aloud,
And all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.
Transliteration: khiy-veshimechah tetseu uveshalvom tuvalun hehariym vehagevavot yifetsechu lifeneykhem rinah vekhׇl-atsey hashadeh yimechau-khaf

Hebrew: תַּ֤חַת הַֽנַּעֲצוּץ֙ יַעֲלֶ֣ה בְר֔וֹשׁ (תחת) [וְתַ֥חַת] הַסִּרְפַּ֖ד יַעֲלֶ֣ה הֲדַ֑ס וְהָיָ֤ה לַֽיהֹוָה֙ לְשֵׁ֔ם לְא֥וֹת עוֹלָ֖ם לֹ֥א יִכָּרֵֽת׃ {פ}
Translated:
Instead of the brier, a cypress shall rise;
Instead of the nettle, a myrtle shall rise.
These shall stand as a testimony to GOD,
As an everlasting sign that shall not perish.
Transliteration: tachat hanaatsuts yaaleh vervosh (tcht) [vetachat] hasirefad yaaleh hadas vehayah layhovah leshem levot volam lo yikharet {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה שִׁמְר֥וּ מִשְׁפָּ֖ט וַעֲשׂ֣וּ צְדָקָ֑ה כִּֽי־קְרוֹבָ֤ה יְשׁוּעָתִי֙ לָב֔וֹא וְצִדְקָתִ֖י לְהִגָּלֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
Observe what is right and do what is just;
For soon My salvation shall come,
And My deliverance be revealed.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah shimeru mishefat vaashu tsedakah khiy-kervovah yeshuatiy lavvo vetsidekatiy lehigalvot

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֤י אֱנוֹשׁ֙ יַֽעֲשֶׂה־זֹּ֔את וּבֶן־אָדָ֖ם יַחֲזִ֣יק בָּ֑הּ שֹׁמֵ֤ר שַׁבָּת֙ מֵֽחַלְּל֔וֹ וְשֹׁמֵ֥ר יָד֖וֹ מֵעֲשׂ֥וֹת כׇּל־רָֽע׃ {ס}
Translated:
Happy is the mortal who does this,
The one who holds fast to it:
Who keeps the sabbath and does not profane it,
And holds back from doing any evil.
Transliteration: asherey envosh yaasheh-zot uven-adam yachaziyk vah shomer shavat mechalelvo veshomer yadvo meashvot khׇl-ra {s}

Hebrew: וְאַל־יֹאמַ֣ר בֶּן־הַנֵּכָ֗ר הַנִּלְוָ֤ה אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הַבְדֵּ֧ל יַבְדִּילַ֛נִי יְהֹוָ֖ה מֵעַ֣ל עַמּ֑וֹ וְאַל־יֹאמַר֙ הַסָּרִ֔יס הֵ֥ן אֲנִ֖י עֵ֥ץ יָבֵֽשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Let not the foreigner say,
Who is joined to GOD,
“ GOD will keep me apart from this covenanted people”;
And let not the eunuch say,
“I am a withered tree.”
Transliteration: veal-yomar ven-hanekhar hanilevah el-yehovah lemor havedel yavediylaniy yehovah meal amvo veal-yomar hasariys hen aniy ets yavesh {f}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה לַסָּֽרִיסִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁמְרוּ֙ אֶת־שַׁבְּתוֹתַ֔י וּבָחֲר֖וּ בַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר חָפָ֑צְתִּי וּמַחֲזִיקִ֖ים בִּבְרִיתִֽי׃
Translated:
For thus said GOD:
“As for the eunuchs who keep My sabbaths,
Who have chosen what I desire
And hold fast to My covenant—
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah lasariysiym asher yishemeru et-shavetvotay uvacharu vaasher chafatsetiy umachaziykiym viveriytiy

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֨י לָהֶ֜ם בְּבֵיתִ֤י וּבְחֽוֹמֹתַי֙ יָ֣ד וָשֵׁ֔ם ט֖וֹב מִבָּנִ֣ים וּמִבָּנ֑וֹת שֵׁ֤ם עוֹלָם֙ אֶתֶּן־ל֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֖ר לֹ֥א יִכָּרֵֽת׃ {ס}
Translated:
I will give them, in My House
And within My walls,
A monument and a name
Better than sons or daughters.
I will give them an everlasting name
That shall not perish.
Transliteration: venatatiy lahem veveytiy uvechvomotay yad vashem tvov mivaniym umivanvot shem volam eten-lvo asher lo yikharet {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י הַנֵּכָ֗ר הַנִּלְוִ֤ים עַל־יְהֹוָה֙ לְשָׁ֣רְת֔וֹ וּֽלְאַהֲבָה֙ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה לִֽהְי֥וֹת ל֖וֹ לַעֲבָדִ֑ים כׇּל־שֹׁמֵ֤ר שַׁבָּת֙ מֵֽחַלְּל֔וֹ וּמַחֲזִיקִ֖ים בִּבְרִיתִֽי׃
Translated:
As for the foreigners
Who are joined to GOD,
To render service,
And to love GOD’s name,
To be devoted servants—
All who keep the sabbath and do not profane it,
And who hold fast to My covenant—
Transliteration: uveney hanekhar hanileviym al-yehovah lesharetvo uleahavah et-shem yehovah liheyvot lvo laavadiym khׇl-shomer shavat mechalelvo umachaziykiym viveriytiy

Hebrew: וַהֲבִיאוֹתִ֞ים אֶל־הַ֣ר קׇדְשִׁ֗י וְשִׂמַּחְתִּים֙ בְּבֵ֣ית תְּפִלָּתִ֔י עוֹלֹתֵיהֶ֧ם וְזִבְחֵיהֶ֛ם לְרָצ֖וֹן עַֽל־מִזְבְּחִ֑י כִּ֣י בֵיתִ֔י בֵּית־תְּפִלָּ֥ה יִקָּרֵ֖א לְכׇל־הָעַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
I will bring them to My sacred mount
And let them rejoice in My house of prayer.
Their burnt offerings and sacrifices
Shall be welcome on My altar;
For My House shall be called
A house of prayer for all peoples.”
Transliteration: vahaviyvotiym el-har kׇdeshiy veshimachetiym veveyt tefilatiy voloteyhem vezivecheyhem leratsvon al-mizevechiy khiy veytiy veyt-tefilah yikare lekhׇl-haamiym

Hebrew: נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה מְקַבֵּ֖ץ נִדְחֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל ע֛וֹד אֲקַבֵּ֥ץ עָלָ֖יו לְנִקְבָּצָֽיו׃
Translated:
Thus declares my Sovereign GOD,
Who gathers the dispersed of Israel:
“I will gather still more to those already gathered.”
Transliteration: neum adonay yehovih mekavets nidechey yisherael vod akavets alayv lenikevatsayv

Hebrew: כֹּ֖ל חַיְת֣וֹ שָׂדָ֑י אֵתָ֕יוּ לֶאֱכֹ֥ל כׇּל־חַיְת֖וֹ בַּיָּֽעַר׃ {פ}
Translated:
All you wild beasts, come and devour,
All you beasts of the forest!
Transliteration: khol chayetvo shaday etayu leekhol khׇl-chayetvo vayaar {f}

Hebrew: <big>צֹ</big>פָ֞ו עִוְרִ֤ים כֻּלָּם֙ לֹ֣א יָדָ֔עוּ כֻּלָּם֙ כְּלָבִ֣ים אִלְּמִ֔ים לֹ֥א יוּכְל֖וּ לִנְבֹּ֑חַ הֹזִים֙ שֹֽׁכְבִ֔ים אֹהֲבֵ֖י לָנֽוּם׃
Translated:
The lookouts are blind, all of them,
They perceive nothing.
They are all dumb dogs
That cannot bark;
They lie sprawling,
They love to drowse.
Transliteration: <big>tso</big>fav iveriym khulam lo yadau khulam khelaviym ilemiym lo yukhelu linevocha hoziym shokheviym ohavey lanum

Hebrew: וְהַכְּלָבִ֣ים עַזֵּי־נֶ֗פֶשׁ לֹ֤א יָֽדְעוּ֙ שׇׂבְעָ֔ה וְהֵ֣מָּה רֹעִ֔ים לֹ֥א יָדְע֖וּ הָבִ֑ין כֻּלָּם֙ לְדַרְכָּ֣ם פָּנ֔וּ אִ֥ישׁ לְבִצְע֖וֹ מִקָּצֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Moreover, the dogs are greedy;
They never know satiety.
As for the shepherds, they know not
What it is to give heed.
Everyone has turned their own way,
Every last one seeks their own advantage.
Transliteration: vehakhelaviym azey-nefesh lo yadeu shׇveah vehemah roiym lo yadeu haviyn khulam ledarekham fanu iysh levitsevo mikatsehu

Hebrew: אֵתָ֥יוּ אֶקְחָה־יַ֖יִן וְנִסְבְּאָ֣ה שֵׁכָ֑ר וְהָיָ֤ה כָזֶה֙ י֣וֹם מָחָ֔ר גָּד֖וֹל יֶ֥תֶר מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
“Come, I’ll get some wine;
Let us swill liquor.
And tomorrow will be just the same,
Or even much grander!”
Transliteration: etayu ekechah-yayiin veniseveah shekhar vehayah khazeh yvom machar gadvol yeter meod

Hebrew: הַצַּדִּ֣יק אָבָ֔ד וְאֵ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ שָׂ֣ם עַל־לֵ֑ב וְאַנְשֵׁי־חֶ֤סֶד נֶאֱסָפִים֙ בְּאֵ֣ין מֵבִ֔ין כִּֽי־מִפְּנֵ֥י הָרָעָ֖ה נֶאֱסַ֥ף הַצַּדִּֽיק׃
Translated:
A righteous person perishes,
And no one considers;
The pious are taken away,
And no one gives thought
That because of evil
The righteous one was taken away.
Transliteration: hatsadiyk avad veeyn iysh sham al-lev veaneshey-chesed neesafiym veeyn meviyn khiy-mifeney haraah neesaf hatsadiyk

Hebrew: יָב֣וֹא שָׁל֔וֹם יָנ֖וּחוּ עַל־מִשְׁכְּבוֹתָ֑ם הֹלֵ֖ךְ נְכֹחֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Yet one who walked straightforward
Shall come to peace,
Shall have rest on their couch.
Transliteration: yavvo shalvom yanuchu al-mishekhevvotam holekhe nekhochvo {s}

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֥ם קִרְבוּ־הֵ֖נָּה בְּנֵ֣י עֹנְנָ֑ה זֶ֥רַע מְנָאֵ֖ף וַתִּזְנֶֽה׃
Translated:
But as for you, come closer,
You children of a sorceress,
You offspring of an adulterer and a whore!
Transliteration: veatem kirevu-henah veney onenah zera menaef vatizeneh

Hebrew: עַל־מִי֙ תִּתְעַנָּ֔גוּ עַל־מִ֛י תַּרְחִ֥יבוּ פֶ֖ה תַּאֲרִ֣יכוּ לָשׁ֑וֹן הֲלוֹא־אַתֶּ֥ם יִלְדֵי־פֶ֖שַׁע זֶ֥רַע שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
With whom do you act so familiarly?
At whom do you open your mouth
And stick out your tongue?
Why, you are children of iniquity,
Offspring of treachery—
Transliteration: al-miy titeanagu al-miy tarechiyvu feh taariykhu lashvon halvo-atem yiledey-fesha zera shaker

Hebrew: הַנֵּֽחָמִים֙ בָּאֵלִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת כׇּל־עֵ֣ץ רַעֲנָ֑ן שֹׁחֲטֵ֤י הַיְלָדִים֙ בַּנְּחָלִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת סְעִפֵ֥י הַסְּלָעִֽים׃
Translated:
You who inflame yourselves
Among the terebinths,
Under every verdant tree;
Who slaughter children in the wadis,
Among the clefts of the rocks.
Transliteration: hanechamiym vaeliym tachat khׇl-ets raanan shochatey hayeladiym vanechaliym tachat seifey haselaiym

Hebrew: בְּחַלְּקֵי־נַ֣חַל חֶלְקֵ֔ךְ הֵ֥ם הֵ֖ם גּוֹרָלֵ֑ךְ גַּם־לָהֶ֞ם שָׁפַ֥כְתְּ נֶ֙סֶךְ֙ הֶעֱלִ֣ית מִנְחָ֔ה הַ֥עַל אֵ֖לֶּה אֶנָּחֵֽם׃
Translated:
With such are your share and portion,
They, they are your allotment;
To them you have poured out libations,
Presented offerings.
Should I relent in the face of this?
Transliteration: vechalekey-nachal chelekekhe hem hem gvoralekhe gam-lahem shafakhete nesekhe heeliyt minechah haal eleh enachem

Hebrew: עַ֤ל הַר־גָּבֹ֙הַּ֙ וְנִשָּׂ֔א שַׂ֖מְתְּ מִשְׁכָּבֵ֑ךְ גַּם־שָׁ֥ם עָלִ֖ית לִזְבֹּ֥חַ זָֽבַח׃
Translated:
On a high and lofty hill
You have set your couch;
There, too, you have gone up
To perform sacrifices.
Transliteration: al har-gavoha venisha shamete mishekhavekhe gam-sham aliyt lizevocha zavach

Hebrew: וְאַחַ֤ר הַדֶּ֙לֶת֙ וְהַמְּזוּזָ֔ה שַׂ֖מְתְּ זִכְרוֹנֵ֑ךְ כִּ֣י מֵאִתִּ֞י גִּלִּ֣ית וַֽתַּעֲלִ֗י הִרְחַ֤בְתְּ מִשְׁכָּבֵךְ֙ וַתִּכְרׇת־לָ֣ךְ מֵהֶ֔ם אָהַ֥בְתְּ מִשְׁכָּבָ֖ם יָ֥ד חָזִֽית׃
Translated:
Behind the door and doorpost
You have directed your thoughts;
Abandoning Me, you have gone up
On the couch you made so wide.
You have made a covenant with them;
You have loved bedding with them;
You have chosen lust.
Transliteration: veachar hadelet vehamezuzah shamete zikhervonekhe khiy meitiy giliyt vataaliy hirechavete mishekhavekhe vatikherׇt-lakhe mehem ahavete mishekhavam yad chaziyt

Hebrew: וַתָּשֻׁ֤רִי לַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ בַּשֶּׁ֔מֶן וַתַּרְבִּ֖י רִקֻּחָ֑יִךְ וַתְּשַׁלְּחִ֤י צִרַ֙יִךְ֙ עַד־מֵ֣רָחֹ֔ק וַתַּשְׁפִּ֖ילִי עַד־שְׁאֽוֹל׃
Translated:
You have approached the king with oil,
You have provided many perfumes.
And you have sent your envoys afar,
Even down to the netherworld.
Transliteration: vatashuriy lamelekhe vashemen vatareviy rikuchayiikhe vateshalechiy tsirayiikhe ad-merachok vatashefiyliy ad-shevol

Hebrew: בְּרֹ֤ב דַּרְכֵּךְ֙ יָגַ֔עַתְּ לֹ֥א אָמַ֖רְתְּ נוֹאָ֑שׁ חַיַּ֤ת יָדֵךְ֙ מָצָ֔את עַל־כֵּ֖ן לֹ֥א חָלִֽית׃
Translated:
Though wearied by much travel,
You never said, “I give up!”
You found gratification for your lust,
And so you never cared.
Transliteration: verov darekhekhe yagaate lo amarete nvoash chayat yadekhe matsat al-khen lo chaliyt

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מִ֞י דָּאַ֤גְתְּ וַתִּֽירְאִי֙ כִּ֣י תְכַזֵּ֔בִי וְאוֹתִי֙ לֹ֣א זָכַ֔רְתְּ לֹא־שַׂ֖מְתְּ עַל־לִבֵּ֑ךְ הֲלֹ֨א אֲנִ֤י מַחְשֶׁה֙ וּמֵ֣עֹלָ֔ם וְאוֹתִ֖י לֹ֥א תִירָֽאִי׃
Translated:
Whom do you dread and fear,
That you tell lies?
But you gave no thought to Me,
You paid no heed.
It is because I have stood idly by so long
That you have no fear of Me.
Transliteration: veet-miy daagete vatiyreiy khiy tekhazeviy vevotiy lo zakharete lo-shamete al-livekhe halo aniy machesheh umeolam vevotiy lo tiyraiy

Hebrew: אֲנִ֥י אַגִּ֖יד צִדְקָתֵ֑ךְ וְאֶֽת־מַעֲשַׂ֖יִךְ וְלֹ֥א יוֹעִילֽוּךְ׃
Translated:
I hereby pronounce judgment upon your deeds:
Your assorted [idols] shall not avail you,
Transliteration: aniy agiyd tsidekatekhe veet-maashayiikhe velo yvoiylukhe

Hebrew: בְּזַֽעֲקֵךְ֙ יַצִּילֻ֣ךְ קִבּוּצַ֔יִךְ וְאֶת־כֻּלָּ֥ם יִשָּׂא־ר֖וּחַ יִקַּח־הָ֑בֶל וְהַחוֹסֶ֥ה בִי֙ יִנְחַל־אֶ֔רֶץ וְיִירַ֖שׁ הַר־קׇדְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
Shall not save you when you cry out.
They shall all be borne off by the wind,
Snatched away by a breeze.
But those who trust in Me shall inherit the land
And possess My sacred mount.
Transliteration: vezaakekhe yatsiylukhe kivutsayiikhe veet-khulam yisha-rucha yikach-havel vehachvoseh viy yinechal-erets veyiyrash har-kׇdeshiy

Hebrew: וְאָמַ֥ר סֹֽלּוּ־סֹ֖לּוּ פַּנּוּ־דָ֑רֶךְ הָרִ֥ימוּ מִכְשׁ֖וֹל מִדֶּ֥רֶךְ עַמִּֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
[GOD] says:
Build up, build up a highway!
Clear a road!
Remove all obstacles
From the road of My people!
Transliteration: veamar solu-solu fanu-darekhe hariymu mikheshvol miderekhe amiy {s}

Hebrew: כִּי֩ כֹ֨ה אָמַ֜ר רָ֣ם וְנִשָּׂ֗א שֹׁכֵ֥ן עַד֙ וְקָד֣וֹשׁ שְׁמ֔וֹ מָר֥וֹם וְקָד֖וֹשׁ אֶשְׁכּ֑וֹן וְאֶת־דַּכָּא֙ וּשְׁפַל־ר֔וּחַ לְהַחֲיוֹת֙ ר֣וּחַ שְׁפָלִ֔ים וּֽלְהַחֲי֖וֹת לֵ֥ב נִדְכָּאִֽים׃
Translated:
For thus said the One who high aloft
Forever dwells, whose name is holy:
I dwell on high, in holiness;
Yet with the contrite and the lowly in spirit—
Reviving the spirits of the lowly,
Reviving the hearts of the contrite.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar ram venisha shokhen ad vekadvosh shemvo marvom vekadvosh eshekhvon veet-dakha ushefal-rucha lehachayvot rucha shefaliym ulehachayvot lev nidekhaiym

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֤א לְעוֹלָם֙ אָרִ֔יב וְלֹ֥א לָנֶ֖צַח אֶקְצ֑וֹף כִּי־ר֙וּחַ֙ מִלְּפָנַ֣י יַעֲט֔וֹף וּנְשָׁמ֖וֹת אֲנִ֥י עָשִֽׂיתִי׃
Translated:
For I will not always contend,
I will not be angry forever:
Nay, I who make spirits flag,
Also create the breath of life.
Transliteration: khiy lo levolam ariyv velo lanetsach eketsvof khiy-rucha milefanay yaatvof uneshamvot aniy ashiytiy

Hebrew: בַּעֲוֺ֥ן בִּצְע֛וֹ קָצַ֥פְתִּי וְאַכֵּ֖הוּ הַסְתֵּ֣ר וְאֶקְצֹ֑ף וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ שׁוֹבָ֖ב בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ לִבּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For their sinful greed I was angry;
I struck them and turned away in My wrath.
Though stubborn, they follow the way of their hearts,
Transliteration: vaavon vitsevo katsafetiy veakhehu haseter veeketsof vayelekhe shvovav vederekhe livvo

Hebrew: דְּרָכָ֥יו רָאִ֖יתִי וְאֶרְפָּאֵ֑הוּ וְאַנְחֵ֕הוּ וַאֲשַׁלֵּ֧ם נִחֻמִ֛ים ל֖וֹ וְלַאֲבֵלָֽיו׃
Translated:
I note how they fare and will heal them:
I will guide them and mete out solace to them,
And to the mourners among them
Transliteration: derakhayv raiytiy veerefaehu veanechehu vaashalem nichumiym lvo velaavelayv

Hebrew: בּוֹרֵ֖א (נוב) [נִ֣יב] שְׂפָתָ֑יִם שָׁל֨וֹם ׀ שָׁל֜וֹם לָרָח֧וֹק וְלַקָּר֛וֹב אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה וּרְפָאתִֽיו׃
Translated:
heartening, comforting words:
It shall be well,
Well with the far and the near
—said GOD—
And I will heal them.
Transliteration: vvore (nvv) [niyv] shefatayiim shalvom shalvom larachvok velakarvov amar yehovah urefatiyv

Hebrew: וְהָרְשָׁעִ֖ים כַּיָּ֣ם נִגְרָ֑שׁ כִּ֤י הַשְׁקֵט֙ לֹ֣א יוּכָ֔ל וַיִּגְרְשׁ֥וּ מֵימָ֖יו רֶ֥פֶשׁ וָטִֽיט׃
Translated:
But the wicked are like the troubled sea
That cannot rest,
Whose waters toss up mire and mud.
Transliteration: vehareshaiym khayam nigerash khiy hasheket lo yukhal vayigereshu meymayv refesh vatiyt

Hebrew: אֵ֣ין שָׁל֔וֹם אָמַ֥ר אֱלֹהַ֖י לָרְשָׁעִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
There is no safety
—said my God—
For the wicked.
Transliteration: eyn shalvom amar elohay lareshaiym {f}

Hebrew: קְרָ֤א בְגָרוֹן֙ אַל־תַּחְשֹׂ֔ךְ כַּשּׁוֹפָ֖ר הָרֵ֣ם קוֹלֶ֑ךָ וְהַגֵּ֤ד לְעַמִּי֙ פִּשְׁעָ֔ם וּלְבֵ֥ית יַעֲקֹ֖ב חַטֹּאתָֽם׃
Translated:
Cry with full throat, without restraint;
Raise your voice like a ram’s horn!
Declare to My people their transgression,
To the House of Jacob their sin.
Transliteration: kera vegarvon al-tacheshokhe khashvofar harem kvolekha vehaged leamiy fisheam uleveyt yaakov chatotam

Hebrew: וְאוֹתִ֗י י֥וֹם יוֹם֙ יִדְרֹשׁ֔וּן וְדַ֥עַת דְּרָכַ֖י יֶחְפָּצ֑וּן כְּג֞וֹי אֲשֶׁר־צְדָקָ֣ה עָשָׂ֗ה וּמִשְׁפַּ֤ט אֱלֹהָיו֙ לֹ֣א עָזָ֔ב יִשְׁאָל֙וּנִי֙ מִשְׁפְּטֵי־צֶ֔דֶק קִרְבַ֥ת אֱלֹהִ֖ים יֶחְפָּצֽוּן׃
Translated:
To be sure, they seek Me daily,
Eager to learn My ways.
Like a nation that does what is right,
That has not abandoned the laws of its God,
They ask Me for the right way,
They are eager for the nearness of God:
Transliteration: vevotiy yvom yvom yideroshun vedaat derakhay yechefatsun khegvoy asher-tsedakah ashah umishefat elohayv lo azav yishealuniy mishefetey-tsedek kirevat Elohim yechefatsun

Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה צַּ֙מְנוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א רָאִ֔יתָ עִנִּ֥ינוּ נַפְשֵׁ֖נוּ וְלֹ֣א תֵדָ֑ע הֵ֣ן בְּי֤וֹם צֹֽמְכֶם֙ תִּמְצְאוּ־חֵ֔פֶץ וְכׇל־עַצְּבֵיכֶ֖ם תִּנְגֹּֽשׂוּ׃
Translated:
“Why, when we fasted, did You not see?
When we starved our bodies, did You pay no heed?”
Because on your fast day
You see to your business
And oppress all your laborers!
Transliteration: lamah tsamenu velo raiyta iniynu nafeshenu velo teda hen veyvom tsomekhem timetseu-chefets vekhׇl-atseveykhem tinegoshu

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן לְרִ֤יב וּמַצָּה֙ תָּצ֔וּמוּ וּלְהַכּ֖וֹת בְּאֶגְרֹ֣ף רֶ֑שַׁע לֹא־תָצ֣וּמוּ כַיּ֔וֹם לְהַשְׁמִ֥יעַ בַּמָּר֖וֹם קוֹלְכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Because you fast in strife and contention,
And you strike with a wicked fist!
Your fasting today is not such
As to make your voice heard on high.
Transliteration: hen leriyv umatsah tatsumu ulehakhvot veegerof resha lo-tatsumu khayyvom lehashemiya vamarvom kvolekhem

Hebrew: הֲכָזֶ֗ה יִֽהְיֶה֙ צ֣וֹם אֶבְחָרֵ֔הוּ י֛וֹם עַנּ֥וֹת אָדָ֖ם נַפְשׁ֑וֹ הֲלָכֹ֨ף כְּאַגְמֹ֜ן רֹאשׁ֗וֹ וְשַׂ֤ק וָאֵ֙פֶר֙ יַצִּ֔יעַ הֲלָזֶה֙ תִּקְרָא־צ֔וֹם וְי֥וֹם רָצ֖וֹן לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Is such the fast I desire,
A day for people to starve their bodies?
Is it bowing the head like a bulrush
And lying in sackcloth and ashes?
Do you call that a fast,
A day when GOD is favorable?
Transliteration: hakhazeh yiheyeh tsvom evecharehu yvom anvot adam nafeshvo halakhof kheagemon roshvo veshak vaefer yatsiya halazeh tikera-tsvom veyvom ratsvon layhovah

Hebrew: הֲל֣וֹא זֶה֮ צ֣וֹם אֶבְחָרֵ֒הוּ֒ פַּתֵּ֙חַ֙ חַרְצֻבּ֣וֹת רֶ֔שַׁע הַתֵּ֖ר אֲגֻדּ֣וֹת מוֹטָ֑ה וְשַׁלַּ֤ח רְצוּצִים֙ חׇפְשִׁ֔ים וְכׇל־מוֹטָ֖ה תְּנַתֵּֽקוּ׃
Translated:
No, this is the fast I desire:
To unlock fetters of wickedness,
And untie the cords of the yoke
To let the oppressed go free;
To break off every yoke.
Transliteration: halvo zeh tsvom evecharehu fatecha charetsuvvot resha hater agudvot mvotah veshalach retsutsiym chׇfeshiym vekhׇl-mvotah tenateku

Hebrew: הֲל֨וֹא פָרֹ֤ס לָרָעֵב֙ לַחְמֶ֔ךָ וַעֲנִיִּ֥ים מְרוּדִ֖ים תָּ֣בִיא בָ֑יִת כִּֽי־תִרְאֶ֤ה עָרֹם֙ וְכִסִּית֔וֹ וּמִבְּשָׂרְךָ֖ לֹ֥א תִתְעַלָּֽם׃
Translated:
It is to share your bread with the hungry,
And to take the wretched poor into your home;
When you see the naked, to clothe them,
And not to ignore your own kin.
Transliteration: halvo faros laraev lachemekha vaaniyiym merudiym taviy vayiit khiy-tireeh arom vekhisiytvo umivesharekha lo titealam

Hebrew: אָ֣ז יִבָּקַ֤ע כַּשַּׁ֙חַר֙ אוֹרֶ֔ךָ וַאֲרֻֽכָתְךָ֖ מְהֵרָ֣ה תִצְמָ֑ח וְהָלַ֤ךְ לְפָנֶ֙יךָ֙ צִדְקֶ֔ךָ כְּב֥וֹד יְהֹוָ֖ה יַאַסְפֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Then shall your light burst through like the dawn
And your healing spring up quickly;
Your Vindicator shall march before you,
The Presence of GOD shall be your rear guard.
Transliteration: az yivaka khashachar vorekha vaarukhatekha meherah titsemach vehalakhe lefaneykha tsidekekha khevvod yehovah yaasefekha

Hebrew: אָ֤ז תִּקְרָא֙ וַיהֹוָ֣ה יַעֲנֶ֔ה תְּשַׁוַּ֖ע וְיֹאמַ֣ר הִנֵּ֑נִי אִם־תָּסִ֤יר מִתּֽוֹכְךָ֙ מוֹטָ֔ה שְׁלַ֥ח אֶצְבַּ֖ע וְדַבֶּר־אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
Then, when you call, GOD will answer;
When you cry, [God] will say: Here I am.
If you banish the yoke from your midst,
The menacing hand, and evil speech,
Transliteration: az tikera vayhovah yaaneh teshava veyomar hineniy im-tasiyr mitvokhekha mvotah shelach etseva vedaver-aven

Hebrew: וְתָפֵ֤ק לָֽרָעֵב֙ נַפְשֶׁ֔ךָ וְנֶ֥פֶשׁ נַעֲנָ֖ה תַּשְׂבִּ֑יעַ וְזָרַ֤ח בַּחֹ֙שֶׁךְ֙ אוֹרֶ֔ךָ וַאֲפֵלָתְךָ֖ כַּֽצׇּהֳרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
And you offer your compassion to the hungry
And satisfy the famished creature—
Then shall your light shine in darkness,
And your gloom shall be like noonday.
Transliteration: vetafek laraev nafeshekha venefesh naanah tasheviya vezarach vachoshekhe vorekha vaafelatekha khatsׇhorayiim

Hebrew: וְנָחֲךָ֣ יְהֹוָה֮ תָּמִיד֒ וְהִשְׂבִּ֤יעַ בְּצַחְצָחוֹת֙ נַפְשֶׁ֔ךָ וְעַצְמֹתֶ֖יךָ יַחֲלִ֑יץ וְהָיִ֙יתָ֙ כְּגַ֣ן רָוֶ֔ה וּכְמוֹצָ֣א מַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יְכַזְּב֖וּ מֵימָֽיו׃
Translated:
GOD will guide you always—
Slaking your thirst in parched places
And giving strength to your bones.
You shall be like a watered garden,
Like a spring whose waters do not fail.
Transliteration: venachakha yehovah tamiyd vehisheviya vetsachetsachvot nafeshekha veatsemoteykha yachaliyts vehayiyta khegan raveh ukhemvotsa mayiim asher lo-yekhazevu meymayv

Hebrew: וּבָנ֤וּ מִמְּךָ֙ חׇרְב֣וֹת עוֹלָ֔ם מוֹסְדֵ֥י דוֹר־וָד֖וֹר תְּקוֹמֵ֑ם וְקֹרָ֤א לְךָ֙ גֹּדֵ֣ר פֶּ֔רֶץ מְשֹׁבֵ֥ב נְתִיב֖וֹת לָשָֽׁבֶת׃
Translated:
Some from your midst shall rebuild ancient ruins,
You shall restore foundations laid long ago.
And you shall be called
“Repairer of fallen walls,
Restorer of lanes for habitation.”
Transliteration: uvanu mimekha chׇrevvot volam mvosedey dvor-vadvor tekvomem vekora lekha goder ferets meshovev netiyvvot lashavet

Hebrew: אִם־תָּשִׁ֤יב מִשַּׁבָּת֙ רַגְלֶ֔ךָ עֲשׂ֥וֹת חֲפָצֶ֖ךָ בְּי֣וֹם קׇדְשִׁ֑י וְקָרָ֨אתָ לַשַּׁבָּ֜ת עֹ֗נֶג לִקְד֤וֹשׁ יְהֹוָה֙ מְכֻבָּ֔ד וְכִבַּדְתּוֹ֙ מֵעֲשׂ֣וֹת דְּרָכֶ֔יךָ מִמְּצ֥וֹא חֶפְצְךָ֖ וְדַבֵּ֥ר דָּבָֽר׃
Translated:
If you refrain from trampling the sabbath,
From pursuing your affairs on My holy day;
If you call the sabbath “delight,”
GOD ’s holy day “honored”;
And if you honor it and go not your ways
Nor look to your affairs, nor strike bargains—
Transliteration: im-tashiyv mishavat ragelekha ashvot chafatsekha veyvom kׇdeshiy vekarata lashavat oneg likedvosh yehovah mekhuvad vekhivadetvo meashvot derakheykha mimetsvo chefetsekha vedaver davar

Hebrew: אָ֗ז תִּתְעַנַּג֙ עַל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהִרְכַּבְתִּ֖יךָ עַל־[בָּ֣מֳתֵי] (במותי) אָ֑רֶץ וְהַאֲכַלְתִּ֗יךָ נַחֲלַת֙ יַעֲקֹ֣ב אָבִ֔יךָ כִּ֛י פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבֵּֽר׃ {פ}
Translated:
Then you can seek GOD’s favor.
I will set you astride the heights of the earth,
And let you enjoy the heritage of your father Jacob—
For GOD’s mouth has spoken.
Transliteration: az titeanag al-yehovah vehirekhavetiykha al-[vamotey] (vmvty) arets vehaakhaletiykha nachalat yaakov aviykha khiy fiy yehovah diver {f}

Hebrew: הֵ֛ן לֹא־קָצְרָ֥ה יַד־יְהֹוָ֖ה מֵהוֹשִׁ֑יעַ וְלֹא־כָבְדָ֥ה אׇזְנ֖וֹ מִשְּׁמֽוֹעַ׃
Translated:
No, GOD’s arm is not too short to save,
Or ear too dull to hear;
Transliteration: hen lo-katserah yad-yehovah mehvoshiya velo-khavedah ׇzenvo mishemvoa

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אִם־עֲוֺנֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ הָי֣וּ מַבְדִּלִ֔ים בֵּינֵכֶ֕ם לְבֵ֖ין אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם וְחַטֹּאותֵיכֶ֗ם הִסְתִּ֧ירוּ פָנִ֛ים מִכֶּ֖ם מִשְּׁמֽוֹעַ׃
Translated:
But your iniquities have been a barrier
Between you and your God—
Your sins have made the divine face turn away
As [God] refuses to hear you.
Transliteration: khiy im-avonoteykhem hayu mavediliym veynekhem leveyn eloheykhem vechatovteykhem hisetiyru faniym mikhem mishemvoa

Hebrew: כִּ֤י כַפֵּיכֶם֙ נְגֹאֲל֣וּ בַדָּ֔ם וְאֶצְבְּעוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם בֶּעָוֺ֑ן שִׂפְתֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ דִּבְּרוּ־שֶׁ֔קֶר לְשׁוֹנְכֶ֖ם עַוְלָ֥ה תֶהְגֶּֽה׃
Translated:
For your hands are defiled with crime
And your fingers with iniquity.
Your lips speak falsehood,
Your tongue utters treachery.
Transliteration: khiy khafeykhem negoalu vadam veetsevevoteykhem veavon shifetvoteykhem diveru-sheker leshvonekhem avelah tehegeh

Hebrew: אֵין־קֹרֵ֣א בְצֶ֔דֶק וְאֵ֥ין נִשְׁפָּ֖ט בֶּאֱמוּנָ֑ה בָּט֤וֹחַ עַל־תֹּ֙הוּ֙ וְדַבֶּר־שָׁ֔וְא הָר֥וֹ עָמָ֖ל וְהוֹלֵ֥יד אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
No one sues justly
Or pleads honestly;
They rely on emptiness and speak falsehood,
Conceiving wrong and begetting evil.
Transliteration: eyn-kore vetsedek veeyn nishefat veemunah vatvocha al-tohu vedaver-shave harvo amal vehvoleyd aven

Hebrew: בֵּיצֵ֤י צִפְעוֹנִי֙ בִּקֵּ֔עוּ וְקוּרֵ֥י עַכָּבִ֖ישׁ יֶאֱרֹ֑גוּ הָאֹכֵ֤ל מִבֵּֽיצֵיהֶם֙ יָמ֔וּת וְהַזּוּרֶ֖ה תִּבָּקַ֥ע אֶפְעֶֽה׃
Translated:
They hatch adder’s eggs
And weave spider webs;
Whoever eats of those eggs will die,
And if one is crushed, it hatches out a viper.
Transliteration: veytsey tsifevoniy vikeu vekurey akhaviysh yeerogu haokhel miveytseyhem yamut vehazureh tivaka efeeh

Hebrew: קֽוּרֵיהֶם֙ לֹֽא־יִהְי֣וּ לְבֶ֔גֶד וְלֹ֥א יִתְכַּסּ֖וּ בְּמַעֲשֵׂיהֶ֑ם מַֽעֲשֵׂיהֶם֙ מַֽעֲשֵׂי־אָ֔וֶן וּפֹ֥עַל חָמָ֖ס בְּכַפֵּיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Their webs will not serve as a garment,
What they make cannot serve as clothing;
Their deeds are deeds of mischief,
Their hands commit lawless acts,
Transliteration: kureyhem lo-yiheyu leveged velo yitekhasu vemaasheyhem maasheyhem maashey-aven ufoal chamas vekhafeyhem

Hebrew: רַגְלֵיהֶם֙ לָרַ֣ע יָרֻ֔צוּ וִֽימַהֲר֔וּ לִשְׁפֹּ֖ךְ דָּ֣ם נָקִ֑י מַחְשְׁבֹֽתֵיהֶם֙ מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת אָ֔וֶן שֹׁ֥ד וָשֶׁ֖בֶר בִּמְסִלּוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
Their feet run after evil,
They hasten to shed the blood of the innocent.
Their plans are plans of mischief,
Destructiveness and injury are on their roads.
Transliteration: rageleyhem lara yarutsu viymaharu lishefokhe dam nakiy macheshevoteyhem macheshevvot aven shod vashever vimesilvotam

Hebrew: דֶּ֤רֶךְ שָׁלוֹם֙ לֹ֣א יָדָ֔עוּ וְאֵ֥ין מִשְׁפָּ֖ט בְּמַעְגְּלוֹתָ֑ם נְתִיבֽוֹתֵיהֶם֙ עִקְּשׁ֣וּ לָהֶ֔ם כֹּ֚ל דֹּרֵ֣ךְ בָּ֔הּ לֹ֥א יָדַ֖ע שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated:
They do not care for the way of integrity,
There is no justice on their paths.
They make their courses crooked,
No one who walks in them cares for integrity.
Transliteration: derekhe shalvom lo yadau veeyn mishefat vemaegelvotam netiyvvoteyhem ikeshu lahem khol dorekhe vah lo yada shalvom

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֗ן רָחַ֤ק מִשְׁפָּט֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וְלֹ֥א תַשִּׂיגֵ֖נוּ צְדָקָ֑ה נְקַוֶּ֤ה לָאוֹר֙ וְהִנֵּה־חֹ֔שֶׁךְ לִנְגֹה֖וֹת בָּאֲפֵל֥וֹת נְהַלֵּֽךְ׃
Translated:
“That is why redress is far from us,
And vindication does not reach us.
We hope for light, and lo! there is darkness;
For a gleam, and we must walk in gloom.
Transliteration: al-khen rachak mishefat mimenu velo tashiygenu tsedakah nekaveh lavor vehineh-choshekhe linegohvot vaafelvot nehalekhe

Hebrew: נְגַשְׁשָׁ֤ה כַֽעִוְרִים֙ קִ֔יר וּכְאֵ֥ין עֵינַ֖יִם נְגַשֵּׁ֑שָׁה כָּשַׁ֤לְנוּ בַֽצׇּהֳרַ֙יִם֙ כַּנֶּ֔שֶׁף בָּאַשְׁמַנִּ֖ים כַּמֵּתִֽים׃
Translated:
We grope, like the blind along a wall;
Like those without eyes we grope.
We stumble at noon, as if in darkness;
Among the sturdy, we are like the dead.
Transliteration: negasheshah khaiveriym kiyr ukheeyn eynayiim negasheshah khashalenu vatsׇhorayiim khaneshef vaashemaniym khametiym

Hebrew: נֶהֱמֶ֤ה כַדֻּבִּים֙ כֻּלָּ֔נוּ וְכַיּוֹנִ֖ים הָגֹ֣ה נֶהְגֶּ֑ה נְקַוֶּ֤ה לַמִּשְׁפָּט֙ וָאַ֔יִן לִישׁוּעָ֖ה רָחֲקָ֥ה מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
We all growl like bears
And moan like doves.
We hope for redress, and there is none;
For victory, and it is far from us.
Transliteration: nehemeh khaduviym khulanu vekhayyvoniym hagoh nehegeh nekaveh lamishefat vaayiin liyshuah rachakah mimenu

Hebrew: כִּֽי־רַבּ֤וּ פְשָׁעֵ֙ינוּ֙ נֶגְדֶּ֔ךָ וְחַטֹּאותֵ֖ינוּ עָ֣נְתָה בָּ֑נוּ כִּֽי־פְשָׁעֵ֣ינוּ אִתָּ֔נוּ וַעֲוֺנֹתֵ֖ינוּ יְדַעֲנֽוּם׃
Translated:
For our many sins are before You,
Our guilt testifies against us.
We are aware of our sins,
And we know well our iniquities:
Transliteration: khiy-ravu feshaeynu negedekha vechatovteynu anetah vanu khiy-feshaeynu itanu vaavonoteynu yedaanum

Hebrew: פָּשֹׁ֤עַ וְכַחֵשׁ֙ בַּֽיהֹוָ֔ה וְנָס֖וֹג מֵאַחַ֣ר אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ דַּבֶּר־עֹ֣שֶׁק וְסָרָ֔ה הֹר֧וֹ וְהֹג֛וֹ מִלֵּ֖ב דִּבְרֵי־שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
Rebellion, faithlessness to GOD,
And turning away from our God,
Planning fraud and treachery,
Conceiving lies and uttering them with the throat.
Transliteration: fashoa vekhachesh vayhovah venasvog meachar eloheynu daver-oshek vesarah horvo vehogvo milev diverey-shaker

Hebrew: וְהֻסַּ֤ג אָחוֹר֙ מִשְׁפָּ֔ט וּצְדָקָ֖ה מֵרָח֣וֹק תַּעֲמֹ֑ד כִּֽי־כָשְׁלָ֤ה בָֽרְחוֹב֙ אֱמֶ֔ת וּנְכֹחָ֖ה לֹא־תוּכַ֥ל לָבֽוֹא׃ {ס}
Translated:
And so redress is turned back
And vindication stays afar,
Because honesty stumbles in the public square
And uprightness cannot enter.
Transliteration: vehusag achvor mishefat utsedakah merachvok taamod khiy-khashelah varechvov emet unekhochah lo-tukhal lavvo {s}

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֤י הָאֱמֶת֙ נֶעְדֶּ֔רֶת וְסָ֥ר מֵרָ֖ע מִשְׁתּוֹלֵ֑ל וַיַּ֧רְא יְהֹוָ֛ה וַיֵּ֥רַע בְּעֵינָ֖יו כִּי־אֵ֥ין מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
Honesty has been lacking,
Whoever turns away from evil is despoiled.”
GOD saw and was displeased
That there was no redress.
Transliteration: vatehiy haemet neederet vesar mera mishetvolel vayare yehovah vayera veeynayv khiy-eyn mishefat

Hebrew: וַיַּרְא֙ כִּֽי־אֵ֣ין אִ֔ישׁ וַיִּשְׁתּוֹמֵ֖ם כִּ֣י אֵ֣ין מַפְגִּ֑יעַ וַתּ֤וֹשַֽׁע־לוֹ֙ זְרֹע֔וֹ וְצִדְקָת֖וֹ הִ֥יא סְמָכָֽתְהוּ׃
Translated:
[God] saw that there was nobody else,
Gazing long, but no one intervened.
Then God’s own arm did win triumph,
The victorious right hand gave support.
Transliteration: vayare khiy-eyn iysh vayishetvomem khiy eyn mafegiya vatvosha-lvo zerovo vetsidekatvo hiy semakhatehu

Hebrew: וַיִּלְבַּ֤שׁ צְדָקָה֙ כַּשִּׁרְיָ֔ן וְכ֥וֹבַע יְשׁוּעָ֖ה בְּרֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַיִּלְבַּ֞שׁ בִּגְדֵ֤י נָקָם֙ תִּלְבֹּ֔שֶׁת וַיַּ֥עַט כַּמְעִ֖יל קִנְאָֽה׃
Translated:
[God] donned victory like a coat of mail,
Wearing a helmet of triumph—
Dressing in garments of retribution,
Wrapped in zeal like a robe.
Transliteration: vayilevash tsedakah khashireyan vekhvova yeshuah veroshvo vayilevash vigedey nakam tilevoshet vayaat khameiyl kineah

Hebrew: כְּעַ֤ל גְּמֻלוֹת֙ כְּעַ֣ל יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם חֵמָ֣ה לְצָרָ֔יו גְּמ֖וּל לְאֹיְבָ֑יו לָאִיִּ֖ים גְּמ֥וּל יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
Translated:
According to their deserts,
So shall fury be repaid to God’s foes;
Requital shall be made to God’s enemies,
Requital to the distant lands.
Transliteration: kheal gemulvot kheal yeshalem chemah letsarayv gemul leoyevayv laiyiym gemul yeshalem

Hebrew: וְיִֽרְא֤וּ מִֽמַּעֲרָב֙ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה וּמִמִּזְרַח־שֶׁ֖מֶשׁ אֶת־כְּבוֹד֑וֹ כִּֽי־יָב֤וֹא כַנָּהָר֙ צָ֔ר ר֥וּחַ יְהֹוָ֖ה נֹ֥סְסָה בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
From the west, they shall revere GOD’s name,
And from the east, the divine Presence.
For [God] shall come like a hemmed-in stream
That the wind of the ETERNAL drives on;
Transliteration: veyireu mimaarav et-shem yehovah umimizerach-shemesh et-khevvodvo khiy-yavvo khanahar tsar rucha yehovah nosesah vvo

Hebrew: וּבָ֤א לְצִיּוֹן֙ גּוֹאֵ֔ל וּלְשָׁבֵ֥י פֶ֖שַׁע בְּיַֽעֲקֹ֑ב נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
[God] shall come as redeemer to Zion,
To those in Jacob who turn back from sin
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: uva letsiyyvon gvoel uleshavey fesha veyaakov neum yehovah

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י זֹ֣את בְּרִיתִ֤י אוֹתָם֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה רוּחִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלֶ֔יךָ וּדְבָרַ֖י אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֣מְתִּֽי בְּפִ֑יךָ לֹֽא־יָמ֡וּשׁוּ מִפִּ֩יךָ֩ וּמִפִּ֨י זַרְעֲךָ֜ וּמִפִּ֨י זֶ֤רַע זַרְעֲךָ֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה מֵעַתָּ֖ה וְעַד־עוֹלָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: And this shall be My covenant with them, said G<small>OD</small>: My spirit that is upon you, and the words that I have placed in your mouth, shall not be absent from your mouth, nor from the mouth of your children, nor from the mouth of your children’s children—said G<small>OD</small>—from now on, for all time.
Transliteration: vaaniy zot veriytiy votam amar yehovah ruchiy asher aleykha udevaray asher-shametiy vefiykha lo-yamushu mifiykha umifiy zareakha umifiy zera zareakha amar yehovah meatah vead-volam {s}

Hebrew: ק֥וּמִי א֖וֹרִי כִּ֣י בָ֣א אוֹרֵ֑ךְ וּכְב֥וֹד יְהֹוָ֖ה עָלַ֥יִךְ זָרָֽח׃
Translated:
Arise, shine, for your light has dawned;
The Presence of GOD has shone upon you!
Transliteration: kumiy voriy khiy va vorekhe ukhevvod yehovah alayiikhe zarach

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֤ה הַחֹ֙שֶׁךְ֙ יְכַסֶּה־אֶ֔רֶץ וַעֲרָפֶ֖ל לְאֻמִּ֑ים וְעָלַ֙יִךְ֙ יִזְרַ֣ח יְהֹוָ֔ה וּכְבוֹד֖וֹ עָלַ֥יִךְ יֵרָאֶֽה׃
Translated:
Behold! Darkness shall cover the earth,
And thick clouds the peoples;
But upon you GOD will shine,
And God’s Presence be seen over you.
Transliteration: khiy-hineh hachoshekhe yekhaseh-erets vaarafel leumiym vealayiikhe yizerach yehovah ukhevvodvo alayiikhe eiraeh

Hebrew: וְהָלְכ֥וּ גוֹיִ֖ם לְאוֹרֵ֑ךְ וּמְלָכִ֖ים לְנֹ֥גַהּ זַרְחֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
And nations shall walk by your light,
Kings, by your shining radiance.
Transliteration: vehalekhu gvoyim levorekhe umelakhiym lenogah zarechekhe

Hebrew: שְׂאִֽי־סָבִ֤יב עֵינַ֙יִךְ֙ וּרְאִ֔י כֻּלָּ֖ם נִקְבְּצ֣וּ בָֽאוּ־לָ֑ךְ בָּנַ֙יִךְ֙ מֵרָח֣וֹק יָבֹ֔אוּ וּבְנוֹתַ֖יִךְ עַל־צַ֥ד תֵּאָמַֽנָה׃
Translated:
Raise your eyes and look about:
They have all gathered and come to you.
Your sons shall be brought from afar,
Your daughters like babes on shoulders.
Transliteration: sheiy-saviyv eynayiikhe ureiy khulam nikevetsu vau-lakhe vanayiikhe merachvok yavou uvenvotayiikhe al-tsad teamanah

Hebrew: אָ֤ז תִּרְאִי֙ וְנָהַ֔רְתְּ וּפָחַ֥ד וְרָחַ֖ב לְבָבֵ֑ךְ כִּֽי־יֵהָפֵ֤ךְ עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ הֲמ֣וֹן יָ֔ם חֵ֥יל גּוֹיִ֖ם יָבֹ֥אוּ לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
As you behold, you will glow;
Your heart will throb and thrill—
For the wealth of the sea shall pass on to you,
The riches of nations shall flow to you.
Transliteration: az tireiy venaharete ufachad verachav levavekhe khiy-eihafekhe alayiikhe hamvon yam cheyl gvoyim yavou lakhe

Hebrew: שִֽׁפְעַ֨ת גְּמַלִּ֜ים תְּכַסֵּ֗ךְ בִּכְרֵ֤י מִדְיָן֙ וְעֵיפָ֔ה כֻּלָּ֖ם מִשְּׁבָ֣א יָבֹ֑אוּ זָהָ֤ב וּלְבוֹנָה֙ יִשָּׂ֔אוּ וּתְהִלֹּ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה יְבַשֵּֽׂרוּ׃
Translated:
Dust clouds of camels shall cover you,
Dromedaries of Midian and Ephah.
They all shall come from Sheba;
They shall bear gold and frankincense,
And shall herald GOD’s glories.
Transliteration: shifeat gemaliym tekhasekhe vikherey mideyan veeyfah khulam misheva yavou zahav ulevvonah yishau utehilot yehovah yevasheru

Hebrew: כׇּל־צֹ֤אן קֵדָר֙ יִקָּ֣בְצוּ לָ֔ךְ אֵילֵ֥י נְבָי֖וֹת יְשָֽׁרְת֑וּנֶךְ יַעֲל֤וּ עַל־רָצוֹן֙ מִזְבְּחִ֔י וּבֵ֥ית תִּפְאַרְתִּ֖י אֲפָאֵֽר׃
Translated:
All the flocks of Kedar shall be assembled for you,
The rams of Nebaioth shall serve your needs;
They shall be welcome offerings on My altar,
And I will add glory to My glorious House.
Transliteration: khׇl-tson kedar yikavetsu lakhe eyley nevayvot yesharetunekhe yaalu al-ratsvon mizevechiy uveyt tifearetiy afaer

Hebrew: מִי־אֵ֖לֶּה כָּעָ֣ב תְּעוּפֶ֑ינָה וְכַיּוֹנִ֖ים אֶל־אֲרֻבֹּתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Who are these that float like a cloud,
Like doves to their cotes?
Transliteration: miy-eleh khaav teufeynah vekhayyvoniym el-aruvoteyhem

Hebrew: כִּי־לִ֣י ׀ אִיִּ֣ים יְקַוּ֗וּ וׇאֳנִיּ֤וֹת תַּרְשִׁישׁ֙ בָּרִ֣אשֹׁנָ֔ה לְהָבִ֤יא בָנַ֙יִךְ֙ מֵרָח֔וֹק כַּסְפָּ֥ם וּזְהָבָ֖ם אִתָּ֑ם לְשֵׁם֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהַ֔יִךְ וְלִקְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כִּ֥י פֵאֲרָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Behold, the coastlands await me,
With ships of Tarshish in the lead,
To bring your children from afar,
And their silver and gold as well—
For the name of the ETERNAL your God,
For the Holy One of Israel, who has glorified you.
Transliteration: khiy-liy iyiym yekauu vׇoniyyvot tareshiysh varishonah lehaviy vanayiikhe merachvok khasefam uzehavam itam leshem yehovah elohayiikhe velikedvosh yisherael khiy fearakhe

Hebrew: וּבָנ֤וּ בְנֵֽי־נֵכָר֙ חֹמֹתַ֔יִךְ וּמַלְכֵיהֶ֖ם יְשָֽׁרְת֑וּנֶךְ כִּ֤י בְקִצְפִּי֙ הִכִּיתִ֔יךְ וּבִרְצוֹנִ֖י רִחַמְתִּֽיךְ׃
Translated:
Aliens shall rebuild your walls,
Their kings shall wait upon you—
For in anger I struck you down,
But in favor I take you back.
Transliteration: uvanu veney-nekhar chomotayiikhe umalekheyhem yesharetunekhe khiy vekitsefiy hikhiytiykhe uviretsvoniy richametiykhe

Hebrew: וּפִתְּח֨וּ שְׁעָרַ֧יִךְ תָּמִ֛יד יוֹמָ֥ם וָלַ֖יְלָה לֹ֣א יִסָּגֵ֑רוּ לְהָבִ֤יא אֵלַ֙יִךְ֙ חֵ֣יל גּוֹיִ֔ם וּמַלְכֵיהֶ֖ם נְהוּגִֽים׃
Translated:
Your gates shall always stay open—
Day and night they shall never be shut—
To let in the wealth of the nations,
With their kings in procession.
Transliteration: ufitechu shearayiikhe tamiyd yvomam valayelah lo yisageru lehaviy elayiikhe cheyl gvoyim umalekheyhem nehugiym

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הַגּ֧וֹי וְהַמַּמְלָכָ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יַעַבְד֖וּךְ יֹאבֵ֑דוּ וְהַגּוֹיִ֖ם חָרֹ֥ב יֶחֱרָֽבוּ׃
Translated:
For the nation or the kingdom
That does not serve you shall perish;
Such nations shall be destroyed.
Transliteration: khiy-hagvoy vehamamelakhah asher lo-yaavedukhe yovedu vehagvoyim charov yecheravu

Hebrew: כְּב֤וֹד הַלְּבָנוֹן֙ אֵלַ֣יִךְ יָב֔וֹא בְּר֛וֹשׁ תִּדְהָ֥ר וּתְאַשּׁ֖וּר יַחְדָּ֑ו לְפָאֵר֙ מְק֣וֹם מִקְדָּשִׁ֔י וּמְק֥וֹם רַגְלַ֖י אֲכַבֵּֽד׃
Translated:
The majesty of Lebanon shall come to you—
Cypress and pine and box—
To adorn the site of My Sanctuary,
To glorify the place where My feet rest.
Transliteration: khevvod halevanvon elayiikhe yavvo vervosh tidehar uteashur yachedav lefaer mekvom mikedashiy umekvom ragelay akhaved

Hebrew: וְהָלְכ֨וּ אֵלַ֤יִךְ שְׁח֙וֹחַ֙ בְּנֵ֣י מְעַנַּ֔יִךְ וְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֛וּ עַל־כַּפּ֥וֹת רַגְלַ֖יִךְ כׇּל־מְנַאֲצָ֑יִךְ וְקָ֤רְאוּ לָךְ֙ עִ֣יר יְהֹוָ֔ה צִיּ֖וֹן קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Bowing before you, shall come
The children of those who tormented you;
Prostrate at the soles of your feet
Shall be all those who reviled you;
And you shall be called
“City of GOD,
Zion of the Holy One of Israel.”
Transliteration: vehalekhu elayiikhe shechvocha veney meanayiikhe vehishetachavu al-khafvot ragelayiikhe khׇl-menaatsayiikhe vekareu lakhe iyr yehovah tsiyyvon kedvosh yisherael

Hebrew: תַּ֧חַת הֱיוֹתֵ֛ךְ עֲזוּבָ֥ה וּשְׂנוּאָ֖ה וְאֵ֣ין עוֹבֵ֑ר וְשַׂמְתִּיךְ֙ לִגְא֣וֹן עוֹלָ֔ם מְשׂ֖וֹשׂ דּ֥וֹר וָדֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Whereas you have been forsaken,
Rejected, with none passing through,
I will make you a pride everlasting,
A joy for age after age.
Transliteration: tachat heyvotekhe azuvah ushenuah veeyn vover veshametiykhe ligevon volam meshvosh dvor vadvor

Hebrew: וְיָנַקְתְּ֙ חֲלֵ֣ב גּוֹיִ֔ם וְשֹׁ֥ד מְלָכִ֖ים תִּינָ֑קִי וְיָדַ֗עַתְּ כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ מֽוֹשִׁיעֵ֔ךְ וְגֹאֲלֵ֖ךְ אֲבִ֥יר יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
You shall suck the milk of the nations,
Suckle at royal breasts.
And you shall know
That I GOD am your Savior,
I, The Mighty One of Jacob, am your Redeemer.
Transliteration: veyanakete chalev gvoyim veshod melakhiym tiynakiy veyadaate khiy aniy yehovah mvoshiyekhe vegoalekhe aviyr yaakov

Hebrew: תַּ֣חַת הַנְּחֹ֜שֶׁת אָבִ֣יא זָהָ֗ב וְתַ֤חַת הַבַּרְזֶל֙ אָ֣בִיא כֶ֔סֶף וְתַ֤חַת הָעֵצִים֙ נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וְתַ֥חַת הָאֲבָנִ֖ים בַּרְזֶ֑ל וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י פְקֻדָּתֵךְ֙ שָׁל֔וֹם וְנֹגְשַׂ֖יִךְ צְדָקָֽה׃
Translated:
Instead of copper I will bring gold,
Instead of iron I will bring silver;
Instead of wood, copper—
And instead of stone, iron.
And I will appoint Well-being as your government,
Prosperity as your officials.
Transliteration: tachat hanechoshet aviy zahav vetachat havarezel aviy khesef vetachat haetsiym nechoshet vetachat haavaniym varezel veshametiy fekudatekhe shalvom venogeshayiikhe tsedakah

Hebrew: לֹא־יִשָּׁמַ֨ע ע֤וֹד חָמָס֙ בְּאַרְצֵ֔ךְ שֹׁ֥ד וָשֶׁ֖בֶר בִּגְבוּלָ֑יִךְ וְקָרָ֤את יְשׁוּעָה֙ חוֹמֹתַ֔יִךְ וּשְׁעָרַ֖יִךְ תְּהִלָּֽה׃
Translated:
The cry “Violence!”
Shall no more be heard in your land,
Nor “Wrack and ruin!”
Within your borders.
And you shall name your walls “Victory”
And your gates “Renown.”
Transliteration: lo-yishama vod chamas vearetsekhe shod vashever vigevulayiikhe vekarat yeshuah chvomotayiikhe ushearayiikhe tehilah

Hebrew: לֹא־יִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֨ךְ ע֤וֹד הַשֶּׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ לְא֣וֹר יוֹמָ֔ם וּלְנֹ֕גַהּ הַיָּרֵ֖חַ לֹא־יָאִ֣יר לָ֑ךְ וְהָֽיָה־לָ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ לְא֣וֹר עוֹלָ֔ם וֵאלֹהַ֖יִךְ לְתִפְאַרְתֵּֽךְ׃
Translated:
No longer shall you need the sun
For light by day,
Nor the shining of the moon
For radiance [by night];
For GOD shall be your light everlasting,
Your God shall be your glory.
Transliteration: lo-yiheyeh-lakhe vod hashemesh levor yvomam ulenogah hayarecha lo-yaiyr lakhe vehayah-lakhe yehovah levor volam velohayiikhe letifearetekhe

Hebrew: לֹא־יָב֥וֹא עוֹד֙ שִׁמְשֵׁ֔ךְ וִירֵחֵ֖ךְ לֹ֣א יֵאָסֵ֑ף כִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה יִֽהְיֶה־לָּךְ֙ לְא֣וֹר עוֹלָ֔ם וְשָׁלְמ֖וּ יְמֵ֥י אֶבְלֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Your sun shall set no more,
Your moon no more withdraw;
For GOD shall be a light to you forever,
And your days of mourning shall be ended.
Transliteration: lo-yavvo vod shimeshekhe viyrechekhe lo eiasef khiy yehovah yiheyeh-lakhe levor volam veshalemu yemey evelekhe

Hebrew: וְעַמֵּךְ֙ כֻּלָּ֣ם צַדִּיקִ֔ים לְעוֹלָ֖ם יִ֣ירְשׁוּ אָ֑רֶץ נֵ֧צֶר (מטעו) [מַטָּעַ֛י] מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָדַ֖י לְהִתְפָּאֵֽר׃
Translated:
And your people, all of them righteous,
Shall possess the land for all time;
They are the shoot that I planted,
My handiwork in which I glory.
Transliteration: veamekhe khulam tsadiykiym levolam yiyreshu arets netser (mtv) [mataay] maasheh yaday lehitefaer

Hebrew: הַקָּטֹן֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָאֶ֔לֶף וְהַצָּעִ֖יר לְג֣וֹי עָצ֑וּם אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּעִתָּ֥הּ אֲחִישֶֽׁנָּה׃ {ס}
Translated:
The smallest shall become a clan;
The least, a mighty nation.
I GOD will speed it in due time.
Transliteration: hakaton yiheyeh laelef vehatsaiyr legvoy atsum aniy yehovah veitah achiyshenah {s}

Hebrew: ר֛וּחַ אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה עָלָ֑י יַ֡עַן מָשַׁח֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֹתִ֜י לְבַשֵּׂ֣ר עֲנָוִ֗ים שְׁלָחַ֙נִי֙ לַחֲבֹ֣שׁ לְנִשְׁבְּרֵי־לֵ֔ב לִקְרֹ֤א לִשְׁבוּיִם֙ דְּר֔וֹר וְלַאֲסוּרִ֖ים פְּקַח־קֽוֹחַ׃
Translated:
The spirit of my Sovereign GOD is upon me,
Because GOD has anointed me.
I have been sent as a herald of joy to the humble,
To bind up the wounded of heart,
To proclaim release to the captives,
Liberation to the imprisoned;
Transliteration: rucha adonay yehovih alay yaan mashach yehovah otiy levasher anaviym shelachaniy lachavosh lenisheverey-lev likero lishevuyim dervor velaasuriym fekach-kvocha

Hebrew: לִקְרֹ֤א שְׁנַת־רָצוֹן֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וְי֥וֹם נָקָ֖ם לֵאלֹהֵ֑ינוּ לְנַחֵ֖ם כׇּל־אֲבֵלִֽים׃
Translated:
To proclaim a year of GOD’s favor
And a day of vindication by our God;
To comfort all who mourn—
Transliteration: likero shenat-ratsvon layhovah veyvom nakam leloheynu lenachem khׇl-aveliym

Hebrew: לָשׂ֣וּם ׀ לַאֲבֵלֵ֣י צִיּ֗וֹן לָתֵת֩ לָהֶ֨ם פְּאֵ֜ר תַּ֣חַת אֵ֗פֶר שֶׁ֤מֶן שָׂשׂוֹן֙ תַּ֣חַת אֵ֔בֶל מַעֲטֵ֣ה תְהִלָּ֔ה תַּ֖חַת ר֣וּחַ כֵּהָ֑ה וְקֹרָ֤א לָהֶם֙ אֵילֵ֣י הַצֶּ֔דֶק מַטַּ֥ע יְהֹוָ֖ה לְהִתְפָּאֵֽר׃
Translated:
To provide for the mourners in Zion—
To give them a turban instead of ashes,
The festive ointment instead of mourning,
A garment of splendor instead of a drooping spirit.
They shall be called terebinths of victory,
Planted by GOD for glory’s sake.
Transliteration: lashum laaveley tsiyyvon latet lahem feer tachat efer shemen shashvon tachat evel maateh tehilah tachat rucha khehah vekora lahem eyley hatsedek mata yehovah lehitefaer

Hebrew: וּבָנוּ֙ חׇרְב֣וֹת עוֹלָ֔ם שֹׁמְמ֥וֹת רִאשֹׁנִ֖ים יְקוֹמֵ֑מוּ וְחִדְּשׁוּ֙ עָ֣רֵי חֹ֔רֶב שֹׁמְמ֖וֹת דּ֥וֹר וָדֽוֹר׃
Translated:
And they shall build the ancient ruins,
Raise up the desolations of old,
And renew the ruined cities,
The desolations of many ages.
Transliteration: uvanu chׇrevvot volam shomemvot rishoniym yekvomemu vechideshu arey chorev shomemvot dvor vadvor

Hebrew: וְעָמְד֣וּ זָרִ֔ים וְרָע֖וּ צֹאנְכֶ֑ם וּבְנֵ֣י נֵכָ֔ר אִכָּרֵיכֶ֖ם וְכֹרְמֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Strangers shall stand and pasture your flocks,
Aliens shall be your plowers and vine-trimmers;
Transliteration: veamedu zariym verau tsonekhem uveney nekhar ikhareykhem vekhoremeykhem

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֗ם כֹּהֲנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ תִּקָּרֵ֔אוּ מְשָׁרְתֵ֣י אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ יֵאָמֵ֖ר לָכֶ֑ם חֵ֤יל גּוֹיִם֙ תֹּאכֵ֔לוּ וּבִכְבוֹדָ֖ם תִּתְיַמָּֽרוּ׃
Translated:
While you shall be called “Priests of GOD,”
And termed “Servants of our God.”
You shall enjoy the wealth of nations
And revel in their riches.
Transliteration: veatem khohaney yehovah tikareu mesharetey eloheynu eiamer lakhem cheyl gvoyim tokhelu uvikhevvodam titeyamaru

Hebrew: תַּ֤חַת בׇּשְׁתְּכֶם֙ מִשְׁנֶ֔ה וּכְלִמָּ֖ה יָרֹ֣נּוּ חֶלְקָ֑ם לָכֵ֤ן בְּאַרְצָם֙ מִשְׁנֶ֣ה יִירָ֔שׁוּ שִׂמְחַ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם תִּהְיֶ֥ה לָהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Because your shame was double—
Men cried, “Disgrace is their portion”—
Assuredly,
They shall have a double share in their land;
Joy shall be theirs for all time.
Transliteration: tachat vׇshetekhem misheneh ukhelimah yaronu chelekam lakhen vearetsam misheneh yiyrashu shimechat volam tiheyeh lahem

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אֹהֵ֣ב מִשְׁפָּ֔ט שֹׂנֵ֥א גָזֵ֖ל בְּעוֹלָ֑ה וְנָתַתִּ֤י פְעֻלָּתָם֙ בֶּאֱמֶ֔ת וּבְרִ֥ית עוֹלָ֖ם אֶכְר֥וֹת לָהֶֽם׃
Translated:
For I GOD love justice,
I hate robbery with a burnt offering.
I will pay them their wages faithfully,
And make a covenant with them for all time.
Transliteration: khiy aniy yehovah ohev mishefat shone gazel vevolah venatatiy feulatam veemet uveriyt volam ekhervot lahem

Hebrew: וְנוֹדַ֤ע בַּגּוֹיִם֙ זַרְעָ֔ם וְצֶאֱצָאֵיהֶ֖ם בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעַמִּ֑ים כׇּל־רֹֽאֵיהֶם֙ יַכִּיר֔וּם כִּ֛י הֵ֥ם זֶ֖רַע בֵּרַ֥ךְ יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Their offspring shall be known among the nations,
Their descendants in the midst of the peoples.
All who see them shall recognize
That they are a stock GOD has blessed.
Transliteration: venvoda vagvoyim zaream vetseetsaeyhem vetvokhe haamiym khׇl-roeyhem yakhiyrum khiy hem zera verakhe yehovah {f}

Hebrew: שׂ֧וֹשׂ אָשִׂ֣ישׂ בַּֽיהֹוָ֗ה תָּגֵ֤ל נַפְשִׁי֙ בֵּֽאלֹהַ֔י כִּ֤י הִלְבִּישַׁ֙נִי֙ בִּגְדֵי־יֶ֔שַׁע מְעִ֥יל צְדָקָ֖ה יְעָטָ֑נִי כֶּֽחָתָן֙ יְכַהֵ֣ן פְּאֵ֔ר וְכַכַּלָּ֖ה תַּעְדֶּ֥ה כֵלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
I greatly rejoice in GOD,
My whole being exults in my God—
Who has clothed me with garments of triumph,
Wrapped me in a robe of victory,
Like a bridegroom adorned with a turban,
Like a bride bedecked with her finery.
Transliteration: shvosh ashiysh vayhovah tagel nafeshiy velohay khiy hileviyshaniy vigedey-yesha meiyl tsedakah yeataniy khechatan yekhahen feer vekhakhalah taedeh kheleyha

Hebrew: כִּ֤י כָאָ֙רֶץ֙ תּוֹצִ֣יא צִמְחָ֔הּ וּכְגַנָּ֖ה זֵרוּעֶ֣יהָ תַצְמִ֑יחַ כֵּ֣ן ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה יַצְמִ֤יחַ צְדָקָה֙ וּתְהִלָּ֔ה נֶ֖גֶד כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
For as the earth brings forth her growth
And a garden makes the seed shoot up,
So my Sovereign GOD will make
Victory and renown shoot up
In the presence of all the nations.
Transliteration: khiy khaarets tvotsiy tsimechah ukheganah zerueyha tatsemiycha khen adonay yehovih yatsemiycha tsedakah utehilah neged khׇl-hagvoyim

Hebrew: לְמַ֤עַן צִיּוֹן֙ לֹ֣א אֶחֱשֶׁ֔ה וּלְמַ֥עַן יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם לֹ֣א אֶשְׁק֑וֹט עַד־יֵצֵ֤א כַנֹּ֙גַהּ֙ צִדְקָ֔הּ וִישׁוּעָתָ֖הּ כְּלַפִּ֥יד יִבְעָֽר׃
Translated:
For the sake of Zion I will not be silent,
For the sake of Jerusalem I will not be still,
Till her victory emerge resplendent
And her triumph like a flaming torch.
Transliteration: lemaan tsiyyvon lo echesheh ulemaan yerushala͏im lo eshekvot ad-eitse khanogah tsidekah viyshuatah khelafiyd yivear

Hebrew: וְרָא֤וּ גוֹיִם֙ צִדְקֵ֔ךְ וְכׇל־מְלָכִ֖ים כְּבוֹדֵ֑ךְ וְקֹ֤רָא לָךְ֙ שֵׁ֣ם חָדָ֔שׁ אֲשֶׁ֛ר פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה יִקֳּבֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Nations shall see your victory,
And every king your majesty;
And you shall be called by a new name
That GOD shall bestow.
Transliteration: verau gvoyim tsidekekhe vekhׇl-melakhiym khevvodekhe vekora lakhe shem chadash asher fiy yehovah yikovenu

Hebrew: וְהָיִ֛ית עֲטֶ֥רֶת תִּפְאֶ֖רֶת בְּיַד־יְהֹוָ֑ה (וצנוף) [וּצְנִ֥יף] מְלוּכָ֖ה בְּכַף־אֱלֹהָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
You shall be a glorious crown
In the hand of GOD,
And a royal diadem
In the palm of your God.
Transliteration: vehayiyt ateret tifeeret veyad-yehovah (vtsnvf) [utseniyf] melukhah vekhaf-elohayiikhe

Hebrew: לֹא־יֵאָמֵר֩ לָ֨ךְ ע֜וֹד עֲזוּבָ֗ה וּלְאַרְצֵךְ֙ לֹא־יֵאָמֵ֥ר עוֹד֙ שְׁמָמָ֔ה כִּ֣י לָ֗ךְ יִקָּרֵא֙ חֶפְצִי־בָ֔הּ וּלְאַרְצֵ֖ךְ בְּעוּלָ֑ה כִּֽי־חָפֵ֤ץ יְהֹוָה֙ בָּ֔ךְ וְאַרְצֵ֖ךְ תִּבָּעֵֽל׃
Translated:
Nevermore shall you be called “Forsaken,”
Nor shall your land be called “Desolate”;
But you shall be called “I delight in her,”
And your land “Espoused.”
For GOD takes delight in you,
And your land shall be espoused.
Transliteration: lo-eiamer lakhe vod azuvah ulearetsekhe lo-eiamer vod shemamah khiy lakhe yikare chefetsiy-vah ulearetsekhe veulah khiy-chafets yehovah vakhe vearetsekhe tivael

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִבְעַ֤ל בָּחוּר֙ בְּתוּלָ֔ה יִבְעָל֖וּךְ בָּנָ֑יִךְ וּמְשׂ֤וֹשׂ חָתָן֙ עַל־כַּלָּ֔ה יָשִׂ֥ישׂ עָלַ֖יִךְ אֱלֹהָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
As a youth espouses a maiden,
Your sons shall espouse you;
And as a bridegroom rejoices over his bride,
So will your God rejoice over you.
Transliteration: khiy-yiveal vachur vetulah yivealukhe vanayiikhe umeshvosh chatan al-khalah yashiysh alayiikhe elohayiikhe

Hebrew: עַל־חוֹמֹתַ֣יִךְ יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם הִפְקַ֙דְתִּי֙ שֹֽׁמְרִ֔ים כׇּל־הַיּ֧וֹם וְכׇל־הַלַּ֛יְלָה תָּמִ֖יד לֹ֣א יֶחֱשׁ֑וּ הַמַּזְכִּרִים֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה אַל־דֳּמִ֖י לָכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Upon your walls, O Jerusalem,
I have set sentries,
Who shall never be silent
By day or by night.
O you, the ETERNAL One’s remembrancers,
Take no rest
Transliteration: al-chvomotayiikhe yerushala͏im hifekadetiy shomeriym khׇl-hayyvom vekhׇl-halayelah tamiyd lo yecheshu hamazekhiriym et-yehovah al-domiy lakhem

Hebrew: וְאַֽל־תִּתְּנ֥וּ דֳמִ֖י ל֑וֹ עַד־יְכוֹנֵ֞ן וְעַד־יָשִׂ֧ים אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם תְּהִלָּ֖ה בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
And give no rest to [God],
Until Jerusalem is established
And she is made renowned on earth.
Transliteration: veal-titenu domiy lvo ad-yekhvonen vead-yashiym et-yerushala͏im tehilah vaarets

Hebrew: נִשְׁבַּ֧ע יְהֹוָ֛ה בִּימִינ֖וֹ וּבִזְר֣וֹעַ עֻזּ֑וֹ אִם־אֶתֵּן֩ אֶת־דְּגָנֵ֨ךְ ע֤וֹד מַֽאֲכָל֙ לְאֹ֣יְבַ֔יִךְ וְאִם־יִשְׁתּ֤וּ בְנֵֽי־נֵכָר֙ תִּֽירוֹשֵׁ֔ךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָגַ֖עַתְּ בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
GOD has sworn with the divine right hand,
With a mighty arm:
Nevermore will I give your new grain
To your enemies for food,
Nor shall foreigners drink the new wine
For which you have labored.
Transliteration: nisheva yehovah viymiynvo uvizervoa uzvo im-eten et-deganekhe vod maakhal leoyevayiikhe veim-yishetu veney-nekhar tiyrvoshekhe asher yagaate vvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מְאַסְפָיו֙ יֹאכְלֻ֔הוּ וְהִֽלְל֖וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמְקַבְּצָ֥יו יִשְׁתֻּ֖הוּ בְּחַצְר֥וֹת קׇדְשִֽׁי׃ {ס}
Translated:
But those who harvest it shall eat it
And give praise to GOD;
And those who gather it shall drink it
In My sacred courts.
Transliteration: khiy measefayv yokheluhu vehilelu et-yehovah umekavetsayv yishetuhu vechatservot kׇdeshiy {s}

Hebrew: עִבְר֤וּ עִבְרוּ֙ בַּשְּׁעָרִ֔ים פַּנּ֖וּ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הָעָ֑ם סֹ֣לּוּ סֹ֤לּוּ הַֽמְסִלָּה֙ סַקְּל֣וּ מֵאֶ֔בֶן הָרִ֥ימוּ נֵ֖ס עַל־הָעַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
Pass through, pass through the gates!
Clear the road for the people;
Build up, build up the highway,
Remove the rocks!
Raise an ensign over the peoples!
Transliteration: iveru iveru vasheariym fanu derekhe haam solu solu hamesilah sakelu meeven hariymu nes al-haamiym

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֗ה הִשְׁמִ֙יעַ֙ אֶל־קְצֵ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ אִמְרוּ֙ לְבַת־צִיּ֔וֹן הִנֵּ֥ה יִשְׁעֵ֖ךְ בָּ֑א הִנֵּ֤ה שְׂכָרוֹ֙ אִתּ֔וֹ וּפְעֻלָּת֖וֹ לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated:
See, GOD has proclaimed
To the end of the earth:
Announce to Fair Zion,
Your Deliverer is coming!
See, [God] has brought along the reward,
The recompense is in view.
