Transliteration: hineh yehovah hishemiya el-ketseh haarets imeru levat-tsiyyvon hineh yisheekhe va hineh shekharvo itvo ufeulatvo lefanayv

Hebrew: וְקָרְא֥וּ לָהֶ֛ם עַם־הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ גְּאוּלֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלָךְ֙ יִקָּרֵ֣א דְרוּשָׁ֔ה עִ֖יר לֹ֥א נֶעֱזָֽבָה׃ {ס}
Translated:
And they shall be called, “The Holy People,
GOD’s Redeemed,”
And you shall be called, “Sought Out,
A City Not Forsaken.”
Transliteration: vekareu lahem am-hakodesh geuley yehovah velakhe yikare derushah iyr lo neezavah {s}

Hebrew: מִי־זֶ֣ה ׀ בָּ֣א מֵאֱד֗וֹם חֲמ֤וּץ בְּגָדִים֙ מִבׇּצְרָ֔ה זֶ֚ה הָד֣וּר בִּלְבוּשׁ֔וֹ צֹעֶ֖ה בְּרֹ֣ב כֹּח֑וֹ אֲנִ֛י מְדַבֵּ֥ר בִּצְדָקָ֖ה רַ֥ב לְהוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated:
Who is this coming from Edom,
In crimsoned garments from Bozrah—
Who is this, majestic in attire,
Pressing forward with great might?
“It is I, who contend victoriously,
Powerful to give triumph.”
Transliteration: miy-zeh va meedvom chamuts vegadiym mivׇtserah zeh hadur vilevushvo tsoeh verov khochvo aniy medaver vitsedakah rav lehvoshiya

Hebrew: מַדּ֥וּעַ אָדֹ֖ם לִלְבוּשֶׁ֑ךָ וּבְגָדֶ֖יךָ כְּדֹרֵ֥ךְ בְּגַֽת׃
Translated:
Why is Your clothing so red,
Your garments like those of someone who treads grapes?
Transliteration: madua adom lilevushekha uvegadeykha khedorekhe vegat

Hebrew: פּוּרָ֣ה ׀ דָּרַ֣כְתִּי לְבַדִּ֗י וּמֵֽעַמִּים֙ אֵֽין־אִ֣ישׁ אִתִּ֔י וְאֶדְרְכֵ֣ם בְּאַפִּ֔י וְאֶרְמְסֵ֖ם בַּחֲמָתִ֑י וְיֵ֤ז נִצְחָם֙ עַל־בְּגָדַ֔י וְכׇל־מַלְבּוּשַׁ֖י אֶגְאָֽלְתִּי׃
Translated:
“I trod out a vintage alone;
Of the peoples nobody was with Me.
I trod them down in My anger,
Trampled them in My rage;
Their life-blood bespattered My garments,
And all My clothing was stained.
Transliteration: furah darakhetiy levadiy umeamiym eyn-iysh itiy veederekhem veafiy veeremesem vachamatiy veeiz nitsecham al-vegaday vekhׇl-malevushay egealetiy

Hebrew: כִּ֛י י֥וֹם נָקָ֖ם בְּלִבִּ֑י וּשְׁנַ֥ת גְּאוּלַ֖י בָּֽאָה׃
Translated:
For I had planned a day of vengeance,
And My year of redemption arrived.
Transliteration: khiy yvom nakam veliviy ushenat geulay vaah

Hebrew: וְאַבִּיט֙ וְאֵ֣ין עֹזֵ֔ר וְאֶשְׁתּוֹמֵ֖ם וְאֵ֣ין סוֹמֵ֑ךְ וַתּ֤וֹשַֽׁע־לִי֙ זְרֹעִ֔י וַחֲמָתִ֖י הִ֥יא סְמָכָֽתְנִי׃
Translated:
Then I looked, but there was none to help;
I stared, but there was none to aid—
So My own arm wrought the triumph,
And My own rage was My aid.
Transliteration: veaviyt veeyn ozer veeshetvomem veeyn svomekhe vatvosha-liy zeroiy vachamatiy hiy semakhateniy

Hebrew: וְאָב֤וּס עַמִּים֙ בְּאַפִּ֔י וַאֲשַׁכְּרֵ֖ם בַּחֲמָתִ֑י וְאוֹרִ֥יד לָאָ֖רֶץ נִצְחָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
I trampled peoples in My anger,
I made them drunk with My rage,
And I hurled their glory to the ground.”
Transliteration: veavus amiym veafiy vaashakherem vachamatiy vevoriyd laarets nitsecham {s}

Hebrew: חַֽסְדֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֤ה <small>׀</small> אַזְכִּיר֙ תְּהִלֹּ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה כְּעַ֕ל כֹּ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־גְּמָלָ֖נוּ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְרַב־טוּב֙ לְבֵ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־גְּמָלָ֥ם כְּֽרַחֲמָ֖יו וּכְרֹ֥ב חֲסָדָֽיו׃
Translated:
I will recount GOD’s kind acts,
GOD’s praises—
For all that GOD has wrought for us,
The vast bounty to the House of Israel
That was bestowed upon them
According to God’s mercy and great kindness.
Transliteration: chasedey yehovah <small></small> azekhiyr tehilot yehovah kheal khol asher-gemalanu yehovah verav-tuv leveyt yisherael asher-gemalam kherachamayv ukherov chasadayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַךְ־עַמִּ֣י הֵ֔מָּה בָּנִ֖ים לֹ֣א יְשַׁקֵּ֑רוּ וַיְהִ֥י לָהֶ֖ם לְמוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated:
[God] thought: Surely they are My people,
Children who will not play false.
So [God] was their Deliverer.
Transliteration: vayomer akhe-amiy hemah vaniym lo yeshakeru vayehiy lahem lemvoshiya

Hebrew: בְּֽכׇל־צָרָתָ֣ם ׀ (לא) [ל֣וֹ] צָ֗ר וּמַלְאַ֤ךְ פָּנָיו֙ הוֹשִׁיעָ֔ם בְּאַהֲבָת֥וֹ וּבְחֶמְלָת֖וֹ ה֣וּא גְאָלָ֑ם וַֽיְנַטְּלֵ֥ם וַֽיְנַשְּׂאֵ֖ם כׇּל־יְמֵ֥י עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
In all their troubles [God] was troubled,
And the angel of the divine Presence delivered them.
In love and pity
It was [God] who redeemed them,
Raised them, and exalted them
All the days of old.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-tsaratam (l) [lvo] tsar umaleakhe fanayv hvoshiyam veahavatvo uvechemelatvo hu gealam vayenatelem vayenasheem khׇl-yemey volam

Hebrew: וְהֵ֛מָּה מָר֥וּ וְעִצְּב֖וּ אֶת־ר֣וּחַ קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ וַיֵּהָפֵ֥ךְ לָהֶ֛ם לְאוֹיֵ֖ב ה֥וּא נִלְחַם־בָּֽם׃
Translated:
But they rebelled, and grieved
God’s holy spirit;
Then it was [God] who became their enemy,
And made war against them.
Transliteration: vehemah maru veitsevu et-rucha kׇdeshvo vayehafekhe lahem levoeiv hu nilecham-vam

Hebrew: וַיִּזְכֹּ֥ר יְמֵֽי־עוֹלָ֖ם מֹשֶׁ֣ה עַמּ֑וֹ אַיֵּ֣ה ׀ הַֽמַּעֲלֵ֣ם מִיָּ֗ם אֵ֚ת רֹעֵ֣י צֹאנ֔וֹ אַיֵּ֛ה הַשָּׂ֥ם בְּקִרְבּ֖וֹ אֶת־ר֥וּחַ קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
Then they remembered the ancient days,
The One who pulled a precious people out [of the water]:
“Where is the One who brought them up from the Sea
Along with the shepherd of this flock?
Where is the One whose holy spirit
Was placed in their midst,
Transliteration: vayizekhor yemey-volam mosheh amvo ayeh hamaalem miyam et roey tsonvo ayeh hasham vekirevvo et-rucha kׇdeshvo

Hebrew: מוֹלִיךְ֙ לִימִ֣ין מֹשֶׁ֔ה זְר֖וֹעַ תִּפְאַרְתּ֑וֹ בּ֤וֹקֵֽעַ מַ֙יִם֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת ל֖וֹ שֵׁ֥ם עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
Whose glorious arm was made
To march at the right hand of Moses,
Who divided the waters before them
To make a reputation for all time,
Transliteration: mvoliykhe liymiyn mosheh zervoa tifearetvo vvokea mayiim mifeneyhem laashvot lvo shem volam

Hebrew: מוֹלִיכָ֖ם בַּתְּהֹמ֑וֹת כַּסּ֥וּס בַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר לֹ֥א יִכָּשֵֽׁלוּ׃
Translated:
Who led them through the deeps
So that they did not stumble—
As a horse in a desert,
Transliteration: mvoliykham vatehomvot khasus vamidevar lo yikhashelu

Hebrew: כַּבְּהֵמָה֙ בַּבִּקְעָ֣ה תֵרֵ֔ד ר֥וּחַ יְהֹוָ֖ה תְּנִיחֶ֑נּוּ כֵּ֚ן נִהַ֣גְתָּ עַמְּךָ֔ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לְךָ֖ שֵׁ֥ם תִּפְאָֽרֶת׃
Translated:
Like a beast descending to the plain?”
’Twas the spirit of GOD gave them rest;
Thus did You shepherd Your people
To win for Yourself a glorious name.
Transliteration: khavehemah vavikeah tered rucha yehovah teniychenu khen nihageta amekha laashvot lekha shem tifearet

Hebrew: הַבֵּ֤ט מִשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ וּרְאֵ֔ה מִזְּבֻ֥ל קׇדְשְׁךָ֖ וְתִפְאַרְתֶּ֑ךָ אַיֵּ֤ה קִנְאָֽתְךָ֙ וּגְב֣וּרֹתֶ֔ךָ הֲמ֥וֹן מֵעֶ֛יךָ וְֽרַחֲמֶ֖יךָ אֵלַ֥י הִתְאַפָּֽקוּ׃
Translated:
Look down from heaven and see,
From Your holy and glorious height!
Where is Your zeal, Your power?
Your yearning and Your love
Are being withheld from us!
Transliteration: havet mishamayiim ureeh mizevul kׇdeshekha vetifearetekha ayeh kineatekha ugevurotekha hamvon meeykha verachameykha elay hiteafaku

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה אָבִ֔ינוּ כִּ֤י אַבְרָהָם֙ לֹ֣א יְדָעָ֔נוּ וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹ֣א יַכִּירָ֑נוּ אַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אָבִ֔ינוּ גֹּאֲלֵ֥נוּ מֵעוֹלָ֖ם שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Surely You are our Father:
Though Abraham regard us not,
And Israel recognize us not,
You, O ETERNAL One, are our Father;
From of old, Your name is “Our Redeemer.”
Transliteration: khiy-atah aviynu khiy averaham lo yedaanu veyisherael lo yakhiyranu atah yehovah aviynu goalenu mevolam shemekha

Hebrew: לָ֣מָּה תַתְעֵ֤נוּ יְהֹוָה֙ מִדְּרָכֶ֔יךָ תַּקְשִׁ֥יחַ לִבֵּ֖נוּ מִיִּרְאָתֶ֑ךָ שׁ֚וּב לְמַ֣עַן עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ שִׁבְטֵ֖י נַחֲלָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Why, ETERNAL One, do You make us stray from Your ways,
And turn our hearts away from revering You?
Relent for the sake of Your servants,
The tribes that are Your very own!
Transliteration: lamah tateenu yehovah miderakheykha takeshiycha livenu miyireatekha shuv lemaan avadeykha shivetey nachalatekha

Hebrew: לַמִּצְעָ֕ר יָרְשׁ֖וּ עַם־קׇדְשֶׁ֑ךָ צָרֵ֕ינוּ בּוֹסְס֖וּ מִקְדָּשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated:
Our foes have trampled Your Sanctuary,
Which Your holy people possessed but a little while.
Transliteration: lamitsear yareshu am-kׇdeshekha tsareynu vvosesu mikedashekha

Hebrew: הָיִ֗ינוּ מֵֽעוֹלָם֙ לֹא־מָשַׁ֣לְתָּ בָּ֔ם לֹֽא־נִקְרָ֥א שִׁמְךָ֖ עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם לֽוּא־קָרַ֤עְתָּ שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ יָרַ֔דְתָּ מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ הָרִ֥ים נָזֹֽלּוּ׃
Translated:
We have become as a people You never ruled,
To which Your name was never attached.
If You would but tear open the heavens and come down,
So that mountains would quake before You—
Transliteration: hayiynu mevolam lo-mashaleta vam lo-nikera shimekha aleyhem lu-karaeta shamayiim yaradeta mifaneykha hariym nazolu

Hebrew: כִּקְדֹ֧חַ אֵ֣שׁ הֲמָסִ֗ים מַ֚יִם תִּבְעֶה־אֵ֔שׁ לְהוֹדִ֥יעַ שִׁמְךָ֖ לְצָרֶ֑יךָ מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ גּוֹיִ֥ם יִרְגָּֽזוּ׃
Translated:
As when fire kindles brushwood,
And fire makes water boil—
To make Your name known to Your adversaries
So that nations will tremble at Your Presence,
Transliteration: khikedocha esh hamasiym mayiim tiveeh-esh lehvodiya shimekha letsareykha mifaneykha gvoyim yiregazu

Hebrew: בַּעֲשׂוֹתְךָ֥ נוֹרָא֖וֹת לֹ֣א נְקַוֶּ֑ה יָרַ֕דְתָּ מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ הָרִ֥ים נָזֹֽלּוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
When You did wonders we dared not hope for,
You came down
And mountains quaked before You.
Transliteration: vaashvotekha nvoravot lo nekaveh yaradeta mifaneykha hariym nazolu {s}

Hebrew: וּמֵעוֹלָ֥ם לֹא־שָׁמְע֖וּ לֹ֣א הֶאֱזִ֑ינוּ עַ֣יִן לֹֽא־רָאָ֗תָה אֱלֹהִים֙ זוּלָ֣תְךָ֔ יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה לִמְחַכֵּה־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Such things had never been heard or noted.
No eye has seen [them], O God, but You,
Who act for those who trust in You.
Transliteration: umevolam lo-shameu lo heeziynu ayiin lo-raatah Elohim zulatekha yaasheh limechakheh-lvo

Hebrew: פָּגַ֤עְתָּ אֶת־שָׂשׂ֙ וְעֹ֣שֵׂה צֶ֔דֶק בִּדְרָכֶ֖יךָ יִזְכְּר֑וּךָ הֵן־אַתָּ֤ה קָצַ֙פְתָּ֙ וַֽנֶּחֱטָ֔א בָּהֶ֥ם עוֹלָ֖ם וְנִוָּשֵֽׁעַ׃
Translated:
Yet You have struck those who would gladly do justice,
And remember You in Your ways.
It is because You are angry that we have sinned;
We have been steeped in them from of old,
And can we be saved?
Transliteration: fagaeta et-shash veosheh tsedek viderakheykha yizekherukha hen-atah katsafeta vanecheta vahem volam venivashea

Hebrew: וַנְּהִ֤י כַטָּמֵא֙ כֻּלָּ֔נוּ וּכְבֶ֥גֶד עִדִּ֖ים כׇּל־צִדְקֹתֵ֑ינוּ וַנָּ֤בֶל כֶּֽעָלֶה֙ כֻּלָּ֔נוּ וַעֲוֺנֵ֖נוּ כָּר֥וּחַ יִשָּׂאֻֽנוּ׃
Translated:
We have all become like an impure thing,
And all our virtues like a filthy rag.
We are all withering like leaves,
And our iniquities, like a wind, carry us off.
Transliteration: vanehiy khatame khulanu ukheveged idiym khׇl-tsidekoteynu vanavel khealeh khulanu vaavonenu kharucha yishaunu

Hebrew: וְאֵין־קוֹרֵ֣א בְשִׁמְךָ֔ מִתְעוֹרֵ֖ר לְהַחֲזִ֣יק בָּ֑ךְ כִּֽי־הִסְתַּ֤רְתָּ פָנֶ֙יךָ֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וַתְּמוּגֵ֖נוּ בְּיַד־עֲוֺנֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Yet no one invokes Your name,
Rouses themselves to cling to You.
For You have hidden Your face from us,
And made us melt because of our iniquities.
Transliteration: veeyn-kvore veshimekha mitevorer lehachaziyk vakhe khiy-hisetareta faneykha mimenu vatemugenu veyad-avonenu

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אָבִ֣ינוּ אָ֑תָּה אֲנַ֤חְנוּ הַחֹ֙מֶר֙ וְאַתָּ֣ה יֹצְרֵ֔נוּ וּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָדְךָ֖ כֻּלָּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
But now, O ETERNAL One, You are our Father;
We are the clay, and You are the Potter,
We are all the work of Your hands.
Transliteration: veatah yehovah aviynu atah anachenu hachomer veatah yotserenu umaasheh yadekha khulanu

Hebrew: אַל־תִּקְצֹ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ עַד־מְאֹ֔ד וְאַל־לָעַ֖ד תִּזְכֹּ֣ר עָוֺ֑ן הֵ֥ן הַבֶּט־נָ֖א עַמְּךָ֥ כֻלָּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Be not implacably angry, O ETERNAL One,
Do not remember iniquity forever.
Oh, look down to Your people, to us all!
Transliteration: al-tiketsof yehovah ad-meod veal-laad tizekhor avon hen havet-na amekha khulanu

Hebrew: עָרֵ֥י קׇדְשְׁךָ֖ הָי֣וּ מִדְבָּ֑ר צִיּוֹן֙ מִדְבָּ֣ר הָיָ֔תָה יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם שְׁמָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Your holy cities have become a desert:
Zion has become a desert,
Jerusalem a desolation.
Transliteration: arey kׇdeshekha hayu midevar tsiyyvon midevar hayatah yerushala͏im shemamah

Hebrew: בֵּ֧ית קׇדְשֵׁ֣נוּ וְתִפְאַרְתֵּ֗נוּ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִֽלְל֙וּךָ֙ אֲבֹתֵ֔ינוּ הָיָ֖ה לִשְׂרֵ֣פַת אֵ֑שׁ וְכׇל־מַחֲמַדֵּ֖ינוּ הָיָ֥ה לְחׇרְבָּֽה׃
Translated:
Our holy temple, our pride,
Where our ancestors praised You,
Has been consumed by fire:
And all that was dear to us is ruined.
Transliteration: veyt kׇdeshenu vetifearetenu asher hilelukha avoteynu hayah lisherefat esh vekhׇl-machamadeynu hayah lechׇrevah

Hebrew: הַעַל־אֵ֥לֶּה תִתְאַפַּ֖ק יְהֹוָ֑ה תֶּחֱשֶׁ֥ה וּתְעַנֵּ֖נוּ עַד־מְאֹֽד׃ {פ}
Translated:
At such things will You restrain Yourself, O ETERNAL One,
Will You stand idly by and let us suffer so heavily?
Transliteration: haal-eleh titeafak yehovah techesheh uteanenu ad-meod {f}

Hebrew: נִדְרַ֙שְׁתִּי֙ לְל֣וֹא שָׁאָ֔לוּ נִמְצֵ֖אתִי לְלֹ֣א בִקְשֻׁ֑נִי אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ הִנֵּ֣נִי הִנֵּ֔נִי אֶל־גּ֖וֹי לֹא־קֹרָ֥א בִשְׁמִֽי׃
Translated:
I responded to those who did not ask,
I was at hand to those who did not seek Me;
I said, “Here I am, here I am,”
To a nation that did not invoke My name.
Transliteration: niderashetiy lelvo shaalu nimetsetiy lelo vikeshuniy amaretiy hineniy hineniy el-gvoy lo-kora vishemiy

Hebrew: פֵּרַ֧שְׂתִּי יָדַ֛י כׇּל־הַיּ֖וֹם אֶל־עַ֣ם סוֹרֵ֑ר הַהֹֽלְכִים֙ הַדֶּ֣רֶךְ לֹא־ט֔וֹב אַחַ֖ר מַחְשְׁבֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
I constantly spread out My hands
To a disloyal people,
Who walk the way that is not good,
Following their own designs;
Transliteration: ferashetiy yaday khׇl-hayyvom el-am svorer haholekhiym haderekhe lo-tvov achar macheshevoteyhem

Hebrew: הָעָ֗ם הַמַּכְעִסִ֥ים אֹתִ֛י עַל־פָּנַ֖י תָּמִ֑יד זֹֽבְחִים֙ בַּגַּנּ֔וֹת וּֽמְקַטְּרִ֖ים עַל־הַלְּבֵנִֽים׃
Translated:
The people who provoke My anger,
Who continually, to My very face,
Sacrifice in gardens and burn incense on tiles;
Transliteration: haam hamakheisiym otiy al-fanay tamiyd zovechiym vaganvot umekateriym al-haleveniym

Hebrew: הַיֹּֽשְׁבִים֙ בַּקְּבָרִ֔ים וּבַנְּצוּרִ֖ים יָלִ֑ינוּ הָאֹֽכְלִים֙ בְּשַׂ֣ר הַחֲזִ֔יר (ופרק) [וּמְרַ֥ק] פִּגֻּלִ֖ים כְּלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Who sit inside tombs
And pass the night in secret places;
Who eat the flesh of swine,
With broth of unclean things in their bowls;
Transliteration: hayosheviym vakevariym uvanetsuriym yaliynu haokheliym veshar hachaziyr (vfrk) [umerak] figuliym kheleyhem

Hebrew: הָאֹֽמְרִים֙ קְרַ֣ב אֵלֶ֔יךָ אַל־תִּגַּשׁ־בִּ֖י כִּ֣י קְדַשְׁתִּ֑יךָ אֵ֚לֶּה עָשָׁ֣ן בְּאַפִּ֔י אֵ֥שׁ יֹקֶ֖דֶת כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Who say, “Keep your distance! Don’t come closer!
For I would render you consecrated.”
Such things make My anger rage,
Like fire blazing all day long.
Transliteration: haomeriym kerav eleykha al-tigash-viy khiy kedashetiykha eleh ashan veafiy esh yokedet khׇl-hayyvom

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה כְתוּבָ֖ה לְפָנָ֑י לֹ֤א אֶֽחֱשֶׁה֙ כִּ֣י אִם־שִׁלַּ֔מְתִּי וְשִׁלַּמְתִּ֖י עַל־חֵיקָֽם׃
Translated:
See, this is recorded before Me;
I will not stand idly by, but will repay,
Deliver their sins into their bosom,
Transliteration: hineh khetuvah lefanay lo echesheh khiy im-shilametiy veshilametiy al-cheykam

Hebrew: עֲ֠וֺנֹֽתֵיכֶ֠ם וַעֲוֺנֹ֨ת אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֤ם יַחְדָּו֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר קִטְּרוּ֙ עַל־הֶ֣הָרִ֔ים וְעַל־הַגְּבָע֖וֹת חֵרְפ֑וּנִי וּמַדֹּתִ֧י פְעֻלָּתָ֛ם רִאשֹׁנָ֖ה (על) [אֶל־]חֵיקָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
And the sins of their ancestors as well
—said GOD—
For they made offerings upon the mountains
And affronted Me upon the hills.
I will count out their recompense in full,
Into their bosoms.
Transliteration: avonoteykhem vaavonot avvoteykhem yachedav amar yehovah asher kiteru al-hehariym veal-hagevavot cherefuniy umadotiy feulatam rishonah (l) [el-]cheykam {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יִמָּצֵ֤א הַתִּירוֹשׁ֙ בָּֽאֶשְׁכּ֔וֹל וְאָמַר֙ אַל־תַּשְׁחִיתֵ֔הוּ כִּ֥י בְרָכָ֖ה בּ֑וֹ כֵּ֤ן אֶֽעֱשֶׂה֙ לְמַ֣עַן עֲבָדַ֔י לְבִלְתִּ֖י הַֽשְׁחִ֥ית הַכֹּֽל׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
As, when new wine is present in the cluster,
One says, “Don’t destroy it; there’s good in it,”
So will I do for the sake of My servants,
And not destroy everything.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah khaasher yimatse hatiyrvosh vaeshekhvol veamar al-tashechiytehu khiy verakhah vvo khen eesheh lemaan avaday leviletiy hashechiyt hakhol

Hebrew: וְהוֹצֵאתִ֤י מִֽיַּעֲקֹב֙ זֶ֔רַע וּמִֽיהוּדָ֖ה יוֹרֵ֣שׁ הָרָ֑י וִירֵשׁ֣וּהָ בְחִירַ֔י וַעֲבָדַ֖י יִשְׁכְּנוּ־שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated:
I will bring forth offspring from Jacob,
From Judah heirs to My mountains;
My chosen ones shall take possession,
My servants shall dwell thereon.
Transliteration: vehvotsetiy miyaakov zera umiyhudah yvoresh haray viyreshuha vechiyray vaavaday yishekhenu-shamah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה הַשָּׁרוֹן֙ לִנְוֵה־צֹ֔אן וְעֵ֥מֶק עָכ֖וֹר לְרֵ֣בֶץ בָּקָ֑ר לְעַמִּ֖י אֲשֶׁ֥ר דְּרָשֽׁוּנִי׃
Translated:
Sharon shall become a pasture for flocks,
And the Valley of Achor a place for cattle to lie down,
For My people who seek Me.
Transliteration: vehayah hasharvon lineveh-tson veemek akhvor lerevets vakar leamiy asher derashuniy

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּם֙ עֹזְבֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה הַשְּׁכֵחִ֖ים אֶת־הַ֣ר קׇדְשִׁ֑י הַעֹרְכִ֤ים לַגַּד֙ שֻׁלְחָ֔ן וְהַֽמְמַלְאִ֖ים לַמְנִ֥י מִמְסָֽךְ׃
Translated:
But as for you who forsake GOD,
Who ignore My holy mountain,
Who set a table for Luck
And fill a mixing bowl for Destiny:
Transliteration: veatem ozevey yehovah hashekhechiym et-har kׇdeshiy haorekhiym lagad shulechan vehamemaleiym lameniy mimesakhe

Hebrew: וּמָנִ֨יתִי אֶתְכֶ֜ם לַחֶ֗רֶב וְכֻלְּכֶם֙ לַטֶּ֣בַח תִּכְרָ֔עוּ יַ֤עַן קָרָ֙אתִי֙ וְלֹ֣א עֲנִיתֶ֔ם דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי וְלֹ֣א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֑ם וַתַּעֲשׂ֤וּ הָרַע֙ בְּעֵינַ֔י וּבַאֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־חָפַ֖צְתִּי בְּחַרְתֶּֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will destine you for the sword,
You will all kneel down, to be slaughtered—
Because, when I called, you did not answer,
When I spoke, you would not listen.
You did what I hold evil,
And chose what I do not want.
Transliteration: umaniytiy etekhem lacherev vekhulekhem latevach tikherau yaan karatiy velo aniytem divaretiy velo shemaetem vataashu hara veeynay uvaasher lo-chafatsetiy vecharetem {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה הִנֵּ֨ה עֲבָדַ֤י ׀ יֹאכֵ֙לוּ֙ וְאַתֶּ֣ם תִּרְעָ֔בוּ הִנֵּ֧ה עֲבָדַ֛י יִשְׁתּ֖וּ וְאַתֶּ֣ם תִּצְמָ֑אוּ הִנֵּ֧ה עֲבָדַ֛י יִשְׂמָ֖חוּ וְאַתֶּ֥ם תֵּבֹֽשׁוּ׃
Translated:
Assuredly, thus said my Sovereign GOD:
My servants shall eat, and you shall hunger;
My servants shall drink, and you shall thirst;
My servants shall rejoice, and you shall be shamed;
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineh avaday yokhelu veatem tireavu hineh avaday yishetu veatem titsemau hineh avaday yishemachu veatem tevoshu

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֧ה עֲבָדַ֛י יָרֹ֖נּוּ מִטּ֣וּב לֵ֑ב וְאַתֶּ֤ם תִּצְעֲקוּ֙ מִכְּאֵ֣ב לֵ֔ב וּמִשֵּׁ֥בֶר ר֖וּחַ תְּיֵלִֽילוּ׃
Translated:
My servants shall shout in gladness,
And you shall cry out in anguish,
Howling in heartbreak.
Transliteration: hineh avaday yaronu mituv lev veatem titseaku mikheev lev umishever rucha teeiliylu

Hebrew: וְהִנַּחְתֶּ֨ם שִׁמְכֶ֤ם לִשְׁבוּעָה֙ לִבְחִירַ֔י וֶהֱמִֽיתְךָ֖ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה וְלַעֲבָדָ֥יו יִקְרָ֖א שֵׁ֥ם אַחֵֽר׃
Translated:
You shall leave behind a name
By which My chosen ones shall curse:
“So may our Sovereign GOD slay you!”
But My servants shall be given a different name.
Transliteration: vehinachetem shimekhem lishevuah livechiyray vehemiytekha adonay yehovih velaavadayv yikera shem acher

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר הַמִּתְבָּרֵ֜ךְ בָּאָ֗רֶץ יִתְבָּרֵךְ֙ בֵּאלֹהֵ֣י אָמֵ֔ן וְהַנִּשְׁבָּ֣ע בָּאָ֔רֶץ יִשָּׁבַ֖ע בֵּאלֹהֵ֣י אָמֵ֑ן כִּ֣י נִשְׁכְּח֗וּ הַצָּרוֹת֙ הָרִ֣אשֹׁנ֔וֹת וְכִ֥י נִסְתְּר֖וּ מֵעֵינָֽי׃
Translated:
For whoever blesses themselves in the land
Shall bless themselves by the true God;
And whoever swears in the land
Shall swear by the true God.
The former troubles shall be forgotten,
Shall be hidden from My eyes.
Transliteration: asher hamitevarekhe vaarets yitevarekhe velohey amen vehanisheva vaarets yishava velohey amen khiy nishekhechu hatsarvot harishonvot vekhiy niseteru meeynay

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנְנִ֥י בוֹרֵ֛א שָׁמַ֥יִם חֲדָשִׁ֖ים וָאָ֣רֶץ חֲדָשָׁ֑ה וְלֹ֤א תִזָּכַ֙רְנָה֙ הָרִ֣אשֹׁנ֔וֹת וְלֹ֥א תַעֲלֶ֖ינָה עַל־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
For behold! I am creating
A new heaven and a new earth;
The former things shall not be remembered,
They shall never come to mind.
Transliteration: khiy-hineniy vvore shamayiim chadashiym vaarets chadashah velo tizakharenah harishonvot velo taaleynah al-lev

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אִם־שִׂ֤ישֽׂוּ וְגִ֙ילוּ֙ עֲדֵי־עַ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֲנִ֣י בוֹרֵ֑א כִּי֩ הִנְנִ֨י בוֹרֵ֧א אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם גִּילָ֖הֿ וְעַמָּ֥הּ מָשֽׂוֹשׂ׃
Translated:
Be glad, then, and rejoice forever
In what I am creating.
For I shall create Jerusalem as a joy,
And her people as a delight;
Transliteration: khiy-im-shiyshu vegiylu adey-ad asher aniy vvore khiy hineniy vvore et-yerushala͏im giylahֿ veamah mashvosh

Hebrew: וְגַלְתִּ֥י בִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וְשַׂשְׂתִּ֣י בְעַמִּ֑י וְלֹא־יִשָּׁמַ֥ע בָּהּ֙ ע֔וֹד ק֥וֹל בְּכִ֖י וְק֥וֹל זְעָקָֽה׃
Translated:
And I will rejoice in Jerusalem
And delight in her people.
Never again shall be heard there
The sounds of weeping and wailing.
Transliteration: vegaletiy viyrushala͏im veshashetiy veamiy velo-yishama vah vod kvol vekhiy vekvol zeakah

Hebrew: לֹא־יִהְיֶ֨ה מִשָּׁ֜ם ע֗וֹד ע֤וּל יָמִים֙ וְזָקֵ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יְמַלֵּ֖א אֶת־יָמָ֑יו כִּ֣י הַנַּ֗עַר בֶּן־מֵאָ֤ה שָׁנָה֙ יָמ֔וּת וְהַ֣חוֹטֶ֔א בֶּן־מֵאָ֥ה שָׁנָ֖ה יְקֻלָּֽל׃
Translated:
No more shall there be an infant or graybeard
Who does not live out their lifetime.
Someone who dies at a hundred years
Shall be reckoned a youth,
And one who fails to reach a hundred
Shall be reckoned accursed.
Transliteration: lo-yiheyeh misham vod ul yamiym vezaken asher lo-yemale et-yamayv khiy hanaar ven-meah shanah yamut vehachvote ven-meah shanah yekulal

Hebrew: וּבָנ֥וּ בָתִּ֖ים וְיָשָׁ֑בוּ וְנָטְע֣וּ כְרָמִ֔ים וְאָכְל֖וּ פִּרְיָֽם׃
Translated:
They shall build houses and dwell in them,
They shall plant vineyards and enjoy their fruit.
Transliteration: uvanu vatiym veyashavu venateu kheramiym veakhelu fireyam

Hebrew: לֹ֤א יִבְנוּ֙ וְאַחֵ֣ר יֵשֵׁ֔ב לֹ֥א יִטְּע֖וּ וְאַחֵ֣ר יֹאכֵ֑ל כִּֽי־כִימֵ֤י הָעֵץ֙ יְמֵ֣י עַמִּ֔י וּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יְדֵיהֶ֖ם יְבַלּ֥וּ בְחִירָֽי׃
Translated:
They shall not build for others to dwell in,
Or plant for others to enjoy.
For the days of My people shall be
As long as the days of a tree,
My chosen ones shall outlive
The work of their hands.
Transliteration: lo yivenu veacher eishev lo yiteu veacher yokhel khiy-khiymey haets yemey amiy umaasheh yedeyhem yevalu vechiyray

Hebrew: לֹ֤א יִֽיגְעוּ֙ לָרִ֔יק וְלֹ֥א יֵלְד֖וּ לַבֶּהָלָ֑ה כִּ֣י זֶ֜רַע בְּרוּכֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ הֵ֔מָּה וְצֶאֱצָאֵיהֶ֖ם אִתָּֽם׃
Translated:
They shall not toil to no purpose;
They shall not bear children for terror,
But they shall be a people blessed by GOD,
And their offspring shall remain with them.
Transliteration: lo yiygeu lariyk velo eiledu lavehalah khiy zera verukhey yehovah hemah vetseetsaeyhem itam

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה טֶרֶם־יִקְרָ֖אוּ וַאֲנִ֣י אֶעֱנֶ֑ה ע֛וֹד הֵ֥ם מְדַבְּרִ֖ים וַאֲנִ֥י אֶשְׁמָֽע׃
Translated:
Before they pray, I will answer;
While they are still speaking, I will respond.
Transliteration: vehayah terem-yikerau vaaniy eeneh vod hem medaveriym vaaniy eshema

Hebrew: זְאֵ֨ב וְטָלֶ֜ה יִרְע֣וּ כְאֶחָ֗ד וְאַרְיֵה֙ כַּבָּקָ֣ר יֹאכַל־תֶּ֔בֶן וְנָחָ֖שׁ עָפָ֣ר לַחְמ֑וֹ לֹֽא־יָרֵ֧עוּ וְלֹֽא־יַשְׁחִ֛יתוּ בְּכׇל־הַ֥ר קׇדְשִׁ֖י אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
The wolf and the lamb shall graze together,
And the lion shall eat straw like the ox,
And the serpent’s food shall be earth.
In all My sacred mount
Nothing evil or vile shall be done
—said GOD.
Transliteration: zeev vetaleh yireu kheechad veareeih khavakar yokhal-teven venachash afar lachemvo lo-yareu velo-yashechiytu vekhׇl-har kׇdeshiy amar yehovah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם כִּסְאִ֔י וְהָאָ֖רֶץ הֲדֹ֣ם רַגְלָ֑י אֵי־זֶ֥ה בַ֙יִת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּבְנוּ־לִ֔י וְאֵי־זֶ֥ה מָק֖וֹם מְנוּחָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
The heaven is My throne
And the earth is My footstool:
Where could you build a house for Me,
What place could serve as My abode?
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah hashamayiim khiseiy vehaarets hadom ragelay ey-zeh vayiit asher tivenu-liy veey-zeh makvom menuchatiy

Hebrew: וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ יָדִ֣י עָשָׂ֔תָה וַיִּהְי֥וּ כׇל־אֵ֖לֶּה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאֶל־זֶ֣ה אַבִּ֔יט אֶל־עָנִי֙ וּנְכֵה־ר֔וּחַ וְחָרֵ֖ד עַל־דְּבָרִֽי׃
Translated:
All this was made by My hand,
And thus it all came into being
—declares GOD.
Yet to such a one I look:
To the poor and brokenhearted,
Who is concerned about My word.
Transliteration: veet-khׇl-eleh yadiy ashatah vayiheyu khׇl-eleh neum-yehovah veel-zeh aviyt el-aniy unekheh-rucha vechared al-devariy

Hebrew: שׁוֹחֵ֨ט הַשּׁ֜וֹר מַכֵּה־אִ֗ישׁ זוֹבֵ֤חַ הַשֶּׂה֙ עֹ֣רֵֽף כֶּ֔לֶב מַעֲלֵ֤ה מִנְחָה֙ דַּם־חֲזִ֔יר מַזְכִּ֥יר לְבֹנָ֖ה מְבָ֣רֵֽךְ אָ֑וֶן גַּם־הֵ֗מָּה בָּֽחֲרוּ֙ בְּדַרְכֵיהֶ֔ם וּבְשִׁקּוּצֵיהֶ֖ם נַפְשָׁ֥ם חָפֵֽצָה׃
Translated:
As for those who slaughter oxen and slay humans,
Who sacrifice sheep and immolate dogs,
Who present as oblation the blood of swine,
Who offer incense and worship false gods—
Just as they have chosen their ways
And take pleasure in their abominations,
Transliteration: shvochet hashvor makheh-iysh zvovecha hasheh oref khelev maaleh minechah dam-chaziyr mazekhiyr levonah mevarekhe aven gam-hemah vacharu vedarekheyhem uveshikutseyhem nafesham chafetsah

Hebrew: גַּם־אֲנִ֞י אֶבְחַ֣ר בְּתַעֲלֻלֵיהֶ֗ם וּמְגֽוּרֹתָם֙ אָבִ֣יא לָהֶ֔ם יַ֤עַן קָרָ֙אתִי֙ וְאֵ֣ין עוֹנֶ֔ה דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי וְלֹ֣א שָׁמֵ֑עוּ וַיַּעֲשׂ֤וּ הָרַע֙ בְּעֵינַ֔י וּבַאֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־חָפַ֖צְתִּי בָּחָֽרוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
So will I choose to mock them,
To bring on them the very thing they dread.
For I called and none responded,
I spoke and none paid heed.
They did what I deem evil
And chose what I do not want.
Transliteration: gam-aniy evechar vetaaluleyhem umegurotam aviy lahem yaan karatiy veeyn voneh divaretiy velo shameu vayaashu hara veeynay uvaasher lo-chafatsetiy vacharu {s}

Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה הַחֲרֵדִ֖ים אֶל־דְּבָר֑וֹ אָמְרוּ֩ אֲחֵיכֶ֨ם שֹׂנְאֵיכֶ֜ם מְנַדֵּיכֶ֗ם לְמַ֤עַן שְׁמִי֙ יִכְבַּ֣ד יְהֹוָ֔ה וְנִרְאֶ֥ה בְשִׂמְחַתְכֶ֖ם וְהֵ֥ם יֵבֹֽשׁוּ׃
Translated:
Hear the word of GOD,
You who are concerned about God’s word!
Your own kindred who hate you,
Who spurn you because of Me, are saying,
“Let GOD manifest the divine Presence,
So that we may look upon your joy.”
But theirs shall be the shame.
Transliteration: shimeu devar-yehovah hacharediym el-devarvo ameru acheykhem shoneeykhem menadeykhem lemaan shemiy yikhevad yehovah venireeh veshimechatekhem vehem eivoshu

Hebrew: ק֤וֹל שָׁאוֹן֙ מֵעִ֔יר ק֖וֹל מֵהֵיכָ֑ל ק֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֔ה מְשַׁלֵּ֥ם גְּמ֖וּל לְאֹיְבָֽיו׃
Translated:
Hark, tumult from the city,
Thunder from the temple!
It is GOD’s thunder
As retribution is dealt to the foe.
Transliteration: kvol shavon meiyr kvol meheykhal kvol yehovah meshalem gemul leoyevayv

Hebrew: בְּטֶ֥רֶם תָּחִ֖יל יָלָ֑דָה בְּטֶ֨רֶם יָב֥וֹא חֵ֛בֶל לָ֖הּ וְהִמְלִ֥יטָה זָכָֽר׃
Translated:
Before she labored, she was delivered;
Before her pangs came, she bore a son.
Transliteration: veterem tachiyl yaladah veterem yavvo chevel lah vehimeliytah zakhar

Hebrew: מִֽי־שָׁמַ֣ע כָּזֹ֗את מִ֤י רָאָה֙ כָּאֵ֔לֶּה הֲי֤וּחַל אֶ֙רֶץ֙ בְּי֣וֹם אֶחָ֔ד אִם־יִוָּ֥לֵֽד־גּ֖וֹי פַּ֣עַם אֶחָ֑ת כִּי־חָ֛לָה גַּם־יָלְדָ֥ה צִיּ֖וֹן אֶת־בָּנֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Who ever heard the like?
Who ever witnessed such events?
Can a land pass through travail
In a single day?
Or is a nation born
All at once?
Yet Zion travailed
And at once bore her children!
Transliteration: miy-shama khazot miy raah khaeleh hayuchal erets veyvom echad im-yivaled-gvoy faam echat khiy-chalah gam-yaledah tsiyyvon et-vaneyha

Hebrew: הַאֲנִ֥י אַשְׁבִּ֛יר וְלֹ֥א אוֹלִ֖יד יֹאמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה אִם־אֲנִ֧י הַמּוֹלִ֛יד וְעָצַ֖רְתִּי אָמַ֥ר אֱלֹהָֽיִךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Shall I who bring on labor not bring about birth?
—says GOD.
Shall I who cause birth shut the womb?
—said your God.
Transliteration: haaniy asheviyr velo voliyd yomar yehovah im-aniy hamvoliyd veatsaretiy amar elohayiikhe {s}

Hebrew: שִׂמְח֧וּ אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם וְגִ֥ילוּ בָ֖הּ כׇּל־אֹהֲבֶ֑יהָ שִׂ֤ישׂוּ אִתָּהּ֙ מָשׂ֔וֹשׂ כׇּל־הַמִּֽתְאַבְּלִ֖ים עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad for her,
All you who love her!
Join in her jubilation,
All you who mourned over her—
Transliteration: shimechu et-yerushala͏im vegiylu vah khׇl-ohaveyha shiyshu itah mashvosh khׇl-hamiteaveliym aleyha

Hebrew: לְמַ֤עַן תִּֽינְקוּ֙ וּשְׂבַעְתֶּ֔ם מִשֹּׁ֖ד תַּנְחֻמֶ֑יהָ לְמַ֧עַן תָּמֹ֛צּוּ וְהִתְעַנַּגְתֶּ֖ם מִזִּ֥יז כְּבוֹדָֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
That you may suck from her breast
Consolation to the full,
That you may draw from her bosom
Glory to your delight.
Transliteration: lemaan tiyneku ushevaetem mishod tanechumeyha lemaan tamotsu vehiteanagetem miziyz khevvodah {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה הִנְנִ֣י נֹטֶֽה־אֵ֠לֶ֠יהָ כְּנָהָ֨ר שָׁל֜וֹם וּכְנַ֧חַל שׁוֹטֵ֛ף כְּב֥וֹד גּוֹיִ֖ם וִֽינַקְתֶּ֑ם עַל־צַד֙ תִּנָּשֵׂ֔אוּ וְעַל־בִּרְכַּ֖יִם תְּשׇׁעֳשָֽׁעוּ׃
Translated:
For thus said GOD:
I will extend to her
Prosperity like a stream,
The wealth of nations
Like a wadi in flood;
And you shall drink of it.
You shall be carried on shoulders
And dandled upon knees
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah hineniy noteh-eleyha khenahar shalvom ukhenachal shvotef khevvod gvoyim viynaketem al-tsad tinasheu veal-virekhayiim teshׇoshau

Hebrew: כְּאִ֕ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִמּ֖וֹ תְּנַחֲמֶ֑נּוּ כֵּ֤ן אָֽנֹכִי֙ אֲנַ֣חֶמְכֶ֔ם וּבִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם תְּנֻחָֽמוּ׃
Translated:
Like one whom a mother comforts.
So I will comfort you:
You shall find comfort in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: kheiysh asher imvo tenachamenu khen anokhiy anachemekhem uviyrushala͏im tenuchamu

Hebrew: וּרְאִיתֶם֙ וְשָׂ֣שׂ לִבְּכֶ֔ם וְעַצְמוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם כַּדֶּ֣שֶׁא תִפְרַ֑חְנָה וְנוֹדְעָ֤ה יַד־יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־עֲבָדָ֔יו וְזָעַ֖ם אֶת־אֹיְבָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated:
You shall see and your heart shall rejoice,
Your limbs shall flourish like grass.
GOD’s power shall be revealed
On behalf of those who render service;
But [God] shall rage against all foes.
Transliteration: ureiytem veshash livekhem veatsemvoteykhem khadeshe tiferachenah venvodeah yad-yehovah et-avadayv vezaam et-oyevayv {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ בָּאֵ֣שׁ יָב֔וֹא וְכַסּוּפָ֖ה מַרְכְּבֹתָ֑יו לְהָשִׁ֤יב בְּחֵמָה֙ אַפּ֔וֹ וְגַעֲרָת֖וֹ בְּלַהֲבֵי־אֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
See, GOD is coming with fire—
With chariots like a whirlwind—
To vent anger in fury,
And rebuke in flaming fire.
Transliteration: khiy-hineh yehovah vaesh yavvo vekhasufah marekhevotayv lehashiyv vechemah afvo vegaaratvo velahavey-esh

Hebrew: כִּ֤י בָאֵשׁ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה נִשְׁפָּ֔ט וּבְחַרְבּ֖וֹ אֶת־כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֑ר וְרַבּ֖וּ חַֽלְלֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
For with fire will contend,
With the sword, against all flesh;
And many shall be GOD’s slain.
Transliteration: khiy vaesh yehovah nishefat uvecharevvo et-khׇl-vashar veravu chaleley yehovah

Hebrew: הַמִּתְקַדְּשִׁ֨ים וְהַמִּֽטַּהֲרִ֜ים אֶל־הַגַּנּ֗וֹת אַחַ֤ר (אחד) [אַחַת֙] בַּתָּ֔וֶךְ אֹֽכְלֵי֙ בְּשַׂ֣ר הַחֲזִ֔יר וְהַשֶּׁ֖קֶץ וְהָעַכְבָּ֑ר יַחְדָּ֥ו יָסֻ֖פוּ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Those who sanctify and purify themselves to enter the groves, imitating one in the center, eating the flesh of the swine, the reptile, and the mouse, shall one and all come to an end—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: hamitekadeshiym vehamitahariym el-haganvot achar (chd) [achat] vatavekhe okheley veshar hachaziyr vehashekets vehaakhevar yachedav yasufu neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֗י מַֽעֲשֵׂיהֶם֙ וּמַחְשְׁבֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם בָּאָ֕ה לְקַבֵּ֥ץ אֶת־כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֖ם וְהַלְּשֹׁנ֑וֹת וּבָ֖אוּ וְרָא֥וּ אֶת־כְּבוֹדִֽי׃
Translated:
For I [know] their deeds and purposes.
[The time] has come to gather all the nations and tongues; they shall come and behold My glory.
Transliteration: veanokhiy maasheyhem umacheshevoteyhem vaah lekavets et-khׇl-hagvoyim vehaleshonvot uvau verau et-khevvodiy

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֨י בָהֶ֜ם א֗וֹת וְשִׁלַּחְתִּ֣י מֵהֶ֣ם <small>׀</small> פְּ֠לֵיטִ֠ים אֶֽל־הַגּוֹיִ֞ם תַּרְשִׁ֨ישׁ פּ֥וּל וְל֛וּד מֹ֥שְׁכֵי קֶ֖שֶׁת תֻּבַ֣ל וְיָוָ֑ן הָאִיִּ֣ים הָרְחֹקִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־שָׁמְע֤וּ אֶת־שִׁמְעִי֙ וְלֹא־רָא֣וּ אֶת־כְּבוֹדִ֔י וְהִגִּ֥ידוּ אֶת־כְּבוֹדִ֖י בַּגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: I will set a sign among them, and send from them survivors to the nations: to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud—that draw the bow—to Tubal, Javan, and the distant coasts, that have never heard My fame nor beheld My glory. They shall declare My glory among these nations.
Transliteration: veshametiy vahem vot veshilachetiy mehem <small></small> feleytiym el-hagvoyim tareshiysh ful velud moshekhey keshet tuval veyavan haiyiym harechokiym asher lo-shameu et-shimeiy velo-rau et-khevvodiy vehigiydu et-khevvodiy vagvoyim

Hebrew: וְהֵבִ֣יאוּ אֶת־כׇּל־אֲחֵיכֶ֣ם מִכׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֣ם <small>׀</small> מִנְחָ֣ה <small>׀</small> לַיהֹוָ֡ה בַּסּוּסִ֡ים וּ֠בָרֶ֠כֶב וּבַצַּבִּ֨ים וּבַפְּרָדִ֜ים וּבַכִּרְכָּר֗וֹת עַ֣ל הַ֥ר קׇדְשִׁ֛י יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר יָבִ֩יאוּ֩ בְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֛ה בִּכְלִ֥י טָה֖וֹר בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And out of all the nations, said G<small>OD</small>, they shall bring all your kindred on horses, in chariots and drays, on mules and dromedaries, to Jerusalem My holy mountain as an offering to G<small>OD</small>—just as the Israelites bring an offering in a pure vessel to the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: veheviyu et-khׇl-acheykhem mikhׇl-hagvoyim <small></small> minechah <small></small> layhovah vasusiym uvarekhev uvatsaviym uvaferadiym uvakhirekharvot al har kׇdeshiy yerushala͏im amar yehovah khaasher yaviyu veney yisherael et-haminechah vikheliy tahvor veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְגַם־מֵהֶ֥ם אֶקַּ֛ח לַכֹּהֲנִ֥ים לַלְוִיִּ֖ם אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And from them likewise I will take some to be levitical priests, said G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vegam-mehem ekach lakhohaniym laleviyim amar yehovah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כַאֲשֶׁ֣ר הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם הַ֠חֲדָשִׁ֠ים וְהָאָ֨רֶץ הַחֲדָשָׁ֜ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲנִ֥י עֹשֶׂ֛ה עֹמְדִ֥ים לְפָנַ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה כֵּ֛ן יַעֲמֹ֥ד זַרְעֲכֶ֖ם וְשִׁמְכֶֽם׃
Translated:
For as the new heaven and the new earth
That I will make
Shall endure by My will
—declares GOD—
So shall your seed and your name endure.
Transliteration: khiy khaasher hashamayiim hachadashiym vehaarets hachadashah asher aniy osheh omediym lefanay neum-yehovah khen yaamod zareakhem veshimekhem

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה מִֽדֵּי־חֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ בְּחׇדְשׁ֔וֹ וּמִדֵּ֥י שַׁבָּ֖ת בְּשַׁבַּתּ֑וֹ יָב֧וֹא כׇל־בָּשָׂ֛ר לְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֥ת לְפָנַ֖י אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
And new moon after new moon,
And sabbath after sabbath,
All flesh shall come to worship Me
—said GOD.
Transliteration: vehayah midey-chodesh vechׇdeshvo umidey shavat veshavatvo yavvo khׇl-vashar lehishetachavot lefanay amar yehovah

Hebrew: וְיָצְא֣וּ וְרָא֔וּ בְּפִגְרֵי֙ הָאֲנָשִׁ֔ים הַפֹּשְׁעִ֖ים בִּ֑י כִּ֣י תוֹלַעְתָּ֞ם לֹ֣א תָמ֗וּת וְאִשָּׁם֙ לֹ֣א תִכְבֶּ֔ה וְהָי֥וּ דֵרָא֖וֹן לְכׇל־בָּשָֽׂר׃
Translated:
They shall go out and gaze
On the corpses of those who rebelled against Me:
Their worms shall not die,
Nor their fire be quenched;
They shall be a horror
To all flesh.

And new moon after new moon,
And sabbath after sabbath,
All flesh shall come to worship Me
—said GOD.
Transliteration: veyatseu verau vefigerey haanashiym hafosheiym viy khiy tvolaetam lo tamut veisham lo tikheveh vehayu deravon lekhׇl-vashar
